text: We came here for a Sunday dinner, and as it was the week-end, a wait was expected.  The line actually moved fairly quickly, so it wasn't too bad. After being seated, our waitress came, and she was quite friendly.  It took about 30 minutes before we got our food - longer wait than we expected. It seemed there was a hold-up of some sort in the kitchen though because once the food started coming out, a lot of food was coming out. We had onion rings for appetizer, and it was delicious. The batter was light and crispy, and the sauces were very good.   My husband had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, medium rare, and he really enjoyed it.  I was a bit boring and got the ultimate cheeseburger, medium well (since I'm pregnant and shouldn't eat anything too rare). The waitress asked if I wanted any toppings for my burger, and among other things, I requested extra pickles on my burger. When the burgers came out, it was obvious to me that the waitress wrote down that I asked for "extra" pickles because my burger was loaded with pickles - a good sign that she listened, and the chefs made the food as ordered. While I wished I would have ordered my burger medium, it was still quite good. The cheese flavor was quite strong, but overall, a very good burger.  Perhaps it's because I'm pregnant, but the sweet pickles were delicious - I had to ask for an extra side of pickles and actually finished all of that too. The burger was quite large for me, and after eating half of the burger, I took the buns off the other half so I can finish my dinner without overstuffing myself.  Overall, great place.  If I'm in the area, I wouldn't mind coming back.

Let's just say to start that I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay. This restaurant however, shows some serious irony as to how he shows himself on television when it comes to running a kitchen.   To start we had the kettle chip nachos. These had a nice flavor and the meat was tender.   We ordered the Hog Burger and the Ultimate Cheeseburger with a side of Truffle Parmesan Fries. We ordered the ultimate cheeseburger medium rare and the hog burger well. We were told that the burgers take at least twenty minutes to come out since they are made fresh to order. We had no problem with the wait.   The burgers arrived.... the ultimate cheeseburger was cooked perfect and had great seasoning and flavor in the first bite... the next bite and the rest ended up tasteless and boring. The cheese even lacked flavor.   The hog burger, that was just under cooked. When getting to the middle of the burger the pork was cold, mushy and well... was just raw.   When we brought it to the attention of the waitress, now this is where it gets good, her response was, "Well that is the type of pork it is." We showed her that the middle was cold and raw and she continued by saying, "The chef says that it is the type of burger that no matter how long you cook it the meat stays red and that the center doesn't cook all the way, that it is the way it should be." I tried not to laugh. Kitchen Nightmares flashed in my head and I could picture Gordon Ramsay saying,"You bloody idiot".   The sad part is this restaurant bares the name of Gordon Ramsay a man who prides himself on how food is prepared and consistency of what comes out of his kitchens. I am just hoping that serving raw pork is not what his chefs think is best for his customers.   In this case they should be embarrassed.

We had high hopes for this restaurant as a coworker said it was the best food she had ever had.  We got in line (Thursday night) and after 10 minutes of the line not moving an employee walked down the line to verify everyone in line was group's of 2 or less - asked for an ETA and was told 10-15 minutes.  Shy of 30 minutes later we were seated - it was very nice, but loud, in the restaurant.  Menus were waiting, and within 5 minutes we had water and placed our orders (Tandoori Chicken and the Hells kitchen burger, plus an order of the parmesan fries).  We were told the wait for food would be 25-30 minutes.  The burgers were good, not that much better than a Red Robin burger.  Fries were amazing.  The service was mediocre.

Amazing burger, got there 10 mins before opening on a Sunday, waited a few mins.  Ate the recommended Anniversary burger without sides or appetizers, it was so good.  The price was $22, but compare to other places, it was worth it.

Did come here to see how the chefs from Gordon Ramsay team would prepare the burgers and other items. Would say a complete let down.   I had some uninvited guests in the form of stone/broken chicken bone spec. When asked about it to the waiter he was kind enough to send his manager to speak to us and imagine what, I was told that these kind of things can be possible and sounded so obvious.  My question would be, who would have been responsible if I broke my tooth trying to chew that bone? Gordon Ramsay or his manager?   Before I was assigned my table, I saw almost all tables having fries so I thought it might be the best item in the menu. I think it should have been named as wedges instead of fries. Moreover when they were served they were not served hot. Not sure when they were prepared.                                                  Not quite a standard when you are selling stuff with GR tag to it.

I binge watched kitchen nightmares for hours last year, this restaurant lives up to my standards and then some. Long wait, pricey food, but amazing food and huge burger. Very fancy Parmesan fries, a must buy. Servers are extremely nice, the menu is pretty good. The highlight was definitely the meat and cheese. The mozarella tasted like heaven and made me regret not getting a double cheese burger. I even got a hat.....I don't know why....

My boyfriend and I came here for a late lunch so we only waited 20 minutes for a table. The service was okay, and the food was decent but it definitely is not worth waiting for 1 hour+. The prices are reasonably priced but it's not worth the hype. We probably wouldn't come back next time.

Ordered the F@&K burger, because it's a limited special and I know I won't be back to Vegas for quite awhile. It had a great flavor, and the meat, which I could taste the higher quality being aged, was cook exactly as I asked. My party of six was extremely satisfied. One of whom refused to finish his burger because he said "I do t want it to end". Top notch burgers!

Overrated. I had the truffles fries and the shrimp curried salad, neither was good. The fries tasted old. The shrimp with the salad was cold when served.   The wait to a table was one hour and the wait for food was another hour (even though the waiter told us 30 min).

Absolutely worth it. I got the portobello mushroom burger and it was delicious. Best one i've ever had. I'm assuming wait can get long though, so prepare for that. We came on a monday at around 1pm and waited about 45 minutes from waiting to get a table to actually getting the food. Not too bad for vegas at lunch time.

The burgers were good but I have had better. The fries were stale and weren't as good as we were told. The service was decent, but we received our burgers and then our fries about 5 minutes later. I really believe the rave about this place is just because of Gordon Ramsey's popular name and because it's in The Vegas Strip.

I'm a big fan of the Hell's Kitchen show, so I wanted to eat at one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants on our vacation to Las Vegas.  Sadly, this one was a bit of a let down.  I naturally ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger which was pretty good, but I felt that I could get better burger flavor from Red Robin.  My wife ordered a set of chicken prosciutto sliders which were, admittedly, awful (over cooked).  I really wanted to leave this place a five star review because of my liking for Hell's Kitchen but three is all I can manage.

The food was simply amazing. I ordered the crown burger, truffle fries, and a shake (must be the kid in me). The food was exactly what I expected from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. The food had big bold flavors with seasoned burgers and fries. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about their menu and service was perfect. We waited about 25 minutes for our food but it was well worth the wait. Thank for an excellent meal and great final experience as we get ready to leave Vegas!

Hands down the best burger out there. It must be something with the meat they use I don't know. I come here every time I go to Vegas usually two times per visit. Get the Euro burger. I fucks with it. Also all of there fry options are amazing.

Long wait times to get in, although food was flavorful and delicious. Wine choices and dessert choices were stellar. Honestly saw wear and tear on the bar stools though. The truffle fries were not "snappy" like French fries should be... they weirdly had a stale like consistency. The Hog burger was great, but destroyed my intestines that night. I don't know what ingredient did it; but I'd love to know so I could do an "elimination diet" experiment with the ingredients. Overall, I'd give it four to five stars if it wasn't for loud atmosphere and wear in the restaurant.

What has happened to my favorite burger stop in Las Vegas.  First the jalapeño poppers are off the menu... something I always ordered when I came.  But it took over 60 minutes for them to deliver a medium well burger.  First it was well done, then it was medium well.  They said they would take care of the cost because of the issue in the kitchen.  But starving at the table for an hour is just unacceptable.  Just disappointed in an otherwise great establishment.  I did like the fact I saw a portobello mushroom burger on the menu.  Might try that, if I ever come back.  For now.. I ill try something else

Tried this place because we'll they have a celebrity chef owner and would like to see why so many people are waiting for a hamburger.  Well to start off her the chef recommendation. It's huge and worth it.  The other burger in the menu are smaller than the chef recommendation but it's cheaper.  Fries are good size and looks fresh.  Server is friendly and attentive.  I'm surprised how smiling they are even though the place are packed.

Still the best burger I've ever had. These guys don't F'around. Had the sirloin burger with parmesan sprinkled fries but that burger stole the show. I've been here several times and it never disappoints. They have some really good tasting strong beer as well.

Gordon Ramsay Burger has a permanent spot on our things to do list when we come to Vegas. This was our third time eating GRB and I must say superb. The burgers are so good you over look the wait, about 25 minutes or so. I would definitely recommend GRB to everyone but keep in mind the burgers aren't cheep.
I had the backyard burger it was really good and the fries are big enough to share for two our wait time was about 20 minutes .

Amazing burger. It is well worth the wait. You can have anything from a traditional burger to a crazy concoction. A must have while in Vegas. I suggest making a dinner reservation at 4. There will still be a wait, but something that is "reasonable." The service is very good. Definitely what I would expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.

1. The food was SO salty. There is no way Gordon Ramsey would approve.  We ordered Bluecheese Burger, Crown Burger and Truffle Fries. I asked for a well-done patty, not a jerkey. It was so dry and salty.    2. We had to wait 30 minutes after ordering to get the burgers and the fry. The fry was on the shelf in the kitchen for about good 15 minutes before we got them.  (Because it was an open kitchen, we were able to watch our fry getting dry.) Thanks to the long waiting time, the fry's texture was like a baguette.   3. It took 10 more minutes to get the bill.   4. The server looked really angry. She looked like Gordon Ramsey when he's pissed off.

Not worth it. Although I did not have a burger, I ate with a group of 7 and all of them had a burger. One loved the burger, the others just thought it was mediocre. One person asked for a well done burger and they gave it to him medium rare. My other friend asked for her burger to be cut after it was already out and presented and the guy who delivered the food said sorry but he could not cut the burger in half because the chefs are "you know" and it would ruin the presentation, there were also no knives provided that were good enough to cut the burger. I ordered the ahi tuna sliders and they stuffed the slider too much to eat with my hands. I had to use a fork and it ruined the experience of what a slider is supposed to be. On top of that, they tasted like nothing. The bun was my favourite part of the dish. I will say, our server was excellent. Won't be coming back.

The selection of beers and craft cocktails at Burger is awesome. I ordered the Farmhouse 14 Burger, which was incredible. I had prepared medium rare, and it was loaded with dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon and a fried egg. Yummy!!!  Highly recommend the food and beers.  Unfortunately, I had to give Gordon Ramsay Burger only 1 star due to the service. It was not good, specifically one person. The actual service was good once a tall bartender named Michelle helped my girlfriend and me. The other bartender named Petey was solid, too.  Eric was a total jerk. He was very condescending and rude. It seemed as if he was unhappy to be at work and it was an inconvenience to serve my us. He was making rude comments about a prior customer to us. Uhhh, it was tacky.  Topping it off, Eric was extremely disrespectful and sexist to the girl bartender. The constant barrage of talking down towards the girl bartender was such a turn off. My girlfriend and I decided to leave after paying our bill, heading over to Heart Bar for drinks instead.  If Eric had a better attitude towards us and his co-workers, we would have stayed. Hopefully this was just a circumstance on which he was having a bad day. It still doesn't excuse the chauvinistic and disrespectful attitude directed at women our entire meal.  I will definitely be back for the food and beers, but not if Eric is working. Well, I could handle it, but no chance my girlfriend would want to be served by him ever again. Glad there were other bartenders available to help out and the food was delicious.

Definitely a great burger experience. I got the farmhouse burger, and my wife guy the forest. We shared fries. The beer selection is good with many choices from IPAs to lagers, and our server, Alex, was a pro.   The burger. I don't know how to explain the bun, but it was awesome. It was light, but kept all the burger ingredients in place. The egg on mine was cooked perfectly, and the beef was seasoned nicely. I didn't think I could eat the whole thing, but I did. Perfection on a bun.   The fries came with two dipping sauces, ketchup and a house made aoli with black truffles and garlic. Super delicious.   We waited in line for about 15 minutes, but the food was served fast after we ordered. Overall a great experience.

My husband and I went here on Thursday around 5:15pm. After a very small wait in a very busy restaurant, we got seated and placed our food order around 5:21. Our server was very prompt and got us our drinks (he got a beer and I got the jalapeño 'rita) right away and we got our onion ring appetizer within 5 minutes.  Our burgers and fries arrived at 5:36.   The burger was cooked beautifully and was very tasty, but not nearly as spicy as we were hoping (Hells' Kitchen burger). We love spice and were just a little let down about that, but the overall flavor of the burger was very good. We got one order of fries to split and that was enough for both of us, and they were cooked well.   I decided I couldn't leave without trying a creme brûlée milkshake, and I was not disappointed with the Oreo one. It was delicious and generous enough to share if you feel like it.   I mention the times we arrived and were served because this was the FASTEST food we had gotten anywhere in Vegas during our entire stay there, and the food was delicious.  When I saw how packed the place was, I was expecting a long wait for food and was pleasantly surprised.

I can't speak for the burgers (although the people I was with did like them). I'm allergic to sesame so I figured I'd get the hot dog. I love hot dogs and I knew the burgers had sesame on the buns. However, apparently the hot dog buns did too! (I've never seen a hot dog bun with a sesame seeds). They were very understanding and took the hot dog back; however, they didn't have a seedless hot dog bun option. My two options were either the hot dog wrapped in a flatbread or in lettuce. I chose flatbread. By the time I got my hot dog, though, everyone else had finished eating, and the hot dog was just a normal hot dog. The staff was friendly though, and everyone else seemed to enjoy the burgers. I would just suggest not going there if you have a sesame allergy.

The hamburger was one of the most flavorful and juicy burgers I've ever had! Didn't even need any mayonnaise or ketchup! The fries were ok, told my hubby the fries were like a Prius compared to the burger which was like a Cadillac. But wouldn't deter me from going back. Everyone was so tentative, and our waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. All around great experience.
Amazing got the F burger you have to ask for it, it's not on the menu   Get the Hell's Kitchen!!!  If you have a hard time to figure out what to get just ask them it's pretty good all around

(A little later review on this one....)  While I had high hopes for this place, I got to say, I was really disappointed.   I strolled up on a Friday afternoon, a little after 12:45pm  to place a take out order, as I was staying at PH and just wanted to grab something and take it up to my room.    The girls up front were friendly and eager to help, but seemed to be having a problem with swiping their cards and being able to log in to take my order.   They went back and forth between 2 different machines and called over like 3 different people to try.   Eventually they got it figured out and took my order.   I ordered onion rings, (asked for an extra cheddar ranch) and a burger cooked medium rare.   She repeated my order, but neglected my request for an extra ranch, so I kindly asked if she got the extra ranch part.   She said "Oh yah, don't worry"  MMMMMMoK.  So I pay for my order and she tells me it'll be 30 minutes.   I was a little surprised, but was fine with that, hoping that since it was just a single burger and a side that it may come closer to the 20 minute mark.    It's now a few minutes before 1:00pm.    I go off and gamble in the casino a bit and come back at 1:30 thinking that the order should be ready.   I go back to the counter and ask the girl if my order was ready.    She tells me to wait on the side and she'll go check.   She goes off in the back and comes back a minute later and is just having a good time with her friends up there.   She's helping other customers and then talking story again with her co-workers, having a great time.   All the while, I'm just standing there.  5 more minutes go by and I go back up there and kindly ask if she found out if my order was ready because she clearly had no intention of letting me know what's going on.   She tells me "oh yah, they're checking on it".   Oooooooooook, well you could've at least told me something.    Another 5 minutes go by and now I'm just starving already.   Finally after 50 MINUTES, the girl comes up with my food like nothing ever happened.   She tells me thank you and is about to walk away.   I ask her is the extra cheddar ranch in there? and she tells me "Oh, did you want an extra one?"   Uhhhhhh yes please, I already had to ask for it twice when ordering, why not one more time right?    I mean is that a difficult request to get correct?    She gladly gets it for me and I'm on my way back up to grind!    I'm all excited when I get back to my room thinking this meal is going to be hot and delicious......NOT!    No joke guys/gals, the burger and onion rings were not even warm.   Seriously, not even warm at all!   Oh and my burger was almost cooked well done.   On the flip side, Gordon's onion rings are BOMB (even when cold)!    The burger though was super disappointing.    Obviously because it was room temperature and over cooked, but it was also under-seasoned too.   Sooooooo disappointing.     I thought about calling down and letting a manager know about it, but was just over it already.  We went through our apps, sides, and steaks in less than 50 minutes at Gordon Ramsay Steak earlier in the week, and it was amazing.   The Burger joint.......not so much.   So many better options in Vegas.
First time here and tries Hell's Kitchen Burger.  Best burger I have had in quite some time!!!  Top it with onion rings and a Guinness!!!  Recommend!!
Best burger, ask for the f burger ia not in the menu. Don't forget the onion rings and the truffle fries

We got a lovely surprise... My fiance took a bite of our lovely nachos and ended up with a mouth full of cheese flavored plastic. The waiter scooped it up and had it replaced immediately but after spitting up a huge chunk of plastic we were like "ehhh,no thanks." The waiter persisted and quickly brought out a fresh plate. We were surprised to see that they were not taken off our bill. We didn't even get an apology from the manager. The burger was good enough but my hot dog was pretty gross. I was so excited too. Gordon is my absolute favorite. Oh the disappointment.
This place is a 2.5... I didn't really care for the burger at all! The only reason you should come here for is for the onion rings! They do have great customer service though..

This place is crazy busy. We decided to do take out instead. I gave them my cell so they could text me when my burgers were done. It was going to take 35 mins. Lucky for them, it's part of a casino/mall so we had plenty of things to keep us busy. After almost an hour and no text, I returned to see how the order progressed. The girl returned w my order all ready. To my disappointment it looked like it was sitting there a while and the burgers were not hot.   We had the Hog and it was well made. Pink in the inside and favors well balanced. I also had one w curry spice. Wasn't what I expected but it was still good. No sides w order. Spent almost $40 for 2 burgers n tips. Great to try but I won't do it again. It's not bad but also not that that great.

My God, this was the best burger I have had in a long time. Besides the wait, I guess other people like great food too, the food was pretty quick and our sever was really nice and personable. Even though it was twenty something for the burger and a couple bucks more for the fries, I will definitely swing by the next time I'm back. While you wait, walk around the corner and check out Tipsy Robot. Fully customizable drinks from a robotic bartender.
I have never had a burger that was so good in my life. The burger was cooked to perfection and the truffle fries were incredible! Definitely will be back!

What an amazing burger. I ordered the F word burger which wasn't on the menu yet. Wow! The best burger I ever had. I really hope they open up a place out here in New York. If I ever go to Vegas, coming here will be a must!

Not gonna lie, the Hell's Kitchen burger was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. Considering this is a "Gordon Ramsey" restaurant, the food was delicious at a surprisingly good value. (Paid $16 for the burger, $9 for the Cheddar Ale Soup) Since the restaurant is quite a landmark, the wait time for us was around 1 hour and 45 minutes, but we didn't have to wait in line and just waited for our text notification. Our waiter, Paul, was super warm and friendly. Overall the atmosphere was great, the staff was pleasant, and the food was extremely filling.

We came last night after trying Gordon Ramsay Steak in Paris hotel. We only waited about 15 minutes for a party of 2. We came with high hopes and left extremely disappointed after the service we received. We both have worked in the service industry for years so maybe we were a bit critical but this bordered on ridiculous.  After 12 minutes of being seated, our server  greeted us with "Did you decide what you want yet?"   Not a hello, not a "welcome, have you been helped?"..poor server looked bored and tired. With an unapproachable demeanor she made us and apparently her other tables look a little hesitant to ask questions. We ordered water and cocktails, but our water glasses were empty for 25 minutes and cocktails didn't arrive until our food did.   Appetizers arrived briefly, chips and curry were slightly cold but good.   A whole 45 minutes later our burgers arrived. The meat was delicious and the flavors mixed perfectly, but the server never checked up on us after we started eating. Server was no where to be found when we wanted some limes, and only saw her maybe twice the whole evening.   We had to remind her several times to refill our water, and at the end of the meal when we asked for a box she looked at me as if I spoke to her in an alien language.   If you want to truly experience Gordon Ramsay: try the steakhouse and their amazing beef Wellington and ask for Victor, he will treat you like a proper server should and make sure your experience is worthwhile. You won't wait nearly and hour for your food and you'll leave fat and happy.
One of the best burger in town. Queue was pretty long for about 1 hour, although there are several empty seats inside. Meat is tender and juicy.

Very underwhelming. The best part of the burger was the bun. We should have known this! Gordon ramsey is not known for burgers.   I ordered the Crown burger (mimento cheese, arugula, sun dried tomatos). Their burgers do not come with sides so you will have to order separately. We ordered onion rings and those were delicious. They came with 2 dipping sauces.  Would recommend going somewhere else for burgers...or food for the matter. Their only salvation was Gordon's pretty picture on the wall.

I figured a burger with Gordon Ramsey's name connected to it would be delicious. I was wrong. The burger had very little flavor and the toppings only seemed to cover half the burger. The truffle fries were awful and after trying a few bites, it wasn't worth it to eat anymore for wasted calories. The fries were thicker spears and were not crisp on the outside and the "truffles" and cheese seemed to be an afterthought. I could have gone to Five Guys and paid a 1/3 of the price and had a delicious burger and fries for takeout. Gordon would be screaming in the kitchen if he knew or cared. Plus it took 50 minutes just to get a burger and fries to go.
OMG!!! The burger was spectacular!! Yes, there was a long wait, but IT IS WELL WORTH IT!!! I will return for this divine food experience! Thank you

The food was DELICIOUS!!!! My burger was as juicy as ever and full of flavor. And our server, his customer service was 1st class. I am happy to say I look forward to coming to Vegas more often and definitely will be eating here again. @gordonramsay my friend says these burgers were made with a lot of cuss words  YOU'RE THE BEST GORDON RAMSAY!!!

I walked up to the place, inside of planet Hollywood, and there was a giant line. So I saw a couple of single seats open at the bar, so I asked the hostess if they were available, and got instant seating. I got the burger with the egg on it it was fantastic. I also got the truffle Parmesan fries and they were terrific as well.  I will definitely come back here.

If you love burgers, and are tired of Burgers as usual, then this place is for you.  The restaurant is located inside Planet Hollywood Casino and can be a little challenging to find depending on which entrance you come through.  Dress code is casual. There was a little wait to be seated but the food was delicious!  I took a recommendation from my server and got the Uber burger with mango chutney added.  It was a 10! I also got a side of the truffle fries which are large enough to be shared by two people.  I would definitely come here again.

Contrary to other reviews our service was excellent. Our fries arrived cold, and old. We received another batch which was just as bad. At the end or server removed them from our check without us even asking. I had a Hells kitchen burger which was good but it was just a burger. After waiting in line for 30 minutes I felt kind of silly.

Been to this place numerous times. When Gordon Ramsay ran it, it was the best place in town. Now that the casino runs the place, the quality and service has suffered greatly. Menu changes were disappointing.  There are better burger places in Las Vegas. Not going back and will no longer recommend to friends coming to town.

Came into this spot with high hope and buy they didn't disappoint. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger and it was by far the best burger I've ever had. I tried the truffle fries as well and they were also amazing! I couldn't be more happy with the service I had either. Our server was amazing and fast. Best bite I had in Vegas!

Went here for dinner on our last night and have decided that this is definitely a must eat place for us! The hog burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger were to die for. So many flavors and a decently sized burger. The down side is that your burger does not come with fries you have to order those separately, definitely get the truffle Parmesan fries you won't regret it! Also the "spicy" Hell's Kitchen burger is what this white girl calls white/old people spicy, it does not pack much heat but was still a fantastic burger! The service is amazing as it should be, just ask your waiter what they had to go through to be a waiter there; they'll have quite a story for you!

The burger was out-of-this-world good! It was very juicy and flavorful. By far the best burger I've ever had. The wait to eat was very short and the wait for food was about 20 minutes. The staff was great and the environment is open and casual.
Spectacular... now I know watching Gordon's shows why he get so upset about the taste of other ppl food because there is nothing that compair to the flavor of his food. Like no other

This is seriously the best burger I've ever had.  We were so pleased with our meal the first time, when we went back to Vegas a year and a half later, we returned and the burgers continued to live up to what we remembered.  I highly recommend the parmesan truffle fries.

Okay, four stars because the food was amazing. Best sliders I've ever had- buns so fresh and soft, light crisp. Chicken cooked so well. Just a medley of flavors. I forget the name but they were the ones with "Parma ham" and an aioli. Will post the name soon.  Tandoori chicken burger - awesome. The texture IS a little drier than I would have liked but it worked really well. I think it's meant to be like this. Definitely not something I could make at home I don't think.  Wouldn't give 5 stars bc the wait honestly was a buzz kill. I would have just liked to hop on the bar and eat there but the line included bar spots too. And no one was taking them regardless.  Plenty of TV's to watch the games that are on.  Order right when you sit down-- take a menu and check it over while waiting. Each burger takes 30 min to make  so be sure to snag a menu in line.  Also didn't like how slow the service was all together. But it was relatively crowded when we were there. I'll keep it at 4 stars.

This restaurant ruined my experience in Vegas. My family and I heard of this restaurant and were told it was one of the best. When we went to eat we started off with a 50 minute line. Once we got to the cashier we were told that we would have to wait another hour and a half. After waiting for so long we just wanted some water. There was a bar right next to the cashier with a Gordon Ramsay background so we asked for water. Surprisingly the person who worked there needed an ID to give us water so my aunt showed an ID and she said that she would not give us the water until we back away from the bar, so we did. Once the table was ready we went in and ordered drinks and food. I never knew I would enjoy the drink more than the food. We ordered 3 hamburgers, 2 regular and one with no onions and to add mushrooms. We ended up getting 3 regular ones which one contained a long piece of hair which couldn't have been ours for sure and another with no mushrooms and with onions. We politely told the waitress that the order was wrong and that there are no mushrooms. She then started raising her voice saying she "sees the mushrooms inside" and we opened up the burger showing her there are none. The waitress kept saying we were wrong and wouldn't ask if she could do anything to help. We then asked her so please call the manager so we can figure this out. She started yelling at our table in front of everyone saying "your so rude no costumer ever talked to me Like that" as if we did something wrong. The manager came and heard us out and in the middle she started shaming us on how it's our fault for not being "clear." He then told her not to talk or go near us but that didn't stop her from cussing out every one of us every time she would walk by. We walked out of there not wanting to ever go back even if the meals were free.

I'll be positive as this was not a positive experience. But, a lot of it was the service, not really the food.  Long line - go hit a slot machine first for your drink to stand in line.  35 minute minimum wait Sat at bar. Bartender w no personality. Never seen this in Vegas before. I asked if he had an eta and he said on what? Lol. My food bud. He said 35 minutes. I said well we are at 34 minutes. Thx for the notice.  Don't know if I ever got asked for another beer or refill. It's cool. I'm at a bar at a restaurant I'm Vegas. Lol. Burger was ok. I make a good burger, wanted excellent !

I came here with very high expectations. I was very disappointed, I thought it was only me but after we left I asked my husband what her thought he said, "it's alright". The onion rings are good and crunchy. They taste like a Funyun potato chip. So the star of the show should be the Burger, right? Uh, no. It took 45 minutes to get our food. Our waiter apologized because it takes usually "30 minutes" as he said in the beginning. I think 30 minutes is too long so for me, 45 for a forgettable burger is just ridiculous . Our food comes and I'm excited.   My medium burger had zero pink. The grilled tomatoes looked like it was just thrown on there.  I take a bit and it taste whatever. Not bad, not good. Tasted like a dry well done burger. So I'm hungry and definitely not going to wait for a new one. Well I start eating and I realize the Burger becomes extremely hot tasting. Burn your mouth off, all you taste is chili, hot. I open the burger and the end of the chili they didn't take out all the seeds or forgot. It was so hot I could no longer eat it. Thank God it was only at 1 end, about 1/3 of the burger. My husband even said, "WOW that is super hot, no way will I eat that." So I won't be coming back. Our waiter was nice and the staff was on it. The food was not anything to make a special trip over. Definitely not worth the average time of 30 minutes. Mediocre at best. Don't waste your money.

Holy shit Ramsey! Your food awesome! I love your youtube channel. I have learned so much. But your greeting staff is absolutely fucking terrible!! I have always loved you proficiency, this is not what I accepted from you professional standards. They told us 30min we waited 55min and there where 10 tables open. We were only a part of 2 and 4 parties of 8-12 went before us. What the fuck happened. Sort this out! Horrible just horrible! Rude staff that didn't give to cents about the eager paying customers. Please come down and whip some ass. Turn over the greeting staff ASAP!
Burger was really good....expensive but good. The truffle fries were also pretty good.
Nice atmosphere,  the burger taste very good.  The beer batter onion ring taste delious.
Best Burger In Las Vegas ! We sat on the bar where you can see the kitchen and was a great experience Will go back to this amazing place !

The burgers are worth coming for. The hellfire wings don't taste that great not enough sauce on them tastes pretty bland, the fries ugh biggest disappointment of the night. Super thick starchy and not even crispy literally ended up not eating any of the fries ordered because they were way too thick. Tried telling the waiter, didn't look like he cared said it was something scientific to do with how the fries were made.

Probably the best burger I've ever had. I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, it didn't dissappoint. There was a bit of a queue to be seated. It probably took about 40 mins for the food to arrive but it was worth the wait. The prices were reasonable too for a celebrity restaurant.

Burger was delicious. I had the Pork Chop and Applesauce Burger! Truffle fries were on point and waiter made sure everything was perfect! The wait time can be a bit long so get a few drinks and prepare to hang out in the line for a while. Wish you could make reservation priors but it's still worth the wait!

We dined at Gordon Ramsay Burger on Friday evening. Our service was very good.  Six of us ordered the hamburgers since this is the specialty of this restaurant.  All of us ordered our hamburgers to be prepared medium to medium well.  Three of the six hamburgers were bloody and very undercooked. We had to send them back to be cooked longer.   The French fries were good.  This was my first and probably my last visit to this restaurant.  We were all quite disappointed by the quality of our meal.

Honestly, I can give 2 stars or even 1 because of the wait time, but the service of the waitresses is very good so I give 3 stars. We came almost 9pm, wait to get the seat for about 30-40 mins. I think since this is a famous restaurant, so it's reasonable. But the burger and the fries came almost 1 hour after we placed the order! I know that the restaurant is busy, but I don't think that it needs more than 30 mins to prepare burger, (especially because of Chef Ramsey's famous image) The waitresses keep coming and check on us and say sorry for the wait, they are very nice and friendly. About the burger itself, I was order the hell's kitchen, it is good and I give it 4 stars for the taste.  But the fries is just ok.
Thought it was another chef with his name on a regular burger... best burger I've had. Been coming here every time the last few years.

We ate here tonight and was super disappointed. I asked for a burger med/well but more on the well side and it came out bright red. The waiter tried to argue with me that it was med/well when a friend next to me had a med/well with barely any pink. I'm pregnant so it is a big deal. Then it took FOREVER to get my new burger. Two friends finished their food and another waited to eat with me so hers was cold. Worst meal experience in a long time. Only reason I gave two stars instead of one is due to the fact their truffle fries were really good. Ps the burgers themselves aren't even very good.
Favorite burger place ever! The nachos are a must! The Oreo creme brûlée shake is fantastic! Each of us had different burgers and they were all excellent.
Perhaps the best burger I have ever eaten. Planning on going back before leaving Vegas!

My Pick-up Request: After a long work day and several flight delays, we land in Vegas around 9 pm. We planned to pick-up the order and eat in our hotel room.   Right when I got into the taxi, I called the restaurant and asked if I can place an order for pick-up. She said "no, you have to come in and order." When we arrived, we went straight to the restaurant to place the order.   However, the hostess said that I cannot place and order. I had explained that I called 15 minutes ago and was informed that I could. The hostess continue to say that I can only place the order for take-out before 5pm.   This was super frustrating! We were starving. So, we dropped off our stuff and ran down to wait in line for a sit-down meal. We waited in line for 30 minutes and ordered dinner around 11pm. We waited about 30 minutes for our burgers.   We ordered truffle fries, forest burger and blue cheeseburger. Everything was tasty except the forest burger. The forest burger is bland.   After the meal, I'm still annoyed about being misinformed.

This place ruined burgers for me. It was absolutely delicious, and even the appearance of the the burger was stunning. I love burgers and I am always searching for a good burger. My first bite was so juicy and the balance of the cheese with umami of the beef was such a great balance. I got the blue cheeseburger, my boyfriend got the farm burger, and his cousin got the U.K. burger. Everyone at that table was amazed on the flavor of their burger. The fries weren't something new to me and the reason I'm giving a four star is because of our server. He got our order and gave us the check. Other people checked up on us, gave us the drinks, and the food. Also when he asked for our order he just starred us down instead of speaking up like "and what would you like to order," honestly is it that hard to do? There was a line but they got us in pretty quick. And as I've already mentioned the burger was spectacular and would love to get another burger from here again. Thanks to the chef who made our burgers!!!
Ive been to this restaurant 8 times now and it's very consistent in quality, but they menu keeps changing. The burgers are very good and the service is great. Definitely recommend.

By far the best burger I've ever had. I don't eat red meat and I got a turkey burger. I've eaten a lot of turkey burgers but never one they tasted exactly like a real burger. This one tasted like the real thing!! Ruined for all other burgers. Service was superb as well from the hostesses to waiter.

i have eaten only one time food is excellent i enjoyed the backyard burger ($15), sweet potato fries ($9), chocolate caramel tart ($7), pepsi ($4) cost plus tip $45.  if you want the one time experience eating gordon ramseybetter then go. as for a local i am going to in-n-out.

I really had my standards set high considering how many Gordan Ramsay shows I've watched. First, it was difficult for me to find this location considering that I'm a tourist lol. Parking was terrible but that's to be expected I guess. The decor was great. A wall on fire, multiple tvs. But why is it so squished? They truly tried to fit as many tables as they possibly could in here. Since it was the 2 of us we were seated within a minute. The waiter (I think his name was Sergio, I feel bad to have forgotten) was awesome. He let us know the burger would be at least half an hour, so we went ahead and ordered Just fries, truffle Parmesan fries, and the mushroom poutine. The just fries and the mushroom poutine came out first. The fries was deliciously crispy and lightly salted. I wasn't a big fan of their curry ketchup nor the Chipotle ketchup. The mushroom poutine was so bland! All of the toppings, and honestly had no flavor at all. Our waiter made no deal at all about taking it back and the manager came out to apologize and ask if he could get us anything else, so we asked for the sweet potato fries. Ommgggg. They come with a vanilla powdered sugar with its own shaker. SO BOMB. We ordered the Hells Kitchen burger and it came out at the same time as the truffle Parmesan fries. No words. The meat was juicy and just as I ordered, medium well. The chunk of avocado was perfectly ripe and had no imperfections. The avocado sauce it had was full of flavor. The bun was perfectly toasted and soft. The truffle Parmesan fries were amazing!! Bursting with flavor, perfectly crispy! We ended our meal with the chocolate creme brulee shake. Wow. Speechless. The chocolate shake was rich,decadent. I don't even like chocolate ice cream but wow. Our ending total was $68, so for the average person it is pricey, but honestly worth it. The customer service was incredible and I hope they continue to treat every customer the way we were treated.
The burger was good except for the amount Gordon Ramsey gets mad on his show, I'm surprised his workers don't know what a ripe avacado is. Our burger had a hard avacado on it.

I was curious try this place. Coming from the San Francisco Bay Area, we have many great burger places. We went around 3:30 and waited about 10-15 minutes. We opted to sit at a high top table.  I ordered the farm house burger. I really wanted the fried egg. I asked for my burger to be medium rare - basically red in the middle. It came more medium, pale pink the center. The burger was very tasty and well constructed.   My husband had the jalapeño burger. He ordered his burger medium. It came closer to medium rare. He felt there was too much jalapeño for him.  We also had the sweet potato fries. These were the best sweet potato fries! They were perfectly cooked and dusted with powdered sugar.    We also ordered the Oreo shake with 1/4 creme brûlée. That was the right amount of creme brûlée without it being overpowering. The shake was too thick for straws so we spooned it up. Delicious!  Service was very good. Our server was prompt and just attentive enough. Overall, it was a little spendy for burgers but very good.

We live in Las Vegas and have been going to BurgER for the past couple of years whenever we have company.  I always get the Britannia burger and the truffle fries!  Oh my gosh!   What a delight.  My mouth waters just thinking about the not too sweet burger.  Well, now I want another one!

The service I received was genuine and very personalized, I can't say enough good things about their customer service. The food took some time to prepare but was well worth the wait. The flavors in the burger complimented perfectly and they had a great beer selection to along with it. I ordered the Parmesan fries and the Farmhouse Burger and it was plenty of food, in fact the fries could have been shared with someone else easily. Great atmosphere and great food, I look forward to my next visit.
Every year that I come back to Vegas I come here. Burgers are amazing including their chicken burger. Fries are fabulous. They never disappoint.

Called while walking from the top of Planet Hollywood to the bottom (where the restaurant is located) to check on making a reservation and wait time. Jessica stated that they did not take reservations, that there was currently in line, though she did not promise it would not change. As it took me and my family less than 6min to get there after the call I was not worried. When we arrived, there was a huge line. When I went to the front desk, the person in charge was rude and dismissive. I asked why if I had called less than 6min ago they didn't inform me that it would be a 40min wait with a possibility that they would close before my family and I could go in. He stated "I don't know why someone would say that, this like has been that big all day today." And walked away without a knife ounce of acknowledgment that Jessica had messed up and furthered ruined our plans. It was terrible customer service and there was no need to lie.

I would just like to thank all of the team members at Ramsay Burger.  Saw Gorden plug on it and took my family a few hours we got in to town.    Later that night I spent a good 10+ with food poisoning. The Dr. Said it could be from not washing there hands, bad food etc.   You have provided the most amazing start to my hard for time off.. Thanks you and your team of donkey!
Yummy food. Our server did not check on us as often when we needed things. He was in the corner talking with other employees, we had to waive him but otherwise everything else was amazing

Welp. Wanted to be like the cool kids and give this a shot.   THE GOOD:  1. Line moved quickly. We took under 10 mins at 7.30pm to get a table.   2. Whatever ketchup they used was awesome!  THE OK:  1. Service was slow.   2. Food was ok. I ordered the Forest Burger, which had mushrooms, cheese and duck bacon. Bacon tasted good. Beef pattie was tough unfortunately, and the mushrooms were overlooked little rubber tires. I asked for lettuce wrapped and they were great with that. So that was good. But the food was forgettable. Wouldn't come back.   3. Husband ordered The Farmhouse Burger. He tells me it was a 7/10 so that is good!  3. The fries were good. Not perfect, but good. Solid effort.   THE BAD:  1. My biggest complaint was the ambience and NOISE!!!! Good grief, if I wanted my ears to bleed I would have gone to a frikken Iron Maiden Concert. There is No carpet anywhere and the noise just resounds to the point where you have  to SHOUT to be heard. I am in the audiology industry and 85 dB is where hearing loss begins to occur as a result of noise damage, and I clocked an average of 83dB in this restaurant. So damn loud to the point of super uncomfortable. Just bad form Gordon.   2. TVs were broken down and not playing- kind of added to the vibe of lack of care.   All in all, for the price, I wouldn't come back due to the noise and lack of ambience. For my money, I'd go elsewhere.
The wait was too long. The food terrible. For all Gordon Ramsey brags about... not worth.
Best burger ever.  Best onion rings...EVER.  and the milkshake while it brings all the boys in yard...I wouldn't share because it was too good to share.
Burger was good but the truffle fries were a shame. It was overfried making it so hard to bite.

Realistically this is 3.5 stars, but that's not an option on yelp. While our waitress was friendly, the food itself was only mediocre/decent. Had the truffle fries and Hell's Kitchen burger and also tried the F Word burger. Everything was decent but not perfect. I've had better truffle fries at other restaurants and my burger was pretty tasty but one large jalapeño pepper was in the middle and burned my mouth because it just came out of nowhere. I personally think that the F Word is much better. Overall, not bad but not amazing. Location is great though.
Chef Gordon Ramsey is my favorite chef. Burgers are amazing, shakes are amazing, the atmosphere is amazing as well. Good service, great food what else could you ask for.

We had a fantastic meal here with great service and reasonable pricing. The line to get in was a little long but it went surprisingly fast. We used the time to meet some great people from New Zealand. I would suggest a burger, the meat is fresh and hand prrssed. Great seasoning and buns.

The best burger Ever! There was a bit of a lineup, but patience really paid. They were kind enough to offer to text us when our table was ready, so we didn't to have to wait in line when so much can be done around! They have a very decent wine list by the glass. The ingredients are superb, and the taste combination, truly awesome! The Hog burger was absolutely perfect, as were the other burgers chosen by my companions. They also offer a few appetizer options, but you really ought to go there for the burgers!

Always entertained by Ramsay's TV shows..so thought we would give one of his restaurants a try.  Disappointed!  Every bite was pure SALT!  Had the mushroom burger, turkey burger and truffle fries.  It all tasted the same...salty!  Giving 2 stars for good service only!

The hype isn't all that. The server got our order wrong and service didn't exist here. I've been to Vegas multiple times and as a food network fan I have always wanted to try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. But every time I walk past it the long lines make it real discouraging.   I've finally got a chance to try it. Typical wait but much shorter(about 20 minutes). When we were finally greeted by the host and brought inside It was empty! There were at least 10 tables that were open so I don't understand what the wait was about. When we finally sat down the waitress took forever to come take our order. When she finally did we ordered a 'Hells kitchen burger' and truffle fries. The burger took awhile to come and when it did it was the wrong burger! They gave us the ultimate cheese burger! When we told her it was the wrong burger she didn't ask if we wanted a new one made she took another 10 minutes to go get the rest of the toppings and came back with a plate of it. She gave us a small plate with roasted tomatoes, avocado, and a cup of aioli sauce as if she was saying 'here make ya own damn burger.'  The burger was very mediocre. It was too dry for my taste. I expected a juicy burger filled with flavor. For someone who made a living off of criticizing other people's restaurants maybe Ramsay needs to check into his own.
I went with my family and got stuck at the kids table  unfortunately. But nonetheless, server was super nice and accommodating! The fries were the BOMB and the burger was delicious

By far, the best burger I've ever had! I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger with side of Truffle Fries to share. The meat was tender and juicy with a kick of spicy-ness. The customer service was friendly and attentive. Be prepared to wait to get a table, I checked in with the hostess, and killed time gambling in the Planet Hollywood casino until I got a text message that my table is ready. I highly recommend calling ahead of time to see what the wait times are.

I absolutely loved our two visits to Ramsay's Burger restaurant. Each time I ordered without the bun and my husband ordered with the bun. We were both enjoying every bite. The Parmesan truffle fries and decadent and tasty.  They come with two sauces which are fine, but next time I want mustard (just my preference.) I tried the chicken tikka burger without the bun, and loved the spices! I would order this again. My husband ordered the same thing both times because he loved it so much, and it was served exactly the same on both occasions. The beer is pretty good as well!

Disappointed. We arrived at 2:30 but waited for 20mins, which is acceptable cause Ramsay has so many fans. We ordered sweet potato fries, hell kitchen burger, blue cheese burger and farm burger. They are just good/ok/not bad. They are not WOW. Maybe I expect too much

Best burger I have ever had in my life, period! As a die-hard In-N-Out fan, I used to view Burger as a fast and convenient eat. After trying Gordon Ramsay Burgers, it totally changed the way how I used to perceive Burgers, I had never thought Burgers could be this delicious. I was totally awed by their creativity in combining so many different ingredients to make each burger so unique and delicious. This is not only making a burger, but this is also making an art!   During my stay in Vegas, I had the opportunities to try the following:  1. Farmhouse Burger(Rating 5/5)-The bun which grilled over the apple wood has a slight sweet taste to it and combines so well with beef, cheese,duck bacon and egg. This is a very traditional style burger can be served in many places, but the way Gordon Ramsay does it and the ingredients used making it THE BEST!  2. Lobster and Shrimp Burger(Rating 4.5/5)-The pickled vegetables, aioli combined with the lobster and shrimp patty was incredible. You get the taste of the sweetness and sourness of the pickle vegetables and the ocean taste of the shrimp and lobster all in one bite. The only downside is that the shrimp flavor overshadowed the lobster.  3. Hog Burger(Rating 4.5/5)-The pork patty combined with bacon tasted very juicy, tender and crunchy at the same time and the pickled cucumbers gives a slightly sour taste. Very very good.  4. Just Fries(Rating 5/5)-The potatoes they used were so fresh, clearly hand cut, not frozen and were fried perfectly. It comes with two different sauces: traditional tomato sauce and the spicy tomato sauce, both you can tell easily are home made and both taste are OUT OF THIS WORLD when you dip in the fries. I have never had any fries this delicious before.  The price is significantly steeper than a fast food chain like In-N-Out or Shake Shack, but I believe the quality and the taste made it worth every penny.   I sincerely wish Gordon Ramsay Burger can be opened in LA one day. I will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again.
Forest Burger is life...yum. One star off because it's a little hard to get a table and it took us two tries to make it to get seated. Really good!

Best burger I've ever had! The garlic truffle Parmesan fries are AMAZING!!!! I got the crown burger which was great. Almost got the Hell's Kitchen burger but wasn't too crazy about the jalapeños. The sweet potato fries were so so. Nothing great. My mom got the blue cheese burger and said it was amazing!!! Long wait but so worth it.

The name alone attracts most tourists (I really wanted to bump into Gordon Ramsay and have him yell at me for my lack of cooking skills), but the food will not let you down.  The menu describes every burger down to the T, so if you like your burger a certain way or enjoy the creativity the choices offer, then definitely go with your instincts and let your stomach order. The burgers are huge and the fries are as well so you can always share with a friend if you need to. I will say though, be careful of the truffle fries... the taste is really strong!

Wow wow wow!!!! No words to describe this place. I came here with high expectations and they were definitely exceeded! You really cannot expect nothing but the very finest from Gordon Ramsay. The never ending line out the door speaks volumes as to how amazing the food is here.   My husband and I came here for lunch right before the rush started so the wait in line was only about 30 minutes which wasn't too bad compared to other times we checked to see the wait time and it was at 2.5 hours!!! (Insanity!) we finally got to the front of the line and we're seated. Service was great here (Gordon Ramsay has trained everyone very well here lol).   We ordered the Caesar salad was the best I've ever had. It was a unique twist with Romaine lettuce, baby kale and thinly sliced green apples and radishes which added a nice zest to the salad tossed in their house made Caesar dressing which was phenomenal. Then we got the onion rings, French fries, and the portobello mushroom burger.  We enjoyed every bite of our food!   Definitely deserve five stars! We will definitely be coming back thank you so much for the amazing food and service!!

Okay...let's start with the positives. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger and it was amazingly delicious! The reason for the 3 starts is because 1. I ordered my burger well done and it has soooo much pink that they had to take it back to recook (3 other people at my table had the same issue) 2. The service was mediocre and the waitress didn't come buy enough to check on us 3. The burgers took 45 once the order was placed 4) For the price of the burgers and fries it wasn't worth it.  I got the Parmesan truffle fries and I did not like them at all. There was way too much Parmesan cheese on it  The manager was very apologetic about the burgers not being cooked how we ordered them so she gave us 10% off and everyone got a free dessert! Now the dessert is amazing!!! I tried to Oreo and chocolate shake and YUM!! The Oreo shake tastes better to me as the chocolate shake was very rich.  I won't be returning.

I have been twice now. Once on my own and once with my wife. On my own I was able to get a seat at the counter right away. With my wife we made an effort to get in line at 10:30am so we could be sat as soon as they open. When going here expect a wait. It is very popular and for good reason. It is located in Planet Hollywood on the north end of the casino.   Service was excellent both times. The burgers are extremely flavorful. The bun is delicious. There are many good options to choose from.   On my visit with my wife, Gordon himself actually stopped in. I was very impressed that the first thing he did was walk around and shake every single employee's hand and thank them. Clearly a good guy to work for if you do your job right.   Plan accordingly for the wait, and I think you will find this place to be worth it. Plus a 30 minute wait really is no big deal.

My gf and I had about an hour before our show was going to start so we wanted to grab something to eat. We walked over to Planet Hollywood and we saw there was no line here at 6pm. My gf was craving a burger and had always wanted to eat here, soooooo off we went. There was a wait of 5 minutes to which we avoided by sitting at the chef's table. Normally we love to sit at the chef's table, but this table was different. We sat right next to where the servers roll the silverware. So the staff would dump the silverware into the bucket and it was like nails on a chalkboard over and over again. We did our best to ignore it, but it was tough for sure. We looked back outside and there was now a line of 20 people!   The benefit of sitting at the chef's table is you get to see all the food as it comes out. In addition there is plenty of staff there to help if you need more drinks, items or just have questions. When our server greeted us, he immediately let us know there was a 30-40 minute wait for food. We decided to chance it and order food possibly missing a few minutes of the show. Plus at most places they over estimate those times to cover themselves, usually it's half that time.   We decided to go w/ their specialty burger of the day, to which they only make a certain amount of. I'm not sharing what that is due to not knowing if they only serve it particular days of the week, certain months or if it's a one time thing. I wouldn't want to get your hopes up. In addition to that burger we ordered the 'Hells Kitchen' burger - asadero cheese, roasted jalapeños, avocado, roasted tomatoes, jalapeño aioli  We kept watching food come out and hoping it was ours. It was starting to close in on that 30-40 minute mark. We hadn't see our server since dropping off our drinks and taking our order. Like magic he appeared when the food arrived. To which I quickly asked for the check. The manger on duty came to us to apologize for the wait and ask if we needed anything else. I informed her of the lack of attention our server gave as we sat there and how our waters weren't refilled during the time we got them until the time we got our burgers.  Once we started digging into these burgers, we realized it was worth the wait. Typically it can be hard to wow me w/ a burger at a particular price, but maaaaaaaaaaan were these burgers good! The specialty was $25 and the Hells Kitchen burger was $16. Both well worth the wait and price.   If you are craving a burger on the strip, def check this place out! Just make sure you get a table and not the chef's table.
Nice waiter but the food was bad. My nachos came out in like 10 seconds and it's cold. Fries were awful and burger was okay

Three stars takes into account the price, time of wait and quality of meat.  This was a very good burger overall. The cheeses, sauces, shoestring onions were all tasty. The bun with light and fluffy and was a nice complement to the meat. The burgers were cooked appropriately to my medium request. The house ketchup was excellent. However for a 45 minute wait and 20 dollar burger I expect to have some kind of unique beef like an aged prime beef that is ground in house. The burger itself was bland. The toppings were all unique and quite good. But For 18-22 dollars per burger and 60 dollars for lunch I expect more. Save yourself some time and money and go to earl of sandwich right down the hall.

Not a bad spot to get a burger. I've been here a couple of times. The consistent highlights are the milkshakes. Specifically the Oreo Milkshake with Creme Brûlée topping is possibly the best milkshake I've ever had. It's small and expensive, but we're in Vegas so it's worth every penny.  The burgers themselves are pretty good too. The Hell's Kitchen burger is spicy and balanced whereas The Crown burger I found to be over seasoned and a bit bland otherwise. The burger buns stand on their own though. They're soft and pillowy but also sturdy and soak up the burger juices without falling apart. They're buttery and have a good flavor from the sesame seeds. A perfect bun really.  The fries are pretty blah. I've had better many places. I like my fries crisp on the outside and soft in the middle and I feel like these lack a bit on the outside crispiness. The poutine is OK if you like mushrooms, though I've had better back home.  So if you're a Ramsay fan stop here and grab a Hell's Kitchen and shake!

Excellent! My son and I just happened to pass by and decided to stop. The wait time was about 20-30 minutes for a Monday night. I ordered the farmhouse burger and my son order the shrimp and lobster burger. Both were excellent and the truffle fries with the aioli sauce were absolutely delish! Would definitely recommend.

We were looking forward to trying this place so I hate giving it two stars but the burger and fries just weren't good. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and my husband got the Blue Cheeseburger. The patties were cooked well but there was NO flavor. It tasted like an unseasoned mash of beef and avocados. If I didn't know that there were jalapeños in there, I would never have been able to guess. I had to asked for ketchup and slathered mine in it to finish it. My husband tried mine and said his was only slightly better. I didn't try his since I don't like blue cheese so it wouldn't have been a fair assessment. The fries were the same consistency throughout, no texture on the outside. They were just slightly limp cuts of potato. The only saver of the night were the onion rings. Now those were THE BEST onion rings of my life, and I don't typically go for them. The servers were great so with that and the onion rings, I think two stars is fair. WAH, I so wish I would give a better review but that only comes with a better burger.

I really thought this place would be all hype. Granted, I went anyway, but I didn't actually expect to get what I paid for.   If you are in Vegas, go to Gordon Ramsay Burger. PLEASE!! My friend and I each got a different burger. I got the bleu cheese burger, she got the Hell's Kitchen burger. Get hers. The Hell's Kitchen burger was so freaking delicious!!! Mine was great, but I really can't get over how good hers was!  The burgers are so juicy. We both ordered ours medium well, hers actually came out over cooked, well done, and was still juicy. We later learned that if you tell them that, they'll get you a new burger within minutes. Our server seemed pretty bummed that we didn't tell her sooner. So please note that. They really care that you enjoy your food.   I also enjoyed that you can keep the menu as a souvenir. I initially thought it was a little cheap for a Ramsay establishment to have laminated paper menus, until she said that, then it all made sense.   If you're hungry, I'd go another day. It takes around 20 minutes for the burgers to come. And they're pretty hearty, so I'm not sure if I'd load up on appetizers. You know what you can eat better than I.   Also, I must stress to get the truffle fries!! It comes with their house ketchup AND a truffle aioli. We actually added the aioli to our burgers and it took them up a million notches! Do it. You won't be sorry!!! This is coming from someone who dislikes mayonnaise, it's so good!!! And you can literally see chunks of truffle inside. Totally worth it.    I will point out that burgers and fries are separate. Entries don't come with sides, but the burgers are so good they really can stand alone! I'll be back the next time I visit to try another sandwich. I know it'll be worth every penny!!
We ordered the uber cheeseburger. How can a burger be so good that's just meat, cheese and bun? Best thing ever!

Finishing a trade show at 10:30 and trying to find decent food is a challenge, especially with four sober men who need a beer and some burgers. Stoked GRB was open. Great beer selection and menu. Buddy had a lobster burger and liked it, I had the farm stand burger and felt -yeh. It was kind of like eating a fancied up Johnny Rockets burger. The truffle fried and onion rings made up for it. Worth and shot just know its pricy... like all burgers on the strip.

The food was amazing. My husband is a huge GR fan so we had to get to one of his restaurants while in Las Vegas. The downside is there is usually a pretty long wait. We arrived at 5pm on a Thursday and had to wait approximately 30 min for a table. The service could have been better/more attentive and the dining room is very, very cramped and crowded. But the food more than makes up for it. One of the best burgers I've eaten in awhile.

It's a very good option for gourmet burgers. The F-Burger is not listed in the menu (beef and barbecue pulled pork) and Lobster & shrimps are the best. Include chicken wings as entree. Ask fries with truffle mayonnaise. A drafted beer like New Castle it's a must.

I mean, can you really go wrong with one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants? Everything was delicious. I definitely recommend the blue cheese burger and the crown burger. Don't waste your time and money eating burgers anywhere else in Vegas.

Great burger, great appetizers, great desserts, and most importantly great service!  I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger which was very sophisticated in flavor and very well composed.  The pickled  Jalapenos were a bit too spicy for my taste but I enjoyed every bite of it.  Appetizers and fries were very unique and also very rich in flavor.  The fries were soggy and wasnt freshly fried, hence the one star knocked off.  Desserts were a bit overwhelmingly large in amount, simple and nicely done. I had the crem brulee oreo shake which was very well balanced, not too sweet, not too chunky with oreo.  Overall, I would come back to Gordon Ramsay Burger on my next visit to Las Vegas, and I can assure you it is well worth the extra price for a nice burger.
Ordered poutine and Hell's Kitchen burger. Best burger I've ever had! Service is also good. Had margarita the other day. It's too sweet to me. But definitely will recommend this restaurant!

Had a Curried Shrimp Salad on my visit! Are at the bar and had great service! My drinks were perfect and the salad was memorable. Delicious big shrimp with tasty dressing, almonds and apples. No it's not a burger...it is still worth a visit!

2nd visit with the husband and 1st visit with the kids. Everyone loved their burgers and my husband couldn't stop talking about the Mediterranean Burger. Everyone in this restaurant is so friendly and accommodating. It was a long wait to be seated, but completely refreshing when the staff thanked us for our willingness to wait. Jonathan the GM introduced himself to our table, and was buzzing around the restaurant greeting other guests, seating guests, and removing dishes from tables. The food is amazing, the staff is out of this world, and we will always come back. My kids were only disappointed that Gordon wasn't there yelling at somebody.
Visited on 1-6-18. We loved it! A bit of a wait to be seated and for your food. Got the cheese burger and we shared fries. Definitely would recommend and go back.

Gordon Ramsay definitely knows what he's doing! Been here twice and I really enjoyed it. It's usually busy but I came here at 10pm on a Sunday and didn't have to wait at all. The first time was with a big party and I think we only waited for 20-30 minutes, so not bad.  We got the ahi tuna sliders as an appetizer - it was really good. But heads up, it's only two sliders on the order! I got the Farmhouse Burger, which comes with cheese, bacon and an egg. My boyfriend says you should always get it done Gordon Ramsay style, medium rare. Delicious, juicy and flavorful! My boyfriend got the Hell's Kitchen burger and he said it was alright. We also shared an order of Truffle Parmesan Fries. SO GOOD. Definitely enough to share between a couple.   The menu has many other different kinds of burgers, even hot dogs and milkshakes. I saw a lot of tables order the onion rings too, and it smelled and looked so good!
This here place puts together an honest burger at an honest price.  Be prepared to wait in a long line if you decide to show up at normal dinner hours.

This place has some awesome burgers and very good fries. The spicy jalepeno burger is great if you like spicy food. I gave it a 4, because it's very expensive. Look to pay at least 30 or more per person if you want a burger, fries and a drink. Burgers are approximately $16 each and fries are $8 on up. It's definitely a great place to try if you haven't been. Ask for your burger to be cooked well, if you don't want any pink.

One of my friend wanted to check out this place after passing by the restaurant. There seems to be a long line for lunch and dinner, but if you have a party of 4 or more, they will give you a pager and you wouldn't need to stand in line.   The food was mediocre. To me, it was nothing more than an all-American burger joint with Ramsay's name (and price tag) attached to it. Burgers were about $17, which was not worth the money. The patty is a generous portion, so it's definitely possible to split a burger and order some gravy fries to share. Overall, we thought that the food was a bit too salty.  It was a fun experience to check out a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, but would I come back again? Probably not...

Skip it. Skip it. SKIP IT! I have been in Vegas for a week and literally couldn't find a bad meal. I let my guard down. Fool me once... This was horrible. We ordered chicken wings and they were ice cold in the middle. Clearly precooked and reheated. So gross. I had to insist that I wouldn't pay for them, rather than being offered a comp. Burgers were sub par. Definitely nothing to write home about. Disappointed for sure. I expected way more from Gordon Ramsay. So sad.

We came here at around 4:30 and only had to wait less than five minutes before we were seated. We ordered truffle fries and some beer on tap. My husband ordered the blue cheese burger and I ordered the farm burger, both medium. We did wait a while to get our food but the waitress let it be known that there was an average of a 30-minute wait to get our food. We didn't mind. Shortly after being seated we saw the line get very long. The average wait time was about 40 minutes to be seated. Our burgers were excellent. Can't wait to come back and try some more.
So good and so juicy. Very large fries that was good for 3 people. Ypu need to wait in line if you a couple but definitely recommend.
This place is over rated. Except the the piece of meat, the rest of bun and veggies were below normal quality. Over priced for what you pay! It's just a one time try!
Totally surpassed my expectations!  The truffle fries were off the hook!  Both of our burgers were amazing!

I think Gordon would f*kng appalled and would tear into the staff here, especially the scruffy moist-lipped manager, standing there in his shiny-elbowed jacket with his shirt untucked, while his staff put drinks on our table, right under his nose, then shortly followed up to slide coasters underneath. Similar thing with our shared starters -- side plates for them arrived about 10 minutes later. The burgers were fine, but again, I'm not sure "fine" in that sense it what Gordon is after. I got The Crown Burger which has rocket/arugula and dried tomatoes. Sounds good but here's a thing: more arugula does not a better burger make, especially if you don't offset the dryness with more cheese. I love mimolette, surely everyone loves mimolette. give us more of that! This isn't fine dining, it's just fine. Prices are fine, wait was fine, service was fine, if a little amateur. Food was fine. F*ked off home.

Waiting over 45 minutes to get our food the service is horrific!!! The attitude of the waitress was like what do you mean the service is taking too long I'm a look at one of the good burger I guess I came to the wrong place

3.5 stars Despite having been a life-long fan of Gordon Ramsay's TV shows like Hell's Kitchen, MasterChef, and the F-Word, I've never actually visited one of his restaurants, so on my recent visit to Las Vegas, Gordon Ramsay Burger was the place to go! Located in Planet Hollywood, the place has a casual "sports-bar" vibe, along with an open kitchen, and there were people of all different ages and group sizes eating at this busy restaurant. We started our meal with the parmesan truffle fries, which came with a spiced ketchup and truffle aioli on the side. I didn't find the fries particularly special (there was a distinct lack of truffle aroma/flavor), but the truffle aioli was chock full of amazing umami unctuousness, though the ketchup was just dominated by sweetness.  And then what we came for--the burgers! The Hell's Kitchen burger was a must-order, and it came with melted asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, roasted tomatoes, jalapeno aioli, and avocado. Plenty of fire and spiciness indeed (and the burger itself was nice and juicy), but otherwise, the flavors of the burger weren't all that interesting, and the bun turned out to be overly greasy with butter. I much preferred the Forest burger, which came with salty tremor cheese, forest mushrooms, arugula, and duck bacon. The flavors of this burger were very umami (thanks to the mushroom, cheese, and bacon), and the combination with the refreshing arugula worked very nicely! Again, however, the bun was way more greasy than necessary.  The burgers at Gordon Ramsay were good, but I can't say that they were the best I've had or necessarily worth the celebrity-chef price tag. I won't be in a rush to come back, but perhaps some of Gordon Ramsay's other restaurants in Vegas would be worth a try!

Came on Sunday Night, late, line was short but wait about 15 minutes.  Young female hostesses laughing about things in their life as the customers wait with not even a greeting or an estimate or anything. I definitely felt there was no caring for the customer and wished Gordon Ramsay had walked in causing the hostesses to stand at attention and get people seated. The burgers are excellent, maybe the best I've ever tasted, but the onion rings were not 100% done, a bit doughy on the inside. For the price of these hamburgers I would have like to be treated with a little bit more respect.  Just not feeling anyone cared.

I'm a huge GR fan and this was my first visit to one of his restaurants. However, I'm pretty disappointed.   My waitress asked how I wanted my burger done, and I said well done. I don't like pink in my burger-- it grosses me out. I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger. I also ordered the truffle Parmesan fries. The cocktails are very strong! And yummy.  In less than 4 minutes my burger and fries came out. My burger looked delicious, until I bit into it. So raw, I could mush it (all I thought in this moment was that the cow was literally walking bc it was so rare, clearly I am obsessed with Ramsay). However, the ingredients were definitely fresh, the bun was perfect. The avocado was so huge, it was impossible to eat my burger without making a mess. So I mushed the avocado and then put it on my burger. No big deal, because it was a delicious and generous amount of avocado. The fries were a bit dry, somewhat crunchy, needed some salt, but tasted good once I dipped them in ketchup. You get a bunch of the French fries to share ($11).  I ate what was brown enough. The waitress said the manager took care of my burger which was really generous. I would come back for sure. But would probably choose a different burger and hopefully they make it well done next time I'm in Vegas.
