This was one of the best burgers I have had so far . I loved the ambience of the place . It was amazing , not over prized at all . Burgers ranging from 15-22. Also try there wings and fries in apps.

BurGR was always a staple for us during all of our Vegas trips. When we passed by on our most recent visit and saw that it got rebranded to Gordon Ramsay Burger, we were a little surprised, but it makes total sense seeing as how GR seems to be taking over the strip with new places.  The menu has been revamped. There are definitely new items, and there aren't Total Rewards discounts anymore. The shakes have also been redone so that they aren't just named by numbers anymore. All that being said, the quality of the food is just as good as it was. Juicy, medium rare burgers with heapings of mouthwatering toppings that will just barely fit into your mouth.  Farmhouse Burger. Still our classic go-to. A juicy burger topped with bacon and a fried egg. You know, just in case the burger itself wasn't enough protein for you. The bacon has been upgraded from duck bacon to mangalitsa bacon, which we're told is like the kobe beef of pork. What's mangalitsa, you ask? Google it. You won't be sorry.  Forest Burger. This one offers up more greens in the form of arugula and 'shrooms. Duck bacon still comes into play here though, so don't let the name fool you into thinking this is just made of rabbit food.  Just Fries. Because sometimes, you just want to be fries. Thick cut fries served with two sauces. One reminded me of a curry-like sauce and the other was more a traditional ketchup with a kick.  Didn't have room for dessert this time, but we'll definitely be back!

This is my second time here. Quality not good enough for this price, overpriced IMO. We did order the truffle fries and onion rings, both were dry and really nothing special.   I think the habit burger grill (chain restaurant) is way better than this.
Really great Valentine's Day destination.  Saw over a dozen cute couples leaning towards each other whispering sweet nothings.  Unique menu with fun stuff to see.

Delicious Hell's Kitchen burger and truffle fries. The wait for four people was approximately 45 minutes (not bad for a Saturday) they texted and called us when our table was ready. I would definitely return.

Long wait-time for very slow service and an average burger makes this an over-rated, over-hyped tourist restaurant just to check off a celebrity owned Vegas restaurant. Biggest issue here is the service. Our 45-minute wait time on a Friday afternoon was expected, but it took 1 hr between ordering and our food to come out, and an addional 20 min to get the bill after requested. There are a ton of workers buzzing but hardly come around - even just to refill water, let alone order. Fries are thick-cut, and average. Burger was good....but worth $15...no, however they did cook it to a great medium-rare. Curried shrimp salad was big for $15 with lots of shrimp and spiced well.  Ordered -Hell's Fire Burger -Backyard Burger -Curried Shrimp Salad

I'm not gonna lie. I'm not GR follower so my expectations were nominal. We got right in on a Monday evening at prime time dinner time. The night before we passed by & there was a HUGE line way out into the casino. So I'd recommend reservations for sure. The burgers were stunning. Stacked high with toppings & a fresh baked bun. I had the lobster shrimp burger that was tasty wasn't impressive. It was on the dryer side due to preparedness. The rest of the table had juicy, delish perfectly prepared burgers. Kind of jealous I didn't order a more traditional burger. The table ordered & shared fries, sweet potato fries & onion rings. The fries were all thick cut crispy outside & pillowy delish potato on the inside & the dipping sauces were yum. The onion rings had a crispy beer batter & also a couple of traditional dipping sauces. The cocktails were as delicious as the were strong. The check did have a Vegas GR price tag on it so come prepared to spend some cash & enjoy your burger.

Ramsey would be pissed I sat down with a party of 4 host was very nice but the server was non existent we waiting over 10 minutes before we just got up and left it seemed all the severe wanted to do was chat with each other at their computer station should have expected it since as we walked in another group had approached the host table and asked where do we pay cause they had not seem their server in a long time very disappointing

Hell's Kitchen burger and fries were the best I've ever eaten.  Tender delicious beef.  Perfect bun and delightful heat!  Not so hot it sears taste buds, but very very warm. Every bite was great!   Fries are huge hot planks and extra delicious with special dipping sauce.   Extremely organized and friendly staff managed a very large holiday crowd with ease. We will return!
We had Kettle Nachos, Hells kit burger, Farmhouse burger and Truffle fries. Food and service were great. Nice and warm hospitality.

I had one of the best burgers ever here! I came with my staff, and the food was off the hook! We all enjoyed it immensely! The fries were super good! It's super busy so get there early or get a reservation!

Food was 5/5, Hilary (our server) was 0/5. First off Id like to say I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay restaurants and in my recent visit to Las Vegas I made an effort to visit every single of his restaurants (Steak, Pub, Hells Kitchen, Fish and Chips, and finally Burger). All the other restaurants were fantastic and I loved the food including this one! So you might wonder why a 2/5.... The service was terrible our server was Hilary and I cannot say one good thing about her, after sitting down we waited about 15 minutes before she made our way to our table after coming to our table she looked like she was not interested in serving us because we looked younger and maybe wont tip as much as the table next to us who she was all over. After asking for a drinks menu it came about 10 minutes after I asked, then took another 20 minutes for our drinks order. Every time she came to our table she was terrible and I saw her going up to other servers laughing and just chatting. She was terrible and if you have her as a server please ask for someone else.

Normally when hubby & I travel we'll dine at a steakhouse & initially planned on going to Gordon Ramsay Steak at Paris until our son & his girlfriend convinced us otherwise to get burgers. So, why not? Our visit landed us here on a Wednesday evening about 4pm & we waited 5 minutes for a table. Appetizers looked amazing- especially their Cheddar Ale soup (which I really wanted to try $9) but- it didn't offer options for different portions. If there was a cup portion- I'd be all over it. Maybe next time. I really wanted to try Bangers & mash... but, kept scoping the menu til it caught my eye- Foie Burger!! How often do your tastebuds land on this?!  Foie burger: Foie gras spread; Chevrè (goat milk cheese); frisée; port wine aïoli. I had to cut this burger in half- not that it was some huge gigantic thing... but, I wanted to see how it was layered. I'm neurotic this way, pardon me.  Foie gras spread on both buns- optimum juices flowed beneath burger patty! It took me a quick one to realize what caught my tastebuds attention! It was the Chèvre! I really don't like goat milk- but, it wasn't slathered thick at all.... and I was actually dealing with it well enough to eat every single bite of this burger! Super proud of myself.  The order of truffle parmesan fries comes w/ 2 condiments- ketchup w/ Tabasco sauce and truffle aïoli (you'll see flakes of truffle). Servers were kind enough to bring the curry AND chipotle ketchup too! That curry ketchup blew my mind! So glad these fries are steak cut!  Since we were told Gordon Ramsay liked the Innes & Gunn oak aged ale- why not?! There are notes of vanilla and toffee! Whoa! This ale was delicious!!!
This was the best part of my trip to Las Vegas.!! My wife & I were so excited to eat here. Best food ever!! Next time we are in Vegas this is going to be another for sure stop on our adventures!!
For 15 bucks just for the burger you can get a much flavorful burger at shake shack for way less   Fries where waaaay over cooked

We went here back in March & were in love. We went back in May and were disappointed the menu changed. The burgers we got were still amazing and we left stuffed. Be sure you stop by hostess stand if you have a larger party. All small parties have to just wait in line.
My favorite burger place OMG!!!! We went for late brunch and when we fall in love. Words can explain how amazing this place

Our server Rick made sure we were set up. Just as if we were sitting on the set of Hells Kitchen. Rick recommended a burger for my son, and I. Also I let him pick the beer I washed my burger down with.  We started with a order of onion rings, fantastic. Lots of flavor. Light. Not greasy at all. Our burgers, and a order of fries that we split came out quickly.  Burger was done perfect. It was honestly 1 of the best burgers I have ever ate. Rick did a awesome job taking care of us both. Did a great job with his pairings. If you head there for lunch, or dinner...Rick is your guy
Best burger I've ever had! Definitely don't go to Bobby's Burger Palace. Gordon's is waaaaayyy better and similarly priced. Also make sure you get the Fries!

The service was awesome. The recommendations on point. Get a medium burger. Live your life (we didn't die) and it was amazing. Get two burgers. Skip the fries. The hot wings will melt your tits off. Ugh still thinking about how good the burgers were....it obviously is a very busy place but the best restaurant in planet Hollywood for sure.

Food is ok... I had no service at all for my table. Appetizers put in last.... I had to flag down food runners to get some service. Then a manager comes and resolves my water refilll. But still you call yourself a Gordon Ramsey restaurant I better receive that type of service... Disappointment for a vacation food.

So this week I am in Vegas for 2 days for my daughters roller derby game. My 2nd time in Vegas, my daughters 1st. We arrive at our #Airbnb which is 20 minutes from the strip at 4pm. I've been driving since 10 or 11am and at this point I am #HANGRY. So we start going back and forth about where to eat and not steer away from our #Whole30 ways. All of a sudden it was like a lightbulb went off. Wifey and I were like BUMP THAT!!! Where's Gordon??? "I want a burger"!!!  So we head over to the strip get to the restaurant and of course, there's a line from the door well into the casino. However, because we were only a party of 3 we didn't have to wait in that line. We did have a 45 minute wait time. So we walked around for a bit then came back after 30 minutes and ordered drinks at the bar. I look at the drink menu (which is a tablet) the bartender hands me and like a jerk, I start looking at the list of beers. First off, I hardly ever order a beer in my home state. It's a rule for my family, if you're out of town you do not order something you'd ordinarily get at home; if you do you are a jerk!   Anyway, I ordered the Honey Tennesse Jack Daniels peach cocktail for me and wifey and when I say we were so happy with those drinks I ordered 4 more for myself (in my mind). But I needed to eat and I was conflicted because everything sounded so good. Plus I wanted that seafood burger and the Anniversary burger so I got both and a poutine. I ordered it the way chef recommends and so glad I did. So flavorful and perfect portions. My only critique would be the seating booths are slightly too low, I felt kind of awkward at the table. Other than that the staff was great, warm a personable. We enjoyed every bite and will be back everytime we are in Vegas. #BaptisteClan
Best of the best  Should try if you are in Vegas. Highly recommend the HK burger,it was really good.
It took one hour to get our food, but it was worth it. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger, and it was amazing. Although, it was overprice, I recommend this burger joint if you're in Vegas.

Was recommended by a friend and boy was he right. From the moment I stepped in the, the hostess Ms. Zeleida, greeted us, let us know there would be a few minute wait time, however,  got us seated immediately. She was very efficient, proffesional, and had excellent customer service. The server was aswell excellent, the good was amazing. I have to give this place inside the PH 5 stars all the way. Just how a friend refered me her, i will as well try to convince others of how good this place is. The service and the food will make you come again.

Well worth the extra cost related to the name of the Chef. Truffle fries are legit, my son said the sweet potato fries w/lemon infused powdered sugar are the best ever. Waitress was super knowledgeable & helpful for us. Oh yeah, the best Onion Rings ever!!!!!

Ryan is the GOAT of all waiters! Best service I've experienced in the past 3 years of coming here, and at any restaurant for that matter. Brandon did a  stellar job as well. Outstanding service. 10/10 will be back.

I got the Farmhouse burger sans cheese and it was perfectly cooked and delicious! The fries were excellent as far as steak fries go even though they're not my favorite. The service really was excellent also! The waitress was very attentive! The only negative is the line to wait is right next to the beautiful fire display - I totally don't mind waiting but it feels like you are waiting in the steaming hot kitchen!  (no pun intended!)
Fresh, tasty and the burgers combinations makes you want to try them all! There's a bit of a waiting time but it's worth it.

Wow.  This place was amazing.  The service was awesome.  Waiter was super attentive and very courteous.  Food was delicious and perfectly cooked.  My kids loved it. The picky eater said it was the best burger they ever had.

After watching the Bruno Mars concert, the wife and I headed back towards our hotel and stumbled on this gem of a restaurant inside the PH. It was about 11pm and didn't expect to wait as long as we did. I should have known better, this was Vegas! We stood in line for about 45 minutes before we got seated. Took off one star for this experience. They have a dedicated line for couples and trios; larger parties skip the line and head straight to the hostess for seating. Why penalize the smaller parties. When we got to the front of the line, we counted three parties of six that were seated before us. How about clearing one or two couples in between seatings for the larger parties to make it equitable?  We got seated and proceeded to order. I went with the cheeseburger with bacon and egg and the wife went with the one with arugula. And some fries. In about 5 minutes, a runner came with a plate of tritip nachos. We didn't touch it and waited for our waiter. Asked him what it was and he immediately realized it was wrong. To our surprise, he took the plate away. Why didn't he just leave it? It's not like he could have served it to another party? He came back a minute later and offered it to us no charge. It was excellente! Found out later that it was intended for the trio of drunk girls next to us, to which we had some good conversation.  The burgers came out, and it was perfectly cooked. Medium as we ordered. These burgers were legit, the bun was great and the fixins were perfect. Great great burger. Bacon was thick and crispy and the egg yolk made a de facto sauce for the beef. Wish I came back. And surprisingly didn't feel too gross after. Fries - just ok. I've tasted some awesome fries and this here is lacking. (my baseline for great fries? Lazy Dog)  Legit burger!

This review is long overdue. I was in Vegas back in September. This was the best burger I have ever had. I am glad I didn't order fries because that Made me appreciate the taste of the burger even more! I had the ultimate cheeseburger with bacon. I can't wait to go back when I am in town!

Burgers here are delicious! Fries are amazing! Also had their shakes which were just has delicious. We had to wait about 40 minutes for two, but according to people in the area that's normal.   Staff was very friendly and attentive. We were sat at the counter. Stools were cushiony and comfortable. The counter wasn't very romantic, but there were tables further in that seemed more romantic. They have a wall that appeared to have a gas fire going on which was really cute.  Staff was great. I was hoping to get a surprise appearance from the man himself, but maybe next time haha.

Vegetarian impossible burger is trash. Paid almost as much for the lobster burger and was definitely not worth it at all. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger. It came with avocado, grilled jalapeño, cheese, grilled tomatoes and somehow it still didn't manage to taste good. No flavor at all and, it was super dry even though I got it medium rare. Probably one of the worst veggie burgers I've ever had. Tilt in Oregon still the best one I've had. They had truffle fries which were really freaking good I just wish the rest of the dish was just as good. Our sever was awesome too! He even brought us extra sauce. Don't think I'll be coming back for more though. :( l really wanted to like it.

Waited in line 40 mind just to find multiple empty tables inside... service was so slow! Burger was good but not life changing. Was not told about the specials and they were probably better than what I got... what a let down....

Great food, very nice atmosphere!!! I was super high but didn't feel out of place still.. the only downside is the line is ridiculous and Silver 7 members can cut to the front of the line the so the person just wanting a burger who is not staying at Planet Hollywood can end of waiting quite awhile.. ours was around 1 hour 20 minutes..  But if we can wait it's well worth the food they give you l!!!

Delicious, perfect simple burgers. The bun and the patty are the stars, as they should be. Our server, Alex, really made the meal enjoyable too. Good people, great food, didn't have to wait more than ten minutes for a table because we beat the 1130am lunch rush.

This place lived up to it's name! Everything was amazing, delicious and best burgers we've had. The Ahi Tuna sliders were my favorite, very fresh and flavorful. We also ordered the Hells Kitchen and 2 others (forgot the name) and they were perfect. Got the reg truffle parm fries and sweet potato, but the sweet potatoes were our favorite. Highly recommend the Ahi Tuna sliders, Hell's Kitchen burger and Sweet Potato parmesan fries.

I have tried other GR restaurants and have been pleased in the past. The best time seems to be Saturday between 2-4. Parties of 3 or more can check in with the hostess but 2 or less must stand in the line. On Friday and Saturday nights, this is a very long line. My food was good but I was not about to stand in line for 60 minutes plus.   I chose the patriot burger which is a turkey burger with cheese, a spicy mayo, and potato sticks. It was crunchy and very flavorful. I paired this burger with the truffle fries which were terrific.

The food was amazing and the staff rocks . Sosa was very nice and sincere he made us feel very welcome even though we could see him running around like crazy from behind the counter. I will definitely be coming here again!

Best burger I have ever had in my life. My friend recommended me this place and I didn't understand what all the hype was about. As we walked into Planet Hollywood there was a line (an hour wait). We put our names down and walked around for a while. Once seated we looked through the menu and I eyed the Hell's Kitchen burger. My friends all opted for different burgers and we ordered some truffle fries for the table. My burger was cooked to perfect and the cheese was perfect too. Something about the sesame bun just made it even better. Our table ate the fries so fast, so I'll tell you now...its a must!!! This place won't disappoint you with its good service, clean environment and amazing food.
Great ambiance and fantastic burgers!  The decor and flames are great too!

Hands down the best burger I've ever had (and I live in NYC). I shared the Hell's Kitchen and Blue Burgers with my mom. Both had so many layers of flavor all on a well seasoned burger. We got it well done, yet it wasn't crunchy and burnt! The steak fries weren't my favorite, I prefer slimmer cut fries, but over all they were ok. My sister got a hot dog and it was literally a foot long. She ate half and still had plenty left.

As some one else said, if you only have 2 people in your party be prepared to wait in a long line.  Other than the wait everything else was fine. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger, the meat was very tender and tasty but honestly it wasn't anything special. This place is one of those places you just have to try once. I would come back here but probably not any time soon.

Where a burger and fries feels like fine dining!  The chipotle ketchup makes an otherwise average French fry into a taste explosion!  I recommend going off menu for the delicious anniversary burger. Medium rare and it's a party in your mouth!
If you're a fan of Gordon's work, there's only one word to describe this place. Perfection. From the staff to the food, its exactly what you'd think it would be like. Everything was on point.

Got there just before opening and seated right away. Wife wanted to try the Foie Burger but our waiter, Jaime pointed out that burger will be phased out next update on the menu and suggested the Farmhouse Burger. I ordered the Backyard Burger and Truffle Parmesan Fries with Diet Pepsi. Wife wanted GF so Jaime suggest lettuce wrap as an option. She complimented the Burger with coffee. Both burgers came out perfectly cooked and very tasty. Jaime and his assistant, Don kept my Diet Pepsi and my wife's coffee replaced without being ask. That shows me that they pay attention to their customer's needs and aware of their responsibilities. Definitely be back next time visiting Vegas.

The farmhouse burger is DELICIOUS! The brown butter shake is AMAZING! The ultimate burger was good - but a little strong on the cheese. Onion rings were crispy and a good size; Parmesan truffle fries were also good - although I wasn't a fan of the truffle mayo dip it came with, but my boyfriend really liked it.

For the price, the long lines and all the Hoopla around Ramsey, I'd expect the burgers to be phenomenal. They were decent, but nothing that justifies all the above. I give it 2 stars because about a year ago, I ordered the fish and chips dish (which I believe is no longer on the menu - and thank god for that!) and what I got was appalling. That fish was so greasy, I literally had a POOL of grease on my plate. When picked up there was grease dripping from the fish. I made the mistake of taking a bite and had a real gag reflex. Yes it was THAT BAD. It felt like I got a big tablespoonful of oil in my mouth. I couldn't even swallow it. I had to spit it out into my napkin. For someone who was seen so often yelling at other restaurant owners about greasy fish and chips (on Kitchen Nightmares), the guy should go taste the version his own establishment serves. I think it takes special talent to get the batter that full of grease.  Perhaps it was a fluke, but a dish like that should never leave the kitchen at ANY restaurant. Or maybe that's why the dish is no longer on the menu...?  We were 4 people at our table and nobody really liked their food very much. All other dishes ordered that day got very mediocre responses from our table. Anyway, we never went back after that.

Spent our son's 21st Birthday here at Gordon Ramsay Burger at this has been his request forever!  Was Weds after Christmas. Wait wasn't bad. We had a party of 7 so we got to put our name in with the hostess and not wait in line and was called in an hour.   Was busy but the staff was very attentive!  Questions answered. Recommendations made.   Ordered apps that were WOW. Recommend all of the selections we made. Hummus, Kettle Chip Nachos, and Fries. You will not be sorry.   The burgers were probably the best burgers we've ever had. Between Turkey Burgers, Backyard Cheeseburgers, even the spicy burger (name escapes me) they were perfection. The Hot Dog was the biggest hot dog ever and was scrumptious!  We also ordered fries, truffle fries, and sweet potato fries. O M G!!!  We had no room for dessert which was sad but we will definitely be back!!  Plan on special occasions though because the bill can get hefty.   Enjoy!!

Now this is a good burger...yess there are others . But after you wait 20 mins online it tastes so so much better. Out of the 40 burger we have tried in the past 2 years. This is in the top 5. But also top price.  Enjoy .!!!

Id like to start off by saying im super infatuated by ramsay. Ive been wanting to try his steakhouse for the longest tine, but we wanted to try out the affordable option first....ramsay burger. Because of my infatuation, i had HIGH expectations.  We waited in a 20 minute line. And i was getting nice and toasty by the front glass where the fire display was.  While youre in line, theres a touch screen menu you can scroll at. Pretty economical. There are tvs around, if you wanted to catch a game.   We sat infront of the cooking line. It was amazing to see how efficient everyone was working and how fast food was getting expedited without losing quality.  We both werent super hungry, after eating all day. So we split a burger and app  We ordered the pork special. Pork burger wrapped in bacon for 18$ as recommended by our waiter, his favorite burger. I trusted him....and wish i went with my own intuition. It was good, dont get me wrong. But i felt i would have liked another burger much more.  Mushroom poutine: ive never had poutine and ive always seem ramsay go around the world poutine-ing this and that. So i was excited to try it out. I actually like it better than the burger. Definitely my favorite and most memorable. I went there sunday, and im sorry to say i cant remember the pork. And i love pork. Every single component in the poutine had its own tune. After awhile i started to disect it and try everything on its own(im such a brat foodie like that) and i wasnt disappointed. I could taste all of the ingredients put in. So much love into that poutine! And im sure it was prepped and reheated. Lol  I will definitely return and choose my own burger to my liking. And go for the poutine again. I wish i ordered another one to take home!  I cant wait to try the steakhouse next!

This burger was hands down the best burger I've had. The price was reasonable and it's a good amount of food. I had the backyard burger and fries. The fries were enough to share with someone else. I gave it 4 stars only because we were waiting for our food and no one came to check in on us or give us any updates until we basically got our food.

I ordered the Hells' Kitchen burger and the truffle Parmesan fries. I really do like my burger. I gave it a 5 stars. The fries is just ok. Wish they cut the fires thinner and had less Parmesan to make it more crunchy  and less salty.  The service is pretty nice with friendly attitude and the restaurant is pretty nice and clean.

I only give four stars because of the service and cost overall. The price of the burgers at nearly $20 without any sides isn't worth making multiple trips here but, it was fun to say we tried it and visited one of Gordon Ramseys restaurants. The meat itself was delicious and cooked to perfection! I just can't justify spending nearly $100 with tip for three burgers, one order of french fries and onion rings. The onion rings were the best I've ever had! As much as I wanted to try a refreshing alcoholic beverage being on budget I couldn't do it but, I would love to return for some onion rings and a cocktail! Very loud busy environment but, fun to try with the family. I followed the tips here on Yelp and it did help to not get confused and wait in line as this is only for parties of two.

BEST Burger I've ever had! Must try in Vegas. Had the sweet potato fries and were delicious as well. Service was on point. The only set back was a long line to get seated, But definitely worth the wait.

One of the best Chicken Wings we've tried, and of course those Burgers are incredible, service was great, the line to get there was pretty long, waited about 45 minutes to get seated, but this is Vegas! If you are traveling to Vegas and looking for a great burger spot, then this place is a must try!

Was here a few years ago while attending a Britney concert and apparently this place has been re branded a bit? I couldn't really tell but nevertheless the food is still amazing!!! Before my flight I got here shortly after they opened and was offered a nice table for one. The service was very slow to start but after my order was taken, things definitely improved. I started with a glass of prosecco and settled on the Hell's Kitchen burger medium rare. The burger was absolutely delicious and the meat almost melted in my mouth. I'm pretty sure I scarfed down my burger so quickly and with so much pleasure that people at an adjacent table asked me which burger I was eating haha. The jalapeño peppers and aioli combined with the avocado and toasted tomatoes made for quite a delicious combination. I normally only eat half of my burger buns but with this one, I didn't leave a single crumb of bread left. 2 glasses of bubbly and this burger definitely made me a happy camper on the flight.

Hands down, the best burger I have ever had.   The bun is perfect, the meat is perfect..and OMG how about those sweet potato fries with powdered sugar?!? DELICIOUS!  Probably the best french fry combo ever. I will make burger a stop on every trip to Vegas.

I've always wanted to visit a Gordon Ramsay establishment and I must say I wasn't too disappointed. I'll admit I thought this place could be gimmicky but after a 40 minute wait in line plus an additional 30 minute wait for my food I was not disappointed! Got a counter seat looking into the chaotic kitchen. They were very busy (of course) but when I finally got my first item, the Creme Brulee Shake, I happily enjoyed sipping it! It was a very good shake as I could taste the Creme Brulee on the top but to be honest the actual chocolate shake underneath it tasted just like any other chocolate shake anywhere else. Next was the UK Burger which was very juicy. Juicy as in every bite I took of that meat patty was dripping of meat juice, not oil! What made it unique was they had some sort of sweet jam spread on it which balanced out well with the cheese. And finally the winner of the meal was the amazing Parmesan Truffle Fries! Now if you don't order this you'll be missing out, these fries are delicious but it is that truffle sauce that just blows it out of the water! Each time I dipped a frie into that sauce and took a bite I felt like I was melting into a sea of buttery truffle goodness. Overall I enjoyed the experience very much, I only wish the wait times weren't as long but hey it's a popular Gordon Ramsay establishment! Great things are worth waiting for!

Best lobster and shrimp burger I've eaten, Farmhouse burger were also delicious.  Burgers were juicy, loads of flavor! Onion rings and truffle fries were insanely addictive.  Wait time for burgers took awhile, definitely worth the wait if you are seated along the chef's table. Time flies by faster watching the line cooks and food prep.
Every time I visit Vegas, I come here! Gordon Ramsay really nails the perfect spicy  burger  and Blue Moon combo. Great place, will be back!

Wife ordered the Kale salad and said it was a 5/5. I had the backyard burger. It was maybe a 3 or 4/5. Fairly costly for a burger and salad. Place was packed so obviously Gordon is happy! I asked to speak to him right away to discuss this mediocrity!. Anyway will say not bad!

As the vegetarian at the table I ordered the poutine and an Oreo Creme brûlée milkshake. I liked the milkshake but sent the fries back because they looked and tasted gross. There were no cheese curds, the dish was warm not hot, and the gravy was thick and looked like...unappetizing.   Four stars because this IS a burger place and all the meat eaters at the table loved their burgers!
This place is INCREDIBLE!!! Even though it's always packed with people, they still manage to provide an efficient and fast service. Their burgers are AMAZING! Best burger I've ever had hands down.

I love coming to Vegas; checking out new places to eat so I couldn't pass Gordon Ramsay Burger. I came on a Thursday evening around 6pm; there was no wait time in line and grabbed a seat at the bar. I was greeted by Bianca V. who suggested the backyard burger. Everything looked great! The burger was delicious and super juicy, for the price its definitely the quality you pay for! Will come back soon!

We ordered the best and largest cocktail shrimp I've ever had.  I dislike horseradish and this was the best horseradish I've ever had or will have.   I followed up with a corned beef sandwich with a Moscow mule.  They were both very yummy and would definitely order it again.

The food was okay. But our server TAMMY was HORRIBLE. She never acknowledge us. But she was more focused on the other costumers. She had a whole conversation with them until we finished our dinner. That was a disappointment.
We love their Foie burger and Farmhouse burgers. It's so good. Their shakes aren't bad either.

Everything has been thought through and works like a well oiled machine. Exotic ingredients like duck bacon bring up the price point. All the food was cooked very well but the flavor profiles didn't WOW me. Skip the mushroom poutine and get the chicken saltimbocca sliders.

Craving a burger in Vegas?  Look no further because this might be one of the best burgers in town.    Came here with a group of friends after driving in from LA. Got to the restaurant at 4pm and was seated immediately. When you first look at the menu you might think the burgers are pricey, but each burger comes with a considerable amount of beef.  I ordered the Forest Burger for myself and our table got the Parmesan truffle fries and sweet potato fries to share.  The Forest Burger comes with mushrooms, tremor cheese, arugula, and duck bacon.  This is my definition of a gourmet burger! The combination of all the ingredients was perfect; no item dominated the other.  If you aren't super hungry, sharing a burger is definitely reasonable, but be sure to ask for a knife to split the burger.  The Parmesan truffle fries are a MUST.  They might have changed up the way they serve this because the first time I ate here (maybe a year ago) it came with shoestring French fries, melted parmesan cheese, and truffles on top. My most recent trip, they came out with thicker pieces of fries, truffles, and shredded Parmesan.  Both times the fries were phenomenal and full of flavor.  Make sure to dip your fries in the garlic aioli sauce that comes on the side, you will thank me later.
were delicious. The wait was a little long but it was definitely worth it. I definitely recommend this place to start the day off.

This is the second time I have been here. The burgers are SO good! They are totally worth going to the strip for. The first time we went, we ordered a bunch of items to try and we were too full to enjoy our burgers. So this time we only ordered burgers. We REALLY enjoyed the burgers. Juicy and delicious!

Visited restaurant expecting a great dining experienced butafter waiting a long time after ordering, my backyard burger needed seasoning ( the burger patty could have used salt and pepper).  Conversely, the french fries were too salty and were too crisp ( on the border of burnt). This "gourmet" burger and fries are over-rated and way overpriced. Plain old ketchup would have been more appropriate and less salty that the curry and chipotle mixed ketchup preparations they served with the french fries. I had to beg the waiter to come and provide a refill of my beverage...The place was a clip joint!  In and Out with its mass produced burgers and fries are much better prepared and their staff are more courteous.  I was very disappointed with the food and the service, the place was also very noisy, you couldn't hear your dining partner across the table.  Nicole O:  Thank you for your note to me regarding the aforementioned review, the staff person was a shaven headed fellow working about 7:30pm - 9:00 pm on January 18th and he had the section near the register/order computer near the flame window and the booths.  He served the two-person tables.  He gestured rudely to me when I signaled that he come to our table for water, it seemed he was overwhelmed serving the two tables on the sides of ours.    Unfortunately, we will not be returning to Las Vegas for a good while. Truly, I appreciate your offer to return to your restaurant and give it a second chance. Thank you very much and best wishes.

Gordon ramsay is fucking brilliant. Enough said. There was a little bit of a wait when we went, but it was totally worth it. Got the Bleu cheeseburger and my friend got the hells kitchen burger. Along with some parmesan fries. Everything was absolutely delicious! Go if you're in town.

We got burgers & fries. I got the backyard burger cut in half, I forget what my bf got but it is pictured below, but we shared the Parmesan truffle fries. Everything was excellent quality cooked to perfection. It's cool to be able to say I ate at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant but it's not really something I'll keep going back for. My boyfriend raves about it tho so our opinions vary. We both agree the French fries were bomb!  Waited in line to eat for about 45min. Ambiance was romantic & dimly lit. Fancy burgers in Vegas but I think I'll just let them stay in Vegas. I'm happy with my in&out burger any day. Lol.

My husband and I were here for my 30th birthday and this was on our list of places to check out. We ordered the nachos which I was really disappointed in. The toppings were cold but the flavor was there. Our burgers were one of the best things I have ever tasted in my entire life!! I really wish they would build one here in Chicago. The burger was juicy without being soggy and the bun was as grilled to perfection. The truffle fries with the aioli were to die for! We can't wait to go back!!!

Not bad but not great. The size of burger patty is on the small size relative to price and other burger places. 2 out of 3 at our table were over cooked. Service was fine but hurried then slow. We won't be back.

Best esxperience ever. It started out with amazing host service, continued with an amazing waitress who really stayed on top of things and then the food. Had a burger, medium rare to oerfection! Last but not least the desserts, sticky pudding and chocolate trifle. Didn't think that there would be a restaurant that actually can be that way. Any time again

First of all, I HATE the wait process for this restaurant. If you are a party of three or more, you can submit your name and phone number and be called back. However, if you are only a two top, you have to wait behind some rope and get called in one table at a time. I'm sure this is so a crowd develops and sparks interest but it's really annoying to feel trapped in this line. The wait time we were quoted was way off...and not in our favor. There's nowhere to sit. You can't explore the casino while you're waiting. You have to just stand in the line at their mercy. It would be better if you could at least make an Open Table reservation and the overflow had to wait outside to attract a crowd but this line is your only option. We waited at least 45 minutes at 9:00 on a weeknight!   Anyway...my other con to this restaurant is it kind of smells like a dirty rag at the entry way. Like that dirty bar smell that you sometimes encounter. I was SHOCKED by this two years ago when I first dined here and I was even more shocked that it still had this odor two years later. Very disappointing and it should be taken care of. Not up to Ramsay standards (that he prides himself in on TV) and his name is attached to this place.   It is VERY loud in this establishment. It's totally open to the casino at the front and back of the restaurant so you have restaurant noise, casino noise, bar noise, television noise, music...on this particular day I had a migraine so I was really overstimulated. If you want ambiance and a private conversation...this is not the place for you!   Our server was excellent. He noticed I wasn't feeling well. He sympathized with my migraine and even offered me Advil. He stooped down to our table to talk and take our order and I told him how much I valued his personality after our long day (we just returned from a 12 hour excursion). He was absolutely the star of this visit! He told us the burgers were running long and he would bring us our fries first. He was just so kind, attentive, efficient and great at his job. This establishment is lucky to have him and there should be more servers like him out there!   They don't have Heinz ketchup here. Only homemade ketchup. For me, this was a major flaw. I just don't like the homemade ketchup. It doesn't taste anything like the flavor I enjoy from Heinz. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger. It was ok. It wasn't particularly flavorful which is surprising  considering how much stuff is on it (jalapeño, roasted tomato, avocado...) My mom got the backyard burger which she said was delicious. We split fries. If I was feeling better I would say we definitely could have gotten away with an order of fries per person. I love french fries and the orders aren't THAT big. If you love fries and don't like to share them...go with one order per person.   I wanted to love this place more than I do. My migraine, I'm sure contributed somewhat. They need to figure out that smell...and get some regular ketchup for those of us that prefer it. Stop forcing the homemade stuff on us! And please make Open Table available!

I was expecting a lot, based on the very good reviews of this location and previously great experiences with Gordon Ramsay establishments. I was quite disappointed. I ordered my burger medium, which should have some pink remaining. It came out quite well done. I ordered and Old Fashioned and they muddled a cherry and put a quarter of an orange in it. I know this is not a cocktail bar, but an Old Fashioned is probably the most basic cocktail and at $16 each, I would expect them to get it right. I would expect Gordon would not be happy with the product they are delivering in his name. Consistency and accuracy are his hallmarks.

Stopped in for lunch having dined at both Steak & Fish and Chips. The standards here are no different. Everything is top notch from the table setting, to the decor, to the food. I ordered the hog burger and almost contemplated cutting it in half since it was so big. Quite delicious. I also ordered a side of fries. So damn good! Service was fast and friendly, the only negative I saw was wait staff appears to stand around a lot in the center of the room. I do not care for having the feeling that I am being stared at. Its just a bit awkward for me. Otherwise I highly recommend Burger and cant wait to go back and try something else from the menu. Its pricey but I feel the food was really worth what you pay for.

Fan-freaking-tastic. One of the best burgers I've ever had, and it was honestly not as pricey as I thought it would be. There's a reason his restaurants have earned him 16 Michelin stars. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger, and if you're into spicy, this one packs some heat behind it's amazing flavor. I also sampled the truffle fries and the sweet potato fries, and it was tough to pick which one I liked more. The service was great, and the staff was amenable. There was a line out the door to get inside, but I think that was to be expected at a place like this.

** update ** - manager came by and apologized. Gave us discount. And they started telling tables about the food wait time. So ... gotta give credit where do. Fwiw - food was hot and delicious when it arrived. Subpar experience overall tho  Writing this from our table. 30 minutes into sitting here. No food.   Waitress just said burgers take 25 minutes. Not for tables around us. And not mentioned on the menu. Just ours. So that's great.   The line out front is a lie btw. They have Plenty of space, just want you to think it's great. There are multiple empty tables.   Gordon - they are shitting on your brand mate. Step it up.

Unfortunately our experience was not a good one. We asked when we first were seated how long we should expect to be waiting for our food, because we are on a time crunch. The waitress said it takes about 25 minutes to have our burgers come out. We ordered, got our drinks and even got a refill on our drinks. Then almost 40 minutes later we are told by our waitress that our food will be right out. Guess what? Our food never showed up. The manager on duty, Zach, came over and was apologetic and helpful. He found out that our ticket wasn't ever put in. That is a damn shame. Zach then took our order and told us it would be out in a few minutes and on the house. He kept to his word, and our food came out within 5-7 minutes. The waitress came up to us and apologized and stated it was her fault and not the kitchen's. I appreciate her being forthcoming and all, but that didn't help that we were now running late because of this mess and still had not eaten lunch! I thought things were looking up, but then when our food came out my burger was f*cking well done!! I asked for medium. -- So to start out our waitress forgot to put our order in, then the kitchen messes up my order, and we are waiting over an hour. I didn't even finish the whole burger. The fries were over done;almost as if they had been sitting under a warmer for a period of time. So incredibly unimpressed.

Starting from the beginning,   we waited maybe 15 minutes to be seated.  1STAR seating was nice and comfortable  2 STAR waitress fast, attentive, and happy to answer the wife's 1,000 questions with a smile.  3 STAR Additional wait staff did not allow our drinks to get low  4 STAR FOOD WAS AMAZING  5 STAR  This place was more then we expected. We waited forever to try this place. My wife went outside her comfort zone and surprisingly wasn't disappointed. She has very picky taste and to please her is a challenge and this place did it with ease.   We will be back and we will spread the word to our friends and family in TX!!!

+ THE FOOD This is the best burger I've ever had!! It was so good that we came back again during our short trip to Vegas before we left. The first burger I tried was the Hell's Kitchen burger. This was absolutely perfect since it had nice spicy flavors to it and huge portions of avocados. The burger was extremely juicy- so much that I spilled it all over myself. The flavors were perfect- not too salty but still good enough to keep you wanting for more. The second burger I had was the Farmhouse Burger. While this one wasn't as the first burger I tried, it was still pretty good. A lot of the flavor came from the egg only. The truffle fries were amazing. There was a lot of truffle flavor to it but the best part came from the dipping sauces! There is a garlic aiola type of sauce and a sweeter ketchup, which might be curry ketchup. Definitely would pay a visit whenever I'm back in Vegas.
Burgers were awesome! No words for it. Especially the creme brulee shake! We were so full, but the food didnt stop us from having more. It was that good
It's a simple pub food type menu.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  Overall we were happy and will be back.

I have lived in Vegas my whole life and I don't think I've ever been to a celebrity chef owned restaurant yet. Well, there's a first time for everything.   I'll make this short and sweet: this place is kind of overrated. $15 to eat a burger (price of fries not included) in front of a giant portrait of Gordon Ramsay. I had the Crown Burger which is just a fancier version of the DGB from Red Robin. Tastes exactly the same. We waited an eternity for our burgers to come out: the guys who were seated much after us got their food at the same time we did. Our fries were cold and stale. Only thing I liked about the meal was the dipping sauce for the fries. I was also pretty impressed with presentation, but presentation can't fix mediocre food.

The burger was probably the best burger I've ever had. The fries were nicely spiced and perfectly crisp. The desert.... oh the desert....the chocolate caramel tart was so delicious we discussed the desire to lick the plate

I have been here 3 times and I can say each time I have been satisfied some times were more and other times were less.   the first time was the best, it was amazing, service was on top of everything and the meal was incredible. I remember this marshmallow dipping sauce and it was amazing.   the 2nd time i got the jalapeno poppers (not on the menu anymore), burger and my date got a hot dog, we both left so satisfied and excited.   this last time the menu has been changed, they dont have a lot of things they had before which is kind of sad. I loved the jalapeno poppers and they are gone. I enjoyed the hot dogs and there are only 2 now.   I ordered the anniversary burger which was nice and the meat was flavorful, they only had a veggie option that was mushroom and my friend is allergic to port mushrooms.   Everything was good but just lacked that something special the 1st 2 times provided us.   This  last time was for my birthday and it was very nice but I wish i would have stopped after the 1st or 2nd time because the 3rd time was a bit of a let down. I will be back again hope they bring back some of the things i enjoyed before.

The sweet potato fries turned out terrible because they covered them in powdered sugar. The food took an exceptionally long time to make for two burgers, but the burgers themselves were very good. I had the Portobello burger. Our waiter was great :) too pricey for Burgers and fries though.
Best burger in the country.  Taste, quality, pricing, location.  It's a reason I bring friends to Vegas

In my opinion the restaurant is overrated. I was there yesterday and unfortunately I am very disappointed. I was always have very good opinion about Gordon's restaurant, but the reality was different. I ordered Lobster&Schrimp burger and Hell's Kitchen one, also the Trufle fries. The fries was so salty it wasn't tasty and for Lobster burger I also had higher hopes. The Hell's Kitchen burger was very good and I can recommend it at least.   Also the service was very bad poor. For sure it isn't good memory.

Wow, I was expecting to be let down or disappointed at yet another celebrity restaurant just using the name of the chef to sell its product.   This was clearly one of the best hamburger places that I have been too. I am more into a "blue collar" type of hamburger experience with traditional toppings and lots of beefy flavor. NOTE: so being from the Carolina's I love the Carolina-style hamburger but 1) I wouldn't even try getting this out of the Carolina's and 2) I wouldn't get a upscale Carolina-style hamburger (would be a oxy-moron concept).  The service and all the food was very pleasant and professional. My wife and I really enjoyed out lunch here. Highly recommend...  we almost went to Heart Attack grill but so glad we went here instead.   What we had:  Farmhouse Burger : dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg Beer Battered Onion Rings parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip Hells' Kitchen Burger: asadero cheese, jalapeños, avocado,roasted tomatoes, jalapeño aïoli Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake: BrownButter ice cream, pecan shortbread  crumble  Crème Brûlée Shake: chocolate or oreo milkshake with a crème brûlée top

The burger was so delicious! They had unique toppings,  simple but good combinations.  The burger was very flavorful and the service was friendly and fast.   I like the fact that the server let us know that it might take a while for the burger to come so we would be prepared to wait.  It turned out that it didn't take as long so that was a pleasant surprise.  My favorite item on the menu would be the onion rings!!  They tasted amazing and had a good crunchy texture.   They also had a good drink menu with good cocktails.  Overall this is definitely a place I will be back to whenever I am in town.

This is between 3-4 stars. I have eaten here before and experienced much better than service/ food. We waited in line for a party of two for half an hour. Then it took another half hour to get our food.  The burger this time around just didn't cut it for me. Truffle fries were OK. Sweet potato fries are always good. Can't go wrong with those. Fairly priced for a burger spot in Vegas, especially when a celebrity chefs name is on the joint. Props to them for keeping the pricing decent.

My husband and I really wanted to try Burger and we were not disappointed. We didn't wait but 5 minutes to be seated at the bar. The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly! Highly recommend give truffle fries, they are a large enough portion to share between 2-3 people!

BurGR quietly changed their name to Gordon Ramsay Burger.  There is virtually no change to the restaurant except all the GR branding is gone.  If your making a weekend visit, I recommend coming to the restaurant early or face a line.  I went during the week and I was immediately seated.  We ordered an Oreo cookie shake to start.  It was incredibly decadent.  The bottom was the normal Oreo shake, but the top is filled with Crème Brulee and whipped cream! As for the burgers, they are delicious.  I tried the Blue Cheeseburger.  It had blue cheese, manchego cheese, figgy jam, arugula, cider vinegar reduction, and a spicy mayo.  The flavors really worked well on this burger.  I couldn't stop eating it.  I liked the sweet with the savory.  I've learned my mistake with the fries.  There's enough for 2 people to share, so only order one.    I really like the family of restaurants Gordon Ramsay has been putting out.  If you can, you should make it to his Fish and Chips north of Burger.

I was really excited about trying this place.  The wait was kinda long and after we was seated we had to wait a while for the food.  The burger I had was ok, and the truffle fries was just ok...nothing really spectacular.

Gotta hand it to Gordon, he lives up to the standards he demands of others!   The burgers are succulent (we had the hog burger which was incredibly tender) and all of the sides were delicious - truffle Fries, onion rings and sweet potato fries. Each came with their own yummy dips. Totally worth the wait!  The service was great! My one gripe was the brown butter shake that came highly recommended was just too intensely sweet to drink. Other than that great place and definitely a great Vegas spot to eat!
Great service and food!! You have to try the oreo shake my first Gordon Ramsay restaurant and I loved it.
The burger was as good as advertised!  I had the hell's kitchen burger and truffle fries, and everything was excellent.  One order of truffle fries is large, so good for sharing.

Egg slut is way better. This place is Not worth the wait.  First it took us 30 min to get a table.  One we ordered it took 30 min to get the food.  The burger came out looking great but when I took my first bite there was no wow factor.  Just a plain unseasoned burger.  The bacon was the wow factor.

My buddy insisted we go here and was hesitant at first, as I'm not big on celebrity hyped restaurants.  Well I'm happy I went.  I can say that it was one of the best burgers I had. I ordered the farmhouse burger with side of yam fries.  My buddy ordered the special which was an sirloin burger and side of eer battered onion rings.  I did try his onion rings and though they were good, one was enough as didn't feel like deep fried battered that night , as it was very filling.  My burger ordered med-rare and was cooked perfectly.  Beers on tap are plentiful and actually pretty good priced starting at $7 (remember this is Vegas I paid at some places $13 for the same beers).  Service was awesome and constantly checking on us. Usually I am not a fan of burger places that charge around $14 for just a burger, with sides extra, but this is one place where I found it worth it.  Just be warned of you don't have reservations then it could be a bit of a wait.

For starters, we went with the Onion Rings. Nice flavors in the sauces that accompany them. The Burgers are all they're hyped up to be with service to match! I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger. (I'd rate the "hot" factor as a 5/6 out of 10 for the jalapeño factor.) The Forest Burger went over just as well. There are quite a few burger spots in Vegas. Make sure you put aside a couple of hours for Gordon Ramsay Burger.
Favorite burger place ever! Get the hell's kitchen if you can handle spice, you won't be disappointed! :)

My friend had been here before and wanted to take me there. We had quite a wait. Our server was so friendly and that always makes for a nice experience. The burger was good. The beer battered onion rings and truffle fries-ABSOLUTELY delicious!!!!

Definitely coming back here next time I'm in Vegas!! I had the curry burger, which was veryyy delicious! My boyfriend got the hog burger which was waaay tastier than mine but nonetheless I was very happy with my choice. Also great customer service!

Waited in line 45 min. Then once we were seated waited another 10min before anyone came to our table. We had a weird thing happen when a second  waiter came up and said our waitress had gone home. We witnessed her the whole time waitressing other tables right next to us. Finally ordered our food and it took 45 min before we were served. Food was good but not worth the wait.  Gordon  Ramsey you need to work on service here.

Was really excited to try out Gordon Ramsay Burger. But we were disappointed. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, forest burger and chips and curry sauce. The burgers were good but not great. Fries were rock hard. We waited 30 mins before the food came out. I dont think Gordon would approve. With so many burger option in vegas, don't think we will come back.

Best burger, Best wings, Best drinks, a little bit of wait.  The food and the drinks all had unique flavors and were worth every penny. Everytime you eat or drink something, it has a few different flavors you experience from the first bite/sip, then while your chewing/drinking and then the aftertaste. I don't know how they do it but it's a spectacular feeling! Kind of like that scene from Ratatouille when he makes his friend eat a mixture of good cheese and nuts. See here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6qtEjJuGo_U

This place was the first place my wife and I went every time we went to Vegas.  In fact we would plan our trip so that we ended up in Vegas at lunch time just so we could go straight here after we checked into whatever hotel we checked into.  The burgers were great but the poppers were our favorite and basically the main reason we went.  They have discontinued the poppers so now we will have to find another place to call our favorite because this place no longer is.  The burgers are great but you can get a great burger anywhere.  What a shame
Le nom ne reflète pas la dite notoriété ... Dommage ! L état des toilettes : no comment !?

Let me start by saying I'm not huge into burgers I usually like more of a foodie scene but this was great!  We had a bit of a wait but the food was worth it.  Loved the fries with curry sauce and the Forest burger was delicious. Hell's Kitchen burger was really good too (could have had a bit more of a kick).  I loved all the British touches, being a Brit all all, with the decor and menu, super fun!

No reservations. There is a line and you give your party size at the front. We waited in line for about 15 minutes and that was ok. I didn't mind waiting and we got in quicker than expected.  Food took a little long to arrive but it was worth every minute. We started with a cheddar ale soup and a Cesar salad. Both were absolutely amazing. Soup was hot, creamy and had perfect texture. I ordered the blue cheese burger and my husband ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger. The blue cheese was of really good quality and the meat cooked exactly how I asked. The Hell's Kitchen burger was off the charts fantastic. Don't be intimidated by the heat! It's perfect. Just the right amount of kick and all the flavor! Finally, we had a chocolate shake. There's pudding on top of the shake! Pudding! Enough said!  I was beyond satisfied at Gordon Ramsay's Burger. I'm a big fan and think he's fantastic. This place lived up to my Ramsay expectations as far as cleanliness, quality and service. Please open one in LA!!

Great burger and would recommend when you're looking for a nice juicy burger. It is the hotel and you need to walk around to get there. We were seated quickly but when we left around 7 there was a line and I had read they usually have lines. So go earlier if you can.   Service was just okay. But again, recommend if you're in the food for s burger! The sweet potatoes are also so tasty.

This is one of the few 1 star reviews I'll ever give and I didn't even go to Gordon Ramsay Burger. This review is of the reservation system they have set up there.   It all started with me calling them to make reservations about a month in advance for July 3rd. I wanted to reserve a dinner for my family of 15. Everything went fine until they emailed me. The email said that because we have a large group, it's a minimum of $95 a person and we have to pay an estimated down payment ahead of time. I thought they must be joking. How can you bill someone a meal BEFORE they even eat it? Probably the most absurd thing is that even though it's $95 a person, they sent me a list of set menus that had a couple of three course meals for $70-80 each. That means pay $1500 up front? That means that every person has to have a drink? Well, we have 5 children a couple of my family members that don't drink.  So when I tried to talk to the "Sales Manager" Heather, she just so happens to be on vacation for the week. As popular as the Gordon Ramsay name is, I can't believe this is how they function when someone tries to book a party ahead of time. There's no way I'm going to pay money ahead of time for food we haven't ate and I can't believe people actually would. Even though I expect great food and great service, it's a people's business and all it takes is one person to have a bad day to ruin our experience. How do you expect us to pay for that in advance?

Always wanted to try this  Went for lunch.  Quick seating if we sat at the bar.  What I like about Ramsays restaraunts is the menu shows the ingredients. I like knowing what makes my plate.  Had a bleu cheese burger, which was lovely, and truffle fries, which were fine.   I would recommend to anyone who is willing to eat a burger and fries on a 30 dollar budget

I'm giving this restaurant only one star because the expectations were so high for the best gourmet burgers ever.  Coming from the Midwest where we have the best beef in the world, I expected the "gourmet" to build on the perfect juicy, tasty burger (which even I know how to cook.). We were also very excited to see poutine on the menu, as my husband is from the birthplace of poutine (Montreal) and GR could only make it better, right?  Wrong on both accounts.  The patty in our burger, although cooked medium, was dry and tasteless.  Now a medium burger is pretty hard to dry out!  It was as if they took gourmet ideas and plopped them on a little bit bigger (being generous) McD's patty and put GR's name on it to make people think they were getting something g special!  The poutine was equally disappointing.  The gravy was a VERY strong pepper gravy (some people might like... for me a bit too strong.)  But the biggest SIN was to hardly put any curd chees on it at all!  That's the best part of poutine, and we were left fighting over the tiny, tiny morsels of chees sprinkled throughout.  Curd cheese is CURDS of cheese!!  Plus the reservation/call ahead/ you're screwed if your're only a party of 2 check-in system is wonky and ilexplained.    Bottom line... don't go!  GR would be embarrassed by these burgers!!
This place is legit. Worth the hype, worth the wait.  The burger patty was cooked just right. It has an amazing taste and was juicy. Definitely recommended
Best burger ever is all I have to say. You have to get their shakes they are amazing also! The creme brulee oreo is my fave!

Went for dinner with my husband. Got seated right away but service was very poor after that. I got the potato chip nachos. They were so salty I could barely eat them. My husband got a burger and loved it. It's annoying that there is no bathroom and you need to walk through the casino.
Sat at the bar and had a Hell's Kitchen Burger with the truffle and Parmesan fries with a Belvedere mule. So damn good!

Currently at the restaurant. Friday 3/9/18 only reason why I'm rating low because the food is above 30 minutes and not out yet. A table came after us and got the food before. The server is nice as well as the Hostess who walked us to the table.
Yumm! It was worth waiting in line for.  Great experience for our vacation.  Fun selection of burgers and they were cooked perfectly. Recommend it for sure.

When entering the casino at 9 o'clock on Tuesday the line looked daunting but after a 20-25 minute wait we were seated. The menu is filled with burgers, a couple salads, a few appetizers and some sides. Cone filled shaped sundae cups came out overflowing with truffle garlic fries but sad to say I didn't try them. I did however have the Farmhouse burger and found it to be cooked perfectly, with the bacon crisp and the yolk on the egg just right. My husband had the Hells Kitchen burger pictured below topped with green chiles and avocado slices. $36 for two burgers ? It's Vegas after all. Would I go there again, probably not because though everything was delicious I wasn't blown away. I would reserve for his Hells Kitchen Restaurant in advance though.

Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever eaten! My boyfriend and I went to Gordon Ramsay's Burger on a Friday night. We waited about 10 minutes in line to be seated. This restaurant pretty much always has a wait so I recommend coming early for lunch if you don't want to wait in line. Service was good and I like that they have a wide variety of burgers to choose from. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed our burgers very much! He ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno aioli. I ordered the farmhouse burger with dubliner cheese, mangalitsa bacon and fried egg. We also enjoyed the truffle parmesan fries! On our last visit we got to sit at the bar next to the kitchen - if you are a true foodie and want an inside look I would recommend asking to sit there.
Wow, the burgers here are freakin good. One of the best I've had. Meat is so juicy and full of flavor. The burger also has a nice kick with the jalapeno peppers. YUM!!

The wait is a bit long but my husband and I think that it's worth it. The burgers were delicious and the truffle fries.. yum! Tip: If you do go here, it's better to have a party of 2. For parties with 3+ people, the wait is a lot longer.

Short line to get seated and didn't take more than 10 minutes on a late Friday night... to be seated in the middle of the damn dining room, my fave spot for utmost comfort btw. I wish they would've asked what we preferred or gave options.   My hubs ordered the Hog Burger medium done and enjoyed it more than my Hell's Kitchen Burger. I thought mine was pretty bomb, good flavor balance. They really do medium to perfection!   Since everything's a la carte, we ordered truffle-Parmesan fries and some wings. Truffle n Parmesan fries were aromatic n wings were deboned n delicious; be sure to smear bleu cheese onto each bite.   Finished w a nicely plated blood orange creamsicle, homemade from scratch, that tasted really nice.... except I wasn't sure why it was so soft n melty.  Overall: Great upscale ambience, perfect gourmet burgers n spotless service. Iced teas kept coming before we even thought to ask and our waiter never failed to check on our alcohol situation. Solid place, so glad we tried!

This is a great location with a wonderful upbeat menu.   There are multiple choices for burgers as one would expect as well. As many other main course selections.  The appitizers are a plenty and well worth the attention as Everthing has explosive tastes.

Oh boy the longest wait ever in the world! I guess that's to be expected from a celebrity chef restaurant.  I ordered the Patriot Burger, which was a turkey burger, smoked Gouda, spicy mayo, cherry compote(?) and crispy onions. DANG this burger was so good. I chose the turkey burger simply because it sounded healthier, but when I read all the dressings that came with it, it very quickly made my mouth water. And it did not disappoint. My friends ordered standard burgers like the kinds with eggs, avocado, or bacon. And they were upset. I mean, this is Gordon freaking Ramsay. You have a higher expectation!  But the Patriot Burger was amazingggg!   Because of the celebrity chef owner, the line here is long. You can put your name down and they'll text you when your table is ready. This basically means you have time to gamble in the casino, or shop around in the stores nearby.   Would I come back? Probably not, but if you find yourself dragged here get the Patriot Burger. It's the only one worth it on the menu.

I'm never down to wait more than 30 minutes for food, so if you're impatient like me then SKIP the long line and order burgers to-go.   Food-wise, the Hell's Kitchen burger definitely lives up to the name. I usually get the wheat bun along with a patty done medium well. The burger comes with huge pieces of avocado and jalapeño aioli, which comes as a surprising (but tasty) kick. Everything was cooked to perfection and the burger itself just effortlessly melts in your mouth. However, I'm not a huge fan of their fries. Think thick-cut steak fries on the soggier side with no seasoning at all. Not even a pinch of salt or pepper - lacking some love, I'd say. Plus the curry ketchup was very much an acquired taste. The flavors just didn't mix well at all in my opinion. Skip the fries, but the Hell's Kitchen burger is a must.

This location you can save a few bucks compared to some other options in the area but if you're not careful can definitely blow up your wallet.  The burgers here really are top notch quality! Lamb burger was super juicy and moist! Just be prepared to fork over some cash.  The irish nachos were subpar, the cheese sauce is amazing but the pork had inedible chunks of fat on them.

Going in, I was a bit of a skeptic, having been burned by "celebrity" chefs in the past, but my "anniversary special" burger was unique and flavorful, while the onion rings were verifiably TDF!!   The staff were very friendly, always on time, and accurately split the checks for our large group. All the meals were on the table within about 2 minutes of one another.   We were able to get an "arrive at" reservation time and then it only took about 15 minutes longer to get seated...no small feat considering the size of our group (almost 30).   This was a great all-around experience....highly recommended.

Service was good.  And the nachos were delicious.  But we came here for burgers and fries, and those were a major letdown.  I think it comes down to fundamentals with a burger:  the preparation and arrangement of the components, the cooking of the burger, the presentation on the plate....those were all failures for 3 of the 4 dishes.  (One eater liked his Hells Kitchen burger).  Burgers were red-to-pink for medium-well!  And the pickles on one burger were all haphazardly centered in the middle so half the pickles had to be pulled off and the burger rearranged.  Minor quibble but we ARE talking about an $18 burger!  Bacon was soft and chewy on two burgers, and hard as a rock on another.  And the fries!  Just terrible.  Oversalted, and some strange ketchup/tabasco(?) combination, we left the fries alone.  Overall, very disappointed in the Brits' re-imagination of an American classic!

Of course we had to come here to get something after seeing Gordon Ramsay killing the game on tv. I was trying to set realistic expectations for this place but it's really hard with a chef of this caliber in its name. For me, the burger was only alright. We got the forest burger and it was just too fancy for us. I guess sometimes simple is better, and this is definitely the case. The buns were really good and didn't look or taste like it came from a bag. The meat was well seasoned and cooked medium just like the way we liked it. Somehow the meat wasn't very juicy though. I wonder what the ratio of fat is in their patty...The part that threw me off was the cheese. In my opinion, the tremor cheese just doesn't go well with the burger. It tasted like goat cheese and I felt like it overpowered the burger. I was really surprised about the arugula though. It wasn't too bitter and actually went well with the burger. However, I still feel like normal green leaf lettuce would've been better. But I did really like the mushrooms which gave it a different change of texture. We also got the truffle fries and it was phenomenal. The truffle and cheese gave it a unique, creamy flavor that tasted best with the normal ketchup. Service here was great and our server was very attentive. To justify the price for just a burger I expected this to blow my mind away. This didn't happen today. If it wasn't for how good the fries were, I would've given this place 3 stars. I hope I just got the wrong burger and the others are actually very good. Probably wont be back for a second chance though.

While all of our burgers were exceptionally delicious, what really stood out on was the parmesan truffle fries. They are exquisite!   It was a lengthy wait to get in, close to an hour, but the food was worth waiting for, the staff were friendly, knowledgeable and knew the menu inside and out.

Came after reading a bunch of good reviews and was extremely disappointed. We arrived a little after midnight and the place was not busy. There were 3 girls at the to be seated booth. We stood there waited to be seated and not one addressed us and ask how many. We looked like idiots standing there until my girlfriend utter maybe we should just go somewhere else. It was then, one of the girls turned around and seated us. Our waiter was good but the lack of service from the beginning really sour the experience. I ordered the farm burger, truffle fries, and wings. Farm burger had no taste, wings was cold, and truffle fries taste old. Aside from our waiter, we would have given this a negative 2 stars. Not what we expected for a Ramsey restaurant.
Best burger you'll ever taste in your life. Awesome environment and service! There was about an hour wait but it was so worth it.

I make sure to eat here every time I am in Vegas. I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan so I may be biased but I think this restaurant is fabulous. It is so affordable and the burgers are to die for. Most recently I ordered the 'Patriot Burger' which was actually a turkey burger and it was amazing. I also really enjoy the 'Caribbean Dream' drink. Although I'm not positive what is in it, it is delicious.  Atmosphere and decor are different and fun. Good for families or date-night.
Decent ingredients, burger was undercooked, fries were great, server was attentive.  Restaurant is on the border of the casino, so the smell of cigarette smoke still permeates into the restaurant.

We started off with drinks of course, and the Truffle Parmesan Fries since they said it takes a half hour to get your burger (I don't know why it should take so long to cook a burger! Especially when Gordon's biggest grips on his tv show Kitchen Nightmares is the speed of service!) The fries were very good though! For the burger, I went with the Ultimate Cheeseburger, and I had them add bacon to it, but when I received my burger there was n bacon added to it! So if you order something like that to your burger CHECK IT FIRST! All they did was give me an option of either having it on the side- ya right! Had them take that part off on the bill! They should have offered something more- oh well. So wasn't impressed there, but the burger and the bread was very good!  My wife went with the Forest Burger with Duck Bacon, which worked real well! Maybe I should have had that one minus the mushrooms!

The burger wasn't FAWKIN RAW. IT WAS DELICIOUS. It was really good and that is the point, it was quick too. Even with the restaurant seeming like it was full, our burgers still came quickly. They were hot too, and cooked the way we wanted them.  It's really good.

The foie burger and truffle parmesan fries are a match make in heaven. I finished everything with my Modelo. Pleasantly surprised because this is the first time I've come here and it surely won't be my last!

I thought this burger was just ok. They have a variety of burger choices and toppings. I had just a regular bacon burger which was average. I wanted regular ketchup but they only had one that was homemade and in my opinion not good. Parmesan fries was cold and hard.   Save the extra money. This is just a high priced burger served at a celebrity restaurant.

Always a 5. I would recommend Burgr to everyone! Especially if you own a restaurant! This is how a restaurant should be run. First Class service is followed up by the best food you'll eat. This place is a must, but fair warning, go EARLY, if you 'pop' in after 6 looking for a table, you'll be waiting for a long time.
Excellent burgers!!!! Even better,  the wait staff was superior and the comfortable decor.  We'll worth the visit.

The wait was long for just 2 people took about 40 min and then burgers took another 30 min. The patty was a little dry and very plain. I'm not sure they seasoned their patties or not but the buns were good. We ordered chicken wing, 2 burgers, and truffle fries. Our total came out to be $70. Wouldn't come back again. Recommend going to other burger joint or go to Gordon's steakhouse over Gordon's burger. Portions were a good size because we had appetizers the burgers filled us up. We did not finish our truffle fries.

First time here and now I understand why there's always a line!    Food:  all of the burgers and dishes are well thought out and flavor execution is as good as it sounds on the menu.  Our favorites:  the chicken saltimbacco sliders are tasty.  Perfectly breaded, thin, fried chicken topped off with arugula salad that is dressed on a crispy toasted seasame brioche bun.  The onion rings were crispy and not oily, served with house made spicy ketchup and mayo. The mangalica pork burger wrapped in mangalica bacon and pulled pork is divine!  The forest burger is also amazing. All the flavors work well together and the meat temp came out exactly as ordered.  Service:  all the service staff was quick, friendly and attentive.  Our drinks were quickly refilled before empty.  Even though the restaurant was full, service was impeccable and food came up quickly.  I'm totally impressed with how well run this restaurant is and the food is deserving of the Gordon Ramsey brand.  Will be back to try some of the other burgers.
