Went here on Thursday evening.... there was a long line but it moved quickly.... I tried the Blue Burger --excellent Really tender meat and great flavor great burger!  The onion rings -beer batter with grated  cheese... sides of ranch and ketchup Chipoltle ... unfortunately the onion rings were too salty and ranch also--like someone lost control of salt shaker !  The ketchup Chipolte was less salty  but still no good with onion rings still having sooo much salt! Service -I eat at bar was fine... people tending to eat their burger and leave .. quick turnover...

The atmosphere here is nice, with modern decor and a beautiful fire display in the front as you enter. I was surprised by the food here, as my expectations were pretty high for this place given the name, but I was incredibly disappointed. There were 4 in our party and two ordered burgers. One was ordered as medium well, but it was medium (bright pink center throughout) at best. The second was ordered medium and it was closer to medium rare (bright red center).Our server only checked on us once right at the first bite, so we never had a chance to voice our complaint. She was very nice and did a great job otherwise.  The truffle fries were way over cooked.  Check out some of the other burger joints in this area as there are TONS and here you are really only paying for the name.    *Edit: I added a third star to my review as I was contacted by the management team in regards to my review. The individual who reached out has shown genuine concern for my experience and promised follow up will be made with staff to ensure this does not happen in the future.  I personally feel exceptional customer service is essential in this industry, so this was very meaningful to me. Ownership is essential and they seem to want to genuinely provide a great experience to their customers, including recognizing they made a mistake and ensuring they catch any that may occur quickly enough in the future so it can be resolved.
Outstanding burgers! Gorgeous decor/ambience. Server was great! Want to come back again, and again and.....

Maybe it was the hype, but this place wasn't THAT good. It was a good burger but nothing special, if I'm honest. The staff was good, from the hostess to the waitress to the bussers. I'll probably be back, but I won't be expecting a meal I've become accustomed to from other GR establishments.
Best Damn burger and truffle fires I ever had in my life!!!! You won't be disappointed if you are your just hater and don't know quality.....

Yummy burgers!!!    but this review is based off of service and it sucks ( what was the waitress doing) I wish Ramsay came in and put two slices of bread on this waitress and ask her "WHAT ARE YOU!?" .....and I think you guys know the response to that, if not then just look it up.  There was a party of 2 that sat 15min after us and received their food way before us; we had to wait an additional 10min for our food to come out. What a bummer.

The review is for the Tandoori Chicken Burger only. It tasted overly salted and was inedible half way through. Really sad as I had high expectations for this place. The other burgers seem good though. Maybe I had an off one.

Finally got to try Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant and it was everything and more. The decor, the menus, the whole ambience was amazing. I was in a group of 7 people and they told us it would be an hour wait which was fine since we were on the casino already so we just gambled until we were notified through text message that our table was ready. We arrived and were told they were clearing off our table, okay cool but it literally took them 15 minutes to clear a table off which I felt like was a little bit long to wait after you told us our table was ready. Anyways, the food was great! I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger because it had jalapeños which i thought would be spicy but it really wasn't but good none the less. Our table also ordered the sweet potato fries and the truffle Parmesan fries. Both amazing!! The swear potato fries were just so damn good! Can't really figure out way but they were not your ordinary fries! And you can't go wrong with truffle! Those fries were amazing as well! Our experience was overall great! I'm docking a star because of the wait but everything else was top notch!
Riktigt bra burgare, ganska dyrt så om det är värt det är en bra fråga men helheten med upplevelsen av restaurangen och en bra burgare är bra.

I went here on a Sunday night at around 9. The place was super busy and Poppin but it was worth the 40 minute wait. The service was fantastic and the servers are attentive and friendly. The atmosphere was semi casual and very clean.   The food: My girlfriend ordered the forest burger. She says it was amazing and the mushrooms were fresh and the patty was cooked to perfection.  I ordered the crown burger and the aioli was great with the meat. I added bacon and it was crispy and flavorful.  We both agreed that the buns were the best component as they were fluffy and had some good sesame seeds on top.   The truffle fries and aioli were the best things I've ever eaten. I would die for those fries.  The only negatives were the patties themselves as they were a tad underseasoned, but the ingredients and buns help with that.   Overall: if you like burgers and Gordon Ramsay, this place is worth the wait and the moderate pricing. However if the novelty of a celebrity chef isnt your shtick, you might not be too impressed

Went here with a group and all enjoyed our burgers. But what really made the experience was Caleb who was assisting our server with drinks etc.  Before we could even finish our drinks,  he was already there with a refill and smile on his face. The whole time we were there, he was running around helping the whole restaurant. It was so refreshing to see someone who loved their job with a positive attitude!

Finally got to try this place after years of hearing about it and wanting too but never wanting to wait in the long line but my friends are diamond rewards members so we didn't have to wait in line last night!!! We started with the burnt ends poutine which was absolutely delicious!! I had the Hell's Kitchen burger which comes with roasted jalapeños, roasted tomatoes, and avocado. I asked for my mine medium and it was perfectly cooked.  My friends both had the forest burger which comes with grilled mushroom and they both loved it.  Also had the truffle fries which were just okay (nothing special)  Our server was very attentive and kept checking on us.  Overall a good experience.

No exaggerations here. Top 3 burgers I've ever had and I've had quite a few. It was juicy and flavorful like a ribeye almost. I went around 2 so there was no wait and service was wonderful. Our waitress literally gave me a new glass of lemonade half way through my first. They have a weekly special that changes but I didn't try because I wanted a beef burger and it was pork. For my first time in Vegas this was a must have on my list and it didn't disappoint. I had the farm house. House cured bacon, egg, and dublinar cheese. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town. We also tried the truffle fries were excellent as well and big enough to share between 3. Sorry I didn't get a photo my friends attacked before I could act but the photos of my burger are more than you need to decide

Dined in here the day after Christmas. Wait time was around half an hour to 40min. We ordered the truffled Parmesan fries, Hell's Kitchen burger and Hog burger. Price was reasonable. The Hell's Kitchen burger was ok but Hog burger was really good. It gave you different layers of flavors with burger patty, bacon, beef, brisket, and the fried onion layer offers a crispy texture. The fries were also very tasty and not oily at all. Recommend this place.

I heard so much about this place and wanted to give it a try. Ordered Caesar salad and lamb burger. The salad was very salty. When I told the waiter that he said it must be the cheese(!?!?!). The lamb patty was very dry and again the burger was very salty. Food was a big flop here. And the wait was 30 min for the food to come to your table. I recommend to skip this place. Not worth your money and time.

Well...we waited 1.5 hours to eat here. It was edible. All I can really say about the flavor is that it lacks flavor. I gave it a three stars because the root beer was good. I got the parmesean fries and the ketchup that came with it was funky tasting. I hope Gordon Ramsey reads this, your burgers are not the greatest buddy, stick to British food and leave the American burger alone.

Best burger I have ever eaten! Got the Blue Cheeseburger. Made all my foodie dreams come true. Parmesan Truffle fries were great too. Ambiance was great and wait staff were very accommodating. Highly recommend.

I'm a big fan of Gordon Ramsay... from his shows, books, and restaurants. This place did not disappointment. I'm a pescatarian and found the lobster/shrimp burger more than satisfying. The wait was very long... but it was expected. This place was more than exceptional.
Truffle fries are to die for!!! Pre drink with the pear wine sangira and you've reached bliss.

Sunday, March 4, 2018 @ 1:16am Bad experience!    The service was good.  BUT the food (burger, fries) were bland and cold.  Had to ask for salt and pepper to give them flavor.  Not worth the time and money.  Manager was equally cold and rude!

Meh. Came here last night. I will say service was 5 stars. Wait took forever, they sat us next to the fire wall but we were way too hot and the staff reaccomdated our seating which made them get 5 stars in my book. Our waiter was helpful and really knew the menu. Reason for the lower ranking is that I had really high hopes for this place. Now I ate the entire burger because I was so hungry. The ketchup is home made and I was not a fan, it was spicy almost like a cocktail sauce, but just not good with their fries. Fries were overly seasoned. I preferred the regular ones over the truffle. The onion rings were bomb. The burger I had was good, but dry and I did not like the cheese on there, very stinky like goat. I prefer red robin over this place.

I am giving this four stars for the service. The food is not up to standard of the other Ramsey Gordon locations in our opinions.  It is good, but the sliders that we had were on the salty side, and the burgers that we had were not the best that we've ever had. I like the Gordon Ramsay pub burgers better.  The service however was first class, and everyone was more than welcoming.
Omg I ate the best Parmesan fries there! And my forest burger was delicious. Everyone liked it. I would definitely come back here when I'm next time in Vegas.

If you are a fan of Gordon Ramsay, just like me, this is the place. It's just Wow!!  Don't forget about a long long line tho. Awesome!  Two Thumbs up!!   Food: Good Price: Good Service: Good Parking: Good
Didn't know what to expect but it was damn good, I'd say worth the price. When we went wait wasn't very long. Great atmosphere, bar seating as well as table.

First let me preface this by saying I'm not a burger person.  I probably only eat one or two a year but my husband, well it's his favorite food on earth.  The big thing with this place is timing.  If you go in off hours it's no problem.  During a regular dinner or lunch hour it's packed and there are lines out the door.    Since it was an off time, I can't say if the service is always this good but on that day it was perfect.  We sat down with our menus, had the server there in minutes to take our drink orders.  They have lots of appetizers and stuff on the menu but since I never eat a lot I opted to just eat the burger and fries.  Think maybe they make their own buns or source them from some bakery because they didn't come out of a package.  The burgers were juicy and just the right amount of toppings.  Fries seemed like they might have been double fried, crisp on the outside and moist and tender on the inside.    If you're a burger lover, don't miss this place, even though I'm not a fan of Gordon Ramsay

Wow!! The best burger and fries I ever had I'm sitting here almost a year later reminiscing about my meal from here! Thinking to myself " Gordon Ramsey can be as mean as he wants producing food like that" I got the burger with the duck bacon and egg and it was amazing and the truffle fries are bomb too
The food itself is 4 stars. Good burger, great onion rings, awesome brown butter shake. But man, I really don't think burgers for 2 should cost over $100. Won't be going back.

A friend and I went here when visiting Vegas. It was an hour wait but worth it. They have great food, I had Hells Kitchen burger with their truffle fries. I remember it like it was yesterday. And not to mention good beer to go along with it. Try the Innus & Gunns with your food. We got seated at the bar near the kitchen. The sous chef in the kitchen talked to us and didn't make it feel like we were sitting right there but it was nice to see where all the action took place. Next time I'll want to sit by the nice fire.

2 stars for service. Place was empty. 3 ladies in the front were friendly. Seated quickly but then nothing. No server. No water. Nothing. We got up and left after 10 minutes waiting to order which is probably a good but overpriced burger. $15.00 and up with no sides from the menu only. As we left the gal said thanks for coming not remembering we had just walked in. Who knows if tbe food would. E good. We are now at PBR Rock Bar. Already better service. Hopefully the  food is good.

I was ready to rate this place a 1 until I ate my burger. I have to admit the burgers are good. That said, the weird wait system is ridiculous.  If you are a party of 2 you get to wait in a line and 3 or more you put in a reservation and get a text when your ready. So I waited in line for 30 mins even though they quoted 15 and the line was short. It goes REALLY slow. So I'm watching a bunch of larger parties getting seated before me.  When I complain about this to the overstaffed hostess stand, they explain that they have way more two top tables. This is a flat out LIE because they put many of them together to accommodate larger parties. Then after waiting a half hour, they break down a large table at the front with the sun blaring in to make four 2-top tables and offer it to us, after I complained about the wait and larger parties going before us. The four hostesses that were working didn't have enough sense to skip that question. You would think that between the four of them, that was a bad offer. Then they went down the line to offer that.  So then we order the signature burger, but are told no substitutions. Come on Ramsey, don't be like that. Let us take off the lettuce, especially since they are little pieces.   I will admit tho, the signature burger (once we removed the lettuce ourselves) was delicious. Short ribs with rib eye, and pickled onions were to die for!!!!! The farmhouse burger was also really good.
The best burgers in Vegas! This place is worth the long wait in line.
Had the "Foie" Burger with some onion rings. Rings were good. Reminded me of Funyuns in a good way. The burger was delicious. I'll definitely come back here when I'm in Vegas.

Food was okay but staff needs some fine tuning     I just got the feeling that business was good so they really didn't care about your experience.  Burger was good but not good enough to bring me back.   I don't need to be fussed over but a simple greeting isn't too much to ask.    The checkin process was also very chaotic and disorganized.     Food was 4 stars  Service was 2 stars

Excellent burger .   The atmosphere is nice. Very clean and quiet place. The service is a little slow. But my waitress was polite and nice.  Would have loved to take a picture of my mushroom burger but my battery died on my phone.

I went here for lunch with my son a few months back and have been meaning to write a review. I got the Farmhouse burger and some sweet potato fries... and my son got the Big Dawg. Mind you my child is 6 and took down this humongous hot dog. The little bit that he let me try was delicious. Now my burger... OMG. This burger guys. This burger? OMG. I just about died and went to burger heaven if south a place exists. The Dubliner cheese and the duck bacon and the fried egg just blended so well together that I could've ordered another had I not been trying to watch my calories. This place is definitely worth a try and worth the wait if there's a line out the door like there was when we went.

This was my first time here and it was beyond anything that I had imagined. The burger was by far one of the best I have ever had. We had a great time talking and laughing with our wait staff and it made for a memorable night. Do yourself a favor and try a milkshake!!
If you're going to pay 40 bucks for a   , this is the place. Food was good, service was good. Its a churched up burger joint from a British celebrity chef. It's everything you'd expect, + and -.

Yep... Gordon Ramsay knows what he's doing, but was there really any doubt? The burgers were seriously fantastic. Came here on a double date and we all ordered different burgers so we could try a little of each other's. Each of them were excellent as well as the drinks. I ordered the antioxidant one. I cannot stress enough how delicious all of our burgers were so which ever one you choose to order will probably be delicious.  There was a really long line, but... there was a sign that said for parties of "three or more" to see the hostess. We did and boy am I glad we can read. They put us on a different list for bigger parties and we were seated in a reasonable amount of time without having to wait in that long line we initially saw. So we gambled a bit more and were then texted when our table was ready. We waited approximately 30 minutes total and if you saw the original wait line, it looked like a busy day at Disneyland so 30 minutes was great in our minds. They don't take reservations either so FYI.   I honestly can't wait to go back the next time we're in Vegas. The burgers are so worth the wait.

The restaurant is located in the Planet Hollywood hotel off of the Vegas strip. The restaurant is fairly easy to find since it is not fully enclosed. The exterior is decorated with a cool window displaying a fire design.   The menu is built around gourmet burgers. I ordered the Forest burger and Parmesan truffle fries. The fries were crispy and seasoned well with the Parmesan and truffle oil. It is enough for two to share as a side. The burger marinated well with the combination of mushrooms and tremor cheese. J was skeptical of trying the duck bacon since I am not a huge fan of bacon in general, but it complimented the burger itself, which was a thick patty. It was also topped with arugula and the sesame seed bun was toasted to a perfection and not too thick as to take away from the toppings.  I would definitely return to try one of the other burger options. The price point is decent considering it is a well crafted burger that will make you full. The menu offers a handful of burgers, but unfortunately you cannot substitute other toppings free of charge.

We were so disappointed! Terrible service!  Cold fries, no refills and no server for most of the meal! I have watched Gordon Ramsay for years and I went in there expecting top notch service.... not at all what we got! We spent over $100 on a burger and a drink and it was not good.  The service is what really killed it!!!! I know when it's busy you have to juggle your tables... but at least acknowledge us and let us know you will be right with us..... it took 25 minutes just to get waters. Such a disappointment!  Lisa Shaw

Had an amazing lunch at Godon Ramsay Burger. The onion rings were cooked perfectly. I had the forest burger and my husband got the Hell's Kitchen burger. We shared and both of the burgers were delicious. Forest mushrooms on the forest burger were amazing. The staff here is great. They're polite and attentive.  Strongly recommend this place.

I went to this place because of the Gordon Ramsay name. I'm a big fan and the line is always long at this place. I have no complaints about the burger, it is good. However this place is pretty expensive. And keep in mind (atleast when I went there) the sides were not included so if you wanted fries you had to pay separate when most places included this in the price. The sweet potato fries though are great! My biggest disappointment was the desert (we got some sort of pudding) and it tasted just like a high school cafeterias pudding. Other than that I would give this place a shot and I like the design of it.

Here is a tip:  when the line is long and you can't wait an hour and a half to eat, get it to go. We did that last night because we were short on time and trying to make the Britney concert. You order from the hostess and pick up your food in about 30 minutes.   We sat in the casino sports lounge next door. I would totally do that again!  The tuna sliders had a lot of textures and flavors, I liked it. My favorite was the fries with curry sauce, I would get this again.  I want to try the portabella mushroom sandwich because my friend loved hers, she said it had the perfect flavor combination.

Expected way too much for this place, only to get disappointed.    Wait time: 40 minutes before we got seated, there was a line, ahhh must be fuxking good plus it's Gordon Ramsay for Christ sake!......then another 40 to get our food. That anticipation game is just adding up to the hype of eating burger of the famous Gordon Ramsay. (Not good when you have this type of mentality)   Location: Cozy, with "Gordon Ramsay" everywhere, plates, menu, coasters, even the little stick on the burger,  he also has a big picture displayed inside. Overrated.   Server: Good looking attentive tattooed chick  Food: I ordered the crown burger and bf ordered the "hells kitchen". Mine turned out to be salty and his is supposedly spicy but they must have used fake jalapeños. French fries are ok.   Overall, don't set your standard too high just coz a famous chef owns it! In and out is better than waiting almost 2 hrs for a 15-20 dollars burger alone!

Although the burger I had was delicious and the staff was great.  I was disappointed in the fact they way over cooked my burger and the fries completely sucked.  I would expect better after getting the top $22 burger it should at least be close. I asked for med rare and got med well to well done burger 0 pink.  The fries looked like they were the end of a bag.  Each fry was like 1/4-1/2 inch long.  I understand they are high volume but I would expect more even from  a chain burger joint how hard is it to cook a burger to proper temperature?

I have been waiting a long time to try this place and I was not disappointed. The service was friendly and knew their stuff. After recommendations I decided to try the Hell's Kitchen burger and the Farmhouse burger. Both were delicious and cooked to perfection! The Hell's kitchen burger was not too spicy and the flavor was out of this world. The Farmhouse burger was like a  breakfast explosion in my mouth. The egg was cooked just right and not over done like some places. The onion rings and dipping sauces have changed my whole perspective and expectations when it comes to this side. The prices were reasonable, the staff was friendly, and the food was amazing!

This is a mixed review.  5 stars for service, excellent staff and speed.  2 stars for the food. I gave a 2 star because the experience left me feeling like I don't want to go back. I love a good burger, this place has big but underwhelming burgers. I've had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, the Hog Burger (separate occasions), the fries, and the onion rings.  The taste blends together too much. It's just a hot mess of meat and bread. They have few sauce selections. The house ketchup is too pungent, and the ranch is a cheese ranch, too much on the cheese flavor. Nothing fresh that cuts through the burger flavor.  There are much better burgers nearby. Don't let the fire display distract you, I think this place has little to offer in terms of special Vegas experiences or in a special dining experience.

This used to be one of my favorite lunch places when I am in Las Vegas.  Previously this restaurant was named Gordon Ramsey Burgr.  The quality of food and cleanliness has gone down substantially since the name change.  The Fire decor at the front of the restaurant is so dirty and grungy.  The sweet potato fries were hard not soft and crispy.  The dipping sauce for the fries tasted fishy.  The Hog Burger was still very good.  Service was still excellent.

What can I say about Gordon Ramsay? I can tell you if you're coming for a burger you will not be disappointed. The options are endless, and if you're willing to wait 30 minutes or so for your meal you'll be very pleased. My burger was outstanding. The set up the delivery of the presentation or on par. Excellent job. I would've given it five stars if it was just a little bit quicker but the food was so good that again as long as you have the time you're gonna be the supportive whatsoever.

I came here last Sunday before driving back home. I was going to eat-in but seeing the long line, I asked the hostess if I could get it to go, and hopefully, I could sit somewhere on the strip and eat it. I ordered the farmhouse burger and truffle fries. I was told that it would take 25min and that I could sit in the adjacent lounge. There was no space there because football games filled it up and I'm sure you have to buy drinks to sit there. I thought that I'd have nowhere to eat, so I asked if I could change my order to eat in and asked if there were seats for one. She said I could sit at the "chef's table"-(stools facing the kitchen). While I waited, I took my Rubiks cube out and started to solve it. I noticed the worker stop doing what she was doing and watch me solve it. Afterwards, she gave me a high 5 and I got a fist bump from the chef.        The girl (Lydia) asked where I bought my cube and I told her if I could write it down. I had said that I bought mine from eBay when the first came out with stickerless 7x7 cubes for about $50. Now that more companies have been making them, the price is now $23 from www.cubicle.us, a company in upstate New York, which is good because you don't have to wait for it to come in the mail from China. She said she wanted to buy one for her sister or was it her daughter. I told her how I learned to solve it by watching how-to videos from a Prof. Arthur Benjamin, the creator of Mathemagic. I told her that I took a month to "master" the 3x3. and that I watched YouTube to learn the 4x4. I told her that you need to learn how to do centers with the 4x4, and if you know the 3x3 and the centers of the 4x4, then you can solve any sized cube.       Next, the maitre d and I talked about how to solve it, and I told him that the night before, I went to Wahlburgers and drank to see how much is needed to slow me down. I said its more fun when you are drunk because now I have to think harder instead of solving it on "auto-pilot". I drank 3 drinks and still didn't slow me down much. He told me that I should eat now before my food gets cold. This was the best burger I've eaten yet. It's too bad I was still stuffed from the last night. I'm glad I decided to eat in. I ate half my burger the fries. The fries were great and was probably made with all natural truffle oil. I've bought a Perigord truffle once and I've bought artificial essence of black and white truffle that you mix with olive oil. After being halfway done, I stopped and played with my cube until I was able to eat again. Finally, I chatted with the chef and asked him if he had met the man himself. He told me that he his nothing like the Hell's Kitchen persona and that he is very mellow nowadays. I told him about how I love the UK version of Kitchen Nightmare, where he can curse, but it is more evidence that he cares. Check it out on youtube. I will try other burgers next time and I hope the chef there will go far in his career just like Marcus Wareing. I wish I knew the name of the chef. Lydia had told me, but I didn't hear her clearly. I also wished I learned the name of Maitre D'. I totally recommend this place and recommend sitting at the chef's counter.

Surprisingly it wasn't as good as I was hoping...  The wait wasn't too bad, they told us about 2 hours for a table of 8 but it ended up only taking 1 hour.   We got a poutine to split for the table, and I just got one of the burgers and truffle fries... No clue which burger it was, I think the hell's kitchen burger that had avocado in it. It was nothing spectacular though. In the end, service was pretty slow and food was just okay.   I had really high hopes for this place, but I only have myself to blame. I hyped it up for myself, next time, I'll just stick tot he buffets or something.

There are long lines for sure. I had the U.K. Burger and it was super tasty. This gourmet burger was worth the wait. Yes, all the hype is real. The Chutney sauce and the cheese makes the burger exceptional. I would definitely eat here again next time I'm in Vegas.

I was worry this place was all hype but the burger was very delicious. It is inside planet Hollywood right near an entrance. The wait was 30-40 mins on a weekend. The burger did not take too long to come. Service was decent.   We got the Hell's Kitchen and lobster/shrimp burgers. I enjoyed the lobster/shrimp burger a lot. The burger patty was very flavorful and you can taste the shrimp and lobster. The patty texture was very good too - doesn't fall apart and not mushy with a slightly chewy texture. The pickled carrots in the burger was nice and crunchy and added the needed acid to the burger. The buns were light and didn't feel too heavy.   I thought the burger was gonna be my caloric heavy weight but man the Oreo creme brûlée shake stole the title! It's super decadent and delicious but probably 800+calories! Definitely would order it again if we ever go back and workout like crazy to burn it off!   Glad we try this place!

HUGE disappointment!  Come on, GR!  You may want to come check on this restaurant of yours.....  Server Ryan- rude.  Food- eh.  Would I return?  Probably not.  Mentioned to my Uber driver that we had been there and she said it's a common thing to hear her riders say they were disappointed with their experience.  I will say though,  the glass fire wall was super cool!

I visited here on 7/9/17 during lunch. Our server was friendly and efficient (don't recall her name) and the place is very modern and cool. The flames in the glass wall leading inside were a really nice/different touch. All the food my friends and I ordered tasted great but there was one major snafu! When one of my friends took the first bite of his Portobello mushroom burger, a LONG BLACK FABRIC STRING CAME OUT THAT HAD BEEN COOKED INTO THE BURGER! WTF?!!! We called our server over asap and she apologized profusely stating that the string was probably from the towels used in the kitchen to handle hot plates. But still - gross! If Gordon himself had been there that day to see that, he would have cussed someone out royally! She took the burger away and ordered my friend a fresh one. Then the manager came over and apologized and comped our bill for that order. A new burger came out perfect and we enjoyed the rest of our meal. But that incident definitely tarnished my opinion of this place. It was our first time here and other than that, everything else was on point. There was only about a 5 minute wait time too. My cheeseburger with several different British cheeses was delish as were the onion rings we shared, Cheddar soup, and truffle fries with chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch. All-in-all and despite the "string incident", I would give it another chance and I plan to soon!

My family and I traveled from Southern California to Las Vegas to try a Gordon Ramsay burger. I have to say that after waiting 45 minutes in line and another 45 minutes to get our order I was surprised how mediocre the food was. The burger was okay the fries were nothing special. I won't be back it was not worth the travel, time and wait.

Backed by a famous chef for a reason! This place blew the away when we were here on vacation recently. Location was in walking distance from our hotel, and wait was only five minutes even though it was super time. Food too a little while to come out but man oh man, what a delight it was. Will have to be back whenever I'm back in town. Hopefully soon

The location was great in Planet Hollywood where we stayed. The burgers looked great. Considering  we waited for them to be cooked. My burger was not hot and it just came off the grill. My husband was in the middle of eating his. I contacted the manager. I informed her I waited for the burger to be cooked and I an in the restaurant so why was my burger not hot. She was accommodating and I waited for another burger to be cooked. The second won was hot. She said they have to be at a certain temperature. I understand but it still should be hot. It seemed it was pre cooked an d tossed on the grill to heat up but not hot all the was through. I love burger from medium well to well done. This on was requested well done. I had sautéed onions and no bacon or fancy topping added to it.  I didn't see anything special about the burger but  a bit over priced for the name.

You are paying for the name. Buffets are wasted on me, and I really wanted a Hell's Kitchen burger ... 1 burger and 2 lemon shandy beers later, $40 bucks was worth it for me. Was it a life-changing-melt-in-your-mouth decadent experience? No. But it was flavorful and spicy with every bite. Definately something to do once in Vegas! If you're complaining about price, hit up In-and- Out ... A cheese burger with anilmal style fries will fit your budget and you're appetite. :)

My second time here. My friends ordered the burger and I customized one of the sandwiches to have mushrooms avocado and cheese and it was sooo good. The first time I was here I had the mushroom burger and it was also great! Our waiter was quick and friendly and made the whole experience even more enjoyable.

Had an amazing experience here! Started off with a order of Kettle chip nachos! They were  then we ordered a grilled cheese for my son, and my wife and I got the Hells Kitchen burger and the Farmhouse burger! And boy they did not disappoint! We ordered them medium rare and they were cooked to perfection! Definitely would recommend coming here. Wait time to get a table was about 45 min but it's really worth the wait!

Great food and great wait staff! Long wait time but for good reason and worth it. The appetizer and burgers were cooked perfectly and the portion was just what we needed to feel full. The interactive tap list was pretty helpful as well.

Wow!! We were a party of 12 gave us a time frame of25 - 30 min wait. After waiting for 45 min still not ready. They were waiting for two party's to get out. After 55 min of waiting we finally got a table. Ramsay say the F all the time well this is one of those moment for us. F F

I had high hopes for this place as I know Gordon Ramsey has high standards for his restaurants. Sadly to say I was a bit underwhelmed flavor wise, with my Forest Burger. The meat patty wasn't flavorful though I do like the duck bacon. Also my chips were really chewy and hard, like to they were overcooked. Are British chips supposed to be like that? If so, then I guess I just prefer fluffier fries.

I didn't get a chance to try this place out the last time I was in Vegas so this was bookmarked as one of the first places to eat when I came back.   Wait time: 45-1hr wait  Ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger - Medium rare and Parmesan truffle fries  - the burger was juicy, cooked to perfection, and had a nice kick from the jalapeños. The burger looks small but it was soooo filling!  - Truffle fries were good with 2 sides of dipping sauce  Overall it was 3.5, the burger was good, the service was good but probably not worth the wait.

Gordon Ramsay gets so much hype that I had to at least try one of his chains. There is the Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood (there's also a Steakhouse, which is super expensive). I walked in thinking I would need to pay $50 for a burger, but it was surprisingly affordable at $16 for my Blue Cheeseburger. I really like the sweet taste to it (not overwhelming, but a tint) and remember you will need to order fries with it if you want. I think the burger itself was enough for me.  After trying the burger, I cannot tell if it's a special GR burger or just a regular homemade burger. Nothing too special but with a GR stamp.   Also, you get to take the menus for souvenirs in case you want it (which I left).

Light, airy, and jam packed with pungent and juicy flavors that are a step away from melting in your mouth. Favorite burger so far, I got the Blue Cheesburger (blue cheese, figgy jam, arugula, cider vinegar reduction; I put the spicy mayo on the side).  10/10.

Finally got a chance to try a Ramsay joint and was super excited to. With all the hype around Ramsay I was sure this place would be good. Boy was I disappointed!! Are you kidding me!? This place was horrible. Can't believe I waited an hour to eat at this place when there were so many other options, it is Vegas. First the fries.. ordered extra crispy and when the food runner brought it out we asked if it was extra crispy and she was like sure. Then when we tried it, it was all soggy and def not crispy. Server came to check saw it wasn't right, took it away and brought us a new one. Same thing, no flavor and barely fried. Burgers.. there were 8 of us so we got to try everything from the lobster to the regular burger. Not sure if it all sat there a while before getting to the table but even the center of the meat was cold. The buns was stale and cold, probably didn't even get toasted. Not sure why this place had high ratings maybe cause of the name? However we won't be coming back.

I had one of their most expensive meal, foie gras and it was my first time trying out. The meal was extremely delicious and their sangria was on point. For those two, I paid $43 including tip/tax. The meal wasn't too fulfilling for how much I paid, but it was somewhat expected. The servers seem to discriminate me a bit early on because I was a young Asian kid, going in by myself at the bar area. They were fine later on though.

Craving a good burger and staying nearby, we decided to give Gordon Ramsay Burger a try on a Monday evening. They do not take reservations but we figured we'd get in line and see how fast it moved. After about 5 minutes a girl came by with a tablet, took our name and number, and said we would get a text when our table was ready. She estimated the wait at about 30 minutes, which turned out to be quite accurate.   Our order taker-I hesitate to call him our server because he basically just took our orders-was clearly not interested in chitchat. His first words to us were "are you ready for me?" I can probably count on two hands how many words he spoke to us after that. We never saw a drink menu, which is apparently tablet-based because we saw other tables around us looking at it. We all ended up ordering iced teas, which was OK but we might have ordered something alcoholic...so basically they lost some of our business.   Anyway, we all ordered burgers of some sort and sweet potato fries to share. To his credit, our order taker warned us that the burgers would take about 30 minutes, which again proved to be pretty accurate. Our burgers were good but the fries were not especially hot. Portion sizes were decent and prices seemed reasonable, at least for a celebrity chef/gourmet burger joint on the Strip. We don't regret going but it probably won't be high on our list of places to visit next time.
Fantastic burger (Hells' Kitchen Burger), great service and a nice, friendly vibe, cant wait to go back and eat again

This was the best aged burger I have ever had in my life. They have this one burger that they only serve 100 per shift that's made with aged steak and it's just the greatest thing ever! I love Hell's Kitchen but the Hell's Kitchen burger is too influenced on the sauce rather than the burger itself. The fries themselves were crisp and ultimately ended up melting in your mouth. We all loved every burger except ironically the Hell's Kitchen burger

This is because of the incompetence of being able to seat us with the most dumb system ever. Waited over an hour and thirty min for a tuesday lunch. Not worth the wait after getting the food. Use your own system of vibrators than a cell phone text. Thought this would have been thought of by now.

Third time dining here.  Gets better every time.  Place was PACKED, but service was quick.  Ordered a kale quinoa salad that was probably one of the best I've ever tasted.  Loved every bite and quite large too!  Will be back again.

My husband and I just went here for the first time while we were on vacation in Vegas, and we were so glad we did. Those burgers were definitely worth the wait, and the staff was very friendly and attentive.
Service is just okay, but the burgers are always worth it. There's usually quite a line to get in, but it's Vegas after all, so grab a drink and hang tight, I promise the food is worth the wait!

Helluva place. The service was amazing. Even after I screwed up my burger order, the staff moved to fix MY mistake like it was their own. I had the "Hells Kitchen" burger and it was awesome. Further more the truffle fries were amazing. My gf had the fish and chips which she loved.  Again the service here was phenomenal and the food great. I would go back just for the truffle fries and friendly atmosphere.

This is a must for anybody who loves a good burger. We had sweet potato fries and the burgers were bursting with flavors. If you want to eat here with out waiting in line some after 2:00. Regardless, it is worth the wait! It is on the pricy side, but worth the experience. The waiters are friendly and it was a great experience!!!
Too expensive for the quality. I'm speaking about the burger I had. The wings were pretty good, but I expected a better experience with my burger.

Absolutely delicious! Ramsey Burger is a must stop during our trips to Vegas! They recently updated their menu which was disappointing because I wanted the Yard Burger (chicken), but it's been removed! I tried one of the other burgers which was cooked perfectly. Tons of flavor. I ordered the Parmesan Truffle fries as well and they are addicting! The service was alright. The waitress was familiar with the menu but I had to ask for refills which was frustrating.

Update: 10 stars for this place if I can give it!! They lost our ticket and we had to wait for over an hour. How does that warrant a 10 star rating? Both the manager and the waiter came to apologize. They comped the entire meal and even give us a shake to go! I highly recommend this place! We will definitely need back!!  P.s. shout out to our waiter Christian! You were amazing! We hope to see you soon!

The wait wasn't extremely long when I came in on Saturday. Maybe a 15 minute wait to be seated, but for the food was around 30 minutes. Service was on point though! Very attentive service.   I got I believe the Hell burger (I think that's what it's called). It was good, had jalapeño, avocado, tomato, beef. It's was a great burger, but it's just a mediocre burger anyone burger restaurant carries. Delicious and satisfying but not finger licking.   My boyfriend got the farm burger (again I think that's what it's called) and just the same as mine. A burger you can get anywhere.   Our friend for the Foie burger (again I think that's what it's called) and he said it's a legit burger. Like the best he's had. I believe him because it was one of the most expensive burger on the menu.   We all got the truffle fries and it was delicious! I love it, but I hope I didn't just love it because I was starving... I did notice it was extremely salty so I couldn't eat a lot.   Overall, it's a great restaurant to try once and say you've eaten here. But the price is a little high and the food just isn't something I'd pay for because I can get the same meal elsewhere but for a cheaper price.

I ordered a hotdog, it was subpar in comparison to the reputation of the restaurant. The service was not great, our waitress never checked in on us. However my friends had the specialty burgers and they absolutely loved it. The burgers were juicy and flavorful.

This is one of the most delicious burgers you can taste. I had the anniversary burger (not on the menu) and it is amazing. The service are quick and good. The wait line was not that bad (15 min), but worth the wait. If you in town and craving a burger, this is the place to go.

We were excited to go here on our first trip to Vegas in over 10 years but little did we know we should have passed on this place. We waited 1 hour to be seated and 1 hour for our food.  Service was terrible, the waiters never asked us how our food was or even refilled our drinks. The 17.00 burger was good but the bun was very greasy. At the end of our meal, we waited and waited for our waiter to bring our check.  Then we had to walk up to the register to pay because the guy never came back to pick up our check and payment. You'd think for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant at their high prices would have extraordinary service. But unfortunately Denny's would have been a better experience! Very disappointed!!

Excellent quality burgers at a high price.  If I'm paying this much for a burger, I expect the quality that Gordon Ramsay Burger brings to the table. Each bite is full of richness. I also really liked their truffle fries.  We put our name down on the waitlist and ended up waiting about 2 hours. Fortunately, Gordon Ramsay Burger takes down your phone number and you will receive a text to make your way back to the restaurant. Since it's located in the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mall, you can shop while waiting to be called. Once you get the text, your entire party has to present itself and you will have to wait in a line at the front of the restaurant for a bit.  --  taste / 5 aesthetics / 5 vibe / 5 service / 4 price for quality / 3 OVERALL / 4.4
I am happy to be here. it was very delicious. I recommends hog bugger! french fry also was very good.

Gordon Ramsay is basically my food idol. I've always wanted to eat at one of his restaurants ever since I heard about them. I got the fries and they were pretty thick which filled me up a bit. It was good though with nice flavor but a little too filling. I also got the forest burger which was cooked to perfection! The meat just softly melts in your mouth and it's so juicy and flavorful. The buns were the perfect texture to complement the soft meat. Overall I was in love and I can't wait to try another one of his restaurants.   Gordon Ramsay,  teach me your ways!

We were a party of 6 and a high chair. The wait was an hour long to be seated. They texted me my table was ready but made us wait another 10 mins. We places our orders and it took another 30-40 mins for our food to be ready. Food was good, but not worth the wait. Plus it was like 16 dollars a burger not including fries or drink. Our tab was 180.

This place is excellent for burgers for sure. I came here after looking at yelp reviews and I must say I am impressed. Good burgers, beers and fries. When I come back to vegas this will definitely be a place to come back to. Long lines but worth waiting for.

I went here with my classmates while TDY to Nellis around September of last year and I was not impressed. My burger was not that great, just okay and it was expensive. It really was unfortunate since I took the recommendation of the waiter that said that was the feature burger of the week. The service was good so that was redeeming and a couple of the folks I was with said they liked their burger but not for the price. I'd recommend other lesser known burger joints over this one that are cheaper, tastier and a shorter wait time.

Got off to lousy start. When I pulled out my chair, it was covered in filth,. Seriously, a nasty amount of food, like someone had wiped down the table and was trying to sweep it on to the floor but missed. Amazing buffalo wings? Nope... your local pizza joint probably has better. Crisp onion rings, not so much. Who doesn't love French fries with curry catsup? Me, if you buy them here. Beer selection was really good. The "blue burger" was well above average.

I found this to be the best burger spot ever! They have so many options which is not typical. Who knew a pescatarian could find both a veggie burger and a lobster & shrimp burger! Resturant has a waiting line most of the time Resturant very busy however the staff was very attentive and happy to get anything you needed!  Will defiantly seek out the Ramsay Resturant in NYC next month.  Resturant decor may scare someone off because the presentation would lead you to believe it would be very expensive....... but honestly the menu is priced quite modestly and the quality of food exceeded expectations! Treat yourself

We ordered the shrimp lobster burger and it was one of the most amazing burgers I've ever eaten. The burger was juicy and full of flavor. It came with truffle fries which was very good as well. The wait time was long but we were prepared for that.

Had a great first experience the first time so of course I went back. But the second time I went, it was a much different experience.   I had a horrible visit with our server Janet and the manager Eric. If you are looking for great service, this is not the place to go!   After we were seated we ordered waters right away and when she brought them we were ready to order. It took 55 minutes to get our food and when we finally did there was a huge problem. Last time I was there I ordered they turkey burger and loved it so I ordered it again and it looked much different. It looked like chicken this time and last time it more resembled beef. When I questioned Janet, she went on about their spicy chicken patty...listening was just not her thing. She then said that I was probably given beef last time. I asked to speak to the manager. I explained to him the problem and he said there was nothing he can do.  I took a few bites of the burger and did not like it, leaving over half. I told Karen that I did not like it and had lost my appetite and she said "Excellent, no worries." Who says that?!  She then charged me for it and I asked her to take it off because she took it away. She sent Eric to our table and he took her side and told me there was nothing he could do. He then proceeded to get in an argument with me and refused to leave my table when I asked I'm to.   Dont' waste your visit to LV on this place.

Decided to have our last meal in Vegas here. Waited in line for about 15 minutes which wasn't to bad. Ordered the Crown Burger and the Blue Cheese burger, the burgers were cooked well bit disappointed as was expecting more flavour in the burgers. Also sampled the truffle fries which were delicious. The meal was expensive and not sure if worth the money

2017 Review 33/100  5 stars for some of the best food and best service I've ever received at a restaurant. I'm a Gordon Ramsay fan and this was my first time at one of his restaurants and I was very impressed.  The food was the shining star, as it should be. We had the hummus as an appetizer and W.O.W. It was probably some of the best - if not THE best - hummus I've ever had in my entire life, no exaggeration. After we finished the dish I immediately looked up Ramsay's recipe and I plan to make it very soon. Funny enough, neither of us ordered burgers and this burger joint. We had burgers for lunch so we were feeling something different. My friend ordered the Chicken Saltimbocca Sliders and I had the Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad. Both were extremely good. And the burgers looked amazing. I really want to return again and try one. For desert, it was the Blood Orange Creamsicle. Tangy orange popsicle goodness with a creamy center. We also ordered drinks. I had the Skinny Screw and she had the Acai Lemonade. Again, very, very good.  Our waiter, Ryan, was the best. He was super personable and knew the menu extremely well so he was able to make some great recommendations on what to order. Since he seemed to be such a foodie we even asked him for a recommendation on where to go for breakfast the next morning and his recommendation did not disappoint (see my review for Mon Ami Gabi).  It's worth noting this place does not take reservations. You will have to wait in line to get a table. How long you have to wait just depends on the day and time you choose to dine here. We went on a weekday for a little bit earlier dinner and only had to wait about 15 minutes. But I have heard from others the wait can get up to 2 hours, so plan accordingly, particularly if you are catching a show afterward.  The hype is real and I highly recommend you add Ramsay's burger joint to your Vegas foodie "to do" list.

This was on my Vegas bucketlist so my friends and I had to come here on our visit. There were 10 of us and we were seated fairly quickly. They even text you when they have a table available, however they don't take reservations. I had the specialty lobster and shrimp burger and it was delicious. My drunk self definitely thanked myself for saving the other half for later that night. Most of my friends thought it was the best burger they had ever had.

Been here twice and it was okay both times.  Nothing about the food or atmosphere justifies the long line.   Must be fans of the show that come here because the food just isn't amazing enough to justify standing in line over 30 min.  The fish sandwich was bland.  It didn't have anything to give it Pop!  I wish there was a spicy tartar with lemon on it. The Ribeye Special burger I had was ruined by the shredded beef that was all over the burger.  Ribeye burger is by itself supposed to be more than enough.  I just didn't like it.  The best part of the meal was the truffle fries.  If you come and eat here, those are a must!!!  If I ever return, it will be for those yummy fries.

I didn't really want a burger for dinner, but after walking the strip, we ended up here. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen (hot) burger. It was very good. My daughter ordered the Farm burger and loved it. The skinny screw was very good too.
Great food and staff. Definitely a bit on the expensive side for a burger and pub restaurant.  I would love to return but would need to save up some $$$$ first.

We ate here last weekend with a group of 20 people. The service was great. The ambiance was relaxing and comfortable. I loved that they put our name down in the beginning and texted us when our table was ready. So in the meantime we shopped around! Now about the food. Delicious. I was honestly not even that hungry because we had a somewhat late breakfast, but I definitely did not want to miss out, so went ahead and ate anyway. We started off with 3 kinds of fries - sweet potato fries, the just fries, and the truffle parmesan fries. The parmesan fries were hands down the best! And the sauces that came with were so good. Next came our burger. Our entire group was basically divided in half between the Backyard burger and the Hells Kitchen burger. The latter sounded more appealing to me, so I went with that. And It. Was. Good. So Good. We are definitely going back!!

By far the most juicy burger I've EVER eaten! Cool restaurant & we were seated quickly for being prime dinner hours! We got the Hells Kitchen burger & the Crown burger, both excellent with awesome flavors & textures. They say their most popular is the Hells Kitchen burger, but I personally liked the crown a little better! I will be going to more of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants in the future!!

Solid burger joint with the man, the myth and the legend, Gordon Ramsay, slapping his name on it to make it famous. We were seated immediately because we went at 2:30 in the afternoon, but be warned that it isn't a large restaurant so wait time can be bad. After ordering, burgers take about 30 minutes to come out, with the option of your fries coming out before or with your burger.   My fiancé got the Hog Heaven which is a pork burger with BBQ pork and tons of other meaty toppings. Although he went in with a huge appetite, he could only polish off a little more than half. I ordered the Patriot Burger, which is a turkey burger with smoked Gouda, cherry chutney, spicy mayo and crunchy topping. I LOVED it, and after peeling off over half of the bun, I was totally able to finish mine. The fries were tasty, and we found it more than enough to share an order.   I would certainly be back during non-peak times, but I'm interested in his steakhouse now, too!

Had to try Golden Ramsay for that one time! Located inside the casino, the line was super long even on a weekday so get here early! I believe if you have 3 or more people, you can bypass the line to the front and check in with the hostess. To be honest, I expected more from a restaurant named after Gordon Ramsay. Waitresses were nice but they were sort of unprofessional, talking about calling in sick and such. Also, the service was slow, I know it's busy, but it shouldn't take 10 minutes or so just to get our order in or to get water. Food took over 45 minutes after it was ordered, which was a bit long. I was looking forward to the chicken burger but they replaced it with some other burger, so I was disappointed. I ended up getting the cheese burger which was pretty good, I wish it came with a side of fries (which has to be ordered separately).

Excellent burger you get here. Wait is pretty serious here. They text you, when your table is ready, within 10 minutes you have to show up, unless they give your table to the next. It happened to us.. So we had to wait another 45 minutes, but it was worth it! It located in side of Planet Hollywood.

I was honestly underwhelmed by this restaurant.  If Gordon Ramsay had actually been here, I hope he would have sent our food back.  I don't know how a burger with bacon, egg, and cheese on it can be bland, but they managed it.  The patty itself was seriously underseasoned, which makes for a sad burger.  The fries (thick wedge-style) were also completely devoid of any salt - we actually did send these back, because they were not tasty at all.  It wasn't a good burger, and definitely not worth waiting 40 minutes in line for.

Well, we waited in line a long time for a good burger, but I certaintly won't eat here again. It was still just a burger. The fries and onion rings were different from the typical place and were far above average. I will say that the seats were surprisingly comfortable. Otherwise, it was louder and more crowded than I would like after sitting at casino tables all day. Our server was excellent and the other servers all helped each other out.

Wasn't overly impressed with this place.  I thought for a 25 dollar burger it would be amazing but it just tasted very beefy.  I couldn't taste anything else on the burger.  I will say the serving of fries and the burgers are huge.  It was definitely way too much food.

I Had to wait 1 hour to seat, another hour for the food, but the food is delicious, hamburger was great and natchos was really yummy! I think  he should open another location , so it would not be so crazy busy, it is the reason i give 4 stars not 5, because the wait is a joke.

We waited almost an Hour to be seated, after which it took an even longer time to get our food. --minus 1 star A menu was present near the initial line so we were able to decide our food even before we reached the table.  The FARMHOUSE BURGER was great, though the fried egg could have been a little more runny. The proteins blended together to create a very satisfying taste. The HELL's KITCHEN BURGER was super delicious yet not too heavy midst all that goodness! (Avocado + jalapeños are a great combo)   Both burgers were worth the wait. But not sure I'd come again on a short visit- the entire experience takes up A LOT of time. (Could be due to the popularity and its Vegas after all!)

Great atmosphere, good service, and one of the best burgers I've ever had. We had to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant while we were in town and opted for burgers for lunch. Not the most family friendly place so I wouldn't take little kids but older kids do just fine. The fries are excellent and two orders fed six in our group. Try the Hog Burger if your up for a challenge - think upscale Cheeseburger in Paradise.

I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and the kettle chips nachos with beef. The nachos were great as the kettle chips mixed with the sauce and beef had a great blended taste.  The burger however was a major disappoint! All I could taste was the avocado. It took over the entire taste of the burger. The bun was soft and delicious but everything else inside was not. The patty was cooked just how I liked it , but I couldn't enjoy it because of the dominant avocado taste.  Came out disappointment as the place wasn't anything special

I typically am basic with my burger, but I branched out a little here. I ordered the Farmhouse Burger which has bacon, egg, and cheese...I was not disappointed! I also got the truffle fries which were great! People traveling with me loved the sauce/dip that came with the fries.

Everything was exceptional. As I think about my meal my mouth is starting to water.   RECOMMENDATION: if you're going with a small party or even another guest, I would recommend getting two different burgers and splitting them. There are so many delicious options to pass up on!   Truffle fries: a thicker cut fry sprinkled with parmesan cheese and comes with ketchup and another dipping sauce. (Perfect for sharing) They were perfectly cooked, meaning they weren't soggy or over cooked. The other dipping sauce had a touch of garlic to it which made the French fry experience that much better.   Blue cheeseburger: Holy mother of flavors. Comes with blue cheese and manchego, fig jam, cider vinegar reduction and spicy mayo. From the first bite to the last, there is an explosion of flavor. The sweetness of the fig jam compliments the savory of the two different cheeses while the heat of the mayo gives it that extra kick that you didn't even know you needed. This is by far one of the best burgers I've ever had.   Hell's Kitchen burger: more of a classic style burger with extra heat. We opted out of the roasted jalapeños but the jalapeño aioli was more than enough to bring the burger up a notch.

The presentation of the establishment is nice, even if no thought about the environmental impact is taken into account with the 24 hours a day flames. The fries tasted stale, and the burger meat was a bit on the dry side.
Literally the BEST burger I have ever had in my life! I still salivate thinking about it.

Shouldn't be this hard to rate an establishment. While I would have rated it higher, if you are comparing, I went to Guy Fieri's place the night before. That became my number one all time ever, and after visiting Gordon Ramsey's Burgr, Guy's is still my number 1. In fact sorry I can't say Gordon's is my all time number 2. Don't get me wrong, it was good. But not the best.   So if you are out for the best, I've compared for you. I think you will be happy with my honest burger opinion. .

Second time trying this burger place and it was not very impressive again. I've had the truffle parmesan fries and foie burger. I could not taste the foie gras spread. The patty was cooked perfectly but it was quite bland. Our fries were thick cut so it's not really crispy and lack of truffle flavors. I tried my friends onion rings and it was surprisingly good. Sorry but it was not worth over an hour wait..

Go for the burger! Ha! This place is self explanatory. The flames are very eye catching with a mesmerizing motion to draw you towards the long line of people waiting to have a bite of one of these mouth-flavoring burgers.   It's conveniently located near an entrance which is great if you want to avoid the cigarette smoke when walking through the casino area.

I'm torn with this place. I love Gordon Ramsay and perhaps my expectations were too high. The burger was good, but for the value and wait it wasn't worth it. First, you only get the burger for the price. No fries or side items. I can deal with that but not at $15-20 for the burger. Second the desserts sucked. I got some pudding that tasted very plain like a 99 cent pudding. The line was very long and we waited but if a place is popular kudos to them. The staff is nice, the place is clean, no complaints in that department. The fire pit thing in front is a nice touch as well. I would give this place a 3.5, it is good, not great considering the name it has.

This was a good burger. Was it the best I've had? No. The meat had great flavor but was too dry for me. I did ask for it to be cooked well done and that was probably a mistake. I always get my meat well done and I've had very juicy burgers. But here it wasn't that way. I loved the batter on the onion rings but not the Parmesan cheese they added on top....it made it too salty. Service was outstanding. I would eat there again.

I had high expectations considering it has Gordon Ramsey's name on it. The burgers were outstanding (we had the farmhouse and ultimate) and they were cooked to perfection. The truffle fries are definitely sharing size so don't let the $11 price tag deter you. The beer selection could be a little better but has some decent staples. Now the not so great...the service. Even my 16 year old recognized that that our server was clueless. He kept forgetting what we said and seemed totally distracted. I get that it's a relatively new place but perhaps a bit more training would help.

Atmosphere was fun and the service was great.   The onion rings were a big hit at our table. Unfortunately, two of the three burgers we ordered were overcooked. Outside of that, it's a good restaurant and fun place to eat.

We had the Hell's kitchen burger , Butter Pecan Milkshake and Beer battered onion Rings.  Onion Rings were good , could have improved on the portion though.  The burger is one of the best I've ever had. My 2 cents -- Add the Roasted Jalapeno to it . The milkshake is so good ! 2 of them a day is definitely worth 2000 calories though :)  Highly recommend !   -Pradeep

If you're a Gordon Ramsay fan and you're in Vegas you need to check out one of his restaurants. We were all craving a burger and went here. The line was around the corner to get in for dinner but we were able to get on a list and they called us. They said 45 min wait but it was much faster. We went and got a drink while we waiting in Planet Hollywood. I liked how they let us bring in our outside drinks to our tables, server even got us a glass to pour our beers into to match the restaurant atmosphere. We had two couples and shared two orders of delicious parmesan truffle fries. I split a 16$ burger with my wife that was really good.  Only unfortunate thing happened was when I got up to leave my pants got stuck to some gum on the chair. No fault to the restaurant but was not fun to try and get off. Server felt bad and hopefully changed the chair for the next guests.

Burger is a great spot to visit in Vegas. For parties of two or less, stand in line ( next to the amazing wall of fire at the entrance) and wait to be seated. For parties of three or more, place your name on a list wth the hostess. If there is a wait, you will be texted once your table is ready, a very convenient feature which allows guests to go elsewhere on the Planet Hollywood floor. We were seated after a 20 minute wait. Our booth was roomy and comfortable (note-the majority of seating in the restaurant was booths...a feature I LOVED). Drinks were ordered and the server provided helpful tips across the board. We ordered the kettle chip nachos as a starter-the brisket was tender, the chips were thick and well-seasoned, and the cheese was creamy (English cheddar cheese blended in with sour cream-delicious). I ordered the Blue Cheeseburger, and it was sensational. Juicy, tender, and bursting with flavor. The figgy jam and cheese were an amazing combination. The bread was soft and delicious. This burger was hands-down the best I have had in a while, definitely this year:) I even ordered mine "well done" which can frequently be too dry...it was not. It was a juicy flavor-explosion, and I am already planning our next visit.  We ordered truffle fries as well, to share. I love the thick-cut style, and the seasoning was nice. The truffle aioli, which accompanied the fries, was okay-honestly, the aioli seemed better suited to plain fries, since truffle on truffle was just a lot. But they were very good fries, and the ketchup was tangy and flavorful. Two thumbs up, definitely visit if you are in town.
The hummus and pita here are by far the best I have ever eaten. As a Gordon Ramsay fan, I was stoked to try this place out and it definitely met my expectations. I would definitely go back!

I had dinner here tonight and ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, truffle fries, and onion rings. The burger was a perfect medium well with a nice crunch on the outside and pink in the middle. The burger itself was seasoned so well! The toppings gave every bite a great taste. The fries were great and so were the dipping sauces. I enjoyed the onion rings especially the dips they give with the rings. The service is wonderful, truly. The food took a bit but for this case it was worth it. Go here!

Which chef doesnt taste his own food? I Was at this restaurant, i Got appetizer, main course and dessert, it was good expect The dessert, i Got a White chocolate parfait and it tasted like cheese, really strong. When i complaint The server told that no one Would taste it?? They asked me If i wanted a new dessert, but seemed like they didnt Care.  If it was my restaurant i would always taste my food

It pretty much lived up to the hype! Huge line for lunch but we were able to give our name & phone number so we could wander around or gamble. We did split up to do that & the wait was shorter than the 40 min. It was about a half hour but felt a lot faster.   Walking by, there were a bunch of empty tables. And we were seated at one of them later. I never understand why places do that, is there not enough staff or does it take that long to seat people?   Anyways on to the food:  Chicken wings (5+)- Prob the best damn chicken wings I've had in my life. The sauce was perfect. It was not a normal chicken wing but like a lollipop style where it's cut differently and the meat literally just falls off the bone. The blue cheese sauce is a must with it, my cousin wanted to opt out since he's not a blue cheese fan but he's so glad we got it on the side so he could try it & he was a fan.   Blue Cheese Burger (4 stars)- This was my favorite out of the 3 that we had. I love blue cheese & ah fig jam brings the sweet & salty aspect of it. I've had better burgers so it's not quite 5 stars but def satisfied the craving.   Hells Kitchen Burger (4 stars)- my second fav and others first. So I guess it's also all personal preference. This was a tasty burger though.   Forest Burger (3.5 stars)- I found this one to be a bit dry. Thank goodness for the duck bacon which made the burger have flavor but as a whole nothing to write home about.   Truffle Parmesan Fries (5+)- god damn these were good. You know how you order these and all the Parmesan eventually just falls to the bottom? Well this place knows how to do it right. Perfect seasoning on each fry & homemade dipping sauces (truffle aioli & homemade ketchup) were excellent!! A must order!   Overall if I were craving burgers in Vegas I may come back or try another place. It was surprising to me that the things I enjoyed most weren't the burgers though. So maybe I need to try different appetizers, sides & dessert next time!

We were very excited to Gordon Ramsay Burger, especially because we had Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips the day before and absolutely loved it. Unfortunately, it did not meet the hype. It was a 45 minute wait for a table of 10, and another 15-20 minutes for the actual burger.   We ordered the truffle fries. I don't agree with some of the reviews here, about the truffle fries being amazing. I've definitely had better. The fries were thick cut and not crispy, and the sauce that accompanied it was just okay. Gordon Ramsay Burger has their own homemade ketchup which none of us was a fan of. The onion rings were slightly better than the fries but again, I've definitely had better. For my entree, I've had one of their "secret" burgers which consisted of NY Strip and Ribeye and cost $22. The meat itself was amazing - very juicy and tender, absolutely delicious. My boyfriend had the Forest burger. He did not like it at all and only had a couple of bites. He thought it was dry. My friend had the hotdog, which he thought was good.   Service was great and the restaurant itself was beautifully renovated. I'd probably go back to Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips and Gordon Ramsay Steak and skip this one.

I'm not into burgers but the alternatives are delicious. I ordered the wheat berry and quinoa salad. It was amazing! For dessert I ordered the chocolate parfait. It was also delicious, creamy and there was a bite of fresh berries in each spoonful.  I don't drink alcohol but husband does and he enjoyed the Squatters IPA. The alcohol is pricey @ 11.00 for an average size beer. The rest of the food was a good price.

All the burgers here are great!! The onion rings were pretty thick to my liking! However the truffle fries are a must have. If you have a total rewards card and rank in the platinum or higher you do not have to wait in line which rocks because this place can definitely get busy.   Their home made truffle aioli, ranch and chipotle ketchup are all amazing sauces. Definitely check this place out

If you are a party of two there is a line for you to wait, but if you have a bigger group, they'll text you when your table is ready so you don't have to wait in line.     My friends and I all got one shake of different flavors.   I got the Crème Brulee pudding with oreos milkshake, it was the best one out of all them.   But, even with my sweet tooth, I couldn't handle all the sugar, it was straight up diabetes in a cup.       All their burgers are delish but it is very salty.   A fair warning.   This is definitely a man's meal, if you know what I mean, not for the faint in heart.

Just finished one of the best burgers I've ever had! I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and the sweet potato fries. The experience was what you would expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. The presentation was spot on. The cook on the meat was perfect. It was juicy without being messy. Everything was perfectly seasoned. The waitstaff were friendly and knowledgeable and the food arrived in a reasonable amount of time. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

I was actually very surprised by "Burger". I ordered their "hells kitchen" burger.  I didn't expect much since most restaurants believe it or not don't know how to make a good burger.The meat was very delicious and perfectly seasoned. Juicy and not over seasoned to hide the taste of the meat. The buns were toasted perfectly and the jalapeños were a delicious option as well. Our waiter was very friendly and pleasant. Despite how busy they were I was surprised at how fast the food came as well. I would love to go back to this place again!!

Dawg, I haven't been to Bachi Burger yet, but dawg these burgers right chear, these burgers right chear!  Greats buns, ingredients, and perfectly cooked patties.  Just plan to wait in line.    If you're a burger dude like me, you will absolutely notice that these are qualities burger that won't disappoint....As of now this is my favorite burger spot in Vegas.  Still got to try Bachi, Bobby, and Holsteins.

BLOW MINDED! I only gave 4 stars just because the line was 2 hours!  But the food is amazing Truffle fries: i know everyone recommend it but for me they smell weird and taste bad Anniversary burger was BLOWMINDED go for it

I think the portabella burger here is incredible. The sweet potato fries without the sugar topping also good... but not great. soggy. What is NOT GOOD are the sauces that accompany the fries. Ew. So nasty I don't get why these are something Gordon gets behind. The yellow one is waxy and tastes like lemon. Gross. It also looks like pudding. The red one is not ketchup. They don't have regular ketchup. Bottom line, I don't want to spend $20+ on a burger if there aren't good fries to pair it with and good sauces.   I wish they amp up their game.

We had lunch on Friday. Seated immediately- got there a little before noon, by the time we were done there was a long line. Compliments to our waiter, John. Explained the choices very well and made very good suggestions. Happened to also watch him find a package that another table left, picked it up and ran out the front after them to take to them. I had the Farmhouse burger. Didn't like the duck bacon but just removed it and enjoyed it without. I really liked the Parmesan truffle fries, husband didn't, he thought it tasted garlicky. He had the backyard burger and really liked it. It was more on the medium rare side and we asked for medium but overall good. Prices very reasonable.  The star for us was the dessert orange creamsicle- blood orange and a total surprise. I do get tired of similar desserts and this was a very pleasant ending to lunch. The manager was very present and engaged in what was happening with the patrons. Overall a very good experience
Get the short rib nachos. You won't be disappointed. I took off 1 star because my burger was overcooked and the $11 truffle fries were lack luster. I'd definitely go back.

Prepare to stand in line but good thing they accept reservation and they will text you when the table is ready. So while waiting, why not play some slot machines in the area!?! The burger is definitely gordon ramsay's style. Worth the wait!!!

So disappointing: I ordered a Hell's burger to go on a Sunday afternoon. Restaurant was busy, but nothing out of the ordinary for what they are used to. The order took about an hour (which was totally Ok and they prepared me for). However... when a person spends $18 on a burger (without any sides), they expect it to have some good flavor and at LEAST be hot! I was waiting for the burger at the nearby Extra Bar and as soon as I received the text notice, I made the 30 second walk to go pick it up. When I sat down to eat it (30 seconds later) I was sadly disappointed by it's lack of flavor and the fact that it MIGHT have been luke warm(ok, nope... totally cold). I tried to convince myself that it was better than it was (since it was a little $$$), but in the end... lesson learned... In-n-out burger tops Gordon Ramsey burger any day of the week

When I order a burger medium well it shouldn't be extremely pink inside.  Did my order get mixed up with someone who order their burger rare!?!? And then to not even offer to remove the burger from the $130 check is very surprising, being it was obviously your mistake and you were made aware of the situation.  Sorry, but how can I leave a tip in this situation.  Very poor customer service Tammy!
