I'm not a big Gordon Ramsey fan because I think he's mean..LOL.  However, my fiance is a huge fan and had to have something from one of his restaurants while we visited Vegas this past Dec.  So we tried his burger spot.  It was the best burger that I have ever had..literally.  We didn't dine in, my fiance got it to go, so even with that said (note, I like my food piping hot) it was such a flavorful burger.  I can't tell you the exact names of the burgers we had, but we both had something different, and felt the exact same..best burger ever.  So bottom line it's not even what you get, the quality of beef used and the execution of your burger will always be on point.  We are definitely going to make a return visit the next time we are in Vegas and we'll dine in.

Had to see what the hype was about.  It was better than average but nothing mind blowing or life changing.  Presentation wise the burger looked perfect.  It tasted excellent.  Price was expensive but you are paying for the name.  French fries were expensive unless it was all you can eat.  The Big Dawg was huge and very tasty.  Be prepared to wait some time before your food arrives.  It is not McD's.

This place was great. Truffle fries a crown burger and a beer. Meat was perfectly cooked and the buns felt and tasted like they were made just for our burgers. Some say it's hard to f up a burger.... but it happens all the time. Over cooked... stale bread... yuk.  But not here! Perfectly done! Cheers Gordon. We will return!

Best tasting burger. The meat is so delicious and flavorful. The bun. The truffle fries. The cheese. Omg I just love this place. Had the ultimate cheeseburger, truffle fries, and a sangria. Together on of the best meals I ever had.

Sorry for the long review, just thought I would explain everything that happened.  So I was flying from Iowa to Sacramento with an overnight stop in Las Vegas. Thought I would stop in at Gordon Ramsey Burger Restaurant and get a burger.  I got there around 5:00 pm on a Monday and there was no one in line. That was good for 1 star.  Sat down at the counter instead of waiting for a table.  GORDON, GORDON, GORDON!!!  What happened after that was a testament for not eating at the bar.  Ordered a drink, Captain Morgan and Pepsi (they don't have coke, mistake #1), was a little watered down or else Pepsi makes it taste funny.  Ordered the Forest Burger cooked medium and some fries.  Waited about 30 minutes before the burger arrived which is normal for this restaurant.  Ordered another drink just before my food came, Captain Morgan and Pepsi, that is even hard to say. No improvement in the drink, actually was more watered down than the first (mistake #2).  First bite, no pink, no flavor, no rush of "Whoa, that tastes so good".  Took a few more bites, no pink whatsoever in that overcooked burger (mistake #3).  The duck bacon was overcooked, but at least the bacon had some flavor along with the mushrooms and cheese.  I slow ate the burger waiting for someone to come over and ask me how the food was.  No one ever asked me how the food tasted or was it cooked right.  There were three of us customers sitting next to each other.  We all got to talking and we all had the same problem, overcooked food and no one asked us about the food.  Back to my situation, the bartender offered me another drink, I declined and said "I'm good".   About another 5 minutes later, the bartender finally noticed, which was about 25 minutes after I started eating and said, "I see you are slowing down there buddy".  Finally, I get to let them know about the food, which should have happened 3-4 minutes after I received the burger.  I let him know that the burger was overcooked, I still had only eaten about 2/3 of the burger, so it was there to be seen.  He asked, "Was it cooked medium well".  I raised my eyebrows and then he said, "Oh, Well done, eh".  He then let me know that he would get the manager.  The manager came over asked what the problem was and I proceeded to tell him the burger is way over cooked and had no flavor.  He said I should have let the server know that it was not cooked to my liking. I let him know that the server/bartender never came over and asked me about my food.  I told him, anyone, and I mean anyone, can cook a burger correctly the second time.  I let him know that I was not the only one here at the counter having this problem.  He apologized politely and left (mistake #4).  The bartender came back over to me and asked why I had not told him about the burger.  I let him know that I was waiting for him to ask me about the food and he argued with me that he had asked me earlier. Big Mistake #5!!!!     So my lesson that I learned here was that bartenders are bartenders and not food servers. Don't eat at the bar.  Don't eat here on Mondays, as the part time chef works on Mondays, plus the chef needs to learn the difference between, rare, medium and well done.  Gordon Ramsey Burger Restaurant gets many 4 & 5 star reviews but not from me. FIVE MISTAKES for one customer, let's see.  How many stars is that worth!  I gave it one star because I got seated right away.  After that, all downhill as they say.  Oh wait.  The bill for the burger, fries and 2 drinks was $51.96.  They gave me a nickel back, so they gave me a penny tip back!!!  I left the nickel....will I be back or eat at a Gordon Ramsey establishment again...time will tell, but not anytime soon. Thanks for listening!!!

This was a pretty good hamburger! We came here not knowing what to expect and were pleasantly surprised.  We both had the Hells' kitchen burger cooked medium with fries.  The meat is seasoned well and the roasted jalapeño adds so much flavor!  Service was great for as busy as this place was (we had about a 15 minute wait at 2 in the afternoon).  Come early if you are too hungry to wait!  Our only issue was that the fries were not very good.  When a restaurant can execute a burger so well, it always makes me wonder how they can mess up french fries?? They were not crispy from the moment they hit the table.  We did enjoy the two varieties of ketchup that they were served with.  We would definitely return in the future.

Pros: -Farmhouse burger was cooked a perfect medium as ordered. Tasted so great. -Others in my party ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and they loved it. -Great service with a very knowledgeable staff.  -Fries and added sauces were great. -For Vegas, I think it was priced right.  Cons: -None   PS: Also saw Gordon Ramsey. He came in, waved at diners and seemed like a good dude.  Noted- Gordon Ramsay's surprise visit did not influence or mold my excellent review.

I think the name of Gordon Ramsay is the big draw. We ordered two burgers and neither was what I expected from a big name chef. The wait is also very long and the fries were disappointing. I wouldn't recommend this place. Just not worth the wait.

We were so excited to come back here after a year but everything was a big disappointment. The hostess was super unfriendly, the waiter didn't have enough information about the menu and finally those burgers didn't,t have a good quality like before. I,m sorry but we are not going there anymore.

I've been dying to go to this place for a long time but always happen to miss it when I come to Vegas. I found time this visit and I'm glad I got to go. There was a line of people waiting, but my mom went straight to the front and checked in and they have that text service where they'll just text you when your table is ready so you can walk around instead of waiting in line. So make sure you check in instead of just standing mindlessly in line!  We got a text no more than 5 minutes later that our table was ready. We walked back to the front desk and they made us wait like 15 minutes for a table to be cleaned, and they they got frustrated with my mom for standing at the desk instead of further away which was not cool. I didn't witness it but my mom said the front desk girls were super rude and gave her attitude.  After we got seated the manager came over and apologized for everything that had happened which was nice.  So my family all ordered the "Hell's Kitchen" burger which was AMAZING. I got the "F Word" burger which is actually not on the menu! They only sell 50 a day and it's pricier than the rest of the burgers at $22 instead of $15. It was good, but if I came back I would def get the "Hell's Kitchen" burger.  I'm not a fan of sweet potatoes but my boyfriend got those fries and he loved them. I got the truffle fries which were delish as well. The fries are like $12 so they're big enough to share between 2 people.  Overall great food and atmosphere.

The food is good, yet pricey-but it's in Vegas... Everyone has covered the food angle in their reviews so I am going to skip to the service. It was top notch. We came fairly late after just landing and the wait wasn't terribly long. Our server was on top of everything. A glass was never empty or even close to empty. If you enjoy good service, even at a faster pace, this is the place for you!

Delicious burger! Our waiter Alex was great! I had the Blue burger and it was cook to perfection on a tasty bun. Onion rings and fries are separate but 1 tower is perfect to share. My pick,  onion rings but fries were tasty.  Definitely worth the walk over to relax with a beer and burger!

Very delicious.  Great service no wait to order. Had to wait about 15 mins for food to be made but duh it's made to order right there gourmet.  Boyfriend said best onion rings he ever had but his burger was a little too cheesy ( ultimate cheese burger) Mine (blue cheese) was very good. So much flavor.  Drinks were a little pricey but super cute and delicious and strong.  Always a server always by to help  We left full and happy
Absolutely worth the wait! Excellent service and friendly!  Had superfruit antioxidant drink and WOW! Burgers are amazing and huge! Definitely add  onion rings to your meal... Love love this place!
Great burgers! Love the beer batter onion rings and yummy fries with truffle drizzle ! Great service
$70 a bit pricey for pub food but it was really good! Enjoyed it! We got the Oreo milkshake, hog burger (great) and basic wings. The fries were also very good!

Ramsay restaurant is worthy of being in kitchen nightmare. to start the staff on Monday night 4/17/17 seemed to hate their job. me and gf order. she orders the ahi sliders  ( she didn't want a regular burger. ) I order the hells kitchen burger. and we share fries.  the water is nasty..  the ahi sliders arrive about 10 minutes before my Burger. I get it's an appetizers but, the server could have realized that was my gf main course. when the burger comes they bring another plate of ahi sliders. I think "oh cool they realized what they did and are giving us another order of sliders" the server realized they already brought them and decided to take them back. I asked if she could just leave them with us since they are already made. she said no. I guess they are selling to let them sit until someone else orders them. 1 stars since the actual burger I got was great.   now the worst of all things. the 8 dollar fries " just fries" they were the most stale fries I've ever paid for. they were cold and hard to bite. I'm not picky at all when it comes to fries and was hungry. but, I just couldn't eat them..i tried..  no one ever asked how was everything so I didn't complain.

Are you in Vegas?  Do you like burgers?  GO HERE.  RUN.  There was always a line when we went... if you have more than two people you need to check in wtih the front desk. We waited about 25 minutes for a table for three.  Our service was great, he answered every question we had and was super knowledgable about the menu.  The food took a while, but that was a little expected since the place was packed.    The burger I had was the best burger I have ever had in my entire life.  My friend also thought the same of her burger.  This was my first Gordon Ramsay experience, and now I want to do all the others just to see if the food is this good everywhere.

This place is so good. There is a nice variety of burgers. The meat tastes very good. Be sure to ask the server if they are serving the anniversary burger that was great.   Make sure to read the menu and understand everything that comes with the burger. There are all kinds of cheese and spices or sauces so you have to make sure you know what you're getting.   The staff takes care of the huge line and all the people very quickly and efficiently you'll have to wait but it's definitely worth it.

We had a midnight dinner here on our last night in Vegas and we're glad that we did. We were considering eating here since the first day of our trip. But every time, we turned back because of the long wait time. This place does not take reservations so there's usually a queue of people waiting to be seated. And on holidays, it can be a while before you can get in. So, we decided to check it out one last time during the trip, and thankfully, there was no queue at the time.   We ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries, the vegetarian Portobella Burger and the Hell's Kitchen Burger (replaced with a Chicken patty). The fries were good. The mushroom in the Portobella was a tad bit overpowering for me towards the end. But nevertheless, it was delicious. My husband had the Hell's Kitchen Burger. He prefers white meat to red. So, they offered to replace the patty with a Chicken patty. The Hell's Kitchen is a spicy burger. It could be a bit too hot for someone who does not eat a lot of spice. But since my husband does, he loved it.  The atmosphere is great and so is the service. We will definitely go back the next time we're in Vegas.

WHAT?  They changed the menu this past month and took away the jalapeño poppers??? They figured out that their is an "E" in Burger so changed the name to Burger instead of Burgr.  They revamped their menu but some of the classics are still there like the farmhouse burger (my favorite) The sweet potato fries are still great and unchanged.  But come on, you can get a good burger anywhere on the strip.  The Jalapeño poppers truly was my big draw to this place.
Well well for the first time in years I had a good f.....ing burger well flavor and cook perfect well season the fries touch my heart too I would recommend anyone if they in Vegas to try this place

My boyfriend I went here as one of our first pit stops in Vegas the night we arrived.  We were so excited to get a Gordon Ramsey Burger and have some drinks.  First, the Manhatten that my boyfriend ordered wasn't drinkable there was so much Vermouth in it.  We sent it back and decided to go with beer....mistake too! He ordered a Brooklyn Lauger on tap and it was flat, no suds and the glass smelled.  The beer was skunk and tasted like those beers you got back in the day of HS.  Then, the burger came- was JUST ok and the onion rings were gross! To top this all off- not one drink was comp'd And bill was expensive.  Huge disappointment from a restauranteurs establishment that prides himself on quality!  I make better manhattans and burgers at home!  Bartender had no idea how to make any cocktails!  Manhatten was in a highball glass....

I came here with my husband for dinner. Totally underwhelmed with the food. The only thing that was really tasty were the fries. The service was excellent. Our waitress was there for us!  If Gordon actually tasted his food there, he would be cursing.

Decor and layout of restaurant was average. Well lit and plenty of pictures of Gordon in case you forgot where you were. Ordered the Farm Burger ($17) which included bacon, over easy egg, cheese. Overall, good service good atmosphere, good name and that's what you're paying for.

Poutine was great but s but salty and scant with the cheese.  We enjoyed three different burgers and all were fantastic.  Our server Alex was lovely, very informed, honest and exhibited a level of service that far exceeded expectation.

All I have to say, is that this place was not only cool especially with the fire display in the front of the restaurant but omg! The Hell's Kitchen burger was one of the best burgers Ive ever had! The meat was so tender and juicy, overall the burger just melted in your mouth. I couldn't stop eating it, and I normally don't finish a big meal.. but this burger...I made it a mission to eat it.. I made it a goal! And boy, I was sad once I was officially done with it because I knew it will be forever until I get this burger again.:(  It felt like I woke up from a great dream. If you are unsure on what to get from the menu.. GET THE HELLS KITCHEN BURGER!

Hit and miss on food.  Can be really great, but can be really disappointing as food will end up flavorless.  Seems to be a cycle. Get one good run at it and then the next one is absolutely tasteless. The hostesses are always condescending and have an attitude.  The servers are generally pretty attentive.

Oh my gosh! Food was so incredible. Had the brisket nachos and ale cheese soup as well as blue cheese burger.   I want to try everything on the menu!! The waitress wasn't too friendly, but I didn't care. Food was worth it and just the beauty of the restaurant. We went mid afternoon on a week day and no wait!  Go!!
Delicious burgers at a reasonable price. I've never had such a delicious bun like this!

Visited for lunch. Nice atmosphere, didn't have to wait. Ordered the chips with curry sauce to start. Chips were very crispy but great with the sauce, we really enjoyed them. We also ordered the bangers and mash and a burger with cheese, bacon and egg. We both enjoyed our meals and I would recommend this restaurant to others.

Great burgers, fries, and shakes.  Employees were incredibly friendly and attentive. Our server was excellent, he did a great job explaining everything to us and we never had to ask for anything. Our water cups were always full. He had a great personality. Their burgers are made with quality ingredients and you can taste the difference. The bun held everything together and was fresh. The meat patty was juicy and seasoned well. Their fries are also cooked to perfection. Our shakes were amazing and was a meal in itself. I highly recommend getting one and sharing it. The shake, burger, and fries was a lot. You can also share the fries too, their portions are generous. The ambiance is relaxed.   Good stuff!

Order all the burgers and split them between the table.  Crazy? Stupid? Both, maybe?  We ordered the Hog, Hell's Kitchen, special F-Word and the Lobster/Shrimp. Split the burgers four ways between our party of four so we could all try each one.   None of them really stood out...we decided we all liked the hog burger the most, but we could skip this place next time we are in town.  Surprisingly, we ALL really enjoyed the poutine.  It wasn't authentic poutine, but the flavors were awesome.  That mushroom gravy...delish!!

Chef Gordon Ramsey has never disappointed me. The best meal from start to finish I've ever had was at his signature steak house at the Paris resort and casino. Now I can honestly say that the best burger I've ever had in my life was here.  My picture will not do it justice, but the Farm Burger is simply awesome and definitely with every penny. While the cool fire display might bring people in, the food will keep them there.   As a burger lover, this place is a must for me every time I'm in Las Vegas now.

Went there for lunch and ordered to go. The food came out fast! Was still hot when i received it!! It tasted amazing and the customer service was just as good!!!! Definitely recommend the truffle fries. Although they don't have bbq sauce (which i love on my burger) i didn't need it . I didn't even put any condiments because the pickles added soo much flavor .
Everything was delious amd we can't wait to be here for good. Hopefully one day we will gey to meet Mr. CHEF RAMSEY hi.self soon.

We waited about 30 minutes for a table and it was worth every minute.   I ordered the Hells' Kitchen Burger ($15.00) and my husband decided on the U.K. Burger. ($15.00) Both of these burgers hit it out of the park. They were amazing!! Cooked to perfection!! The Hells' Kitchen was prepared with asadero cheese, roasted jalapeños,fresh avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeño pesto aioli. The U.K. had dublinar cheese, major grey's chutney and arugula.    We also tried an order of sweet potato fries. ($9.00) They were fresh and hot.

If you're foodie or just wish to enjoy a simple yet sophisticated burger, this is your place.  We were fortunate to be served by a waitress that worked with their restaurant from the opening. She was very informative and attentive.   Although our party of 8 weren't fortunate enough to see Mr. Gordon , we were still very content....it was all about the food.   Burgers  are simply flavorful!!  Try their truffle fries and Hell's Kitchen burger.  I'll also add, There are very few places that you notice how comfortable your seats are....this place has very comfortable seats.   Highly recommend if you're in Las Vegas.

Good burgers for the hype, pretty popping for midnight so always gonna be good vibes here! Their anniversary burger that's not on the menu is so so compared to their pork burger for those looking for pure taste.

Nice check in process for parties of 3 or more. Give em your number and they text an update.  The service was excellent, very personable and prompt.  The food was hardcore meh status. I ordered a chicken burger, it was dry and kinda lame. The rest of my party ordered other various burgers and quite enjoyed them! So avoid the chicken burger and you'll be fine.  Kinda pricey, but nice vibes. Worth a visit.

Wow wow wow. What can I say about this place. I'm a big burger fan and this was a very good burger. It's not your regular burger joint like a shake shack or a five guys but it is a higher quality place. The staff are very knowledgable and honest. I would recommend a visit to here for a one off meal. It is a bit pricier than other places but you pay for quality and quality is what you get.

Worst food poisoning I have ever experienced. I ate the farm burger, which was a major disappointment; I can do better at home. I ended up in the hospital because the vomiting wouldn't stop. (10/23/17) That was the only thing I ate that whole day. (No, I do not drink alcohol.) After being down for a couple days, I came back to my convention for work and found out a fellow member was sickened by Gordon Ramsay Steak the day after me becoming sick. Never will I ever eat there again!

This is probably the best tasting burger, but considered  the time to prepare the food and the price I give it 3 stars. The service was excellent, waitress are very polite and friendly, one of them even show us her son video. From the time we sit down and ordered our food, took about 36 minutes, 2 Hells Kitchen burger, fries, and a soup. Drink are coming right away though, water and couple of glass of angry orchard. Total bill is $71. By the time the food came out we kinda tired and lost our appetite a little.

Food was delicious and service was excellent. It can be pricey depending on what you order and it does take time to get food but it is 1000% worth it.  Will definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas

Ok sucks I have to say this but it sucked! The waiter Sergio ruined my wife's surprise 46th birthday! He was horrible! No respect no courtesy, no professionalism! When the food was served we moved and added three chairs to accommodate my cousins who where un expectedly in Vegas and the waitstaff literally threw a fit over us adding and moving chairs.  Like it was our fault!  The manager on site was informed of his employees service by my best friend of 20 years and the manager said he would handle it! My wife watched as they talked and laughed at us! I respect Gordon's reputation to service and his food but this staff ruined it for us! The manager comped our three orders of fries they forgot to serve with our food, and our server, frustrated, immediately brought out our fries and with no remorse said the chef apologizes! Not the server! Then we were ignored and arrogantly ignored! As a higher level government employee and 20 year navy veteran I have never been disrespected so horribly! The manager is a joke and a failure to Gordon's impeccable reputation! I will shit on this mans grave for the horrible way he handled the whole issue! A simple table side apology and maybe a desert for the kids would have sufficed! Get your act together and represent Hell's Kitchen as your chef so deserves! What a disgrace to me, a veteran, my friend, who thought this was a once in a life time experience, my wife who's 46th birthday is ruined, and my kids who had to watch this bullshit! Two stars only because the food was good and Gordon is my wife's favorite chef! The management is shit and the server needs to learn respect to his clientele.
Great atmosphere!  I had the original burger and it was fantastic. Service was a little slow. Waitress said they were short 5 cooks and it took 45 minutes to get our food.

I had a mix of emotions at the beginning. I was very excited to try this place, but was very disappointed that was another open wall restaurant into the casino/hotel. For luxury restaurants, I usually expect a private restaurant experience and I feel like the open places feel too much like mall food and not enough like a luxury restaurant. But the location was great, easy to find and right on the strip.  The atmosphere on the inside was very appropriate for what it was. Thematically he was going for the American/British burger joint and it was set up that way. Large TVs with sports (which don't anything for me, but I thought was smart) and the blue and red color theme. Merchandise and photos of Ramsey made it seem more like a destination dining location and less like a luxury restaurant.  The menu was perfect. Small, to the point, and cute. It had burgers, but also offered vegetarian option for burgers which is highly appreciated, modern and makes the burger menu feel complete.  The service was good. We were seated fairly quickly, food didn't take too long to arrive, we were checked in on and my water stayed full. Nothing complain about! The food itself was played beautifully. My chicken was a bit dry. But I will say that I was very much pleased with the flavor design. The idea of the creme brule milkshake is a brilliant twist on the classic beverages! And it was delicious. My chicken sandwich made me feel like a journey to the Mediterranean and it was almost a gyro burger, but without the tsatziki sauce.  The onion rings also were great and the dipping sauces were good too.

Excellent service and food, well worth the 45 minute wait we had. We ordered truffle fries, hot wings and a burger that had foie gras on it, not sure what hat the name was, and it was all delicious.  Probably the best truffle fries we have ever had and the quality of the burger was top notch. I would definitely recommend this place and will be back next time we are in town.

The first time I went here was 2013 and I fell in love with this place. Food is superb and every time I come out to vegas I make sure I eat here. Suggestions: come by the time they open so you don't have to wait so before the peak of lunch time and before the peak of dinner. Just keep in mind there will always be a wait. It's a very popular restaurant. The smaller the party the better, but if you have a large group expect that you will wait a long time.
Went on a Wed night and was seated in 25 min. Had the farmhouse burger and onion rings. Both of them were great! It's a little pricey but your getting an amazing burger!

The food is excellent, but the service is very slow. It took one hour to get a table, then another hour to get our burger!!  Why Gordon is not applying his own rules is his own business!!   Very disappointed!

This is a hard one. Am I grading it for the food or for the experience? Eating at any Gordon Ramsay restaurants is always an experience..the decor, ambience, and crowd make everything so much more exciting. Of course, the service is amazing, even for a place that serves burgers. The burgers are reasonably priced, but the fries and onion rings are a bit expensive. I ordered the truffle fries as well as the Farmhouse burger while my wife ordered the blue cheese burger. They were both good, but is it much better than Inn and Out, Ílands, or Red Robin? I'm not so sure. At least I couldn't tell a big difference. I think Red Robin's onion rings are much better. Overall, it's still a great restaurant if you just want to eat burgers, munch on some bar foods and chill out with some friends without going out to a fancy restaurant. For #Thinsulin fans, you can eat the burgers without the buns but you'll probably want to order two if you want to be full.

Waaayyyyy overpriced! Burger was meh, truffle fries were not real truffle, just over cooked potatoes with nothing special. 2 burgers, 2 beers, 1 fry, 1 salad =$91.  Pro tip - go to a real burger place not a crappy hotel restaurant fancied up with that jerkface dude's name on it....people should be able to yell and fuss at him by this sub par nonsense.  Highly disappointed.   Ask a real local about better burger spots cheaper.
We found hair in the sauce for the fries.....forgot to take a pic since they already took it away
Service was fine, burgers absolutely flawless and especially the "F-Word" and the "Hells Kitchen" were remarkable
Delicious! Great service. Highly recommend getting the Truffle Parmesan fries. Right near the slot machines so you get to people watch :)
The best burger I've ever had. The onion rings and truffle French fries are to die for. And the staff was super friendly.

As a grown ass woman who just witnessed the glory of the Backstreet Boys Vegas comeback, it was only fitting for dinner's first course meal to be the immaculate creme brûlée Oreo milkshake at Gordon Ramsay Burger. No, sir waiter, you did not hear me incorrectly - I am requesting my non-alcoholic dessert drink to arrive, flying on a beautiful unicorn, well before my humongous burger and onion rings. Sil vous plait.   Yah. That milkshake was fan-frickin-tastic. The creme brûlée is a delicious layer resting on a creamy Oreo milkshake.   Tried the farmhouse burger - the meat was cooked to perfection, and the fried egg on top just makes everything ten times better. Sides are ordered separately at this joint, so the table ordered the Parmesan onion rings, truffle fries, and sweet potato fries. Onion rings - crispy and delicious. I was told the sweet potato fries were amazing thanks to the powdered sugar shaker they serve with it. I was told the truffle fries were meh. Everyone seemed to like the burgers they ordered.   The vibe is hip and the service was great. I hear the average wait time is 30-45 minutes, but they do text you when the table is ready so you could roam the casino in the mean time. We got there around 11 after the concert and had no wait. Definitely check this place out!!

Staff were SUPER friendly. The GM was especially nice to chat with as I sat at the bar area by kitchen. Burger was good, but it was not mind blowing or worth the long wait in the line and for it to arrive. Disappointed with the fries..... a burger paired with bad fries totally brought down my review. On a brighter note, their new cocktail (cannot remember name but it was pink) was on point! Not too sweet and strong!

We moved from a table to the bar after the service was taking a little long. A big burly bartender made amazing drinks. We got the Scottish egg, mini burgers and the chip nachos. All were pretty yummy

The hype is real folks, this place is awesome!!! Came here for dinner to fulfill my longtime desire to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Add burgers to the mix and bam, paradise!  First off, the wait is a little disheartening. For a group of two, you wait in a line next to the hostess' booth until a table opens up. There were about 20 people and the wait was about 45 minutes long when I was there, but continued to grow and grow as the night went on. It sucks, but it's Vegas. Just suck it up!  After we were seated, I ordered the blue (yeah, not bleu) cheeseburger and a side of parmesan truffle fries. After about a 20 minute wait, it came out and it was phenomenal. The burger wasn't the absolute best I've ever had, but it was damn good!!! Definitely a top contender. It was very well put together, it wasn't sloppy, it was perfectly cooked, and a great great burger. Perfectly moist. So good. Next, the fries. Holy cow, the fries were freakin' amazing. The fries were the best I've ever eaten. Simply perfection!  Very good restaurant. A few cons, but the pros greatly outweigh them. I would come back over and over again!
This place is SUPER OVER RATED.. Burgers were dry.. food was basic.. and the wait was even worse... only reason I am giving it 1 star is because of the good service we got from our waitress..

I'd give this a 4 because a lot of the appetizers were spectacular, but the emphasis of this restaurant is the "Burger" and I wasn't too thrilled with what I had.  Sadly I wasn't able to take a photo of it but I had the Farmhouse burger. Now it didn't taste horrendous (I've had far worse), but this just didn't live up to its expectations. The bun didn't cut it for me. It tasted like it came straight out from a plastic container and they decided to brush some melted butter on it to mask the flavor.  The meat was also really dry. I didn't feel like I got my moneys worth. It was good that I experienced it, but so far all of Ramsays restaurants for me have been a hit or a miss and most of the time his appetizers are always killin it but when it comes down to the main course, it's nothing great.  To end on a brighter note, the nachos were excellent and the service was awesome!

Let me start by saying I really love my burgers and walked in with the expectation that this could be an overrated celebrity restaurant with a huge line up for a disappointment and yes the line up is quite long !!! My first reaction when I saw the menue was that it was actually reasonably priced and there was a lot of original burgers with high end ingredients!  I decided to go for the forest burger as I like my classic bacon cheeseburger but this one had tremor cheese, forest mushrooms and duck bacon !  When it came out the burger looked gorgeous and the onion rings were huuuuge haven't ever seen them that size and thankfully we were sharing them!  So the burger itself did feel like it was mass produced but one of the best tasting one I have ever eaten and as for the onion rings very crispy but more then 3 would probably blow up my stomach so definitely a good dish to share. I really have to say that for lunch it's the perfect experience in Vegas! Casual, good value and fun !

I am such a Gordon Ramsey fan so when I was in Vegas I had to stop here. There was a line with a wait of 30hr around 3pm Tuesday but we opted to sit at the bar which was available immediately.   We ordered the "forest burger" it had duck bacon my boyfriend loved it, it was an acquired taste. I ate the ' kettle chip nachos" it was sooooooooo good. Def the short rib. I could hve just ate that. Ughhh I was mad because we we never preferred the Parmesan fries which surrounded the room. Def would hve to come back to this place just for the truffle parmasean fries.   Finally tasting his food makes me love him even more. Muah to chef Ramsey.

Delicious! The lines can get long, but if you put your name down, they'll text you when your table is almost ready :) I came on a Sunday night around 7:30pm and had to wait for about 45 minutes for a party of 3.   I got the:  -Farmhouse burger  -Hells kitchen burger  -Hells kitchen chicken wings    The farmhouse burger was soooo yummy. It wasn't as dynamic as the Hell's Kitchen burger, but it was simple yet delicious. There was an egg in it, which went perfectly with the bacon and meat. The egg was made perfectly... the runny yolk actually squirted out when I tried to cut the burger.   The Hell's Kitchen burger had spicy jalapeño aoli and really just so much going on. It was delicious!!   I actually didn't like the chicken wings that much. It was pretty juicy, but I'm not a huge fan of tangy flavors so it wasn't my favorite.   The restaurant's front has a huge fire lining the wall and a 'Gordon Ramsay Burgr' sign- super cool! Gordon Ramsay's picture was everywhere hahahah  who is that again?? Some decent chef, right?! ;)

A really long wait about 45-1hr. But worth it!! Burger was so delicious added truffle Fries too. It was cooked to perfection. Best burger I have ever tried coming from an enthusiast. Highly recommended :)

I am writing this review because I am seeing negative reviews with regards to their gluten free menu. They DO have gluten free options; however like any burger restaurant the burger will be on a lettuce bun. I ate the Forest burger on a lettuce bun cooked medium well. The burger was cooked perfectly. I had never tried duck bacon before and I loved it. They also have gluten free fries. The menu is very clear about what is gluten free and what is not. I did not have a reaction and I am not gluten free by choice.   If I didn't have to eat gluten free I still would have ordered the forest burger on a glorious gluten filled bun. Either way the burger was delicious. The service is slow but it's Vegas and the restaurant was full. The line does move quickly. I recommend the restaurant.
Bar none the best server in Vegas, Alex. Not only did he make me an off the menu iced coffee, he made me three! Nice atmosphere, but Mr Ramsey, I need more cheese on that burgr!

I wish we had this place in Los Angeles! We had the Hell's Kitchen burger and Blue cheese burger, both of us agreed that these were the best burgers we have ever had.  The Hell's kitchen burger jalapeno was perfectly seeded to give it some heat without it being overwhelming. The avocado was fresh and gave a great texture. Overall delicious.The blue cheese burger has a fig jam, this combination makes the burger. Blue cheese is a very salty cheese, delicious but salty; the sweet from the jam mixed with the salt of the blue cheese was heaven. I typically like thin burger patties as the heavy meat flavor can throw off the flavor balance, this was not the case, they are a thicker patty but the flavors are spot on and they were cooked perfectly. The one thing we didn't like is the truffle fries. The flavor was ok (super salty) but even the uncovered ones were lackluster; tasted frozen, not sure if they were. I came for the burger not the fries so I understand why there is a line out the door to this place. Next time I go to Vegas I will be coming back to this restaurant.

First off, the place was hard to find.. there are no signs and Yelp location is not accurate. The restaurant looked good but my first impression of the environment was not so good as the bad cigarettes smell of the casino was also in the restaurant. Then there was a slight wait and the hostess were wasting too much time chatting than helping customer. Once we sat down the service was friendly, but a bit too slow.. as it took at least 30 minutes to get our food after we ordered it; on top of that, they got my wife's order wrong. The only reason I gave a 2 star was because the servicer was friendly. Overall, the experience was a disappointment and my wife and I definitely will not be visiting the restaurant again. So sad because I had high expectations from a place that had Gordon Ramsey's name on it and I am a big fan of his shows.

I thought it was strange when the listing for Gordon Ramsay BurGR was marked as "closed" on Yelp. Then I find out they remodeled. But.......what was even remodeled?! Everything practically looked the same. Except for a menu change.   Yes, burgers may be expensive at $15 an order and that's WITHOUT fries. Adding a side of fries will be an additional $9-11. Get the parmesan truffle fries....yum!!!!!!! The burgers are  delicious and full of flavor. It's a perfect size, enough to make you feel full but it doesn't make you feel like a bloated person waddling outta there. You can request how well you want your burgers cooked and they're pretty on point with that. The Hell's Kitchen burger is all that I order. It's spicy with jalapeños, cheese and avocados. Typing this is making me salivate.     Keep in mind, DO NOT come here when you're starving/hangry. Not only will you have to wait for a table since it seems like there's always a wait here. My party of 4 and I were here for dinner on a normal Thursday evening and we still have to wait about 20 minutes. So after our waitress took our orders, she informed us that the burgers will take 30 minutes to make. WHATTTTT.....30 MINUTES!?!?! Urmm....okay, that caught me off guard. Wow...patience is a virtue here at Gordon Ramsay. I mean, she gave us the option of having the fries out first so we can munch on those but we didn't wanna spoil our dinner and get full off fries. But....different strokes for different folks? *shurgs*  All in all, this burger joint is definitely a must. Much better than Shake Shack in NY NY or this burger place at Fashion Show Mall. Come here instead. I will forever be returning here for my gourmet burger fix.

After seeing crazy long lines at Gordon Ramsay Burger year after year, we knew we had to see what the hype was all about.  During my family's most recent trip to Vegas we finally got try their much anticipated burgers.  Overall, the dinner had some hits and misses. Despite the hustle and bustle, all the servers were all friendly, welcoming, and attentive.  We ordered many of the burgers recommended by the staff (i.e., Hell's Kitchen and Forest) as well as some others we thought just sounded delicious (i.e. Ultimate, Hog, Portobello). My favorites were the Ultimate and Portobella.  Both were bursting with flavor and cook to perfection. I would definitely order these two again. The other burgers left me unsatisfied.  The Forest was overall very bland. The duck bacon was flavorless and chewy and meat was unfortunately overcooked (based on how I wanted the burger cooked).  The Hog just had too much going on so it was difficult to appreciate all the ingredients.  Although the burger was definitely huge and filling! Hell's Kitchen tasted good but was under seasoned.  For sides we ordered the fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings. The onion rings were AMAZING. They were seasoned well and had a perfect crispy batter.  Both fries were pretty average.  They were not very crisp or seasoned.I was not a fan of the homemade sauces. I was in need for good ol fashion Heinz Ketchup. Overall, I had a good experience but I was just hoping for more consistency throughout their menu.

While visiting Vegas, we were in the mood for a burger and decided to give this place a try. We've passed by it before and the line always deterred us from going. We had some time to spare so we decided to try. We did wait in line for about a half hour before being seated. They had a opening at the chef's table so we took that spot. We both tried the ultimate cheeseburger which was very tasty. With the burger, we ordered fries and onion rings. Both of which were fantastic. It did take about 30 minutes for the burgers to arrive which the waiter did advise us. I suggest ordering the onion rings or an appetizer before the burgers come out like we did.   If you have some time to spare to wait in line, I highly recommend trying Gordon Ramsay Burger.

Chegamos em três as 17:00 hs para comer. Restaurante 70% vazio. Antes de nos levar a mesa mostraram o menu e pediram para confirmarmos se realmente queríamos comer. Após confirmarmos disseram que tínhamos que sentar no bar. Não conseguimos comer. A estrela é pela recepção e atendimento. Quanto a comida nao consegui provar.

Medium rare burgers came out well done. Brown in center and no juices. Tasted dry. Manager comped meal though as we had no time to wait for a remake. House made ketchup wasn't that great, watery. Where's the Heinz?
The Blue cheese burger was delicious. Lots of flavour. I thought the parm truffle fries could have had more truffle flavour. Service was fast and friendly.

Highly disappointed in the change in the menu. Less selection than what there was 4 years ago. Sat at the bar since I was by myself. The bar tender (Robert) was less than attentive and doesn't remember an order. Doesn't know the menu either, when asked what is in one of the menu items, he couldn't recall. As a professional bartender one of the BIGGEST skills needed is the ability to mingle with the clientele, to start and carry on conversations to help pass the time and also entertain a little. For some reason the ART of suggestive selling to help guide the guest through an experience has been lost.  I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger Medium Rare (The only way to order a burger)at 17:45(according to the time on the ticket) delivered at 18:19 (time on my phone when it arrived)wow what a long time. It was cooked to Medium Rare+ (just on the outside cusp of Medium Rare edging towards Medium). The flavor profile was somewhat bland with the exception of the mild heat from the roasted jalapeño and roasted tomato. The beef had absolutely no flavor. The fries were warm (not hot) and quickly cooled to a spongy soft potato. The flavor of salt and herb quickly disbursed. No follow up to insure the meal was prepared to satisfaction nor was a follow performed for either of the two guest sitting next to me.  The 2 guest sitting next to me were also displeased with their experience as we entered into a conversation about their experience after I spoke up and mentioned an incident to a bartender (explained below). I informed a bartender that the guest to my left burger was over cooked and the bartender seemed dumbfounded and when I explained what a medium temperature should look like the bartenders response was "I don't know, I'm just a bartender". Wow - that really sealed it for me. My experience was ruined.. A moment later the guest was asked if they wanted to have the manager come by.(WOW really!! There should be NO question there a manager should have been informed immediately without asking anyone)  To add insult to injury, when a different bartender uses a bar towel to wipe his head and then leave the towel for future use on the bar that kind of turns my stomach. When I confronted that bartender his reply was (I wasn't using it) then I explained that he had JUST wiped down the back bar top with that very same towel  he just turned, shook his head in disapproval and said OK and took the towel and put it away.   Overall, this experience was disappointing and only confirmed by the disappointment with 2 other guests dinning at the same time. It is obvious that Mr. Ramsey no longer is involved in this concept and the company that now owns the restaurant is milking the name for all they can. Overpriced drinks ($15 for a cocktail), poor quality of product and execution along with a poor service level brings this experience to a close.  I was SO looking for a great experience like the one I remembered from years past. Unfortunately that didn't happen. It causes concern for my next experience coming up Ramsey's Prime Steak House (I have reservations in a couple of days)..

It bums me out having to write this review because my expectations of this place were super high.   It was 10 min from the time that we got sat before our server came to introduce herself to us. She came over and asked if we were ready to order, my husband needed some more time, so she said she would come back. She could've easily taken our drink order but she never asked. When she came back, took our order, then at that time she asked us what we wanted to drink. It seemed odd due to the fact that everywhere we go, we get asked what we want to drink before anything else. Anywho, we never saw that server again, a younger gentleman came out with our appetizers and sat them down, it wasn't until shortly after that our drinks came out...   The food was okay. We ordered the Kettle Chip Nachos, it was a little disappointing with the small about of shredded short rib it had! I'm pretty sure I would've been able to count the shreds of beef on these chips. We ordered some fries for our 2 year old to eat and they were so hard and tasteless, she gave up after 2 bites and would shake her head no when we offered her some more. This little girl eats crayons and she refused to eat these fries.    Next up was our burgers. I ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger, it come with different kinds of cheese and just the meat. My son ordered the Backyard burger, just a basic burger and my husband ordered the Hog Burger. These were actually pretty good. They aren't served with any sides so we ended up ordering some beer battered onion rings, but just like the drinks... these didn't come out until later, way later.   Basically, service needs to improve. All food should come out at once except for the appetizer, don't bring out the side to my burger when I'm half way thru with it, at that point don't being me anything at all. We found out that the server never came back to our table because she got sent home, there was no introduction to the person that was going to be taking over her section. Really? And on top of this bad service, I'll still expected to tip 18 %  I don't think we'd come back, we have reservations for Hell's Kitchen in a couple of weeks, hoping that it will be a much better experience.

Credit fraud.  That's what happened when I dined at Gordon Ramsey burger in April 2018.  Our waiter overcharged a pre-paid Visa card, and kept some of the cash to himself.  A $90 dinner for three has turned into a $320 dinner.  It's been 7 days since I alerted management to this situation and have not had anything credited back.  Check your bill and do not pay with a card!
Wow!! Thats all i can say about the burgers!! Soooooo good!! Service was eh ok i guess but the food was amazing!!

Always wanted to try the burgers here, I mean cmon! It is Gordon Ramsay! The service was awesome, and food came out quick, unfortunately, the food did not wow'd me.  We had the following:  - Beer Battered Onion Rings - parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip - typical onion rings, nothing out of the ordinary or anything  - Mushroom Poutine - gravy, duck bacon, cheese curds, vinegar pickles - flavors were good, but a little too salty.  Since the mushroom was the medium for this dish, it did not mellow out the flavors well  - Truffle Parmesan Fries - your basic truffle parm fries  - Farmhouse Burger - dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg - I was highly disappointed in the burger, the bread was amazingly cold and dry.. the works inside were good though..  Maybe I went on an off day?  Hopefully I did, I do want to give it another shot.

Very good burger. Got the "Hell's Kitchen Burger" cooked well. You can actually taste the meat, not smothered in ketchup and mustard like most burgers.  Every bite is flavorful. Getting good food for the price! And really.. not that spendy. Had it inside planet Hollywood, was not disappointed! Highly recommend trying it out. Between Gordans, burger, steak, and fish + chips you can't go wrong. Skol vikes

5 stars to the burger! The burger was so delicious. Delicious meat. Delicious cheese. The "just fries" were $8 and nothing beyond less than ordinary. I could have made them better at home. The server was an a$$h*** and couldn't even deliver regular ketchup. Only chipotle ketchup that tasted terrible. This is American food. Get some regular ketchup. Server said I'm just not used to it. No salt and pepper within reach. The server was rude to his trainee in front of customers. He had a bully attitude. Server asked me how I want my burger done then tells the customer next to me that the burgers only come one way. Inconsistency. The fries were stale and chewy. The servers name is Robert at the bar. Attitude problem from *ell.  He automatically judged me for being in my 20s and told me if I don't have money walk up and down the strip and do nothing with my time. Very rude and unprofessional. I understand it's Vegas but coming from the perfectionist Gordon Ramsey cmon now. The server is what made the experience beyond terrible. I would've ignored the terrible fries had I had A+ service.

Appetizers and fries were very good (nachos, onion rings, sweet potato fries and truffle fries). Burger came out medium rare vs the medium I ordered. Not sure if that's common but my table of 8 had the same comments about their orders as well. I advise you to check with your server before ordering. Service was excellent which is why this wasn't a 3 or less. Would go back and try again, making sure that I get the burger cooked to my preference.
Had the Impossible burger for the first time!  It was amazing!   I wouldn't expect anything less from GR!  I love seeing a vegetarian and vegan option at his place!  Long wait but it was worth it!

This place is all hype! My wife had the $26 lobster and shrimp burger, I had a blue cheese burger, honestly I've had better burgers at super duper. I wouldn't waste my time going here again, we should have eaten at Pink's

Im a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, so I had to try this place. I had a plane to catch an hour later so I took it to go, I think the experience inside would've been better. They took about 45 minutes that day when promised around 30 minutes for a to go order (anxiety)! Regardless they were nice and didn't seem bothered when we kept checking in on them.   The burgers were about $15 a pop, which isn't too bad, I've seen worse! I got the hell's burger. Medium well, my friend got it well done and it was very dry! It was tasty! Had all the right things inside for my liking!   The truffle fries and sauce they used on them were amazing, get those with extra sauce!   This place was good, I would definitely go back and try out some other things the next time I'm in Vegas!

Gordon Ramsey really likes himself, his face and name is plastered on everything here, but he has a lot to be proud off. We came for dinner with a group of six, surprised to learn that large parties are given priority seating. Our waiter was very efficient and skillfully described the menu, including the special off the menu burger for the day. Everybody choose a different burger and everybody loved their selection. I shared with a friend and got to try the fish and chip burger as well as the farmhouse burger. Can't pick a favorite because both were on point and absolutely delicious. No one left anything on their plates.  We even ate all three orders of truffle fries and sweet potato fries.  I am glad I choose a very healthy (lol,not really) cocktail to wash it all down. This dinner felt like a splurge but was very reasonable. Burger prices ranged from $18-$25, which is very inexpensive for this quality and ambiance in Vegas. Thanks, Gordon.
Can't wait till my next trip to Vegas to eat the Hog burger  I wish Gordon had a location in LA that served the Hog burger  Service was great

The restaurant was clean, and the servers were pleasant enough, but just try to get a water refill. I dare you! A weird guy kept hovering, who wasn't our waiter, but rather than fill our drinks, he just gave the awkward look and kept moving. I made my husband stop him, finally because most of our glasses were empty.  I think Gordon forgot to heed his own advice because I ordered Hell's Kitchen burger, because I like spicy. Well, if it says "Hells Kitchen", it  really should be spicy. Nope. The bun to burger ratio is sad. We named the buns Sir Mix A Lot buns, because baby got back. Too big for the tiny patty. Speaking of patty, where was it?!?! I thought it would be handmade and/or big and juicy. No, no and no! Such a disappointment! One and done. I pulled the top of the bun off, for the picture or you wouldn't be able to see anything.

WoW went here Excited and was let down .. the service here was bad , everyone in red and grey shirts or blue and grey were more interested with socializing with eat each then getting the food out.. there was constant orders waiting while they stood around and talked . You can see the order up in the kitchen and they just constantly sat there it was so bad and I was really let down. If my name was on this place there would be a big overhaul.
If you like burgers, you might love this place. I thought it was overpriced and not worth the wait.

Didn't know what to expect.  It's Gordon Ramsay!  I will say that my burger, the Forest Burger was exceptional.  However, she ordered the Farmhouse Burger and she ordered it cooked medium but it came much closer to rare, the fried egg was supposed to be over medium and it was over hard.  But she says it was still an awesome burger.  The Mushroom Poutine appetizer was to die for!!  It was very busy and the service was about average.  Would I come here again?  Definitely!!

Really this should be five stars for the food and one star for the front staff. Had to come back a second day just to get in because the wait time was hour and a half at 10:30 at night! Not going to wait that long that late even for Ramsey food! We did get a txt in half an hour but had gone elsewhere. How could they be that far off?!? Anyway, second try same dumb staff out front who could barely understand simple questions! Geez! If Ramsey knew you know what he would say! Food worth all the bother. Totally memorable! I will never look at a burger again without thinking of the one I had. Cooked to perfection. Truffle fries were incredible. I will come back again. If you go, go before 5PM. We had practically no wait with a party of 3.

Bomb burger and a great time with my wife.  Our server was great and the food met our G.R. expectations.  Only thing we didn't enjoy was the jalepeno ketchup.  Did not taste like jalepeno at all.  It tasted oddly like carrots which was weird.  I would definitely return for another burger :)

We were eventually seated and our waitress came over and sat at our table with us to take our order. We received our hummus which was very good and then she came to sit with us again and take our order.  When my wife ordered Med Rare she asked if she's good with red? She said yes and then I ordered and I said would like M R also. They brought out the burgers and truffle fries which were good but underwhelming.  I then took a bite and realized my burger was not just well done but well well done. I asked my wife about hers and she showed me her well done burger. I was in shock since we watch every show that Gordon does and couldn't believe they couldn't get the cook right. Our waitress or I should say order taker took them back to the kitchen. We tried not to eat the fries but figured they would only get cold. The manager brought our burgers back, set them down and asked us to cut into them to make sure they were right. He didn't apologize or say anything about the error and it felt like we were being unreasonable to ask that it be cooked properly. Then he started small talk "what brought you here" etc and said he is the manager if we needed anything. The whole situation was very strange. The burgers were the best burgers we've ever had but would not go back there for all the other nonsense. Thought maybe they would comp a drink or something but should have figured.  We have been to Gordon Ramsay Steak and had the best food and service you can imagine.
Literally best burger ever! The onion rings are SO good. Would drive 4 hours just to go there. Definitely a must when in Las Vegas!!

Wow, rock solid burgers. Went with a party of 6 and all of us loved the food. The onion rings and fries were really good as well. It's Vegas so yes the place is busy but if you're craving a great burger this place has them.

OH boy can you say that this place is the BOMB! Since I have been to Gordon's Steak House I vowed on my next visit to Vegas that I would come to this place. First and foremost I want to thank the new GM Laurence from Gordon't Steak House for arranging a table for my family and I will forever be grateful for it was perfect.  Gordon Ramsay Burger is located in Planet Hollywood which is right next to Paris. This location is on a first come first serve bases. When we went to the counter to announce our arrival we were greeted with a very welcoming smile and they informed us that they were expecting us and they were preparing our table. As  we awaited the few minutes for them to finish preparing our table we had a chance to review the menu which was in Gordon's style; simple and elegant.   In the front of the restaurant there was a bar with several TV's for watching current sporting events for those who wanted to enjoy some appetizers with their drinks. As we were brought to our table we were seated in a lovely blue colored booth with the traditional Ramsay white table setting. My brother was amazed by the weight of the cutlery, which I love a nice balanced fork and knife. Our waiter Jared was just amazing, he answered some of questions about the various types of hamburger's that were offered on the menu. Jared also informed us that they had a special F Word burger that was not on the menu and of course you knew I was going to have exactly that. I also informed Jared of my allergies to shellfish and nuts, which he had made a special note so that the staff would be informed to use equipment that were not used with any products that could cause an allergic reaction.   Some the of things we ordered along with our main dishes was a delicious Cesar salad with green apple slices minus the kale, I am not a kale fan. We also ordered regular fries and the truffle fries with parmesan cheese. The funny thing is that the pictures makes these fries look small but they are actually fairly big and even with 3 of us we could not finish all the fries. The nice served with different sauces too and came out hot and crispy golden.  The ambiance of the restaurant is very relaxing and it has this wonderful wavy fire wall display. The temperature in the restaurant was perfect, yes I am one of those people that get cold easy lol so things like this are very important to me. Jared was very attentive and informed us that our special burgers will take about 20 minutes and I do appreciate that he served all our burgers along with the fries at the same time and they were all nice and hot. We were able to enjoy our dinner and Jared was very attentive by removing dishes that were not needed anymore and keeping our drinks constantly filled. If we were not so stuffed we would have ordered one of their delicious desserts but again the 3 of us shared a salad and fries and we all had our own individual burgers and we were stuffed.   I wish I could describe how delicious this burger was but I have to let the picture speak for itself.  I know that there is no doubt that I will come back here again and I would hope they still offered the F Word burger. If you have a list of things to do in Vegas then put this on your list for you will not be disappointed. Everything is well thought out and you may think 23.00 for a burger? Well it is one of the best damm hamburgers you will ever have I can promise you that.

Perfect Burger is Ramsay burger. Nice interior with fire and it looks modern and it's just a burger place shouldn't expect anything else. We tried Tandoori Chicken Burger and Lobster & shrimp burger. Lobster & Shrimp which is a specialty burger which is worth 25$ too pricey but worth the penny. They don't serve any fries with the burger. I tried onion rings they were a bit salty. The tandoori burger was good they made the filling paneer or tofu, cucumber, and some lettuce. Pretty good place to try on the strip.

Although the food was up to par, but the wait for our food was nearly an hour...Even with the understanding of this being gourmet burger and all, over 1.5hr to eat a burger and some overpriced parmesan sprinkled fries was not pleasant to say the least.. they must be slaughtering the moo moo back in the kitchen to take this long to make burger.. come on now, i've had much more complex dish that come out half the time. Ramsay needs to get his butt in this store to figure what type of time waste his business is causing. BTW thanks for saving me the trouble of eating your dessert, which took another 30mins to come out. Ended up cancelling the damn thang~

We dined here Friday night around 1130 pm. Our server was very attentive and polite. He did a great job and we appreciate that.   We tried the backyard burger, ultimate cheeseburger, and the Hog burger.  The backyard burger had great flavor. A little over done but tasted great The ultimate cheeseburger was a bit of overload. But still tasty. The hog burger was pretty damn good. Lots of pork and the onion straws gave it a nice crunch. No complaints on the burgers. Our only complaint was our fries. They were cold. We were starving so we ate our burgers and left most of our fries. Other than the fries we enjoyed our food.   Tip: do not sit on the wall where the banquette is. It is extremely uncomfortable and not padded well. By the end of the meal my back was sore. As was my daughters.
Delicious  the burgers are to die for and the sweet potato fries are the best ever! The dipping sauces are unlike anything you will find anywhere and all of them are amazing!

I'm not usually a fan of burgers but this place was bombbbb. Got the UK burger and it wasn't too big but definitely filling. I'm very critical of the bun in burgers but the bun was nice and soft. Surprisingly, it wasn't $37293739 so I'd say it was well worth the price.   Came on a Monday morning right when it opened so there was no line.
Burger was delicious. Fries were delicious. Service is great!! Can't wait to go back again the next time we are in town. Not the best burger I've had but it was still really good.

This is my hands down favorite burger spot. Every time we make it to Vegas, we make a stop here. Well worth the money spent. The whole time I didn't have to worry about asking the waiter to refill my drink since they always had someone deliver a new Arnold Palmer when it had less than a 1/4 of a glass left. This place is exceptional on service and quality.

Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had. The beef was delicious, the cook perfect, and the tomato, homemade ketchup, and bun were tasty. The sweet potato fries were a nice blend of sweet and salty, I loved that they were coated with powdered sugar. Add to that, the beer selection was great, and service was fast and friendly. The only downside was that it was a bit hard to find, and really loud, but I'm sure that most places in Vegas seem that way for first timers! I would definitely recommend coming here if your craving a good burger.

Burgers were amazing we ordered hells kitchen and forest burger yummy!! Service was good he was very knowledgeable and explain things really well.  In addition, my son ordered an oreo shake and it was so good because it had creme brulee on top of it.  Definitely a must go if you haven't.  #firsttimers

Service was great, venue was clean and fun. There is definitely a wait if you come at peak hours. A member of our party was able to bypass the line for us, however.   The burgers are delicious. We all thought the the bun to meat ratio was a little off- but that is just personal preference.

Like burgers and WAITING?? Then look no further.   We decided to visit Vegas on a whim. Also we wanted to eat at a "celebrity chef" restaurant. Btw Gordon Ramsay has like 4 restaurants on the strip. We figured we would give Chef Ramsay's burger place a shot.   We came on Monday night and there was no wait for a table. But according to the server sometimes the wait is two hours!! I ordered the UK burger which had arugula, Dubliner cheese and a mango chutney. I prefer my burger or meat to be close rare. The server asked how I would like my burger I told her MEDIUM RARE BUT MORE RARE. She took my order and my hubby's and friends' orders. My friend wanted to modified or substitute an item. The server was nice about it but she did explain that the chefs are picky about modifications they usually DO NOT do stuff like that. But she would ask anyway and the chefs refused. So orders were finally placed. We waited 30 MINUTES!! Still NO burgers in sight!!! We asked our server about our food. She said it's a standard 30 minutes. She could tell we were irritated. She felt that management should post it somewhere but of course they wouldn't!!  Our food finally came out 5 minutes later.   The burgers and fries (btw everything is al la carte) looked good. We were starving too!! My girlfriend order her burger medium. When I cut into my burger my patty was medium well. My girlfriend's burger was more rare and she ordered medium! I was upset!! Not only did we wait 30 MINUTES plus, the chefs DID NOT ALLOW CUSTOMIZED BURGERS and this place's speciality is burgers and they STILL COULDN'T get it right!!!! The burger had good flavor but the patty was OVER COOKED and DRY to me. For almost $20 this burger should be magically! It's was the cheese and chutney that saved it.   I told the server my issue of my overcooked patty. And of course when you're a vegetarian YOU HAVE TO ANNOUNCE IT TO THE WORLD!! I don't know why the server felt it was necessary to tell me she doesn't have issues with overcooked meat because she's a VEGETARIAN!!! *hand clap* very helpful you millennial! I told her I didn't want to wait 30 minutes again because I was hungry. I asked her what can she do for me. So she said she would check with her manager. She returned and gave us 10% off the bill. Thank you millennial vegetarian working at a burger joint! *thumbs up*  SUMMARY  PROS: the mango chutney  CONS: LONG wait for just the food, self righteous vegetarian server, OVERCOOKED DRY PATTY  LAST THOUGHT: Chef Ramsay would shame this restaurant and staff! Never returning!
Daniel is awesome and the team is incredible.  Couldn't ask for a better experience!!!  Keep it up!!

Worth every penny! Get there early the lines are long because everyone wants a Gordon Ramsey burger!!  Mine was spectacular & I devoured it quickly. With so many choices at such high prices it was nice to see a high end Chef serve up burgers. Just because it Las Vegas doesn't mean you have to have caviar

In regards to burgers and appetizers, this is the best I have ever had in my life. We started it off with the chips, the chicken wings, and the ahi sliders. The wings did not have too much flavor, a very basic staple, but were perfectly cooked. The chips had the best cheese with a carrot garnish that totally complimented the starter and wrapped all the flavors together. But the ahi sliders were the best thing I have ever tasted, anywhere. If you eat fish at all, this is a must have. It is truly incredible, so much flavor. For my entree I had the lobster and shrimp burger. This was exactly how I would imagine a seafood burger and so much more. Perfect everything. On top of that, the service was absolutely exceptional, the best I ever experienced, anywhere. Gordon does not mess around. Five stars across the board.

One of the best burgers that I have ever had in my LIFE! Believe the tails of Las Vegas, you will never forget it. There are so many flavors that were going on in my mouth, not a party but a riot! Mind blowing bbq flavor and after eating this density of a burger you will say yes to a light walk! Now let's not ask for the check before,....you guessed it finishing that great paired beer. Blue moon was the one with this one. An IPA too hoppie for a burger this dense. Burger was the pork burger wrapped in bacon (you already know my weakness) topped with pulled pork. The pork butcher deluxe is what I call it! Gordon, your welcome.   Keep it fresh and clean (hands that is) with a cut down the middle. Sit back take it in...1...2...3 NOW ask for the check and treat yourself to a walk on the strip maybe a little gamble dessert at the blackjack table followed by a nap.   Overall, you can't go wrong with this place just get in before dinner time 5pm because it gets crowded. Don't forget, TYS, always!!!
Great service and awesome food. I had the Farmhouse Burger, fries, and onion rings. The ketchup was so good. Everything was delicious. Even the desserts!!!

I hate leaving three stars as I am a huge Hell's Kitchen fan. The stars were how long it took to get our food by the time we sat down and hardly any alcohol in our drinks.We sat down at 7:00pm April 26th and received our food at 7:55pm. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger. The flavors were there but mostly bun needed more meat. My mom order a burger with mushrooms and she loved it. The truffle fries were greasy and not my favorite truffle fries. They were on the thick side and just absorbed all the grease. The flavors were there, I think the fries sat too long before coming to our table. I and my mom ordered two cocktails(cannot remember the exact name) pineapple juice, rum and midori sour. What the cocktails were lacking was a balance between alcohol and juice. We paid $12.00 each for nothing but Juice. I already sent one drink back the Moscow Mule because it tasted like medicine. I  had drinks at Gordon Ramsay Steakhouse and I was hoping the same quality. I have ate at all of the LV Gordon's Ramsay restaurants and this will be my last visit here. I did take the survey at the table and when asked to speak with a manager I opted out. The reason I was so irritated with how long it took to get our food that I just wanted to leave.

This place is really good. Get there before dinner otherwise you'll be waiting in line to get in. The burgers are very well prepared, the service was probably the best i've experienced and the only reason why it's a 4 star is because everything is sold separate. The burgers and fries are sold separate with the burgers being about $15-$20 and the fries are $8-12 which is ridiculous and they're small and not special.   nevertheless, I recommend if you don't mind paying the extra bucks for the fries.

Amazing food and drinks but really amazing food!   We tried the wings(topped with shaved carrot and fresh blue cheese).... best wings to date especially in VEGAS. Duck and cow burgers were great topped and trimmed perfectly.  Truffle fries knocked me out with greatness.     The hotdog which cost $18 was thee best hot dog and $18 dollars spent in VEGAS!    I am a annual visitor in Las Vegas and i always stop here regardless.       The only con is the looooooooong wait for a table.

Goood f***in BURGRs!  After a long day of starving and drinking at a pool party this was the perfect carb and protein boost at 5pm! Tried their tandoori chicken burger, Hell's Kitchen burger and truffle fries! Truffle fries  Hell's Kitchen Burger  Tandoori Chicken Burger   The chicken was really tender! But it didn't do any justice to the name. The taste didn't really hit the spot and it didn't really give the punch of a tandoor! Would say it's something that you can try once to judge it for yourself.  But for a die hard lover of Real Tandoori Chicken, this was a slight let down.

The most amazing Lobster burger ever!!! My husband and I ordered the cheddar soup kind of salty but still good.Then sweet potatoe fries that came w powdered sugar and a dip soo good as well.Finally, it came out Lobster burger and the curry shrimp salad.Took a bite of the Lobster all kinds of flavors in my mouth it was fabulous!!!!!! Going back next time and we both are going to get the Lobster burger,can't wait!!!

Skip the burger, get the truffle fries DIP!  Have you ever seen that meme where Gordon Ramsay slaps two piece of bread around a persons face and makes them admit they're an idiot sandwich? That's how I felt after I tried two burgers: like an idiot who paid $20 per burger.   We waited for an hour before being seated. The line was frustrating because every time we peeked inside there were available tables that were clean and ready. Not sure what they were waiting for since the cutlery and napkins were already set.  ANYWAYS - we got the burger with goat cheese/arugula and the one with foie gras. Both were (and I hate to say this because I had such high expectations): underwhelming. The burgers were cold and I did not taste the melding nor complimentary nature of ingredients.   The highlight of the dinner was the truffle fries dip. I asked for an extra helping and was pleasantly surprised when there wasn't an extra charge. I used everything (burger, crust, fries) as a vehicle and excuse to enjoy the truffle dip. SO GOD DAMN GOOD that it raised this rating from a 1 to 2*.

This is my first Gordon Ramsay restaurant and let's say I was expecting a bit more, but still enjoyed my experience overall. We decided to each order a burger and share so in case we wanted more, we knew what we would order. We ordered: The Hog Burger: surprise burger of the group, as my party and I didn't expect much because our waitress sold us on the special burger ("F Word") on our particular visit. This is layers on layers of pork, it isn't wasn't saturated in grease, and it was quick flavorful. All of the flavors mended well together and was the surprise "favorite" pick amongst us (party of 4). Being as hungry as we were, we decided to try Chef Ramsay's take on poutine. It was winner for us as we enjoyed the mixture of gravy, duck bacon, cheese curds, and vinegar pickled shallots. My friend even said on her next visit, maybe she'll just have an order of this by herself. It satisfied our taste buds and piqued our interest on what else was coming our way. Shrimp and Lobster Burger: had a nice texture and though I liked the curry that seasoned the patty, I felt like it muted the shrimp and lobster flavor (as we know those aren't prominent to begin with). Still a pretty good burger, but I felt it could have been better. Hell's Kitchen Burger: had a subtle kick to it from the jalepeno ingredients, but wasn't overpowering. The avocado did help quell the heat and add another flavor profile to the burger itself. I would say this was the second best burger of the group. "F Word" Burger: this was the special (off menu) during my visit, which is constructed with a patty that is a blend of a 27-day, dry-aged New York strip, ribeye and barbecue short rib. It's topped with frisee, pickled shallots and lemon vinaigrette. Though sold as soon as we heard the ingredient list of this bad boy, we felt like all the flavors were not pronounced enough, but was still a good hunk of a burger. We noticed all the beef patties were consistently good (they have that process down) and the difference on the beef burgers were just the toppings/condiments associated with each "specialty".

I along with a couple friends thought we would try this restaurant back in March. Fortunately the wait during a busy weekend was not to bad, about fifteen minutes. Once we were seated the waiter approached the table and promptly asked if we wold like to order anything to drink. We chose not to order any alcohol and simply ordered waters and soft drinks. It was very obvious from the waiters demeanor that since we did not order any alcohol this was going a low ticket table and assumed his tip would reflect that. Never assume! The burgers were about average, good but nothing to rave about.   The little things are what made the difference. When our burgers were brought to the table they came in stages, not all together. Once we received the burgers it took about ten additional minutes for the fries to arrive. Why is the table not served together?
