Toward the end of the meal one of my friends finished his burger before the rest of us. His plate was clear while we were still eating. Is this common practice to start clearing the table before all the patrons are still eating. It made us feel as though they were trying to push us out the door quickly so they can get the next party seated asap. Maybe they were going to order alcohol to jack up the tab.  Overall, our expectations were much higher and under delivered from a Gordon Ramsay establishment. I've eaten at Chef Ramsay's restaurant in London a few times and always received exceptional service. I know you can't really compare fine dinning to burgers but some sort of consistency would be great.

In Vegas for a work thing. The wife and I, being fans of the shows, thought we would try it. The burgers were sensational. The service was great(unlike our Gordon Ramsay Steak experience), the truffle fries were good but not what they could have been. Could hardly taste the truffle oil. Definitely will go again.
The burger was great but the service did not come close to the expectations of a restaurant with Gordon Ramsey in the name.
Hell's burger was awesome with nice blend of mushroom patty ,jalapeño and avocado. AMAZING Taste

Hella kitchen burger is really good, has a great kick with the jalapeños. I also got the kettle nachos but it was drowned in sauce, made it sauggy and too rich for me. I wish i tried the hog burger. Overall good service and iconic spot to visit.
If it's a Gordon Ramsay-owned restaurant, you know it'll be good.

Wasn't sure exactly where in Planet Hollywood the restaurant was but we found it after walking around the casino a little. Waited in line for an hour but man it was so worth it. I got the Forest Burger and shared the Truffle Fries. Wow it was so amazing. The service was surprisingly really good as well which is surprising due to how busy they were. Definitely worth the wait!

This is my third time here. Wonder why no other info or pictures, because we ate good food too fast. The food here is good, it's always good, thats all I have to say about that.   This trip we ordered the hog burger, yummy, crown burger yummy, uk was ok, farmhouse burger yummy. We also ordered onion rings, super yummy. The  fries are ok but I'm not into this restaurants  fries, but the dipping sauces that come with it are good though. The sweet potato fries are okay, my girls like them a lot.   Overall, I will continue to come back when I'm in Vegas, as often as possible. I have nothing but good things to say about this Gordon Ramsay Burger.
Flipping amazing! Not too expensive, everything is delicious. Everything is gourmet, cold beer on tap, great staff,right in the middle of the strip.  Definitely recommend if your in Vegas.
We had the Farmhouse burger and Ale Dawg. Both were amazing. The burger was juicy and the dawg not greasy at all. Waitress was super helpful and never let thedrink glass go empty.

Decided to try this place out after seeing it on a worth it episode on buzz-feed. There was around a 40 minute wait. The waiter was nice. I ordered the mushroom poutine and the onion rings for appetizers. My table had also ordered the U.K. burger, the patriot burger, the hells kitchen burger and the crown burger. The poutine was very good, i would highly recommend. But the onion ringer were terrible and very oily. All the burgers were very good, but the waiter did mess up my order and brought a different burger. After notifying them of the mistake they brought my burger about 10 minutes later and they took it off the bill. All together a good experience.

I have to say, it's a bit over-rated.  Every time we walked by, there's a long line, so we assumed the food must be damn good.  As a result, we decided to check this out at non peak time so that we didn't have to wait as long.  Our wait indeed wasn't that long but the food disappointed us. We ordered: Farmhouse burger: bacon and patty a bit dry lobster&shrimp burger:  delicious!!!  The best of all we ordered.   backyard burger: dry onion rings: good but nothing to rave about and hellsfire wings:  dry and soggy.  Should have skipped it.   Service was great except for one hostess.    Good thing we didn't have to wait long for a table.  Would probably stick to Bobby burgers instead.

Ordered the HogBurger , Hell's Kitchen burger with a side of Ahi Tuna Sliders and Truffle Parmesan Fries... food finally arrived after an hour wait.   Trust me it wasn't worth it.  The burgers were oily and bland...sadly there wasn't any Sriracha on the table to give the burger some taste.  Fries barely had any hint of truffle flavor... McD's fries are better:)  The pushy photographer was not appropriate for the dining experience. I would not be going back again.

This takes burgers to another level.  Unique toppings like duck bacon, arugula.  They also serve salads and some ribs.  Good looking appetizers.  Try the truffle fries with an awesome dipping sauce.  They also have a pork burger and portobello mushroom burger.  Prices comparable for the Las Vegas strip.

I came here with zero expectations. I had just thrown three jack and cokes at the dome-piece (courtesy of NGINX during Re:Invent), and needless to say I had worked up quite a sweat hiking down from the Venetian. My point is that I was buzzed in a number of ways but I am still confident that my culinary judgement was clear.  I sat at the bar, slammed two pints of Las Vegas's finest tap water, and had my order taken before five minutes had passed by. I ordered the Forest Burger (tremor cheese, seasonal forest mushrooms, arugula, duck bacon). I list those ingredients because they are the only thing that brought life to this burger. I asked for my burger to be cooked medium rare, and received a dry overcooked piece of meat that would have sent Gordon Ramsay himself straight to the kitchen to tell the cook it was "as f***ing dry as a camel's a**hole in a desert storm". Yeah, that's a real quote.   The toppings were stellar but the tasteless patty and sub-par meat quality are going to weigh this down to three stars. Watch out for the $8 up-charge for fries, yoinks!

Just go, don't overthink it! This place has an absolutely perfect management, great food, and reputable service. The menu is simple, food is high-end and the service is fast.... and if they ask you if want  dessert say yes and go for the milkshake, do not say you are too full, there is always room for great delights. This one is really special, you will thank me later. Enjoy!
Great food, any burger can sub with chicken too. Truffle fries great an our waiter was very responsive. A bit of a wait so be prepared.

There are plenty of places to eat while in Vegas. Competition is fierce and relentless. The masses dictate the survival or death of an establishment with their thumbs, like back during the Roman days of the coliseum. One key to unlock the success of a restaurant is to appeal to the majority and even offer a selection that simply can change ones mind about a dish or entree. Gordon Ramsey's Burger has done that. I hate onion rings. I've never been attracted to the concept of wasting batter on an ingredient that's used as a topping or for just flavor. I absolutely love these onion rings! They are by far the showcase menu item to me because the level of excellence it presents overshadows the delicious and decadent selections of burgers that the famous F-you chef's menu offers. Cheers to you sir!

Love this place! The service was amazing, & the food was delicious. We had a terrible experience at a different restaurant where we ended up leaving hungry. Came into this one and told them about our cruddy night. And they turned our night completely around with the service and the food. I'm vegetarian so it's hard to find a good veggie burger but this place has delicious vegetarian options! Cooked perfectly with flavors I never even thought to put together. Can't wait to go back!

Gordon Ramsay Burger is located in Planet Hollywood Hotel/Casino on the Las Vegas Strip. This restaurant originally opened as BurGR. The specialty of the restaurant are burgers. They serve a variety of burgers including a vegetarian. The beef is ground in the mothership kitchen at the Paris kitchen. They are serve appetizers, snacks, salad and milk shakes. This is a full service restaurant with a full bar.   This restaurant always seems busy with a long line to get in but it moves fast. The atmosphere is very fiery, loud and energetic. Our waiters were both very friendly and gave us a briefing on the menu and were able to answer any questions we had.  We started with the Truffle Fries. We received a very large portion of Truffle Fries with two dipping sauces, house made ketchup and truffle aioli. The fries and very creamy and soft but not soggy. The top fries taste the best with the cheese and salt but as you dig down the taste builds up too much and the salt collects and the fries also turn too salty. I'd get plain fries next time.   I tried the Tandoori Chicken Burger. The bun was buttered and grilled just like a grilled cheese sandwich. The chicken almost seemed chopped and was INCREDIBLY MOIST and juicy and full of flavor. It was an absolutely delicious burger full of flavors.  My husband had the Hell's Kitchen Burger. It's bigger than the chicken and is a 7 ounce patty. It was made Medium/Rare just like he asked for and was prepared just so and also was delicious.  The food and service really was good but on the pricy side for what it was. Two burgers, fries and some wine sets you back about $100.00.

Awesome service, up to par food quality. Will def come back when in town! We had the F word burger which is a new burger that hasnt even been added to the menu was the bomb!!! And also the hell wings best buffalo i have ever tried! Im not a fan of buffalo sauce so asked for it on the side jeez!!!! Was delicious!!! We split both plates with my husband and we were soooo full after! People may think is expensive but we are from San Francisco so these are in the cheapest/average prices for us but the portion size is at all comparing to SF here are huge!!! So at the end we save money... win win...

So we came here to Mr. Ramsay's burger joint and the wait was an 1 and 30 minutes. Luckily our waiter was so awesome. He took very good care of us. Kept the drinks filled and the food came out really fast. 10 stars to Guy he totally rocked our socks. Now i didn't enjoy my burger all that much. But that's not taking away from Guy's 100% amazing customer service.

I eat here every time I visit Vegas and it never disappoints. The Hell's Kitchen burger is amazing along with the fries and shakes. The only criticism is that for parties of 3 or more they want you to visit the desk and they will text you. This is great except hardly anyone in line is aware of that, as its not clearly posted and the line is usually long. Another note about the line and that is it's usually hot in Vegas and they have you stand next to a firewall. This is an actual wall of fire, it looks neat but not so neat if you're hot. One you're seated it's great, friendly knowledgeable staff and the food is impeccable.

I normal don't write reviews but this i have to.Service was great 5 stars.the food had flavor BUT was not fresh and I'm sure Mr Ramsay would not be thrilled knowing his name is serving that food. I know I should've said something but when your out on that las vegas strip for a bit and hungry as heck who would you jus want to eat. Burger was barely warm and fries were stale if it wasn't for the chipotle ketchup I probably would've said something it did take a little bit to long also  so. my bill was about $65 for 2 people that's about the norm i guess in vegas but I've could've gone to in and out burger and it be cheaper and fresh.
The burgers were really good! I asked the Bartender if they had a rum punch he said no but he would make me one and he did and it was GOOOOD!

Went to make a to go order and the blonde blue eyed ostess working Wednesday the 14th at 5:30 claimed the food takes thirty minutes to make and when I inquired why she said "because that's how long it takes" with her snappy attitude instead of explaining that to go orders take longer or being nice about it. Idk if you guys take pride in having girls work there with nasty attitudes or what be nice you're in the food service industry I'm a paying customer :)

This being a Gordon Ramsay place, I held the food to a higher standard than I would ordinarily. I know of the guy, and I know he demands quality and precision. Would he have been in the kitchen that evening, I wouldn't have heard a barrage of profanity, but I would not exclude a bit of yelling.   First, the server I had, Alex I think was his name was awesome. He definitely knew his stuff, and not from a handbook or manual, no, this dude has tried literally everything. The fact that the food took a little longer than I would expect to come out he let me know ahead of time, which was much more appreciated than the "It'll be right out" when guests start to get antsy.   I had ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, cooked medium. Let's start with the good, so it doesn't seem like bashing this place is all I came to do: the flavor from the combination of ingredients was good! The burger wasn't overloaded to the point where you couldn't bite, but everything still came together nicely... or was supposed to.  Now, the not-so-good. If this were some little pub, I would give them more slack. In this case, I expected the same level of precision and quality Mr. Ramsay seems to demand of his chefs.   The meat in the burger was overcooked for what I ordered. Per the server, medium is supposed to have lots of pink. In my case, they had overcooked it, as I got a medium-well, with tiny hidden areas of pink in places. I also found the meat slightly underseasoned, a pinch more salt and pepper would have done this place quite a bit of good.   Then there was the overall execution which I found quite lacking. To me, when I bite into a burger, I'd like to get the same experience with the first bite, last bite, and each one in between. The avocado was more or less evenly dispersed, yet the roasted tomato(es) were very unevenly dispersed. Only a handful of bites got this taste, hence the quotes. As for the jalapeno aioli, it suffers the same problem... it was as if it was slapped on without regard. There was so little of this stuff, I don't even recall tasting it.  I'm hoping the photo I've attached from my meal will at least somewhat corroborate this point.   One of the final points I'd like to make is regarding the fries. If you are here with someone, the portions are great for splitting with a friend or two. However, if you come here alone as I did, the portion of fries it too big for one person. That said, it would be awesome if they had smaller, individual sized portions for those not wanting to eat for two.

Where do I start??? I'm not a typical burger and fries gal, but believe in giving things a fair chance. I do have to admit, I did have high expectations of a "Gordon Ramsey" restaurant.  Everything from service to quality was absolutely unenjoyable.   Small patties are hidden under an oversized bun. I expected a nice handmade patty, plump, and juicy, but the patties were undersized and all perfectly shaped and well-pressed under the flame. I ventured to order a "special" burger: lobster and shrimp... boy-o-boy was that a bad idea. The patty tasted like a rubber tire! I took a couple of bites just to make sure it wasn't me and tossed in the napkin. It ruined my appetite.  Quite some time after I'd tossed in the napkin, a manager stopped by to ask how our meal was. I commented on the poor quality and preparation of the lobster and shrimp burger. He did apologize and asked why I didn't let them know, as they could have made me another, but when I said I wouldn't want to try it again he said he'd let the kitchen know and simply moved on.   The sides were just as disappointing. The sweet potato fries were soggy, barely warm and covered in powdered sugar. They were served with a sweet opaque sauce they called a spicy aioli, but there was absolutely nothing spicy about it... it tasted like desert.   I'd put burgers, sandwiches and fries at this establishment in the same class as Red Robin, Johnny Rockets, Applebee's, etc.   If you want a good meal, go somewhere else.
Burgers and fries are delicious ketchup isn't traditional little weird for my liking but the food is great and the atmosphere is great.

The quality of the food is worth the prize. Burger is delicious and the meat is juicy and tender and packed with flavor melts in your mouth delicious. Fries and onion rings are nice a crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. Dipping sauces are flavorful too...worth the wait.
Excellent service, amazing food, came very quick, vintage Gordon Ramsay. If you ain't a big burger fan my mate had hot dogs he also really liked them. Best food we have had in Las Vegas by miles.

This place is amazing and the servers are fantastic! The bartenders are so outstanding from being so friendly and super knowledgeable about "Gordon Ramsay's" menu. I give them all a 5 plus ******, Victor, Robert and Robert!!!! He is very lucky to have them on his team and as amazing employees.   Ok now the food! OMG, my husband and I can't get enough and have been here 5 x's in 3 days. If you have not tried it, it's a must come to place and try... you will be hooked.   Thanks to all the amazing people from the cooks, servers and bartenders that make this place happy and be a 5 star!!!

This is my first experience at this restaurant. After short wait in a line outside, we were let into the restaurant. All food came out fresh and warm. We had the onion rings for an appetizer and they were great. I had a burger that was essentially a ground pork patty topped with shredded pork wrapped in bacon and it was good, I wish I would have gotten a regular burger. The Truffle fries were fantastic, as was the aioli that it came with. Next time I come I will try a different Burger, but if there is a line outside this place is definitely worth the wait.

Yesterday was my bday and we had a show at 9pm to see. We were in line waiting from 7:40pm. We got seated at 8:45pmstill hoping we could eat something. We were informed that the burger will take 25minutes to cookimagine our disappointment. So we sat for a few seconds and stood up and left very hungry and disappointed. There were more seats when we were inside so I didn't understand why it took the 3 lady hostesses so long to seat waiting guests in line. I am a local but we rarely go to the strip because of the traffic and parking but this was a special night so we braved all that. We proceeded to JLo's concert which was incredibly awesome but we were very hungry.  Gordon Ramsay burger was such a tease

Don't believe the bullshit from the Elites here it's not true, it can't be because I came here today and was not impressed.I was looking for something familiar and affordable and hey also because its Gordon's restaurant it's gotta be good right? . Although I was completely wrong about all my expectations. The wait was long about 1hr long wait for a table for four. The customer service was okay, it wasn't above average. My wife and I had already ate but the kids where hungry so we got them some grilled cheeses and we ordered the blue cheese burger with the truffle oil fries. And about three drinks at the end of the day we spent a whopping $70. The grilled cheeses were nothing impressive and the burger was so so, not what I would expect from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. The flavor combination was overpowering, too salty the bun was swamped with butter or an oil. The fries were ok they were not crispy but super chewy like bubble gum, it was like trying to bite off the cartilage of a chicken leg bone. Would I come back? Neh, for sure would go somewhere else next time.

Beautiful burger at beautiful venue! We could not enjoy our burger at the restaurant as there was an half hour wait at 6pm Monday night! Plus our children were restless then. So we bought two burgers and ate at hotel. Even then the burgers were destroyed by us in seconds while fighting over who will have the last bites! It's that good!   The buns were tasty and fluffy with sesame seeds.  The beef patty were real quality meat that was cooked perfectly to our order, medium well done, while succulent with a bit of red inside.  The matching of the sauces, herbs and condiments bring unique flavors to each burger but retains the original flavors of the star, the burger itself.  I don't know much about Godon Ramsay but having gone to both his fish and burger restaurants, this man really knows food!

I've only been here once, and that's enough for me. Was good at all. Burger was way under cooked and fries average. And that the good part. We waited an hour for this meal. Much better and cheaper burgers on the strip.
Absolutely beautiful restaurant with delicious food and service.  The line was long but was still totally worth it.   I tried the hummus with veggies and the poutine.  Both were fantastic.
Loved it! Great burgers, great fries, great beer, and great service! Definitely a restaurant I will return to when I visit Vegas again.

Even at 11pm there was a 1hr wait and let me say, absolutely worth it! Our party of 7 ordered all different kinds of burgers and they were all a hit. The Forest Burger is awesome with the duck bacon as is the mushroom poutine. The brown butter pecan shake is the perfect sweet note and is like a dessert dish on its own. Other favorites include the Hells Kitchen Burger and Farmhouse Burger. The burgers dont come with fries so you can order those on their own. One order of fries can easily be shared between 2-3 people. I do have to say that fries were a little dry and bland. Still, we loved this place! Oh, and they split our bill as we needed it without hassling us so thats a hug help when trying to figure out the bill after a night out in Vegas.

Wife and I stopped by and so glad that we did. I had the Farmhouse burger and was probably the best burger in my life. The burger itself was a perfect medium and the egg was so incredible on it. The chicken wings were also amazing and high quality. Would recommend this for any burger fans looking for something a little different but amazing in taste.

I've been really excited to try Gordon Ramsay burger after hearing great things about it (and watching his show!) unfortunately, it was a bit of a flop for me and disappointed.   After reviewing the menu, I decided to get the Hells Kitchen burger, which was supposed to have roasted jalapeños, roasted tomatoes, jalapeño aioli, asadero cheese, and avocado. Sounds spicy right? Not at all actually. I saw the roasted tomatoes and stuff in my burger, but it was not spicy at all. In fact, I couldn't really taste anything except for the avocado. Not even the jalapeño aioli that was supposed to be in the burger. I ended up just dipping my burger in the ketchup and aioli sauces we got from the Parmesan fries because it was so dry. This was really disappointing.   The second thing that was really surprising was what happened with my friend's blue cheese burger. While this burger tasted much better than mine, the kitchen somehow messed up and there was PAPER in the burger! I could not believe that there was actual paper that somehow ended up in it. We complained about it to our server, Elijah, and he was very nice and quickly corrected it for us and replaced it with a new burger. Shoutout and thank you for correcting the situation. I was just really surprised that this type of thing happened at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.   I'll end the review on a good note with the Parmesan truffle fries - although I was hesitant about the $12 price tag, the fries were really good and you could taste the Parmesan and truffle sprinkled evenly throughout all of the fries. They come in a cone and sometimes because of that the seasoning may not be evenly spread out, but this was not the case at Gordon Ramsay, thankfully. I would have preferred the fries crispier, but they were still good.   Overall, the paper in burger thing was really the biggest surprise at this higher class establishment. That aside, the food was just okay to me and not mind blowing. The service was a saving grace and I appreciate everyone on the team who contributed to that!

The burger place is excellent the burgers are fairly expensive but it's worth the price they try to do a very good job with the french fries really interesting twist on it I would try it out and don't let cost for a burger Scare you off

Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. The rings and fries, not so much. Definitely a little pricey. So, burger 5 stars, atmosphere 5 stars, server 5 stars, rings/fries 3 stars, value 4 stars. I live near Bobby's Burgers and we eat there often, this burger was definitely better, but I paid for it. Had the fries/rings matched the burger, I would have given 5 stars.

Awesome burgers!!! The thing that really amazed me was the pickles! I honestly hate pickles and i asked them to not put any in my burger, they put it on the side, i tried one pickle and it was the best thing ever!!! I highly recommend everyone to try, it has this mango sweet like twist to it!!!

I've visited 3 times and every trip is phenomenal. I highly recommend the Hells Burger, not as big of a fan of the duck bacon & lettuce burger (too salty for me). The burgers are amazing and perhaps the cheapest way to experience a Gordon Ramsay inspired menu. The servers are excellent, if not perhaps a bit over-the-top.  I will say, though, that on my last trip (5/10/18), The bald bartender without a name tag was ridiculously unprofessional. He threw a fit in front of everyone that "every shift needs to do stock" then continued to gossip about other employees right in front of everyone sitting at the bar...I really disliked being stressed by his negative attitude & rants.

Burger was good but nothing really special. Took a while for the food to arrive. A bit too long for me. Ordered fries well done and they were not. I was not too happy with the service. Very slow. Also, i was sitting at a counter seat. I don't like employees standing right in front of me, checking their cell phones every time.   At the counter, they are close to you. Shouldn't you be working?  Overall, just ok. Will not go back.

This last trip to Las Vegas we were in search of the best burger on the strip. It was found in Gordon Ramsay's burger house in Planet Hollywood. Everybody's plates and that which we ordered were all spectacular. This is a must try you are into gourmet burgers.   All of the burger should attempt to come close to the quality and taste of Gordon Ramsey's burgers.   If you are looking for the same for the french fries don't hold any hope because the French fries were actually disgusting. If you want fantastic french fries go to Bobby's Burger Palace. The burgers are good there too but the french fries are fantastic!  Grab your burger at Gordon Ramsay's and head  over to Bobby's Burger Palace for the fries on you are in for a fantastic meal.     MANGA!!
I have eaten at a lot of really good restaurants but this by far has the best burger I have ever had. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and my  Girlfriend got the blu burger and they were both amazing.

Have eaten here before and was content waiting in line, however service was under par. Once sat, the first comments out of the waitresses mouth were "prepare to wait another 40 minutes to get your burger" We ordered drinks right away but it took 15 to 20 minutes to get those to us. The staff appeared to be unorganized. Our waitress was inattentive, not really checking in with us at all. After 40 minutes we recieved our burgers which were cooked perfectly and very delicious, however overall was not a good experience. Plates could use some updating as the Gordon Ramsey logo was very worn.

Staying at PH they gave us $ credit for RGB and everyday there is a line out the door.  So we must!  Our 4YO likes it!    What I ordered, traditional cheeseburger.  Used one of my faves for baseline, Hopdoddys.  It's bigger but probably not double the price better but it's convenient on the strip.  The burger is good but found the bun to be too commercial.  HD makes their in-house so always have a fresh-soft-buttery bun.    Overall a good burger and worth it with the credit!  PS dig the nachos!

staff friendly attentive trained really well able to deal with customers that may or may bot be high and drunk i didn't remember what i ordered but when i got the fish and chips burger i was not disappointed they where surprised by the way i danced to jamacian music

Our first stop in Vegas and we were starving.  There were maybe only 5 parties ahead of us so the wait wasn't too long.  Once we got seated, our server immediately grabbed our drinks and helped us out since it was our first times.  We started off with the kettle chip nachos.  They came out fairly quickly, maybe 2 minutes from ordering them.  It came with a good amount of short rib and corned beef but thought it was a little underseasoned.  For our burgers, my boyfriend ordered the farmhouse burger cause he really wanted an egg and I ordered the anniversary burger (aged rib eye patty topped with short rib).  Burgers were juicy but we both thought they were just ok.  Our server was very friendly but had to wait around since she was busy.  Burgers are reasonably priced, starting at around $15, but fries are not included in the order.

We were able to cut the queue and sat at the bar!  The brown butter and pecan shake was amazing!!!  I got sliders and shared poutine.  Both dishes were nice but I was pretty stuffed and couldn't eat it all!  We waited at least half an hour for our food after it was ordered but I guess it was pretty busy!

The food was tasty but there's a long wait to be seated and the food comes out late as well. If you don't care for salty French fries ask the server to go easy on the salt. Great atmosphere and I reiterate good food
Casual, sports bar feel.  Friendly service.  Yummy burgers and really great truffle fries!

I come here every so often when I visit Vegas (maybe 2-3x a year?), and each time I've had a decently good meal with decently good service. Not really impressed with either, but I'm not necessarily disappointed. It's overly rated in my opinion simply because of the name on the restaurant.

For late-night dinner I tried the beer-battered onion rings ($9), burnt ends poutine ($14), truffle parmesan fries ($12), and the pork chop and applesauce burger ($16).  The onion rings seemed well-battered. The batter did not overwhelm with oil and possessed a fluffy texture.  The burnt ends poutine seemed at times over- and under-garnished. The burnt ends, in their limited quantity and size, made no apparent change in flavor profile. The shredded carrots' hard texture did not juxtapose well with the rest of the dish; future iterations should omit the carrots. The cheddar cheese curds also arrived in such limited quantities that they made no significant effect. The only redeemable element of the poutine, the black pepper gravy, had a lot of black pepper but needed a thicker consistency.  The truffle parmesan fries seemed satisfactory.  The pork chop applesauce burger contained a pork patty, dubliner cheese, branston pickles, apple braised pork shank, and cabbage-apple slaw. While these items individually sound delicious, their combination seemed underwhelming. The base pork patty seemed subdued in flavor, and the apple braising dominated the palate, relegating the other flavors to afterthoughts.  With the majority of my meal (burger + 1 appetizer) resulting in mediocrity, I will pass on future opportunities at this establishment.

This is  my favorite  Burger place in town. From its 30 foot long fire display and keg showcase., the atmosphere is as  exciting as the menu itself. We ordered ( the 3 of us cousins) the same . Lobster & Shrimp Burger, Hellfire Chicken wings & Their hand cut extra crispy Truffle Parmesan Fries with their signature curry ketchup . It's sinfully delicious!!! We top it with the ultimate sweet fix . White & milk chocolate Parfait.  Service is excellent! Celebrity Chef Gordon Ramsey delivers!

The burger and fries were so extremely dry. So disappointing... I was expecting a deliciously juicy burger and amazing truffle fries. Unfortunately, the fries were dry as a bone!!! I mean horrible... the burger (crown burger) was so dry I had to slather mayo and ketchup on it. Just wrong!!! From Gordon local I expect much more. I understand they had a chef missing, but that's unacceptable. And yes, to not comp us anything or a free drink, is not right. Service was mediocre at the bar. Overall dissatisfied. Will not be back.

Decided to eat here at the last minute.  Got in quickly and was very impressed with the staff and organization.  We were greeted promptly and had a very nice server.  The manager was great too! Our food was excellent.  My husband said that it was the best burger he ever had.  We will be back for sure.

Came here to celebrate a monthiversary with the bf & had such a good time!  THE WAIT: - there was a 20 foot line of people around 1PM on a Saturday but we only ended up waiting around 20 minutes!  THE FOOD: - Sweet potato fries +4/5 They sprinkle powdered sugar over the fries, giving the plate a unique, yummy taste. Feel free to ask for extra condiments (chipotle aioli, ketchup, etc..) on the side too!  - Hell's Kitchen Burger +4/5 This was my first time trying this burger & wow - it was good. I'm not a burger person so this says a lot too. The jalapeño added the perfect spicy kick to it & trust me - add an egg to your burger to reward your tastebuds. The only downside was that the burger was pretty salty.  - Hogg Burger +4.5/5 The bf ordered this and we both didn't expect how big the burger was going to be. He couldn't finish all of it but devoured as much as he could. If you've already had the Hell's Kitchen burger, definitely try this one next!   SERVICE: - was amazing. Despite the restaurant was super busy, Daniel - our server - made sure that we got our drinks/food/check in a timely matter. Thanks, Daniel!  If you're visiting Vegas, definitely make an effort to come visit this spot - you won't be disappointed. :)

Long wait, rude hostess and very expensive mediocre burger....ordered the "f burger" after waiting an hour even though I saw tables available the whole time.  The burger I requested was supposed to be medium done and when it came out after 15 minutes it was well done and was dry plus I think ingredients missing....then the bill was sky high for this burger

I was so excited to come here with my mom and little sister for her birthday. We are all big Gordon Ramsay fans! Sad to say...we were all quite disappointed. The onion rings we had heard about were clearly pre-cooked and served to us super dry and tepid (probably from right under a heat lamp). My ahi tuna sliders were pretty good! But then my little sister, on her birthday, got sick from her cheeseburger :(  Very average, and definitely not up to Gordon's standards!

After watching a concert at Planet Hollywood, I was starving! When we saw Gordon Ramsay Burger had no line, my friend and I decided to grab dinner here. We walked in on Wednesday, May 10th around 11:30pm. We were seated immediately at their counter with a view of the kitchen. A friend joined us later and we were able to grab an extra seat.  *Beer Battered Onion Rings: parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip ($9) *Hell's Kitchen Burger: asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes, jalapeno pesto aioli ($15) *Ultimate Cheeseburger: aged provelone, dublinar, boursin ($15) *"Foie" Burger: pate foie gras, chevre, port wine aioli, frisee ($21) *Truffle Parmesan Fries ($11) *Just Fries ($8) *Black Butte ($9) *Coors Light Draft ($8) ×2 *Guinness Draft ($8)  I got the foie burger with truffle fries. I should have read the description closer as I thought it was going to come with seared foie. Instead, it was a foie pate. It probably would have been fine, but paired with the chevre, the burger was too rich. And not in a good way as the chevre added a tanginess I didn't like. It also seemed like the cheese and foie were fighting each other instead of complementing each other. I did enjoy the truffle fries, but I think it's hard to mess those up. We'd been drinking all day, so I just decided to get a couple Coors Light. It was easy to drink. The boys got the rest of the food and thought everything was okay. Not worth the price was the consensus.  I don't mind paying more for a good burger, but these are just okay.

I decided to bring my best friend to Gordon Ramsay Burger for her birthday! We always do the high end steak house type of thing but this time I wanted to switch things up. Gordon Ramsay is one of her favorite chefs and she loves burgers! So this place couldn't have been a better decision. I called in advance to try and make a reservation and was informed that they DO NOT accept reservations and it was a first come first serve type of situation. Yikes! Say what? Yeah I was bit nervous about this because being that we were going on a Saturday night I could only imagine how packed they were going to be!   When we first arrived the line looked like people ready to get on a roller coaster at six flags. I just knew the wait was going to be 2hrs! To my surprise I saw a sign that read "For parties of 3 or more see host" That worked out for us because we had exactly 3 in our party! Score! Gave the hostess my number at was told we would be seated in about 45 minutes! Not bad at ALL! The Miracle Mile Shops are good to wonder around when you have a wait like this but we didn't even have to wait the full 45 minutes I got a text message saying our table was ready in about 30 minutes. Wining points already!  Once we were seated our hostess came right over and gave us a cool little introduction about the place and explained the menu. I appreciated her acknowledging my best friends birthday and made sure that we were brought something out in celebration for that. The cocktail menu is on an iPad which I don't know why I always think this is so cool! No drinks for us though we had plenty before at Fat Tuesdays and at this point starving was an understatement!   Food:  Beer Battered Onion Rings- Parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip  Truffle Parmesan Fries  2 Farmhouse Burgers- Dublinar cheese, Mangalitsa bacon, fried egg  Backyard Burger- American cheese, butter lettuce, tomato,pickle, onion  Overall everything was fantastic! We really enjoyed ourselves and most important my best friend said that she was so excited to try this place. The service was top notch and the food came out exactly how we wanted. NO complaints just kudos and handclaps for Mr. Ramsay!

Not the best burgers, but the best fries I've ever had with the best presentation of onion rings in a loop! I ordered the Swiss with mushroom and I think the grilled onion hamburger; it was too salty and soggy. To be honest, I just came because I thought it would be good in reference to Gordon Ramsay. I loved the restaurant setting and placement, it felt very chic and we'll put together but that's about it. I hope you have a better experience

horrible. The food is EXTREMELY greasy and buttery, it tasted like I was eating pure butter. There was not much flavor in my burger at all. I eventually just stopped eating it. Secondly, the presentation was so plain. Just the burger on a plate with the logo of the restaurant faded and coming off. Lastly, there was a hair in our truffle mayonnaise. Not coming hear again and don't get why there's so much hype.   Looks like this restaurant needs to be on Kitchen Nightmares

I had high hopes for this restaurant that were quickly dashed by the slightly above average burger joint that is Gordon Ramsay Burger. We got into the restaurant very quickly and actually got to sit in front of the kitchen and see the food prepared. However, our order took 45 minutes to cook all the while several people came and got their food quicker than us even though they ordered later. I got the barnyard burger which was rather bland and mediocre in general. I also got the Parmesan fries; they were much like the restaurant: high hopes quickly dashed by an average product. In the end I would like to give them another chance but I am certainly going to give preference to other restaurants in the area first.

Ordered the "Foie" Burger, which the waiter warned was a hit or miss due to the pate on the burger. I thought it was worth the price for the uniqueness of the ingredients. I also ordered truffle parmesan fries along with burned end poutine. Both were very delicious and enough to share with four people.

Husband went here last weekend on a business trip and hit the strip in search of a good burger. The burger was decent, not the best he's ever had but it was okay. He had set his expectations high being it was the "Godon Ramsay Burger" and it was meh...so so. Other thing that earned a 2 star rating was the payment error made by the server. My husband had to place the tip on his personal credit card because he can't tip with his business credit card. Though he asked the server 3 times, she still managed to put the entire bill $$$ on his personal card. Now I'm jumping through hoops with the bank to get the charge removed :(

This place is OKAY. Got the crown burger ($15) our waiter asked how I want the meat to be and I wanted it medium well done. Once the burger arrived and I took a bite into it, the meat was soooooo dry. It was so hard for me to swallow it down. Like wtf I can make better burgers that has juice coming out when biting into it. Disappointed. The waiter was meh.. only came to our table 2-4 ish time? Parmesan truffle fries were aight.

We came here because a friend of ours recommended it saying their burgers were amazing. That being said, we went on a Thursday morning, right before they were about to open, at 11am, and already there was a line of at least 15 ppl waiting to be seated. Definitely come right at opening time if you don't want to wait, this place fills up fast.   I ordered the forest burger, which had duck bacon and mushrooms which was pretty good. Portion size, I actually expected their burgers to be a little bigger than what was given to me...but overall it was a good sized burger. Definitely tender and juicy. However, what I really loved about this place were the truffle Parmesan fries! One order was enough for 4 ppl..and we definitely asked for a side of extra truffle sauce!

nikki, johnny, callie, & eric are the best.   f word burger is here! delicious array of diverse tastes in burgers with great service & celebrity chef atmosphere.    most notable burgers include the hog burger as mentioned in vegas weekly, the f word from the new hit series by ramsay the f word, and the farmhouse burger with dubliner cheese, over easy egg, & mangalitsa bacon!   f word is sweet & savory with a bbq glazed beef short rib, frisée wrapped in a lemon citrus vinaigrette, & pickled sweet shallots. worth the time & price for aged ribeye & new york strip steak!  truffle fries are a good blend of buttery and rich flavors & cocktails/beer selection is expansive. the wait is definitely worth it for such a delicious experience at one of ramsay's best price points on the strip.

I ate here when it was still Burgr a few years ago and loved it. Had lunch here with a group of 7 on a Wednesday around 11am and there was no line. Had the Crown Burger, truffle fries, and Creme brûlée shake. The burger was somewhat dry and needing more seasoning, the truffle fries were too salty, aioli overpowered with mayo and didn't taste much of garlic/other flavors, and the shake was good despite being too sweet (it's a desert shake so I guess that's not too much of a shocker?). The service was great-the server checked in with us a few times and accommodated a request to switch out a burger because it was super dry (switched a Hog Burger to a Farmhouse instead). Restaurant was clean. (They recently switched from Burgr to Gordon Ramsay Burger)

We went there  for lunch, we had to wait 15 minutes to seated. Nice sitting and environment. We ordered the truffle fries ( was good), lobster and shrimp burger ( was ok but too greasy) and the hells's kitchen burger ( I loved the bun and the burger too) but the I had better burgers, I was expecting more from Gordon Ramsay. It is quite expensive, average $16 for a burger sandwich. But overall, good experience.
I ordered a rare burger, thinking that I was at a ramsay restaurant it would be perfect. It took an hour and came out well done. I was very disappointed and my time was wasted.

Gordon Ramsay should do an episode of Kitchen Nightmares on his own restaurant. The burgers were below average, some of the "snacks" were gross. The only thing good about the restaurant was the service.
Good food, terrible service. The hostesses are incredibly rude while we are waiting to be seated.
There are lots of burgers on the strip so we had high expectations from Gordon's place.   He did not disappoint, the whole experience and the food was worth the extra bucks.

One of the best burgers off date. Irrespective of whether I know or not about Gordon Ramsay..we will definitely like the ambience, well managed staff. Would love to go back again. Bit on an expensive side, but worth it.

My friend and I really wanted to try this place and we were not disappointed. I got the "Hells" Kitchen burger while my friend got the Backyard burger. The burgers were soooo good omfg. We both got medium rare and it was nice and juicy. We also got the truffle Parmesan fries which comes with garlic aioli and something else. The garlic aioli gmfu in a good way though. Legit I would eat that garlic aioli with everything haha. The other sauce was just too sweet so we didn't like it very much. The servers are friendly, but we waited 30+ minutes for our food. People that came way after us got their food before us or at the same time so that's why I knocked off a star. Would def come back if I'm ever in town again.

We were so excited to try this place out. There was a 30 minute wait so they gave us a beeper and we went to gamble. When it finally beeped we went to check in and were told the table will be ready shortly. Well...shortly meant 20 minutes! Once we were finally seated we ordered promptly just to wait another 40 minutes for our hamburgers. We were starving. The burgers were pretty good just not spectacular. Looking back I would have just found a nice hamburger joint off the beaten path. Would have been cheaper and just as good if not better and wouldn't have had to wait so long!

I came here for the first time with friends. Service was good and it was definitely one of the better burgers I've had. The truffle fries are a must! Only gave 4 instead of 5 stars because my boyfriend's old fashioned was a little off.

Fans of good food and fast service will have a good time here if my lunch here was a good indication. We were greeted immediately with a smile when we walked in and were seated right away after walking in around 20 minutes after the restaurant opened.  A wall of flames greets guests as they enter the restaurant and the restaurant has a good mix of decor that might interest Gordon Ramsay fans in addition to sports bar appeal.  The onion rings are bomb!  Delicate shavings of cheese topped a large cone of crispy, beer-battered onion rings and the  ranch dressing made the each bite melt into my mouth. My brother and I agreed, these were the star of our lunch. My tandoori chicken burger was good, cooked perfectly with a fresh bun and my tangerine cocktail was so juicy, I wanted more, a great balance between sweetness and alcohol content. The tables have a subtle British theme from the glossy menus with Gordon Ramsay flanked by the British flag to the blue place settings with red cloth napkins, adding a nice touch to the table. One suggestion I'd have is to include plain fries with burgers to provide a more complete meal; it'd allow guests to still choose from their tasty-looking appetizer menu if they wish but would be a more traditional way to enjoy a burger without paying extra. We had a great experience, our waitress was friendly and made sure we were well taken care of.  A fun lunch and an affordable option in Vegas!

In town for Caps and Knights game, ate a late lunch beforehand. Had to wait for a table for 5 people but they texted us when our table was ready and it was worth the wait. Order the burgers as they come, do not add anything!!!! They are awesome just the way they are. You don't need any sauce or any thing extra. I had the backyard burger and my husband had the farmhouse burger. Awesome burgers, awesome fries, awesome atmosphere.

Our group of friends from Seattle last night came for dinner. Everything was excellent. They sat our party of 7 within 10 minutes. The burgers and drinks were delicious. To top it off our server Adam was very friendly and punctual. We will definitely be back before we leave!

Great food! !great place !!  I had hell's burger it was amazing with grilled jalapeño and asadero cheese (I added bacon ) fries  and a root beer.. as appetizer had the wings they were so good... .Four stars instead of five because service could have been better . Server seemed to be distracted by the football game playing on tvs. After getting my food realized a lot of tables had the onion rings so  I order them but never got them... but  I was charged for them. Told server and she did fix The bill.  Great place !
best burger! truffle fries...omg! so damn good. of course it's pricey and you're going to wait awhile..worth the wait...worth the money..you won't be disappointed:)
Delicious! Best burger I've tried!  Food & drinks are great our server was friendly and welcoming. Definitely coming back next time we come to Vegas.

Went on a Thursday night and the wait wasn't too long. Staff were friendly. Ordered the special hamburger that was not on the menu (limited to 100 per night). It was priced at $22. It was a strip sirloin and ribeye grounded together and topped with a little bit of brisket. This was a disappointment. The burger was dry, not tasty and I ordered it as suggested by the server. The bun was excellent.  The nachos tasted good but had way too much cream sauce. The onion rings were tasty. They come in this cone holder. The not so good part was the bottom rings got soggy with oil. Which made them unappetizing. Would I go eat there again? Probably not.

I can't even begin to rave enough about this burger.  The wait time here was minimal, we stood in line for ten minutes, tops, and spent that time gaping over the menu on the outside wall.  Once we were seated, we were waited upon in short order, by a friendly server named Guy.  I forgot the name of the burger I got, but it was the once with a fried egg on top (farm burger?  barnyard burger?) and it was exquisite.  I like my burger medium rare, and usually I struggle to get a place to cook it for me medium rare, but this one came out right at the perfect temperature.  It was juicy, and flavorful, and all the accoutrements included upon it were scrumptious, also.  The fried egg was perfectly fried (overcooked eggs are a huge no-no for me) and the yolk was velvety, and rich.  Just an all around excellent burger.  The fries were okay, the onion rings were okay.  For those you are provided with a few sauces, one it a curry flavored ketchup, which lo and behold tastes like curry.  There is also a chipotle ketchup, which was tasty, but I didn't get much chipotle out of it.  The third is a cheddar ranch which was mindblowingly out of this world.  I would have ordered more fried to get more of this cheddar ranch.  It tastes like ranch dressing, without the acidic finish, instead replaced with a creamy smooth cheese flavor.  I've never had a ranch quite like this, and I lament that I will probably never find a comparable copycat recipe.  Overall the burger was worth the price, really tasty, cutesy restaurant, good service...a good experience for the low to mid budget gordon ramsay fan.

Wait was ridiculous; over 2 hrs for Saturday lunch, but you can skip the line if you are total rewards platinum, diamond or seven star members.  Ordered Hog burger, Hells Kitchen burger, fries and chicken wings. Wings and fries are above average and burgers are so delicious. The burgers are very juicy. Hells kitchen burger is probably the best burger I have ever had in my life.  Price is insanely cheap. $15 for a burger in Vegas is like $5 elsewhere.

Boy I can't wait to come back! Gordon Ramsay you did not disappoint.  We went during the weekday so the wait was minimal.   I love how they had vegetarian options. You can replaced any of the burger with the portobella patty. Don't forget to order a shake with your burger. Let me tell you, it was probably the best shake I've ever had. I've been craving it ever since.   We ordered Hell's Kitchen Burger with the portobella mushroom patty, Truffle Burger, truffle fries, and Creme Brûlée Shake.

Our service was fast and we got our tables pretty quick. It was a party of five and we all ordered their burgers and side of two different types of fries. I wasn't really into the truffle fries but the regular ones were good. We all enjoyed our burgers and the server was really nice too!

Gordon Ramsey burgers are soooo amazing.  It's located in Planet Hollywood hotel and definitely worth stopping by if you are craving for gourmet burgers in Vegas.  There is always a line no matter what time of the day.  So expect a wait.   The wait time isn't too bad since there is a lot of things to do at the hotel while you are waiting.  Since Vegas is the city that never sleeps, its always a good time to stop by for a quick bite anytime.  They serve gourmet burgers, fries, sandwiches, and shakes.   The ambience is modern and hip which you can either get dressed up or casual depending on the occasion.  The staff is friendly and always checks in to make sure you are enjoying your experience.    Food also was served fresh and fast.   We didn't have to wait long before our food arrived.   I highly recommend trying the turkey burger, sweet potato fries, and truffle parmesan fries.  I normally don't like sweet potato fries.  But it is so amazing  It was hot, fresh, and served with a homemade garlic aioli sauce.     Overall, it was a great experience.  I would highly come back again and try different food on the menu.
Best burger in town! Hell's Kitchen burger amazing! Friendly service, amazing food! Shakes were awesome! Will definitely be back

We too the Hill's kitchen burger with sweet fries and Parmesan fries. I went starving and I thought that wouldn't be enough but it's actually bigger than the pictures.  There was a bit waiting line but worth waiting. Enjoy
Good burger, awesome curry sauce for the fries!

This is a go to spot every time I'm in Vegas! Every time we go there is a wait but they text you when your table is ready. Plenty of time to explore the casino while you wait. Every burger I've had here has been amazing and I love the jalapeño popper appetizer! I've never had a shake here but want to try one when I come back in October! See you soon BurGR!

The wait is long as usual but the systems were also down so it took an extra 30 minutes for the food to come out which was understandable. Burgers are always good as usual especially the poutine! The milkshakes are to die for so you have to get it or your meal will not be complete...seriously. Mind you the portions are pretty big so plan accordingly lol

Every time I come to Vegas I make it a point to stop by GRB, ( 5th time) the Hells Kitchen Burger is my fav, and I've never had an issue here.. until..... Monday May 29, 2017 @10pm, Waited 40mins in line, (which was to be expected since it was Memorial Day wknd)... was seated and had to wait another 15 mins to be acknowledge by anyone, or served water, finally was able to place our orders and then proceeded to wait another 38 mins for our food to come out. Burgers were suppose to be Medium rare, and they both came out over done and super dry, we had ordered fries that literally tasted like the bottom scrapped ends of sand paper, I'm giving this review 2 stars because at least the cremé brûlée shake was amazing. Very disappointing GRB was always one of my go to restaurants in LV. Not anymore.

After a long drive, it was nice to find a place to sit down and eat. The line for this place however is ridiculous. It was near closing time and the line went beyond the their fiery design. Luckily we had a card carrying member and we got to skip ahead. The place is good but I think that the popularity is carried by his name. A man who made his name by being mean. The burgers were good but it was the truffle fries that won me over. Stop by if the line is short other wise go on ahead and skip it.
Damn tasty. Excellent burgers and bar food, very friendly staff, upbeat and sporty ambience. Went back twice in one weekend!
Best Nachos ever.  Also our grou had the blue cheese burger and the ahai sliders amazing.   Lobster seafood not so much other then that fabulous to pout. Craving the Nachos.

So lets start with the venue. The restaurant has a clean look and feel that tilts towards a group setting or even a casual date. Service is great, the decor is eye catching, and the music is not in your face.   Now onto the food:  Truffle fries: Straight fire. But ask for extra ketchup.   Sweet potato fries: Yes I know the name says sweet, but I guess personally most of the time I have sweet potato fries they're not really on the sweet side. These ones also had a layer of sugar on top which really gave it that side, so personally I wasn't a fan and would've just struck to the truffle.   Forest Burger: I am a big mushroom person which is why I was leaning towards this one, and I will say that the mushrooms had a TON of flavor. The burger overall was pretty tight. I will say that there was a unanimous decisions that all of the burgers we had were slacking on saucing. So it really tasted like a patty and then your veggies on top. Similarly, i'd recommend asking for an extra sauce.  Finally the milkshakes were very very underwhelming. They only had three flavors and they weren't thick at all. I like true diner style milkshakes and this wasn't that. Of the three flavors I would recommend the butterscotch, even though I typically go for oreo flavored.

I ordered a medium burger. I confirmed with the server that medium will be medium cause some places with error on the more cooked side. Burger came...it was well...the server took it back an assured me that they will fix it...burger came back rare. There was blood on my bun.

I came here expecting to hear Ramsay dropping 'F bombs' but I settled for the 'F burger' instead. What is the Gordon Ramsay Burger restaurant? It's literally the physical brick and mortar restaurant embodiment of the man himself.  In true Gordon Ramsay fashion, his restaurant takes on the famous chef's personality, with flames engulfing his patrons as they dine. His menu offers a selection of delicious burgers, fries, and beverages in a sit down and flame infused environment. Make sure to come early, and put down your name - the wait time can be excruciating!

Pretty good. I shared truffle fries with my boyfriend and got the forest burger because sometimes people say I am a woodland creature, whatever that means. I was not a fan of the trumpet mushrooms on top but other than that, this was pretty good. The truffle fries were quite salty and definitely well-made. Gordon Ramsay did not disappoint, but I don't think I will come back. I loved the decoration inside and the mini waving fingers of fire in front of the restaurant.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. We got there at about 3:30pm and there was a queue. We waited about 15 minutes before we were seated ( we were a party of 2). So the wait wasn't bad at all.   Our waitress was really lovely! We ordered quickly because we decided what we wanted while waiting in the queue. I had the blue cheese burger , hubby had the Gordon Ramsey ( Hell's Kitchen) Burger and we shared fried ( the fries are huge and enough for 2 -3 people). The food took really long to come out of the kitchen ( like 30 maybe 35 minutes). The wait was worth it because the burger and fries was delicious! Probably the best burger I have ever had. I'll definitely be going back to try a few other burgers while I'm in Las Vegas.   For vegetarians - they have a portobello mushroom burger which sounded amazing! I might have that one when I go back.   Tip- it's quite warm sitting by the glass window as there's a display fire .

I had high expectations and GRB did not deliver. I've had a better burger at Denny's. Leave it to this Brits, who eat fries with mayo, to mess up a simple thing like ketchup. The ketchups here pretty much suck. My advice... bring your own ketchup.
Pros: variety of tasty burgers and sweet potatoes are a must!!  Cons: Long wait, longtime for burgers to come out
When it comes to gordon ramsay's place, it has to be good! The burger and the fries were awesome! Service was okay, but the ambiance of the place was great.

Not all it's cracked up to be. I ordered the blue cheeseburger based on the recommendation of the waiter and was not overly impressed. The meat had no real flavor of its own and you could hardly taste the blue cheese. I can see now why the waiter was pushing hard for fried onions and bacon on everyone's burgers since by themselves they tasted  like they were missing something. My friend ordered an egg on his "Anniversary Burger" and it came with a half inch piece of shell in it. The waiter apologized but then only reimbursed the charge for adding the egg. Poor customer service move.   One positive was the delicious Poutine we ordered for an appetizer. That was done extremely well. Overall, this place is not worth the wait or the money.

We're both huge fans of Ramsay, and we try to go to all his restaurants, burger was one of the few that we were so/so about.  It's great food but giving the name behind it and the cost (cost increase do you being on the strip) it's a tourist restaurant for sure. For those who live here in Vegas there are local places with just as good burgers for a cheaper cost.   I would still recommend going for the experience after all you are here on vacation

Don't waste your time or money. We waited for 40 minutes in line, then waited another 40 minutes for food!The $11 fries were not fresh, dry as if left under a heating lamp. The burgers were cooked unevenly. Three people ordered the same burger medium...one was dry, one was raw, and one was actually medium. Gorden Ramsey where are you?  I'd be ashamed to have my name attached to this place.

Good but beware, the lines can get ridiculously long. That's why you gotta get your Seven Stars or Platinum buddy to come to the rescue. It just cuts everyone in line like a hot knife over butter.  -- Got to try 4 burgers and 3 fries --  Let's start with the BEST, the burgers:  1) Forest Burger $17 - AMAZING. Wow, the juicy tender incredibly flavorful patty with even more flavor from the tremor cheese, forest mushrooms, arugula (dressed, no naked ingredients here!) and duck bacon. I just wished my stomach could handle more but the sides we got were killers [I would not order 3 sides of fries for 4 people]  2) Farmhouse Burger $17 - This was great. All protein and not a sight of plant here. I think the fat afrom the mangalitsa bacon does the trick here, a shiny burger doused in liquid lard.   3) "Foie" Burger $22 - My friend got this and she didn't love it. I thought it was okay as I am not a fan of foie anymore. I think it was just too heavy in all aspect, fat, foie, cheese... I personally think burgers should have some vegetables to balance the heaviness. The last two did not.   4) There was also a Lobster and shrimp burger but it isn't on the menu anymore. It was good and lightish but here, you gotta get the beef.   Then there were the sides which really felt like the main courses too (not my favorite and next time, I would skip these altogether)  1) Beer Battered Onion Rings $9. Good but honestly, too much in terms of dough and the salty parmigiano-reggiano as they were very generous with it. The additives make these heavier than your usual rings. Plan accordingly because we did NOT finish any of the fries and we are not slim people.  2) Truffle Parmesan Fries $12. There were aromatic as expected. Thick cut, loads of potato action here. Possibly a tad dry and a little too hard for my liking.   3) Sweet potato fries. Disappointing because they were limp and not hot. They were clearly not freshly fried. I think they were SO busy that night that the quality of the food kinda dropped.   We asked them to bring us freshly fried ones but the next batch was simply hotter and a little darker but did not feel fresh. We left them. Service was slow, it was a busy night.

I'm glad I stopped in but wouldn't go out of my way to do it again. Shared the forest burger and an order of truffle fries. Waiter asked if we wanted the fries as an appetizer. Seems like waiters might recommend that because it takes so damn long to get your food. I think we waited just shy of an hour for a gourmet burger and fries that were both mediocre in relation to price and wait time. The forest burger was nearly devoid of mushrooms (only two little morsels on each half) and the fries were kinda dried out steak fries and came with two sauces. The one sauce was a truffle aioli which was good and the other was a "ketchup" that I am pretty sure was house made and not very good. I could taste the worshi sauce and celery salt and other ingredients independently and it wasn't very well balanced. Heard management dealing with other customers regarding wait time and seemed very service oriented. Perhaps the wait time was a bit more than usual. I would recommend giving this place a try maybe during off hours in between lunch and dinner.

I'm not too much on chef named restaurants because everyone I've ever tried including his were not very good but I must say the hamburgers pretty damn good I will return the service from the bartender where I sat was excellent I wish I could remember his name

The line was scary long. Luckily they let Total Rewards Platinum and higher levels cut the line. I know it's not fair but I'm not complaining. I would say it's not worth the wait but if there is no wait then it's a pretty good burger spot.  The hell fire wings were not spicy. It had a sweetness that I rather it didn't have. It also didn't come with any dipping sauce. I had to ask and was told they don't have blue cheese. They did have ranch but it's just not the same. I was happy to see that the wings were partially deboned.  I got the farmhouse burger. It comes with bacon and an egg. It was really good but the burger came dry, no sauces. I had to ask for mayo. It also doesn't come with fries so I ordered the truffle fries. I don't like the fact it was the thick steak fries. I wish it was cut thinner however the truffle aioli that it came with was ridiculously good.  They also had a lot of unique burgers but I was not feeling adventurous that day. Great burger spot if you don't have to wait. Otherwise it's not worth the wait.
Great burger food and service! They got the order wrong but it didn't matter the food was great and the waitress was amazing.

Great flavored Blue Cheese Burger. Cooked perfectly medium. Fries are good, find fry sauce  okay. It's fresh, but just not my favorite. Would give higher but the list more order. Manager was proactive and comp'd the meal.
Oh my god yum! Best burger I have had. Totally worth dealing with the trash on the strip!
Its everything you would expect from a Ramsay restaurant.  The food was incredible, the service impeccable, the place was spotless, and it was truly enjoyed

First time here and it was amazing. The wait was about an hour, but we got to put our names on the list and walk around the mall until we get a text. We ordered as soon as we sat down, since we heard it takes about 25 minutes for the burger to be made. I got the Mediterranean Burger and Truffles Parmesan Fries. Both were so flavorful and delicious, totally worth the wait. The services was great. There's absolutely nothing to complain about. I highly recommend coming here if you're going to Vegas for a mini-vacation, I promise you will not regret it.

The food here is amazing!! I got them nachos! Wow the cream cheese was delicious! And got the Poutine! The meat on the pountie was was sooooooo good! And the sauce with it was absolutely and eye opener. The burger I had was the Hog Burger. It was so juicy that when I took my first bite, the meat juice dropped on to my pants! It was worth it! The text message was a plus!

Hog burger are crazy good. I'm not a fan of bluecheese so bluecheese burger (in my opinion) is not that crazy yummy. Every piece in the burger makes it worth with the price. Pork meat in hog burger is thick. Pickles are homemade fresh and unique taste. I don't like pickles in general but pickles in hog burger are bomb. Veggie in bluecheese burger is fresh. 2 appetizers (fries with curry souce and mushroom poutine something) are ok but not crazy good.   Service is decent. Waiting line is not bad (I got the table right away when I got there. I came there around 7ish Sunday night). Location is easy to find and decoration in there looks nice.  Worth to try at least one time in your life!

We were in Vegas on Vacation. We decided to check out Chef Ramsay's burger, since we are big fans of the show.   Restaurant is located in Planet Hollywood.  As we arrived, there was a long line. The host was going down the line taking names. For a party of 3 or more you do not have to wait in line. They write down your cell phone number and call you as soon as a table is ready.  Wait was 1hr. 40min.  Finally we sat down!!!  Restaurant looks very clean and Nice decor.  Ordered 3 Hells Burgers and 1 hot dog.   Took about another 30-45 min. For our food to come out! A total of almost 4 hours from the time we checked in to the time we left. Wow!!!   My Party and I where really Disappointed!   $15 Burger does not come with a side.  We ordered a side of wedges and onion rings.   "Hells Burger" the description seemed like if it would be a spicy burger includes jalapeños and avocado. Nope!!! The presentation was really nice, but my burger was tasteless, it needed something, no sauce, I did not taste like jalapeño, it just needed something. It just seemed like a burger I could have prepared myself at home.   Fries and onion rings, nothing special.    Hot dog is huge, but nothing special.   They don't offer a children's menu.   I was just expecting way more. I have had a way better burger somewhere else for cheaper, with a side, and without the almost 2 hour wait.   I probably won't be back.

To die for! I love their burgers and their sauces. This time around we tried their Creme brûlée shake. Oh yeah you better get it! It's delicious! The wait time is very long so don't wait in line hungry because you'll just starve but if your stomach can wait then go for it. This is our go to spot when we are in Vegas.
Fantastic burgers. Time to try the lobster and shrimp sandwich and creme brûlée shake.

Never disappoints. I absolutely love their Oreo Creme Brûlée shake... it's ridiculously good. The line can get a little long, but they are great at moving people through pretty quick. The decor is pretty cool, especially the fire decorative accent near the entrance.

First off, we were told it would be roughly a 20-30 minute wait... literally over an hour wait, although they took multiple large parties who got there after us.   Second, the food took quite awhile. The truffle fries came out quick, but the burgers took about 30 minutes.   Third, the burgers were not great. The beef patty is pretty small. And it was kind of dry and didn't taste very good. I got the blue burger and my friend had the farmhouse.   Absolutely not worth the wait or the money.
Ordered the Turducken burger.  Took my first bite and choked on a large bone.   Showed the waitress, who showed the head chef.   Guess they didn't give a shit.   Otherwise, good stuff.
Tourist trap!!  Waiter warned us it takes 35 minutes for the burger.  40 minutes later we got our food and no one in our party of 4 ordered a burger.  Food is just ok.

The burgers are honestly amazing I've had almost every burger! And there all good. My favorite is the farmer burger. There homemade ketchup is to die for. The price is really good and the staff is really sweet and nice i recommend this place to all friends that come into town.

Went here when I got my wisdom teeth pulled out and it was a great experience! Really enjoyed the cheeseburger I got from here and the Oreo milkshake, really made my day better! Service for superb and the food was awesome. Wish I didn't live so far, I'd come all the time!

I have been a fan of Gordon Ramsay for as long as I've been a foodie. We picked this place over the other GR restaurant because it was within our price range. It's located in Planet Hollywood and you're greeted by a line of fire with the words Gordon Ramsay Burger. The wait wasn't bad, the line moved pretty quickly but please note that if you have a party of more than 3 people, go to the front and tell the wait staff. We had a party of about 15 and we didn't see that sign until we were near the front so it was too late for that. Our wait was about an hour on a Monday night. I think if you have a smaller party, the wait should not be as long as ours. And reservations aren't available. The neat thing is you don't have to be there waiting until the hour is up, I was able to give them my number and they would text me when the table is clearing. We walked around outside and saw the Fountains at the Bellagio.  I ordered the Hell Kitchen's burger with the truffle fries. They warn you ahead of time to share the truffle fries with a couple of people so don't let the price deter you. This was probably the best burger I have ever had in my life. It definitely beats a few of my favorite burger joints in Dallas. It's also big so you'll be super satisfied. I split my burger with my friend who had the Farmhouse burger. The Farmhouse burger was interesting, wasn't my favorite exactly but it was still good. It had interesting toppings. The truffle fries were super flavorful. Every bite you took had good flavor. We were able to dip it in an aioli sauce and ketchup. The ketchup here is SUPER fresh, not packaged in a Hunt's ketchup bottle and you can definitely tell. I'm telling everyone who goes to Vegas to check this place out. Definitely worth your time and money.

Review for truffle fries, forest burger and oreo cookie cream brulee shake   * Fries: tasted amazing! The yellow dipping sauve makes it 10 tines better. 10/10 recommend. * Burger: patty tastes super juicy, yumm. I don't like the cheese at all, maybe it's not my taste. I could only finish half of the burger. * Shake: if you can't comprehend a cup full of sugar then don't. 60% of the shake is the thick, overly sweet cream brulee cream, the rest is oreo shake.   I still give it 5 stars because I really like how the food is cooked. I will come back to try other burgers, and more truffle fries!

I personally love this place, aioli ketchup, curry ketchup---truffle oil Parmesan fries---priceless.  Especially get those out first because burgers take some time.  Really great beers on tap.  I love the farmhouse-juicy beef with bacon and egg.  Love it.  Buns are great.  Don't pass up this place, in the Planet Hollywood.  Highly recommend.  The only downs are always a wait(good sign), and burgers take a minute to come out.  Make sure you order the fries------

The experience was great.  Food was delicious.  The company outstanding.   The curry dipping sauce was out of the world.    The Carmel Pecan Shake was delicious,  more shake less whipped cream next time.   See you soon Las Vegas.

Very slow service even when not busy  They have a very large staff but slow in cooking the food. It's only burger and fries. We ordered dessert. A tart. It took 20 min for something that requires no cooking.
After a 40min wait for my burger it was just "ok". In n out or Eureka is way better, pretty disappointed, I wanted to like it! :(
Best mushroom burger. Every bite was full of flavor. The cap was grilled to perfection, no watery residue !

Very good and different food paired with just the right combo of salty sweet and flavor packed dishes!  Only thing bad is the wait which is normally pretty long unless your a diamond or platinum then it's great but don't forget your iD

Wait was 30 minutes on a Friday night (not bad at all). The burgers were delicious (we got the Farmhouse and the Swine) but the highlight was the Parmesan Truffle Fries, they were thick cut, well-seasoned and not too truffle-y.

My first time here was back in February and there have been some changes since I last came. My recent visit was around 10/16/17 and it was still amazing. Just letting you know now that there will be a line and you will have to wait. My Boyfriend and I were a little disappointed with the Menu changes and it looks like Ramsay did a lot of consolidating on his BURGR menu. The favorites were still on there but the appetizer section was lacking and we didn't order any because of that. BUT YOU DON'T NEED IT- trust me. We both got Burger's (can't remember which ones) and a side of Truffle Fries. It's delicious, and when we advise them we want it cooked Medium Rare you best believe it comes out exactly at that temperature!! This place is amazing and you have to try it at least once if you're skeptical!

It was good. I liked the bun and burger itself but all the toppings were kind of bland. The fries were probably my favorite part of the meal. And for being Vegas, I didn't remember thinking it was crazy expensive.   And that's all I have to say about that.   Jackee

We were seated right away so that was nice. Love the location of it so you don't get lost in the Casino looking for it! My mom and I split the Crown burger, and it was pretty good but not life changing. My Dad however had the Farmhouse burger and said it was the best burger he'd ever had. He's an old man from the South who's had a lot of burgers in his time, so that's saying something. The Truffle Fries were AMAZING. Just wow. It may be an extra add into the price but they are more then worth it. Just get them.

Just an FYI: this restaurant is located in Planet Hollywood. Now for my review:  My husband loooves Gordon Ramsay. Lately he's been watching reruns of Kitchen Nightmares, and I've been trying to avoid hearing it in the background (yuck!). When we were staying in Vegas, I knew we had to go to one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. If you're dining at Burger, there'll likely be a line. We waited for about 20-30 minutes, and were offered a seat at the bar and we took it. The line seemed to die down around 10 pm (on a Sunday night).   Yes, this is a splurge. You're paying for the experience of eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant. That said, my burger was outstanding. I had the U.K. burger and it was honestly one of the best burgers I've had, if not the best. It had fresh green arugula and chutney on it.
