I'm not sure if they grow their arugula, but as someone who's currently growing lettuce, it usually only looks and tastes as fresh as it did if it was harvested recently. The other standout of the night was the white sangria. It was amazing. It has apple, pear, and cinnamon - just fantastic!  I'm only knocking off a star, because of a few things:  - I wasn't a fan of my husband's Hell's Kitchen burger. The flavor was just odd to me. - The online menu needs to be updated. - I wasn't a fan of the sweet potato fries. Maybe I wished they were more savory. They were kind of sweet, but not like dessert. It seemed like they were having an identity crisis.  Otherwise, if we're in Vegas again I might have to come back for the U.K. burger!

We were a party of 2 and went for snacks around 4pm. This place is located in Planet Hollywood and since we were staying in the same hotel, it was a no brainer for us. There was hardly any line when we arrived. But after leaving the restaurant I noticed there was a long line of hungry people wanting to eat.  I had always wanted to try a Gordon Ramsay place, and this place is true to his name.   We ordered Portobello burger and Truffle parmesan fries. Each of the fries had the perfect seasoning and right quantity of cheese. It had a perfect crust and was so flavorful. Each of the fries felt just melted in my mouth. Wanted to curl up can use them as my blanket and sleep Loved the burger too.. they perfect just perfection..  Place is definitely worth your money and time.

I had a farm burger with truffle fries. It was great for the price (very affordable burgers). Not incredibly memorable, but would come back over other local burger joints.  The atmosphere felt like a modern retro diner. I really liked the simplicity of the place despite it carrying the Gordon Ramsay name.

The burgers are amazing, and they are incredibly reasonably priced. My bloody mary was weak, which was a bummer, but the food was mega satisfying to me and my friend so that outweighs the drink experience.  I will definitely hit up this place again when I'm in Vegas.
I liked  my Lamb Burger.My dad ordwred fish and chips  and they were very ordinary. Nothing  special.I guess I was expecting  outstanding,when  it  comes  to Gordon Ramsey

Never say you've had the best burger till you've tried the burgers at gordon ramsay burger. Honestly, there's no joking around here ^^  I tried their Crown burger and it was life changing. Gotta say it kinda sucks cuz they raised the bar so damn high! Definitely get the truffle parmesan fries. It's amazing plus it comes with in house made ketchup and truffle aioli dipping sauces. And their jalapeño poppers were fire. Is it weird I only look forward to eating here when I think about vegas ^^

What can I say? The burgers were something else! We tried the anniversary burger and OMG so delicious. The ambience is casual and the price is a bit high for a burger but the burgers are not a regular burgers so it was worth every penny!!!

Stopped in for a quick lunch before heading home from LV. I thought the burger was really good; I had the Ultimate Cheeseburger (3 cheeses, provolone, boursin and cheddar). Mine was med well and it was cooked perfectly.  The bun (the unsung component of the burger experience) was really good and fresh.  The fries were meh - nothing special and it did not measure up to the burgers.  The fries were steak fries, which I'm not a fan of.  It comes with 2 house ketchups; ask for Heinz and they'll bring it to you. They have sweet potato fries, which comes with a shaker of powdered sugar and an aioli.  I'd go back when I'm in the area; it was good and not outrageously priced.

Steak was burned on outside and raw on inside, $68.00 bone in ribeye, told the server I wanted it medium rare, not rare. Complete failure and disappointment. Wanted a tasty crust, not a burned crust sear. Step your game up Gordon, you let use down.

We had a large party of 9 people and we were excited to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. We left our name with the hostess and were seated after an hour. Service was decent and friendly, but we did have to ask for water and condiments twice. We ordered a variety of burgers plus some side orders of fries (burgers are a la carte) and we all agreed that they were good, but nothing amazing. It wasn't worth the $24+ price tag. I ordered the Forest Burger which promised duck bacon and seasonal mushrooms and a side of Just Fries.The bun was nice and soft. The meat was cooked perfectly to order, but the it could have had more fat. The "seasonal" mushrooms were just criminis and shimejis which can be bought at many grocery stores. I was expecting something more exotic. The duck "bacon" was just a crispy piece of duck meat with barely any skin or fat. When you think bacon, you think a nice mix of meat and fat. The burger also had unmentioned goat cheese. I am not a big fan of goat cheese, but it worked with the burger because of the aforementioned lack of fat content.  The "fries" are thick cut British chips, not bad, but a little misleading. I can get a better quality and better priced burger back home in the San Francisco Bay Area.

So let's see two years ago when we stayed at Planet Hollywood we ate here eight times.  And now we're back!  I love this place. I've gotten a lot of items on the menu but my favorite dishes would have to be the Hell's Kitchen burger and wings.  The burger is cooked perfectly to your specifications and doesn't come soggy like most places. The bun is crisp and goes really well.   I asked for the wings to be cooked extra crispy and naked and they came out perfectly. I recommend doing it this way so the wings aren't soggy because if the sauce is on the wings too long it'll happen.  In conclusion if your staying at Planet Hollywood do yourself a favor and come here. You won't regret it.

We've eaten here a few years ago but it looks like that Yelp page has been closed so I guess a new review is in order.  While they don't take reservations, if you get there early enough, the line is maybe a 10-15 minute wait. This is absolutely one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas. I don't think you can go wrong with any burger at this place but I've got to recognize the Ultimate Cheeseburger, which is my go to item. The buns are quality, the burger is juicy and flavorful, and it has three kinds of cheeses mixed together in what can only be described as my version of heaven. My husband had the Lobster/Shrimp burger which has a shrimp/lobster type patty and pickled veggies on it. It's really a different option then the traditional burgers.   Lastly, you need to get one of their milkshakes. We didn't last time we were there so we made a point to try the Oreo Creme Brulee Shake on this trip. It is so rich and the flavor is better then just your average oreo shake because of the creme brulee pudding on the top. The cocktails we had were also on point. I don't remember what they were called but the white sangria I ordered was our favorite because it had this really nice cinnamon after taste. Do not miss this restaurant!

60 mins for a burger on a Friday at 1:30pm - this is ridiculous- its a  burger  not a entree- all we have gotten was food will be out shortly and two refills.  We had to call the manger "zack" which was very helpful but what happen was our server never put in the order - wow - food will be on the house but just wasted 1.5 hours of our time in Vegas- finally got our food and wifey burger came out over cooked wow def hells kitchen

Love this place.  I try to go to Food Network star restaurants when I can to see if they are as good as I would hope.  This did not disappoint.  I ordered the Blue Cheeseburger and Truffle Fries.  Amazing burger (albeit pricey).  If you are debating this venue vs Bobby Flay Burger Palace definitely go to Gordon Ramsay Burger.
Not a burger person but had to stop in for a try. Service was amazing. Good was well priced. And the burger was one of the best I had

OMG!!!  This place was soooooo good!!!  I'm not a huge fan of burgers, but I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay so I was willing to try with hubby.  We had the Hells Kitchen burger & Fries with Curry Sauce.  Absolutely delicious.  We would go back!  I did see children in this restaurant, but I'm still saying it's not good for children because I'm not a fan of children in Vegas.  Too much for them to be exposed to at such a young age.

I absolutely LOVE Gordon Ramsay. He is an amazing chef and I applaud all his hard work. The first time I came to this restaurant was a couple years back when they had on their menu this amazing delicate fancy fish sandwich. I came back here early june to find out they took it off their menu which was a bummer to hear but Instead I tried one of his other options I got the tandoori chicken burger I believe. It was VERY moist and had amazing flavor to it ! I highly recommend it, My husband got the hells kitchen burger and he was it was pretty damn good. and My in-laws also got great burgers but unfortunately I cannot remember them at the moment. I suggested we get the onion rings because the batter (from what I last remembered) was out of this world! His recipes are to die for and his kitchen runs so smoothly. I love how immaculate everything was. We would LOVE to come back next time.

I finally went to GR Burger, and hands down my new favorite place to go to in Vegas! Everything from the food to the service was phenomenal! If I could give it more than five stars I would! The hosts were very cheerful and accommodating. Once we sat down, Justin greeted us and gave us the complete run down of the menu. You can tell he is very passionate about what he does and has a lot of knowledge of everything on the menu. He made everything so personal and reccomended a few things for us to try. I am a total sucker for Buzzfeed Worth It episodes so I HAD to go with The Hog Burger. We also got the Truffle Fries. Everything was absolutely delicious and I cannot wait to go back again and try a new burger. A huge thanks to Justin for making our visit great!

We've heard nothing but good things about this spot. We've always wanted to stop in and get a bite but the line is always long. We finally waited in the line and it was worth it. The burgers are really good. The onion rings are the bomb. We started with the ahi sliders and they were awesome. It's definitely worth it to wait in the line.

Maannnnnnnnn I LOVE EATING HERE!!!! I used to be a dealer at Planet Hollywood so I remember when this place was first constructed. My friend at the time who was food and beverage manager for casino ended up taking over the manager position here. He kept telling me to come and that it was really good. I finally take him up on his offer and bring my friend along. When I tell you that everything we had was delicious......I mean EVERTHING! He decided to pick out all the courses for us from appetizer to the dessert. I can't remember what I had that time because it was many years back, but I do know that it was the most delicious burger I've ever had. I mean the meat was cooked to perfection and just melted in your mouth with every bite! I'm hungry thinking about it now. Been back a few times since then and the only thing that has changed is the five course meal! Everything else is exceptional and service is 5 star. You want a burger, you will not want any others after going here!

Very slow service, It took an hour to get my food and the other person at the table didn't, 10 minutes later I had to ask our server if the rest of the tables food was coming. He had to retake the order and then I had to return my food as it now was cold. They seemed not to know serving one person at a time was not normal. When we got our food 1.5 hours after sitting down. The burgers were good.  Service sucked The person came by that I assume was a manager but as she didn't speak up we couldn't hear a word she said! Don't even know if she was a manager.  They didn't seem to care!

Was in Vegas for the weekend of 6/30 to 7/2, we stayed at Planet Hollywood and this restaurant is conveniently located in the hotel. When you check in you give them your phone number and they text you when your table is ready. Which is a really nice feature because you can walk around the casino or even go back up to your room if you are staying there.  The food was delicious! I had the ultimate cheeseburger since I am a big fan of cheese, it did not disappoint really juicy and the cheese is fantastic.  We shared the truffle fries and onion rings. Personally, I liked the onion rings better, they were light and not oily. The sauces they give you are also very good. Both of my sisters really enjoyed their burgers, one is vegetarian and got the portobello mushroom burger she loved it and it did look very tasty, the other one got the blue cheeseburger she was very satisfied with the burger. All in all we all really enjoyed our food and would definalty come back next time we are in Vegas.

This place is exactly what you expect for a burger with the backing of Gordon Ramsay. In my opinion it is reasonably priced $15-22 depending which burger you get. Even the truffle fries priced at $12 is not bad especially if you share with one other person.   The only con is see is because of the wait time- but for me that doesn't warrant losing a star. If you plan accordingly and go off peak times, you should be okay.  I do not believe they have a reservation list. I came on a Monday at approx 6:30pm with my parents, we waited about 15 mins for a table (or could have been seated right away at the bar high tables). But when we came out a while later, there was a line all the way to the gaming tables- yes still on a Monday night. I've gone on a Saturday during peak time before and have waited almost 2 and a half hours for a table for 4. So don't do it and let it spoil everything.  The service was great, and the burgers are not monstrous. You will feel full and satisfied but not bloated, even with the fries. I recommend that everyone try this place.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Always tasting great and service is amazing. The manager always comes to our table to check how we're doing and if there's anything he can do to make our experience better.

What I ordered was only worth 2 stars.. I'm sure the other burgers might be good. The truffle fries was not good, and the lobster & shrimp burger wasn't either. I didn't taste any lobster.. i'm vietnamese and while eating the burger all I could think about is fish cakes my parents make. That's what resemble the patty's taste to me.. 5 of my other family members also got the lobster and shrimp burger. They didn't like it, but I think the other 6 enjoyed their beef patty burgers. Next time I'll know not to get a seafood patty for a burger lol

No.  Its not all that.  I made the mistake of ordering the pan seared lobster and shrimp burger, which our waitress, who was very attentive by the way, said was a favorite on the menu.  The menu didn't describe it as a patty.  Which is what they made this burger into, and not a good one.  The flavors just really didn't go together.  Lobster meat should never be made into a patty for F@cks sake!  I should have gone with a regular burger:(

My husband and I really enjoy watching Gordon Ramsay's shows and how dedicated he is to making his food perfect. We decided to dine here for lunch on a Thursday morning. We came a bit after they opened. Surprisingly, there are already a lot of people seated! The seating weren't as comfortable and really close together. We were seated next to another couple and basically watched them eat their burgers.   The menu offers a bunch of different items such as appetizers, soups, salads, and list of burgers to pick from. We ordered   *Farmhouse Burger 15 dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg - My husband loves fried egg in burgers. This was juicy and really delicious.   *Crown Burger 15 aged mimolette cheese, arugula, fine herb aïoli, dried tomatoes - I ordered this as I love arugula and aioli. I cut in half but it was so good that I finished the half in three bites.  True Parmesan Fries 11 - Enough for sharing. I would not order individual fries. We finished about 4/5 of our fries. The aioli sauce that came with it was bomb. Definitely the fries to get if you are dining here.   Overall, the experience was very good. One of the better burgers we've had.

Best burger my daughter has ever had! All 4 of us tried different burgers. Yummy! Cesar's salad was great we split it this is half size! Want to find out if he has other burger restaurants anywhere else! Want to go back!

Hands down the best burger I've ever had. My boyfriend and I shared the truffle fries and they were phenomenal! We were just back in Vegas and disappointed that we didn't eat here again. We'll definitely go back next time we're there. There was a really long line so we sat at the bar but the service was still great there. We enjoyed watching them prepare everything. Gordon himself even stopped in which was awesome. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.
I was in a Food coma the food was so rich and good. Line gets crazy long but food is worth the wait. Get there before they open when the line first starts. Anything on the menu is amazing!!!
Overrated! A tasty burger but I guess you can't expect to get Gordon Ramsay class meal in 30$

Burgers aren't normally my thing, and Im typically disappointed with restaurants that have big name chefs associated with them, but I reluctantly agreed to eat here with some friends after a Britney show. Holy sh*t, this is all I wanna eat the rest of my time in Vegas! I got the blue cheese burger and it was hands down THE BEST burger I have ever ate in my entire life!!! Everyone at my table ordered a different one and they all agreed... Best burger they've ever had. The staff was welcoming, knowledgeable, fast, and friendly... but honestly the staff coulda been rude and I still would've given this spot 5 stars because the food was that good. OHHH I almost forgot! The creme brûlée shakeeee! I died.

My wife doesn't like turkey burgers like I do, but she lived this one!  I really was surprised by how big and thick yet juicy and flavorful it was.  The only thing I didn't like was that they charged $12 for a small order of truffle fries.  My burger was only $2 more!

My wife and I had a good experience here.  Split a hog burger and ultimate cheeseburger.  Service is top notch, but it's a tad on the expensive side -- two burgers, fries, onion rings, and a tip for $66.  Taste-wise it was really good, with perfect levels of seasoning.  Oddly, though, after getting our food our server was sure to tell us how expensive this food would be if we got it anywhere else.... OK?
Completely worth the wait! The poutine fries were to die for and they're burgers are perfect! They also had some great craft beers on tap.  We would absolutely eat here again!

Awesome burger. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger and the potato chip nachos. Also awesome. Definitely coming back to try the other burgers. Service was super fast. Very friendly server and she knew her stuff. Ashley was fantastic

Wow, This was an amazing place and an amazing burger.  The wait was about an hour but well worth it.  The price was reasonable for Las Vegas.  The food was to order and the appetizer was good.  Definitely go here for lower priced Gordon Ramsay cuisine.

It's good. It's worth all the hype. Great burger, great sides, great service, and the wait isn't too long either. Highly recommend eating here when in town. For eating on the strip, it's reasonably priced. That being said you are easily $60 with tip for two people. Check it out!

WOW.  Let's start with the onion rings. No doubt the best I've ever had and I ordered them as appetizer at the suggestion of my waitress Julia to nibble on while they make my Backyard Burger. Great suggestion. Now it's time to move on to the Backyard Burger. The burger was delicious, sweet pickles were a great addition to the burger. Lettuce, onions and tomatoes were fresh. So with all that being said. Hats off to this amazing burger.  Ok. What about dessert? I had to try the Cream Brûlée Oreo Shake.  It sounded good on the menu and was even better on the taste buds. Great food and service makes this an easy  5 Star Review from me.

Two people in my party complained about the food but mine was pretty good.  It's a neat atmosphere and my meal was what I expected.  I do think it's overpriced for what you get.  However the burger is really good.

Had a great experience here from service to food!  Hostess greeted us promptly and provided a very accurate wait time. Once seated, our server was very prompt and exceptionally courteous.   After making our selections for drinks and food arrived rather quickly. The lettuce wrap for burgers is very well done and I was actually able to hold it and eat it and not use a fork and knife like I do at most places. The Parmesan truffle fries were fantastic! Definitely order these! They were perfect!

Gave this place a try since we are locals and have our of town guests visiting and has heard of this guys t.v show. The waitress asked if they wanted fries with their burgers and they said yes.  I saw chips on the menu and didn't know it was also fries I figured actual chips? Either way the food came out cold and boring not what this guy Gordon Ramsey would allow on his tv show so I too wanted to throw a fit like he does on the show but showed way more class. Not worth a $17 burger and $8 cold fries. Normally I'd give a place a second chance but they weren't even busy enough to excuse for the cold food.

Got the blue burger at the bar. Ordered it medium (comes out pink but not raw). They brought it out after about 20 minutes. The burger looked great (see photo). As for the taste, I was underwhelmed. Given this burger is about the blue cheese, I was surprised how little blue cheese flavor came through. Certain bites showcased the cheese and figgy jam nicely, but too many did not. Like the cheese, I wanted more jam than what was provided.   The meat itself was okay. If you want a juicer burger, you may want to try it medium rare. For a gourmet burger, I found it fairly generic.   The bun was solid. Not spectacular, but fresh, tasty, and the multicolored sesame seeds were nice.   I paid ~$21 total with tax and tip. My burger was $16.   Takeaways:  -if I could do it again I'd order the forest burger (I'm a fan of mushrooms and bacon on burgers, and the duck bacon sounded good) -worth trying for the experience, and the menu has several burger options, but don't expect to be blown away

We were in Vegas for a few days and decided to give this place a try because it was where we were staying.  We started off with potato chip nachos.  OMG, it was delicious.  We also got the hells burger and hot dog.  They were both super delicious.  The hot dog was just a little to smokey for me, but that was my only complaint.  We also ordered the plain fries that came with a curry and chipotle ketchup.  The fries were just ok, I dont think it is worth $9.  The curry ketchup was a fail.  But over all I will be back when im in Vegas and ive been telling everyone I know to go.
Ordered a farmhouse burger and took an hour and 20 mins to get it to my table. Never coming back
I have to say the Hell's Kitchen burger was BOMB! It  was worth my money, so much flavor i would definitely come back.

We came here for the first time on a Friday afternoon around 2pm, waited in line for about 10 mins (reservation not needed).   SERVICE - As good as it gets! Very friendly staff all around. Our server was great and very accommodating even though we only ordered a burger and a soup for snacks.   AMBIENCE - Very lively and crowded but you don't feel cramped. Great place for lunch or a snack when you need a break from the casino :p  [HELLS' KITCHEN BURGER] - $17 - Perfectly done. The jalapeno (actually spicy) and roasted tomatoes added a very nice kick to the flavor. The patty was super tender and juicy. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.  [CHEDDAR ALE SOUP] - $9 - Overly salty..... How is Gordon Ramsay ok with this?! (our server was kind enough to take this off our bill)

Finally tried Gordon Ramsay burger, I've attempted to come many times before but the line was always super long. I stopped by late Friday night and there was no wait at all. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was just okay, the avocado pieces were cut way too big and we had to take them out and cut them in thinner slices. Also ordered the Hog burger and it was really good, I would recommend, the patty was wrapped with bacon and all the flavors worked well together. We also ordered a side of truffle fries and it was not worth it at all for $11 it was too salty and it was giant steak fries. I think it would be better if they were regular thinner fries. The creme brûlée Oreo shake was amazing, I would recommend as well. Overall I would probably return if there was no wait.

I had written a review previously for Burger PRE-renovation but after coming here not too long before the renovation in mid-March, I have to admit small details disappointed me on our last visit a few weeks AFTER the renovation, and would disappoint the great Mr. Ramsay himself as well.   My family (fiancé, my pregnant sister & her husband, my big sister & her young daughter) and I came during the late afternoon and were told there'd be a 35 minute wait but were actually seated quickly. We noticed there was a slight change in decor and table setup, but for the most part things looked nice and new. At the table we were given the menus and ipad.   IMMEDIATELY my sisters noticed that their favorite jalapeño poppers were abolished. Lol. New burgers were introduced but they kept my favorite Hell's Kitchen, and changed up the farm burger to a farmhouse, with a different cheese. Basic sides were the same. I thought I'd like to try the forest burger next.   We were waiting a solid 15 minutes before our server came and asked what we would like to drink. She was busy I could tell but I felt that she was also flying through everything, NOT in a good way. As a former server I could just feel the tension from her juggling us, adding us to her pile of mounting mental madness.   We ordered quickly (my sisters pushing for them poppers to no avail), and then waited a lengthy 40 minutes for our food. When our food came, presentation was not as it had been before. My fiancé had a piece of old cheese melted and stuck to his plate from either another plate or from a bad dishwashing. Our server had also forgotten one order of fries which we waited til the end of our meal for. We all needed refills for tea a few minutes into our entrees because they had not been filled after we had gotten them.  Although I have had the Hell's Kitchen burger a few times previously, it wasn't the same as it used to be. I feel like in the name of profit, the restaurant has become more for tourists and not for taste. Before, whenever we got our bill I had always thought "I can't believe I'm paying so little for such a great meal and time." Now, when we got the bill I thought "This is just another typical Strip Burger joint bill for a typical Strip Burger experience". Which is sad, because it had always been a place we loved to go for a treat on the Strip every other month or so, and whenever we had friends or family in town.   Needless to say, we all won't be returning. Sorry, Gordon.

Prepare for a lineup. Hubby, baby and I were staying at PH so every time we walked by there was a line, no matter what time of day. They don't take reservations. We decided to brave it on our last night at the hotel. We waited 45 mins. We had a view of the kitchen and were shocked to see a guy without a beard net on his beard.  Our waiter was friendly. There are lots of unique burgers to choose from. I wasn't feeling brave tho so I ordered the backyard burger. Hubby got the Hell's Kitchen burger. We also shared the Oreo milkshake with creme brûlée on top. Unfortunately, fries don't come with the burgers, they are sold separately.  I got my burger cooked well done and hubby got medium. Two bites into my burger I realized that there wasn't any ketchup or sauce on it at all. It's also not provided at the table. I decided to roll with my sauceless burger and actually quite enjoyed it. The lack of ketchup and mustard allowed me to take notice and enjoy the flavour of the grilled burger and the delicious American cheddar cheese. I really enjoyed all the individual flavours.  Hubby was not blown away with his burger. He was expecting to have the best of the best and said it definitely didn't meet his expectations.  The milkshake was yummy and certainly big enough for the two of us.  Not very baby/stroller friendly.

This was an amazing burger !!!!!! Me and my boyfriend both for different ones and they were both awesome. Line was out the door all the days we were down here but we went here in our last night in town and luckily it was no wait. Eat here !!!!

$16 dollar burgers without fries. A little expensive, but the meat is so tender and in my opinion worth it.   What we ordered:   Appetizer- nachos. These were great. They come with meat and some sort of sauce. They could reduce the sauce and add a little more meat but they were good!   My fiancé ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger: a little too spicy to enjoy it. The peppers are HOT so just know that. I took a bite and couldn't believe how hot the peppers were! Fiancé says it was still delicious  My burger: the farm burger wit a fried egg =delicious. 5 stars.  Check it out. Although  expensive it's delicious!

Oh my god! The meat the meat the meat! I got my burger medium and I couldn't have made a better choice! The flavors exploded in my mouth!!!! Who needs anything else on it besides the cheese! The bun was unusual and not like anything I had had before. But it was very good and soft and paired well with the burger. The fries were a cut above and the ketchup was more than I'd expected.  A curry ketchup and a chipotle ketchup. I preferred the curry. Well worth going to.

It's not worth it. We waited in line for 40 minutes starting at 3:45 pm. If you're in a party of two, they won't take your phone number and send a text when a table is ready. You just have to stand there.   My knees were aching by the time we finally sat down. The food is good, but it was also expensive ($62 for two burgers including $4 for a tiny bit of avocado, lemonade, and a shared order of fries.   So wait time + expense means I won't go again. If they start using text messages or buzzers for parties of two, maybe. But no way will I stand in a 40 minute line again so I can pay $25 for a burger).

Went in with high expectations after a 30min wait. My fries and brown butter milkshake were delicious. However my chicken sliders were rubbery and if Gordon Ramsay himself was eating them he'd go "f*ck me.. this is ghastly"

This place doesn't disappoint . There was a long line but if you are diamond card or greater you can skip that . This 30 minutes wait at prime time only had us waiting 3 minutes .   Service was a little slow but the place was packed . Every table on a Monday night taken .   The draft beer list is is 30ish beers Long . Great for a strip non yard house restaurant    There were 3 of us for dinner .   Poutine fries - duck bacon !! Cheese and gravy  Hell's Kitchen burger -really good burger packing some heat .  Crown burger - mimolette cheese ! One of my favorite cheeses .   Overall top top burger spot in town . The Bill for the 3 items above and two draft beers $68.00 .  Not too bad and definitely worth it for the quality of burgers .

I wasn't expecting much when going here. I thought it might be one of those places people go just for the name of Gordon Ramsay. The Hell's Kitchen burger was absolutely incredible. It was moist, cooked perfectly (medium just how asked) and the bun was just the right amount of toasted. We also got the truffle fries which were delicious. The aioli that comes on the side is something you will just have to try! We will be back here again. The Only thing I didn't enjoy is that they didn't have any kind of kids options so our 4 year old helped us with the fries and had some crackers.

Be prepared to wait in line for a long time but that's OK because they have a wonderful view of a fire wall on display in the window m. the burger that I got had fried egg in it and the meat was a little tuff.

Lively atmosphere, good food, good selection of draft beers. Good, attentive and prompt service.  Hells' kitchen burger - Perfectly cooked with excellent choice of condiment combinations.  Must try IMO.  Curried shrimp salad- Perfectly seasoned and cooked shrimps with fresh and balanced salad. Highly recommended.  Hellfire chicken wings - Great flavor and great choice of wing section. It will be better if it's more spicy or have a choice to pick how spicy.  Baby black kale apple Caesar salad -  Nice salad. Wish there were more kale and the croutons were not soggy.

My husband and I are not from Vegas and whenever we think of it our mouths water over the thought of Ramsay Burger's shakes. Whaaaat!!! You have not had a great great shake until you try these.  In four days we can easily order 10 of them. They cost around $9 but it is totally worthy. Their creme brûlée one with either chocolate or cookies and cream ice cream OMG. I crave it all the time and I do not even have a sweet tooth. Also, forget about eating healthy, we are talking SHAKES. They are big and filling. They may take a bit to make but again, worth the wait. The staff in the front is helpful, some more than others but the servers, the manager and the food make up for it.  Cannot recommend it enough.

For dinner we order hummus. It was outstanding.  However for the main course i ordered veg burger which you not pleasing.  I am vegetarian and served with a burger that looks like meat and tastes like meat is not appetizing.  I hope Ramsey reconsider his recipe for veg burger.  It is not worth paying extra $6 for it.

You might have to wait to get a table, but overall the  experience was very good. A good selection of very flavorful burgers, but I was not a big fan of the truffle fries. Everything else including the service was top notch!

After waiting in line over 45 minutes, ordered our food. Got there refill of Pepsi (?). We still did not get a single pice of our food. That's pathetic.    Food came!   Soggy fries Under cooked bacon  Terrible service   The worst ever experience.   Topical Vegas attitudes, big entitlement
Just, YUM. $$$$, but YUM! We waited a bit for a table and it was expensive but it was worth it. Possibly the best burger I've ever had eating out. We also had the poutine and, again, YUM.

We came here around 10pm on Memorial Day weekend & were pretty excited to try it out since everyone had said it was amazing. We were seated within 10 minutes and a waiter came to take our order shortly after. We decided to share a burger and couldn't decide between the farmers or the Hell's Kitchen burger so the waiter told us to try the Hell's Kitchen burger and add an egg for $3. We also ordered a cheddar ale soup. The servers seemed to be gossiping amongst themselves the whole time; we were seated near the kitchen area so we could see & hear everything such as which tables sent their food back & which tables were complaining, etc because the servers were talking pretty loudly. Also, our food took forever to come out; I think we waited for at least half an hour for our one burger to arrive at the table. By the time it arrived, we were so hungry that we didn't even notice that they had forgotten our egg until we were almost done with the burger. We informed our server & he looked at our food and asked if we wanted to get the egg now -- obviously we didn't because we only had a few bites of burger left -____- the cheddar ale soup was good but a little too salty. The burger itself was pretty good, but the overall experience and wait was blahhh.

Originales y creativas las hamburguesas, pero para ser un chef, desilusionado y atormentado que las papas fritas estuvieran crudas. Esperaba más de un chef tan conocido no solo en Europa sino en América

I will be coming here again and again! I had to try this place out, because I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan. This place did not disappoint! We had about a 15 minute wait to get seated for lunch on a Monday. I had the farmhouse burger with truffle fries. As far as burgers go, they are a little pricey, but well worth it. I couldn't even finish my fries because I was so full. The fries were so good that I tried to mimic the recipe when I got home from the trip, by using left over duck fat from a big family dinner. In conclusion the best way to rate this restaurant is NOM NOM NOM!!!

This isn't a review of the food at Gordon Ramsay Burger - but rather my parties' experience - and specifically the customer service at this establishment.  My wife and I were in Las Vegas celebrating my 50th birthday with 2 other couples on 2/17/2018.  It was during the dinner hours and were happy that the wait for our party of 6 was only 30 minutes.  We were all excited to try his restaurant - having been fans of the TV program and having dined at another higher end Ramsey restaurant on previous business travel to Las Vegas.  Upon putting in our reservation at the hostess stand, we stepped to the bar, placed an order for 6 cocktails ($75 for the round of beverages), and began to watch the Winter Olympics on the TV at the bar.  After a few minutes a hostess approached my wife and explained that we couldn't stand were we were  (at the bar).  Upon surveying the area - I at first thought that the server was saying that we couldn't stand near the area of the bar where they pick up bar orders (i.e. near the rail) or we were in the way of the servers -- we were not.  I totally understand this -- so I made a point of moving down, making certain that we were well clear of the server area.  A few minutes later the server returned -- and very RUDELY told my wife and friends that we "YOU NEED TO MOVE"  (no "please" and in a very rude tone)  *** Important note *** several seats were EMPTY at the bar.   I explained we were having our drinks that we had just ordered -- and the server explained that it was "against policy" and that we would have to stand outside of the restaurant "on the carpet".  We walked back to the hostess stand --  I requested an explanation of the policy from the hostess and she reiterated the same.  Not satisfied with this, I requested to speak with the manager.  He came over - apologized, but said that was "the policy" -- the bar was "full service" and we would have to wait outside of the area.  I explained to him that I had just ordered a round of drinks and pointed out that ample seating was available -- I suppose I could understand if they had diners at the bar... but not really ... these weren't "tables" in the bar ... this was "the bar" -- and we were customers!  Unbelievable!   I explained to the manager that my friends and I were all frequent Las Vegas business patrons -- and didn't appreciate the terrible customer service.  Even if it was a "policy" - the server had no excuse to speak to my wife in such a rude and inappropriate manner.  He apologized for that (indicating he would speak to her) and offered to attempt to seat us -- but at this point I couldn't see giving the establishment another dollar.  Before leaving, I returned to the bar to put my $14 cocktails in "go cups" and the bartender also apologized for the policy.  Very unfortunate as I had enjoyed my other experience at GR restaurants - but given this experience will not return on future business or leisure trips.   I've been to many restaurant bars in my years of business and leisure travel -- but never experienced a policy like this - nor been treated so rudely.  Las Vegas has many great restaurants with exceptional customer service -  and we experienced several over our long weekend --- Gordon Ramsey Burger is not one of them.
A good burger place. You can stick with the norm or you can try something a little bit different. Service was fine, fast and efficient.

got the Hell's Kitchen Burger ($17), which was cooked perfectly (medium rare, as requested), an order of their regular fries ($8), and the Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad ($15).   As burger joints go, this one was actually pretty standard (compared to Au Cheval in Chicago, or even Five Guys), and the real taste probably came from the ingredients themselves, not the way they were prepared. That being said, it's pretty hard to go wrong with a burger, and the patty itself was pretty well cooked but didn't really give it the OOMF that separates a good burger from a great one.   Salad was...okay, but looking back I probably should've tried another burger (the wheat berries and all the fruits in there made the taste quite strange)  Of course, I could've had the one "off" burger of the night, as this place is cram packed with at least a 1hr -1.5hr wait during dinner, and they must've been churning out burgers by the dozens. Still, if I gotta be 100% honest, Cheeseburger+Cajun Fries at Five guys for much less money vs the Hell's Kitchen Burger at Gordan Ramsey....taste-wise and value-wise, Five Guys wins xD (insert a Buzzfeed video haha)
Hot Dog = Food Poisoning  I've never had food poisoning until now, thanks a lot Gordo.

This is definitely one of those restaurants that you must try!  Be prepared for a long wait, or piggyback onto a Diamond VIP client for speedy service.  Burgers are outstanding!  Perfectly seasoned beef, cooked to your taste.   We ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger:  aged provolone,!dublinar, boursin cheese over 1/3 ground chuck patty. Hog burger:   Mangalista pork, bacon, BBQ pork, white cheddar, crispy onions. Truffle Parmesan fries: crispy, tasty and excellent dipping sauces. Curried shrimp salad:  curried marinated shrimp, apple cider vinaigrette  Cheddar ale soup with pretzels- tasted like beer, cheese, and soft pretzels

Super tasty burgers! Didn't know how big the side of fries were so I didn't end up finishing it. Only reason why I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 5 was because our waiter sucked!! His name was Chase and he seemed to be in another world or just purposely ignored us the whole time. He would help all the tables around us but he wouldn't help us. After we got our food he did not come once to ask if we needed anything. We waited sooo long to get our check even after another waiter told him we were asking for it!! It was ridiculous. Other than that the food was great.

This place is awesome. You get your money worth at this place. I ordered the farm house burger. It was delicious. I also ordered the truffle fries which too were delicious.   The waitress was great and speedy. Every time my soda was about half full, she was quick to bring me a fresh drink. AWESOME!!!!  I ordered a burger, fries and drink and left full with fries left over. This is a definite stop place if you're looking for a great burger.
Very good burger cooked perfectly. Fries were also great Homemade  Ketchup was the best.

I loved this place! We had a couple of burgers and truffle fries which were extremely delicious! And at the end of the meal we had a brown butter pecan shake and it was out of this world ! I absolutely recommend this place!!!

This is one of my favorite burger places and I stop by whenever I'm in Vegas! Good food, nice setting and great drinks...you can't go wrong!There's always a line but don't be intimidated, it goes by relatively quickly! And you can always sit at the bar if you're in a rush!
It truly was as good as it gets. Excellent customer service. Staff made sure to compensate for delay and unavailability of some items on the menu. Place was crowded but I can't complain.

Probably one of the best burger restaurants I have been to in Vegas. Gordon Ramsay does not disappoint. I especially love the huge photo of him in the middle of the restaurant with his arms crossed, staring at all of his customers as if to say "Yeah, you know that burger is delicious"   My favorite here is actually the truffle fries. So so so good. Probably the best truffle fries ever. I have only had truffle fries as good as these in LA at a hot dog joint called Wurstkuchen.   I have ordered the Mushroom Burger here and it was ah-maaazzziiinnggg. The last time I came, I ordered the Ahi Sliders instead and pretty much doubled over, with how delicious it was. I was also a bit drunk too. My boyfriend ordered the burger with the jalapenos and the avocado in it ( can't remember what it was called) and I had a bite of it, we both loved it and didn't want to put it down.   We made some friends in the line waiting for a table and the staff was so accommodating and let us move our table to sit with our new friends.   It was also my birthday and they brought over free dessert, which was so sweet! Delicious. I don't really remember what kind of dessert it was considering how hammered I was, all I remember was that it was yummy.

Food was great and worth the wait! Staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend you give it a shot, you'll probably be back for more! I got the hell's burger and two orders of fries for the table we would've been okay with just one for us three. Not expensive compared to other restaurants we've visited on our trip to Vegas.

This place was so amazing we went two days in a row. The first day we had the Parmesan truffle fries and ahi sliders. The second day we had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the Hog Burger. They were both packed full of flavor and absolutely delish. I can't wait to return!

This was my second visit here, so it's not like it is terrible. The burgers are fine. Because of the price and the hype, I expected them to blow my mind, but they are just ok. This time, we were there on a Tuesday afternoon, so it wasn't crowded, and yet the service was still slow. I think the part that got me was that when I flagged down a waiter from another table to point out the cockroach skittering across the floor, he didn't even speak to me; he just scooped it up in a napkin and went back to laughing with his waiter-buddy. I would have thought a comment "oh dear" or brief apology would have been in order. I definitely get a "we don't care; we don't have to" vibe from this place. Overall: Meh.

Great first time experience here, came early on a NFL Sunday and got table next to the bar. Server was excellent and told us all about menu and we chatted about Ramsey for a bit. Seems he drops by every couple of months to check up on things. Kinda of nice to know that he's not just selling his name.  I started with the onion ring appetizer which was probably the best I be ever had. The Maui onion lent a sweetness that really popped in my mouth like no other onion I've had. The batter was light and very flavorful and not greasy. My wife and I split the Forest  and Tandoori chicken burger and enjoyed them both, maybe a bit of an edge to the Forest because when I think of burgers I think beef, but can't go wrong with either. The service was a bit slow, but I don't mind when the product is this good. It is a busy restaurant and they want to make sure the experience is good, so just don't go if you're in a rush.  If you want quick service go to McDonald's. The only negative from me is the dining room is a bit bleh, just cafe style. Would have been nice to have been a little more upscale. But overall, I highly recommend and cannot wait to go back and try more items next time I'm in Vegas.

Huge GR fan , I love that man ! So of course  I had to try this place out . Being my first time here I had to order a little of everything   and it was definitely  worth it . Once seated service was great  and our waiter made awesome recommendations.  Once we got our food .. AMAZING .... jalapeño poppers ...awesome ...gooey fries...delicious!I'm not a big duck fan but it was simply amazing ...we also had the  truffle fries ...which were cooked to perfection with amazing dip...ONLY one thing ...I sent my burger back because I did order my burger medium well and it was a little over well done ..nonetheless they redeemed themselves with a Hell's Kitchen  burger cooked to perfection. Of course I'll be back because I LOVE GR!

We are fans of Gordon Ramsay and would love to try out his restaurants without breaking our piggy banks, so we decided to try Gordon Ramsay burger next after trying Gordon Ramsay fish and chips!  We started to wait for our turn since 7pm on a Tuesday evening and it took us about an hour to get a table for two. Our nice and friendly server gave us really clear explanations on items on menu and he even gave us a heads-up that our food would take at least 45 minutes to prepare, as the kitchen was busy.  We ordered the following for two of us without any sides, so as to not over feed our tummies: 1) "Foie" burger  The foie gras is just a spread on the bun. We weren't able to taste the foie gras spread as the taste of port wine aioli had overpowered the taste of foie gras spread. We probably won't recommend this burger, as it didn't look as appetizing as other burgers served on other tables. 2) Wheatberry-Quinoa salad The chicken skewer was tender and it went really well with the salad. The salad is slightly on a sour side. If there is some sweet mandarin oranges or sweet peaches added to this salad, this will be perfect! The portion is good to share among 3 or 4 people.   We will still go back to try other burgers.

So, I totally love this place. Been here three times and will continue to come back when I'm in Vegas.   I reviewed GR Burgr when it was at the "other location" but it was lost on yelp due to the alleged relocation. However, the restaurant never moved, maybe they redecorated, but it's still at the same spot in the Planet Hollywood resort right off the strip.   Parking is a B! The PH parking is in the back of the resort and the attached miracle mile mall. It's a true workout to walk from the parking garage to the restaurant so you'll be good to chow down when you get there.   We ordered four burgers and three sides and three drinks bill was $126. Well worth the price. The burgers are always juicy and delicious. There are a bunch of different topping combinations on the menu to chose from.   My beef (lol) with them is (1) they exchanged the goat cheese off of the crown burger for a melty cheese which is still good but not the same, and, (2) the chips, or as we call them fries, are dry. Idk if that how they like them in England but I stick with the sweet potato fries and the onion rings for sides because both of them are awesome.  Even with these two beefs, it's still the BEST burger restaurant I've been to. If you're on the fence, just go.

So sad... one of my favorite Las Vegas stops has gone to dumpster. For several years now I have made a tradition of eating here when in town for our annual trade show. This time was just so bad! First of all, after waiting in line for thirty minutes (understandable in the past) we were seated. Then it was no less then 15 minutes before a server came to our table. After we placed our order it took 40 minutes to get our food and even then the order was wrong. I asked to speak to the manager and instead of taking responsibility, which he should have (since these are management issues), he walked away saying he wanted to talk to the server. She returned with a check which instead of comping our meal or at the very least removing the entree that was wrong, he had the waitress remove the automatic 20% gratuity. Just so bad. If Gordon Ramsey new what was going on, heads would roll. We tipped the waitress anyway and left a tip for the manager (a note about what an ahole he was!"
Had the Farmhouse Burger. One of the best burgers I've ever eaten. Great atmosphere, super friendly staff, excellent food. Five stars easy.

The wings are worth trying. They are a good size and have a great flavor. We paid around $75 for a party of two. The food taste good, but it's not the best I have ever had. It's all about the hype. Just a one time thing. Wasn't too impressed. Great service.

This place lives up to the high standards you see during the tv shows. There wasn't anything negative about our lunch experience and we absolutely loved the food!!   Parmesan truffle fries and farmhouse burger were perfectly prepared and DELICIOUS!!!!   You'll need to wait in a line to get in, but it moves rather quickly. Once seated and your order is placed, it does take about 40-45 mins to receive your food (which seems like forever when your hungry) but the results are worth the wait.

Our first night in Vegas for a work event and headed to burger. One of our friends had come here before and raved about it. We waited, maybe 20 minutes,  which wasn't too bad. We all ordered different items and had great service.  But what grossed us all out was that there was a baby cockroach crawling across the floor right by our feet in a walkway for customers and staff.  One busboy saw me see the cockroach, stepped on it, looked back at me with an "oh $hit" look on his face and scooted the cockroach from where he stepped on it towards the kitchen . Yes, the kitchen!! We never spoke to a manager because we were completely grossed out. The food was excellent but the bug issue totally turned us off. Call an exterminator,  Gordon!
As advertised. All types of fries are amazing. Burgers outstanding. Great place if you don't want a fancy dinner or fast food.
Only wish you guys had brought back the jalapeño poppers!!! Gordon, please bring them back!!!

We decided to have dinner here last night after the Britney concert. We had to wait about 20 minutes and were seated at the bar. The bartenders were great and attentive. I ordered the wings and my husband ordered the ultimate cheese burger and onion rings. Best we have ever had. Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly.

The wait is long, but it's worth it if you have your heart set on it.  I'm not the biggest burger fan, but the patty was thick and juicy at medium-doneness without turning the bun into a hemoglobin sponge. I got the forester which has truffled goat cheese and duck bacon. There was plenty of truffle flavor, but the duck bacon wasn't anything memorable. It wasn't the best burger I've had, but it was still top notch.  My favorite part of the meal was the appetizers. The kettle chip nachos taste like an upgraded version of something you might find at the Tilted Kilt. They were good, but the hell fire wings were better. They're cut so that they're easier to eat, and they're fried perfectly so that the skin is crispy while leaving the meat moist. The buffalo sauce is not too hot and slightly sweet, but it's more like a glaze such that it doesn't ruin the crispy texture. Finally, they're topped with some blue cheese. I loved them. Still, my favorite dish was the truffle fries, and that's solely because of the truffle aoli. The truffle scent from the aoli dominates the atmosphere no matter what else you have on your table. It looks thick and heavy, but it instantly melts into a rich cloud of truffle flavor once it's in your mouth. I could've stuck my straw in the sauce cup.  Finally, that oreo creme brulee shake is great if you like rich desserts. The creme brulee pudding layer is very sweet and heavy, and the oreo milk shake layer is runny with no iciness. Getting a little bit of both in each sip is key.  While Gordon's was great, I don't feel right giving it 5 stars when comparing it to other world class burger joints. For example, I still think Chicago's Au Cheval has a much better burger. Still, it's worth a visit if you're in the area.

Drool. I've been somewhat underwhelmed with some of the food we have had while in Vegas. And my hunt for something healthy and tasty has been challenging... This place is in no way healthy, but OMG is it delicious. I got a caramel butter pecan shake with my burger and truffle fries. I literally moaned and talked about the shake the whole time I was drinking it. And it was gone by the time our burgers and fries came out. The burger had 3 cheeses on it and was made perfectly. The truffle fries were the best I've ever had... And this may sound odd, but the chairs were so comfortable. It was a nice place to relax for a few after roaming around the strip. And I like the pyrotechnic decor at the entrance. It's a nice touch.
Being a fan of all things GR I've been here a few times.  It's a great place for Hell's Kitchen fans to reminisce about the episode/competition filmed here.  It is really too pricey for what you get.

First, you give the hostess your number and they will text you when you're up. You have 10 minutes to get back. Great idea!  I got a turkey burger with fries and onion rings.  Burger patty was delicious but the bread was so forgettable. The patty itself had that smoky over flames on the grill flavor and was quite moist. Fries were subpar; I've definitely had better.  Onion rings were a dream. They are thick, juicy, flavorful, and addicting. Covered in parmesan cheese, I couldn't get enough. The ranch was amazing too as it is made with little bits of cheese that compliment the onion rings perfectly.  Service was good. Our waiter actually suggested that instead of us each getting our own fries, we share as there quite large. He was right. Thanks for the tip!
Food awesome.  Long waits and pricey.  But the burger was the bomb.  Truffle fries should be shared.  Little pricey but good.  Long waits n

Don't need to post the food. Wait time is a horrific 2 1/2 plushours. Okay its the New Year's weekend, but we started waiting at 10:15 p.m. on the couples line. The hostess at the front desk never informed us that a party of three or more needs to check-in for a table. We waited at the couples line for 45 minutes.   Once we got to the front of the line, we were informed that we needed to check-in for a party of three or more. We barely had our name on the list at that time. We waited an extra 40 minutes. I complained to the manager on duty that they should post signs in front of their establishment about check-in procedures. They shouldn't put signs that aren't visible at the couples line. They also should have their hostesses inform guest about their check-in procedures.  Meanwhile, after being seated at 11:40 p.m., we're still waiting for our food at 12:27 a.m. NEVER GO HERE.

Best Burger in Vegas/the world. The Hell's Kitchen Burger and off the menu F-word burger are both outstanding. Parm fries and onion rings will be the best you ever eat. They both come with 2 flavorful sauces that will blow your mind. Whiskey lemonade and Caribbean Dreams to accompany the meals were awesome and refreshing.  If you get there when they are opening don't panic at the huge line- it moves fast and the food is very much worth the wait.  Server was excellent. They are quick service and delivery, but you don't feel rushed out the door.  The atmosphere is casual and fun and the food presentation is on point! Fire feature adds a lot to the experience.  Highly recommended.

Expect it to be very busy! If you have a party of 3 or more, walk up to the hostess without waiting in line and inquire your reservation. There is also a sign with its instructions too if you did wait in line like me without reading the huge prints!! Lol the line is only lent for parties of 2 or less. When you request your reservation from the hostess, they ask for a contact number to send you a text when the table is ready for seating. Usually takes about 30 minutes wait time to get our table, so just stick around the area and/or do a little shopping.   I love the seating arrangements. There's quite a few bar areas and good lighting especially if you're next to the glass wall of fire .  Let's talk about their menu! It's like a British flag  that unfolds like an origami!! Lol jk more or less.   Now let me talk about the service! Gordon Ramsay trained their crew perfectly, cuz when you talk gourmet burger, my tastebuds felt gourmet expectations lol All the servers are very keen on our needs and all ways checked back on our table for feedback.   I purchased a Forest Burger = tremor cheese, forest mushrooms, duck bacon $15, Farm House Burger = dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg $15, and Sweet Potato Fries $8.   I'll end this review with a famous quote, "why did the chicken cross the road? Because it was way too f@#%*ing undercooked!" - Gordon Ramsay

My boyfriend and I ate here for the first time today and we both loved it . I had the Hell's Kitchen burger with bacon my boyfriend had the Farmhouse Burger we both really enjoyed our burger . Service was great too and the wait wasn't to bad , we will different be back here again

I'm honestly not happy with any of the service I've received one bit...first of all it started with a friend of mine and I being placed at this wobbly table about the size of a nightstand that was directly next to the excessively loud kitchen(not saying the kitchen should be quiet but why have a table right next to it) but I then requested to be placed at a booth I had seen a pair of people sitting at and soon after left but the waiter said she couldn't sit us there because you need a party of 3 when I just watched a party of 2 eat Nd leave she then began to make the whole experience awkward as can be by literally staring me and my buddy in the face for about 20 seconds after we ordered....nothing said, just a weird blank stare and she continued to do this for the remainder of my stay.... I then requested to have a side of ranch which took 3 reminders to finally get and also never got a refill throughout the whole night I've been here before and spent countless hours and dollars at this establishment but I have yet to be absolutely satisfied with my stay nothing on my table that night was served properly and it's a shame I had to experience this but nobody is perfect even a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant.

The food at Gordan Ramsay did not disappoint. I ordered one of the more popular items on the menu (Hells' Kitchen Burger - $16). For the name and the quality, I would say that the burger is definitely worth the hype.  The only complaint I have is the wait time. I came with a party of 9 and we were promised a wait time of 45 minutes to 1 hour which is what we had anticipated; however, our wait time gradually increased until it hit 2 hours and 30 minutes.   On the bright side, the manager was very sincere and provided two plates of mushroom poutine on him.   Overall, I would recommend the place if you are in a smaller party (2-4) and willing to wait in a line for about 15-20 minutes.
I recommend the Farm house burger!  Be adventurous and trust the fried egg!.  The Parm fries were also good.

Lots of times a "celebrity" restaurant falls flat...not in this case!  While they do not take advanced reservations, the line moves rather quickly, so don't get frustrated!  We ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the Bleucheese Burger along with a (mandatory) order of Truffle Parmesan Fries. Let's put it this way...the BEST burger I've ever had!  Don't fret, you will thank me later!!
Had the Blue Cheese Burger and it was phenomenal. One of the best tasting burgers I've had!

Good atmosphere. The food was DELICIOUS, TASTE WAS excellent,  BEST BURGER in vegas! Get the Hells kitchen burger. You won't regret it. Very happy with the quality of food here, this chefs resturant did not disappoint unlike guy fierries. This one you won't be disappointed that's forsure

This place is sure popular at all times! We waited about an hour and a half to be seated. When we ate here in April (I know, super late review), they were in the process of switching over the menu so the server notified us of a back up in the kitchen and that the food could take up to 45 minutes to come out. Kind of annoying after having waited so long for a table, but whatever. The Tandoori Chicken burger was great. I really liked the vinaigrette. My husband got the U.K. Burger and really enjoyed it as well. We liked the food but felt it wasn't exactly worth the price or long wait. Overall, it's a yummy and trendy celebrity chef restaurant that you should at least try once!

Love the burgers here. Every burger takes around 20minutes to make but it taste pretty good. My 2 favorites are the special 10 year anniversary burger they have and the lobster and shrimp burger. I really like the fries here, sweet potato fries with sugar coating on top and the parmesan truffle fries.    Anniversary burger - 22$, patty is delicious, can do workout the pork on the top Lobster and shrimp burger- 26$, light and tasty

Great place to get some stunning burgers. I've been here three times and I've never been disappointed by the burgers or entrees.   One thing I must say about the chips (French fries) is that they can be so hard or stale sometimes. I'm not sure if this is affected by when I go in (the later I go in, the more stale the chips get), but it's a bit annoying because I love having fries with my burgers. The sauces are good but I would love some more universally friendly versions of them. I know the curry sauce had a very overwhelming spice to it.   The burgers are good. The salad (pictured) is also great. It's Gordon Ramsay, what else do you expect?   The only reason why I took two stars off was because the service is always sooooooo slow. I don't get it. I understand that it'll get a little slower when it's busy, which is fine, but even when it's not and there's barely a line, my server will always forget something or take forever to check up on me.   Otherwise, it's a great burger joint. Maybe avoid the fries if you can? Breading on the onion rings were stellar!
The best burger I ever had!! All the sauces are great and milkshake was phenomenal! I'll go back to Vegas just for this place lol

I tried the hog burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger as well as the curry fries and the nachos. The nachos I had here were the greatest nachos I have ever had mostly because of the English cheese sauce that they added. The fries were crispy and well done, but the curry was not as rest. Curry was decent but not really my taste. The burgers were extremely juicy and flavorful. I think I finally found a better burger place than. In-N-Out.

This is one of the worst burger joints I have visited in recent years. I waited 45 minutes for my order and I received terrible service. Staff behind counter were talking incessantly about non-work related affairs and servers were not attentive at all. After the ridiculously long wait, I received a burger that was dry, had no flavor and nothing at all what I expected from a restaurant with Gordon Ramsay's name branded on it. Do not come here if you are ever on the Vegas strip.

After waiting about 15 minutes, to get seated due to line outside of the restaurant, I was finally invited to come inside.  I ordered the hells' kitchen burger the wait for the burger and anticipation grew my curiosity why are people talking so much about the famous Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood. I didn't take a photo there are plenty on here anyways.  There it was the ultimate creation in front of me perfectly crafted. I had little doubt how would it taste with sesame seed bun, avocado, jalapeños, roasted tomatos and cheese. After i took that first bite, it was like harmony of different flavors working as one not fighting but working together. I was really happy and enjoying every single bite of this masterpiece  burger. I don't know what else to say try it for yourself, I am definitely coming back for more....

Came to Vegas so many times and finally had chance to try that famous burger. Maybe because i came after lunch time there was no line.  But i was so dosappinted, we ordered a hell's kitchen burger ,hog burger and truffle fries. And i asked the jalapeno on the side for my hell's kitchen burger. The fries had came first and it not crispy enough and sauce tasted very light. Then burger came i noticed there was only one set of silverware on our table. Meanwhile the buser dropped plates and cups while cleaning the table. The burger was over charred and i noticed i didnt see my jalapeno on the side after my first bit , guess where was it? yep it was inside my burger! so i just moved on the side. My server came and asked how everything i said its spicy and i thought its on the side then he just ignore what I said and walk away. Well i dont usually complain, but for the famous restaurant like that i expected more. We all know Gordon is a high standard person and thats why he is famous and successful. We expected his restaurants are same high standard. For people who want to have a nice burger i suggest you go in and out.

I am not just a fan but a worshipper of Gordon Ramsay and I have learnt to review a restaurant from HIM through each and every show and tweet and youtube video that he does. I am very very disappointed with the restaurant and to some extent the food. The service is very bad and the staff is clearly overworked. I ordered the Hog burger, the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the truffle fries. The Hog burger was welldone and COLD it must have been sitting around for a while. The fried we had to send back because they were stale and dry. The only good thing was the Hell's Kitchen Burger done medium well done to the T. The server was proactive and ready to replace our fried immediately but you should at least get fresh fried after 40 mins of waiting and not much crowd (most of the tables were empty since it was Sunday 10 p.m). No body likes cold fries or cold burgers. :( :(

This is the best burger place in Vegas. I just spent 5 days with the family in Vegas and we visited a number of burger places.    Pros - the service is terrific!!!  They have a very organize waiting process for table which is not the case at most places.  Everyone is friendly.  And food is delicious!!!  No cons  Burgers are great, also try the BBQ sandwich-I loved it.  Truffle fries are great and so are the onion rings.

My farmhouse burger was great. We will be going back before we leave. Also, this was by far the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. The wait staff was an example that there is no "I" in team.

Last time we were in Las Vegas we tried Gordon Ramsey's Fish n' Chips and liked it a lot. This popped up and we decided to give it a try. It is expensive for what it is, but not overly so for the venue and association. The food we have had all our life is given a different experience with different presentations, textures and flavors. Together, we shared the ale soup, Hell's Kitchen burger and onion rings. I don't think we can be regulars here, but we wouldn't mind coming back some day. Also, be prepared to wait. We came at the end of the day and there was still a small line; waiting 30-40 minutes. Others that came behind us reported the line was six times as long earlier in the day.

It's a bit of a challenge going here with a large party, we definitely waited much longer than just waiting in the line and sitting separately. After about a 50min wait we finally got to our seats YAY! We already knew what we wanted since we had 50min to decide before we sat. I must say it was absolutely worth the wait not to mention they make everything fresh so the burger wait time is another 30 min or so. We had these bomb truffle fries while we waited for the deliciousness. I highly recommend the Hell's Kitchen Burger with bacon so full of flavor it tasted like Heaven despite coming from the kitchen of Hell lol pardon the corniness. My son had the Hog burger which was yummy as well a 1/4 beef patty wrapped in bacon topped with pulled pork and some sweet pickles to add some balance yum. I would definitely comeback and maybe just play some machines if a wait is necessary. Thanks again Chef Gordon

A must stop visit if you're a fan of Gordon Ramsey's work. That man knows how to slice and dice so lets see what his creation tastes like.   So glad that there wasn't a line or wait when we had came here. We get promptly greeted by the host and seated within minutes upon check in. The server came out to introduce himself and took our beverages and order. It was my friends and I first time eating here so the waiter was extremely helpful on pointing out which one to try. He suggested the Hell's kitchen Burger for me so I took his suggestion.  The restaurant was semi busy during the lunch rush so the food came out in a fairly decent time. Our server was amazing. He catered to our every needs so the customer service here is superb.  As I bit into the burger, I could immediately taste the seasoned, savory, juicy burger going down my esophagus. I felt the heat from the grilled jalapeños and jalapeños aioli spread swirling on my tongue. The egg yolk was gushing down the burger which gave it a nice syrupy coating to the sandwich. The cheese also gave it that sharp taste and creamy texture. There was so many flavors and texture happening all at once. The sesame buns was a great choice of bread. A solid burger if you were to ask me! Sweet potato fries were good as well but I could care less about it.   The ice cream smoothie dessert was great itself.  Nothing special but a delicious treat to eat none the less. Overall, it was an great dining experience for a first timer. And yes I would recommend it to a friend!
Burger is not that great. Had high expectations before eating, kind of disappointed. The patty was not delicious at all.

True to Vegas style, Gordon Ramsay Burger has an over the top commercial vibe but a pleasant enough atmosphere. Service was pretty good. We started with the kettle chip nachos which had a decadent delicious creamy cheese sauce and tender short rib beef topping, pretty yummy. We also had the truffle Parmesan fries that were thick, crispy, while being soft on the inside, really satisfying. The burger selection was pretty impressive and definitely had something for everyone. I chose the farmhouse burger which I have to say was pretty delicious with a nice large juicy patty, thick chunks of bacon and an oozy egg. My one complaint is that the burger patty was a little under-seasoned for me. I heard no complaints about anyone else's burgers. All in all I would recommend this place if you're a Gordon Ramsey fan and your craving a solid delicious burger and satisfying pub food.

If the food weren't so amazingly incredible and the staff so wonderful, I'd take a star away because waiting next to the fire wall for 20 mins when you've been out in the 114° heat of Las Vegas is kind of frustrating. But geeze the food is amazing!!!

Holly Molly! I don't eat too many Burgers but... I will take Gordon Ramsay home with me forever!!!  Prime location in the Strip within the Planet Hollywood hotel. There are enough servers to take good care of the hundreds of people that have the pleasure to stop by in a daily basis.  I ordered the Blue Cheese Burger ($15) with Manchego cheese, figgy Jam, arugula, took off the Spicy Mayo and it was GLORIOUS!  The patty was perfectly cooked, it was juicy and tender but not runny, the Figgy Jam was sweet and was the perfect combination with the Blue Cheese chunks.   I also had the Truffle French Fries ($12). Steak fries, crunchy outside but soft in the inside.   The servers were welcoming and very attentive.    I will come back while in exciting Las Vegas.   Cheers!
The service was very slow. It toke almost an hour to get our burgers.  Also it wasn't that tasty
Best burger and great service with added bonus of being able create a chicken version to any of the burgers

Not a hater by any means, but Gordan Ramsey might want to consider an undercover boss episode for his own burger joint to prove he's better at cooking than talking. The burger itself is a 3 star but considering the price and availabilities in Las Vegas, this doesn't live up to the hype at all. The worst part about the burger is the bun. The best part about Gordan Ramsey Burger is the drink refills.

Is it weird that I read everything on the menu in Gordon Ramsay voice?  Big dawg was huge and full of flavor. Crown burger cooked just right but feel like it needed more oomph. Still enjoyable. Parmesan truffle fries are amazing.  Wait is a little long so be prepared during prime times.

Came here for the weekend for my friends bday and she wanted to try Gordan Ramsay restaurants.   Order the tuna sliders for appetizer which was amazing! LOVED IT!   For entree, I order the FOIE Burger and Truffle Parmesan Fries.  Two of my most recent cravings... Foie gras and Truffles :) :) :) NOM NOM GOOD!   Got the burgers finally, took a little while. It was tasty and juicy but I didn't really see the foie in my burger and the truffles aioli was delicious, you actually saw the foie gras in the aioli. The burger was juicy and cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish it, def a big portion.   I enjoyed the burger and will definitely come back.

Had the opportunity to come to Vegas for an industry related event, so of course a group of us had to visit at least one of the celebrity-owned establishments on the Strip. We opted for the moderately priced Gorden Ramsay Burger, located inside Planet Hollywood and were seated faster than the given wait time (early weekday evening).  Ambience is definitely buzzing, and the establishment was smaller than expected.  Food was great, as stated by my group who had the Truffle Fries, Bleu Cheeseburger, Hell's Kitchen Burger, and their off-menu special, The F-word (in honor of G-Ram's new show).  Fries come thick-cut with 2 sauces, Hell's Kitchen was not as fiery as presumed, and the F-word was mouthwateringly delicious, with its dry-aged ribeye and short-ribs. I myself had the Tandoori Chicken burger, which was on the dry side and begging for more of the scrumptiously-described tahini & mint vinaigrettes. On the other hand, love the black & white sesame bun aesthetic.  Skip the jumbo onion rings.  Service was 3/5. Kept our waters filled but the food took a good while.  The experience was not as amazing as I expected, but I'd recommend stopping by for a good beef burger.

I love coming here every time I'm in Vegas!  Unfortunately, they changed their menu recently.   I always get the Hells Kitchen Burger! It has a nice heat to it. I always have to share because their burgers are pretty big.   Since they no longer have the gooey fries, I got the kettle chip nachos instead. They were a decent substitute, but still miss them!   The fries are more like steak fries. They had the texture as if the fries have been sitting under a heat lamp. It was crispy but a strange crispy.   Still coming back but I really wish thy bring back the gooey fries!

Hands down, best burger.  This review is a few months late but wanted to put this here since I just did one for the Fish & Chips joint and didn't feel the same way there.  The fact that I am still craving the Hell's Kitchen burger after few months proves that it was memorable.  The patty was juicy and not heavily seasoned.  I could taste the natural flavor of the beef and each ingredient inside the burger added a different layer and dimension to the bite.  The whole burger felt thoughtful and made complete sense.  I've never felt that way about a burger before so that was a first.  I should've ditched Fish & Chips and went back here last vegas visit.    Truffle fries were superb.  I am picky about my truffle fries.  Sometimes they can feel like when you're trapped in an elevator with someone with way too much perfume.  Not this one.
