Here's the thing...... my review is very limited because, for some bizarre reason, upon arriving in Vegas for a mini-vacation, I was battling some kind of stomach flu and/or was seriously overtired.  I did manage to take one bite of the burger my husband ordered, but that's all I could muster.  I must say, for that one bite, it was OUTSTANDING.  The beef literally melted on my tongue, and it was easy to tell it was very high quality.  The flavors were excellent, and while there was more waiting for me to eat, I just couldn't.  Everyone else devoured their burgers and 2 types of fries that were ordered (plain and truffle fries).  Oh, if only I was feeling better........ but for that one bite, yeh, I am reporting excellence on that.  Gordon Ramsey Burger is located in a very heavily smoke-filled Planet Hollywood, so if you are sensitive to smoke, beware.  Please also note that the wait-time can be quite long.... no matter what time you go !!  They do not accept reservations.

It's simply the best burger you will have in your life.   I did a review for this restaurant before but I see yelp created another page for it so I will update you guys on this one. This is my second time here and the experience was just as good as the first. It's located inside of Planet Hollywood not too far from PF Chang's. This time, we did have to wait about 15-20 minutes in line before being seated. The last time...we simply walked right in. If you have a group of three or more, you will be seated a lot quicker than those with just two people. The service is fantastic! Not one complaint there.   As per usual, the burger, the fries and the drinks are AMAZING! The flavor is intense and the burgers just melt in your mouth! The fries are big enough to share (try the truffle fries). As expected, it's not expensive but it's not cheap either. A drink gets is $13 and the burgers are between $15-$30.    I would recommend the Crown Burger or the Backyard burger if you are looking for something simple. I'm definitely going to try the lobster and shrimp burger next! I hear great things about it!

Our table of 4 each ordered a different burger. For starters the nachos and I must say the shredded beef was delicious but with the cheese sauce and fried potato chips it was greasy overkill. Onion rings are delicious and fries are good not over the top. Ketchup = what is this imposter red sauce they serve with the fries and rings???  I get the I am Gordon Ramsey and a great chef but let's leave it at that and serve the best ketchup ever Heinz!    All the Burgers we ordered are very good! Cooked perfectly and meat has great flavor. Light handed on the sauces which is perfect for me I don't want the meat masked.   Prices are excellent!

Thanks to the Total Rewards Diamond card, we were able to skip the *gulp* 2-hour wait that was quoted to another curious customer. In fact, our wait was 5 minutes max, which was great. The parmesan truffle fries were in fact kick-ass, and the Caesar salad with chicken was pretty nice (I liked the little fancy touches of 2-3 other greens besides the iceberg lettuce) and amazingly enough, adding chicken on was ONLY $1. Say what? This was two skewers of chicken freshly grilled. Usually chicken is $3 or more as a salad add-on, so I was impressed, skewer or no skewer.   The downside is, of course, the wait on the burger. Like don't come hungry, cause you will be left hungry for a-whi-le. We were quoted 25-30 minutes, but it was more in the 45 plus range. More accurately, an hour plus but we had appetizers so it didn't feel that bad. The couple next to us only ordered burgers though; it got to the point where they complained, and their burgers were delivered first with a free appetizer, so maybe it worked out?   As for our burger, we got the mushroom to split. They are able to cut some burgers in half, but ours had bacon, so it was no-go. By then, I had filled up on fries, water, salad, and wait-time, so I took two bites, one for the experience, one for good measure and gave up on the rest. It was good, but nothing I would care to order again.

Amazing hamburger. We stopped on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised. I don't normally eat at celebrity places (over priced and underwhelming) but this really was exceptional. We split the Bleu Cheeseburger with truffle fries. The burger also had manchego cheese and arugula lettuce. The Bleu wasn't over-powering and everything blended together nicely. The fries were a must-do as other reviewers have pointed out. The real star was the meat patty which was done absolutely perfect! I'd like to know how they do it. If you are a burger fan or would like a smaller bite for lunch, I'd recommend it.

Overrated, our family was a 2nd customer as we waited at the opening 11:00 am. Ordered, mediterranean burger, Dawg, signature Hells' burger, onion rings, milkshakes and a glass of beer: 1) waited 40 minutes for food!!! 2) Dawg visually wonderful, but tastes too salty, only finished half 3) burger too dry and again salty as well 4) However, son liked a mediterranean burger   Spent $100 including a tip, definitely overrated and it is not worth it.  Ramsay Hell's Kitchen is so much better - tastes, price, service and atmosphere, if you can get a table!
A must if your in Vegas. Burgers are amazing. Try the F word burger. I would skip the fries or share them.

I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger. I also ordered the truffle Parmesan fries. The burger took about 30 mins to come out so i waited on the fries.  So much food! I would say share the fries The burger was delicious probably the best Ive ever had. The meat was cooked perfectly and the ingredients paired so well together i was not disappointed. I will be back to try something different.

Stood in line before it opened and asked to be seated at counter by kitchen as I Love watching a kitchen work. They tell you that the burgers take 25 minutes so we ordered the poutine and it was AMAZING. Creamy and rich with the burnt ends, it could almost be a meal itself. My son had the Farmhouse and he loved it. He also had the Creme Brûlée shake and all I could think of was the scene from Pulp Fiction where John Travolta asked Uma Thurman about a $5 shake and than said it was pretty good. It's REALLY good. I had the Pork Chop and Applesauce Burger cooked medium and it was super flavorful. My only mistake was ordering a side of fries, not that they weren't good, they were, but I had them w the poutine. I wished our server had suggested something different. Staff was friendly and I noticed that all of them were unusually attractive, so certainly an incentive to wait in line. The only thing missing was the yelling from the kitchen.

I used to love Burg(e)r but I'm disappointed in the recent menu changes. A few of my favorite items are gone but thankfully the Hell's Kitchen burger stayed. I tried the ale cheddar soup, which was just barely lukewarm so that was a little disappointing. Something was off with the staff tonight as well. Would've been 4 stars if my soup was warmer and the service a bit better. The seating process is also silly. If you're a party of q or 2, be prepared to stand in line for 30-45 minutes at dinner and larger parties be prepared to wait 2x that for a table. Why can't I just sign in, go gamble, and receive a text when my table is ready?

The Poutine fries weren't bad; flavorful but needed a little more gravy.  The Hell's Kitchen burger disappointed me significantly.  I asked for medium rare and got a thin patty that was way over cooked. The bun was dry.  It had a little heat from the grilled jalapeño, but I've had better burgers for the price.    Sorry Gordon, I'm a private chef and your restaurant disappointed.   On a good note, the beer was half way decent.   Cheers!!!

What an opportunity to have to be in one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Coming to Vegas, I have always been looking forward to this restaurant.  Soooooo I ordered the Forest Burger. I chose this because I saw that it has some sort of duck bacon which immediately caught my attention. Tried it and it tasted great and unique. The meat was my favorite part; It was perfectly cooked to medium rare and everything. When it comes to portion, at first I thought it was a bit small. However I realized that it was at a pretty good portion to keep you happy and satisfied without feeling bloated. A side of fries could also fit right in.   Service was awesome. They check up more often than not and they're super friendly and sociable. As for the wait time, it took about 20 minutes. Not ideal but it's fine.  Would come back!
Delicious burgers. The fries is ok and there is long wait for food but overall they know what their doing and its not a simple burger.

Hands down the best burgers we've had in a long long time! We tried the hell's kitchen burger and it was simply magnificient, so good we came back the day after and had another ! The flavours all came perfectly together with the roasted tomatoes and delicious aioli making the burger! At some point there was meat that came out of the sandwich and just having the meat plain was also delightful, cooked perfectly ! We also had the Crown burger and both of them were so good you can't have them with anything else, i.e fries. You will want to bite in and take your time to allow all the flavours to be enjoyed. I didn't want my burger to end!  Service was also fantastic !
Great atmosphere! I got the  Backyard Burger (impossible /vegan). Really tasty. Would come back for sure.

Here is my review Chef Ramsay.... I did go to you LV site to have a burger and maybe if I would have followed my own advice I may have had a pleasant experience however I ordered the lobster shrimp burger... Hugh mistake on my part. Lobster and Shrimp are so delicate you have to beware of over seasoning them this location or this chef was not... I wasn't sure if I was eating seafood or sausage the consistency and flavor were that bad, it was unrecognizable, If it was truly Lobster and Shrimp it was over cooked to rubber consistency .... I was very disappointed

BELIEVE THE HYPE!  Amazing burgers, even though it was a little too salty, but management made it right. Just be aware, it takes about 30 mins for the best burger, but just order a cocktail n be happy,,,,you're in Vegas!  Find a VIP, so you don't have to wait in line,,,,like I did lol.   Also amazing service (that always wins my heart).

As far as Vegas food sites, there are more than someone could cover in a lifetime. This is my second visit in 5 years, and I will continue to come back.  Decor: They just finished up a rebuild, and it looks stunning. The same fireplace entrance is there to give people wanting selfies more than they could ask for. Comfortable seating and bar area.   Service: It's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, of course it was good. Just be nice and respectful to the servers and they will do the  same to you. I was a little off put when the hostess told me my party could be moved up if I gave her what everyone in Vegas wants...money.    Food: The food has always been spot on. I had a burger with a specialty pork on it. It was super filling, I had to force the fries down too. I can't comment on the drinks, I don't drink alcohol anymore.   Overall: This is a really nice place, great for tourists. It's expensive like all the food there, but worth the wait.

I use to love this place they recently changed there menu and took off my favorite the jalapeño poppers and they don't have the farm burger any more. The farmhouse is similar to the farm burger but it's not that great. Every time I go to Vegas I always stop by here it was always one of my fav to go spots but after this memorial weekend trip they disappointed me so much. I love Gordon Ramsey's restaurants from his steak house at the Paris to the pub at the Cesars and to have this spot change so drastically on taste and menu is such a disappointment it really doesn't uphold the Gordon Ramsey name brand

I ate the Hell's kitchen burger and paid extra $6 for the veg impossible burger. Honestly the burger was ok but overall the burger was lacking sauce /flavor. The onions rings were good but too oily. The fries were good but nothing like English chips. No I would t go back to eat here. Ambiance was cool!

My husband ate here for the second time last night. Last year we loved every bite. This year was a different story. My husband got the hog burger and he said it was just ok. I got the portobello burger which has no meat but still cost $18. The mushrooms were horribly salty, also the menu said it had shaved veggies.....I can cut thinner veggies by hand at home. The waiter was nice enough to take my burger off the bill. He said they tasted the mushrooms in the back and in fact they were brined in a salt solution and that they were way too salty. All I could think of is what Gordon would have said, "You served this to a customer?!"  I will say the onion rings were light and crispy and not greasy....they were the best part of our meal.

Came in for dinner at around 6, and the place was swamped. Service was slow, burgers took 30 minutes, but failry attentive. Sides are okay at best, but burgers Al la carte are worth the visit. I had the farm burger and it was skillfully seasoned and cooked perfectly; Bacon crispy and egg runny. Bun was soft and everything seemed well thought out flavor and texture wise. Everytime I have been here these thing have been true. And I returned yet again. Not a perfect experience, but a damn good burger. ( And great beer selection)

I loved it, the burger was AMAZING, worth the wait to get in, and the price. It is not often I order meals as they were designed, some say I am a picky eater, but there are things I don't like.   I loved every bite.

Not a bad burger, but definitely expected more out of Ramsey. The burgers are okay. I even tried out their anniversary burger with aged Ribeye and New York strip. No amazing flavor or anything.   The truffle oil I got on the side though was amazing. Lol   My wife tried out the farmhouse burger, and she liked the juiciness of the burger as did I.

The wait is long but I suspect they do it on purpose so the food will be delicious which it was. Had the sweet potato fries, wings, and hell something burger. Yummy but this review is for a worker that my plus one and I couldn't take our eyes off of. Found out his name is Levi. Whoever management is needs to take note of this employee. His heart and enthusiasm was in his work!  If I were local I would try to poach him. :) Half kidding

I ate here with my husband about 3 years ago and the food and service was amazing. Tonight the food and the service was horrible. Our whole party came from all over the country to meet (before a wedding) on our recommendation and the party of 11 was horribly disappointed all around. So unhappy and SO expensive for poor food. Dont EVER order the poutin fries.  Tasted like a cafeteria microwave meal with dog food on it.  Nasty

Wait time was ridiculous. Not just the lineup to get into the restaurant. Once seated it took far too long to order and receive our meals. The fries were undercooked and the burger was a bit underwhelming. It's quite possible that I came on an off day when the food and service wasn't up to its usual standard. I would try it again if I didn't have to wait so damn long to eat

Enjoyed Our Evening!!! Hubby's Birthday!! Thank you Sister Evy Eve for treating Pops? He loved dirge Farmhouse Burger!!! I loved the Ahi Sliders!!! Great service!!!! So delicious and comfortable setting!!!!
We ordered the blue cheese burger and was so good and the Parmesan fries was to die for...

Only good thing about this place was the service, and the truffle fries. We had the blue cheese burger. I love blue cheese, but it had way too much. Honestly all that was tasted was the blue cheese. Would not order again. And we also had the burger with duck bacon. Again, way too much of whatever cheese was on there. It was all you could taste and I had to remove the top bun to even enjoy. Also had the wings. They were okay, but came out really cold. Probably would never go back. 3 stars for the truffle fries.

My favorite restaurant that we went to.  The burgers were excellent, I got the ultimate cheeseburger as I am not really into fancy goods.   The onion rings were pretty good but the truffle parmesan fries were amazing!  Tried to go again on our last day but we ran out of time and the wait was too long.  Looking forward to going back.

The last time I was in Vegas, there was a HUGE line so we called in ahead of time for reservations. Unfortunately, this place doesn't take reservations.  Luckily, our party of 4 got there pretty early so we were able to get a table almost right away. Our hostess recommended the Hells Kitchen Burger, which I was planning on getting anyway because DUHHH! Gordon Ramsay! My bf got the Forest Burger for the mushrooms. We also ordered the garlic fries and poutine.   The Hells Kitchen Burger was AMAZING! Cooked to a perfect medium and full of flavor! My bf's Forest Burger was really good too, but I still prefer the Hells Kitchen Burger. The fries and poutine were also very good. The burgers were a good size. With the fries, we were too full to finish everything and took half the burgers and fries to go.   I would definitely return here for a casual lunch on my next Vegas trip!

Disappointed. I really wanted to like this place, and like other reviews I hold Gordon to a high standard.  2pm on a Sunday, after being seated we waited 15 minutes to order, then 30 minutes for the burgers. I ordered mine rare, and like the other review mentioned, I think they only know one temperature, plus the patty is thin. Even after remaking it so it would be rare, it pretty much looked the same.
The burger was great; exactly what I would expect(especially for the price) the fries however were terrible! $8 for fries that were bland and uninspired.

Ok. I'm just gonna say it. Straight up. And I don't want you to think less of me.   I went to Gordon Ramsay Burger and I ordered a salad. Yes, the wheatberry quinoa salad. And here is comes:   It was the BEST SALAD I have ever had in my life.   I'm just gonna repeat myself because I know you're probably in disbelief. I went to Gordon Ramsay Burger and had the best salad of my entire life!   I don't know when I became THAT girl that ordered a salad at the burger joint. I usually judge people who does that shit. It's like going to a Chinese restaurant and ordering fried rice and orange chicken. No! That is not acceptable. (I'm Asian if you can't tell). But I did. I don't know if it's because I'm pregnant and trying to be remotely healthy for this unborn child or because I've been eating shit all week in Vegas, but something inside of me was screaming for the wheatberry salad.   I was actually very hesitant to order it because I saw everyone around me eating burgers. And damn! Those burgers looked and smelled so good. So I thought I'd make the healthier choice and go for the salad. I knew I was gonna regret it.   But to my surprise, it was the best decision I've made in life. It truly was. (Am I dramatic? Maybe! But food is life!) That salad was incredible! The chicken was so flavorful! Not greasy at all! The salad was full of crunch with all sorts of nuts, dried fruits, fresh veggies, and quinoa. It was epic and it was everything I wanted and more. I couldn't have dreamt of a better salad. I had asked for the dressing on the side, and I didn't even poured an ounce of dressing onto my salad! It didn't need it! It was that good!!   The best part of the salad? It was massive! It can probably feed 3 people. Or one pregnant girl! Ha! I ate the entire thing myself even though I was so full half way through it. But I was determined not to let that deliciousness go to waste! Trust me on this- order the wheatberry quinoa salad!! You won't regret it. Your body will thank you.   I had a bite of my friend's turkey burger and truffle fries. It was pretty darn good. I won't lie! Truffle fries are pretty greasy though. You can tell it came straight from the deep fryer and you can see the oil dripping down as you dive in for your first bite. If that's your type of thing, then go for me. For me, it was too greasy.   I will definitely come back here! It makes me sad that we don't have this joint in SF. The restaurant is great- very modern and clean. Servers are attention and friendly. Prices are reasonable for the strip. And overall, it's just delicious! I don't know and I don't care who Gordon Ramsay is but man, he sure knows how to make an unforgettable salad!

This place lives up to the hype and the burgers are amazing! A friend and I stopped by here on a Friday night around 5pm. Although there was already a line, it wasn't too long and we were quickly seated in about 10-15 minutes.  The atmosphere is casual but classy and the waiters and waitresses are wonderful. Since this is called the Gordon Ramsey Burger, we both got burgers and truffle/parmesan fries.  The forest burger is a beef patty topped with tremor cheese, seasonal forest mushrooms, and duck bacon. It was sinfully savory and the buns are crispy and buttery without being overly heavy. The patty was cooked to perfection (caramelized edges with a hint of pink on the inside) and the goat cheese gives an unexpected tang to tickle the taste buds in a delightful way. The mushroom lend the burger an overall mellow earthy tone. Lastly, the duck bacon complements the tangy cheese well with its saltiness. However, I would have preferred the bacon to be thicker since this slice was too thin to bring out the meaty and fattiness of duck meat.  The tomato sauce and truffles aioli sauce for the parmesan fries are really good! The tomato sauce tastes like Italian sweet gravy and the truffles aioli is creamy, earthy, and savory. However, I prefer my fries to be crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The fries I received were dry on the inside and out.  The service was very good, but the burger could have been hotter when it arrived. When we received the burger, it was lukewarm which means that it was sitting out for a while before being brought to our table.  Overall, good meal and very good service. Gordon Ramsey Burger did not disappoint!
OK. thay take soooo long to serve.. they are nice but u have 2 wait over an hour to get serve!!!! so if u are really hungry don't come here

The best place in Vegas for casual dinning! Corn beef sandwich is out of this world!Ask for truffle fries instead of kettle chips! A bit pricy but hey it's Vegas ! $80 for a sandwich a hamburger a beer and a Bloody Mary ! But with it! Enjoy.

Was so excited to finally get to try out a Chef Ramsey establishment that I didn't mind waiting an hour and a half to eat hamburgers.  Apparently when you have a party of 3 or more, you can leave them your number and they will text you when you're table is ready vs less then 3 you just wait in this long looking line.  Either way it's a long wait.  When we got the text, we waited another 6 min for them to clean the table and finally we got seated.  Yay!  Most of us ordered the Hells' Kitchen Burger because of our waiter's recommendation for first timers.  We also ordered the truffle parmesan fries and beer battered onion rings to share.  And Creme brulee shake and brown butter caramel pecan shake to wash down the greasy food.  The patty was melt in your mouth delicious!  I ordered medium rare and it came perfectly cooked.  My issue with the burger was that it was INCREDIBLY salty.  I recall a bite where it felt like I was eating salt straight up and could feel the crunchiness of the salt on my teeth.  Maybe the salt was spread on unevenly or extra was spread on after?  Had the same issue with the fries where it was just too salty.  The onion rings were ok but nothing to rave about.  I loved the oreo shake part to my creme brulee shake but it turns out to be overwhelming with creme brulee on top and on the bottom.  It was just too rich for me to finish and felt kind of sick sucking up creme brulee on the bottom.  I'd recommend just order the oreo shake without the creme brulee.  Everyone liked the pecan shake but I prefer something sweeter when it comes to shakes.  I think overall maybe I just had a really high expectation for this place and it really fell short for me: food and service.  I love Gordon Ramsay and I'm a huge fan of his show and it saddens me to write this review but   everything was just okay and no way in hellz am I gonna wait an hour and a half ever again for mediocracy.

Cannot go wrong here!! I stop by every time I come to town, as the food is amazing and service is top- notch. Never had anything that was less than stellar. I miss the jalapeño poppers they used to offer, but there are plenty of other great apps, such as the ahi sliders or poutine fries. The burgers are large and always cooked perfectly. Each one combines unique flavors that are just perfect. I recommend going early, as the line gets long during main meal times.

We were excited to try this place out, we waited for 30 minutes which wasn't bad I guess, I ordered the shrimp and lobster burger, my husband had the blue cheeseburger. For $26 I expected to be wowed but was disappointed. My husband wasn't impressed either, he said he liked super duper burgers way better. We should have eaten at Pink's

Waited maybe like 20-25 min.   $12 for a side of fries ??   The spicy jalapeño burger was delicious! Cooked to perfection! Definitely recommend.   Got the nachos and they surprised me because they were kettle chips. It had meat and a white cheese. Never had nachos like that but my friend really loved it. It wasn't that flavorful in my opinion   The service was A1. She was very knowledgeable and helpful.

Great burgers for a tourist but hang onto your wallet! Mucho denero!  If U are really craving a Unique burger this is your place for a date! Right up the street is Fatburger for half the price and just as good!

Talking about this place makes me salivate. The burgers are incredible. I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the patty was so juicy, I was extremely satisfied with this burger. Don't forget to get their sides. Beware though, the line can sometimes go around the restaurant.

This place is awesome lol the seats are comfortable and they don't let you finish a soda before you got a fresh one and the food is unbelievable will behave again and try the forest burger with duck bacon it's the greatest...

La primera vez no pudimos entrar porque la línea era demasiada larga, la segunda vez si lo logramos las hamburguesas súper deliciosas, podrían compartirse entre 2 personas sino llevas mucha hambre. Imperdibles las papas con trufa y la ketchup es casera

Excellent food! Waited in line for about 30-40 minutes to get in. Ordered the Parmesan truffle fries right away, they were great! Our waiter was very friendly. I had the portobello burger and my boyfriend had the Hell's Kitchen burger. Both were delicious! The only con was that the burgers took a long time to come out.

Where do I begin so I had the lobster and shrimp burger and that was probably the most delicious burger I've ever had in a long time definitely worth the price!! Got sweet potato fries barely finished them cuz they were so generous with the amount they give lol highly highly treccomend!!

Pretty good food but not spectacular. We all got the farmhouse burger (which was decent, but not great) and shared the onion rings (which, when dipped in their ranch sauce, were super good! ) and the parmesan truffle fries (also pretty good) but for 100 bucks for 3 people seems a bit spendy when all we drank was water.

Oh what's the big fuss about..it's the guy we always see on TV -  Gordon. It's just a another burger joint. Lol. But after the first bite of my Crown Burger, I'm sold!  Very juicy and tender and full of flavor. Will definitely come back again, but beware there maybe a 30 min wait..just go relax and grab a drink by the nearby bars.

One of the best burgers I've had in Vegas.  Even the fries were top notch.  Be sure to ask for all the sauces.  They have a couple of different types of ketchup that all tasted great, but the start of the meal was their ranch that was mixed with some cheddar cheese.  So good and worked perfectly on every item we got.

My burger was amazing. The creme brulee shake to die for. There is a long wait if you don't get there before they open but it is totally worth it.  My only complaint is that we didnt get our order of fries until after we had already finished our burgers.

The lobster burger was bland and the just fries had no salt on them-I had to ask for a salt shaker! I asked the people next to us who had onion rings and they said they were delicious.   Won't be a next time

This place was good but didn't quite live up to the hype, I was told the high end beef burger they had in this week was one of if not the best burger they ever had. I expected it to be more like a steak burger but it was ground up beef. The fries we got with our order were 100% undercooked, if they were going for potatoes wedges they should have called them that. Worth a lunch but maybe not as hyped as it should be.

Not sure what's changed since it was BURGR except the name, color of mats and menus, but still seems to be the same type of place?  This burger spot is a must go to for me and my friend and never disappoints. Service is always spot on, and food is filling and tasty.  My friend and I both ordered a yummy tequila cocktail which was quite strong for me! We also both ordered the Forest Burger and an order of just fries. They both came out pretty quickly, and the burger was amazing! The mushrooms in it was the perfect compliment. The fries are steak fries, which aren't my favorite, but they give you a chipotle and curry ketchup. I don't like ketchup, but the curry one is nice. I also asked for a truffle aioli which was yummmmmmmmmy! Perfect to add to the burger too.  For the price, this place can't get any better! A must try for some good food!

I think 4 stars is about right. Way too long of a wait for these burgers. They were good, but too much hype for them. Definitely not worth the 90 mins wait time and then another 30 mins for them to cook it. I tried the hell kitchen burger and the truffle fries. Fries were amazing. Burger was decent.

This was our first experience at this restaurant and I have to say these were the BEST burgers we've ever had! My wife had the Blue cheese burger and I had the Farmhouse burger. Both were completely different but they both had the perfect combination of complex flavors. We also ordered the Poutine fries which were impeccable!  Do yourself a favor and check this place out!

I'm a fan of Gordon Ramsay, but I felt like there is a lot of hype surrounding the restaurant. Yes, I understand that he is a world-renowned chef and that he has put time into creating these fancy, unique burger recipes. However, I personally thought my burger was good, but nothing spectacular.  Seating took a while (as expected), which is okay. However, it took us almost 30-40 minutes to receive the food after ordering. I ordered the Hog Burger - mangalitsa pork, mangalitsa bacon, bbq pork, white cheddar, pickles, crispy onion & slaw. The ingredients were fancy and the burger was flavorful. However, the pork was a little too dry for my taste and wasn't really juicy at all. I'd want to order something else next time before deciding if I like/dislike this place.  On the other hand, the Burnt Ends Poutine was good - fries, burnt ends, black pepper gravy, cheddar cheese curds & pickled onions. Incredibly savory and the black pepper gravy was perfect. I enjoyed this much more than my burger..

The service was horriblr. 1st they texted me for a table for 5 i checked in and then they forgot about my party and said we did not make it on time. When the hostess told us they were setting up the table. Then we ordered our food and they did noy bring our truffle fries or onion rings until we asked for them because we were almost done with our meal! Although they wete eventually comped it was horrible service and ruined a birthday lunch.
Bad service.  Slow service.  EVERYTHING was far over cooked - even the fires.  We had to wait 18 minutes to even send anything back.  Awful!  Try something else.

One of the best burgers I have ever had. The patty was nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection. I ordered the Hog's Burger which surprised me how good it was because it was an all pork burger! Also the fries were very good with housemade ketchup. The milkshakes and tart were a perfect finish to the meal. The service was also very nice and all the staff were very attentive and friendly. A great restaurant in Las Vegas

Worth the hype, worth the wait.  THE juiciest burger I've ever had in my life.  The exact flavor you want and need when you're craving "that" kind of burger.  Every mouthful has you pausing to take in the texture, aroma and savory bliss of the bun, meat and all your other toppings.  My mouth is watering all over again.  LOVED IT.  Other stuff: the poutine fries were - eh - for me; the star wasn't the fry, it was the pepper....a bit too much, actually.  There were some cheese curds that the menu said were included, but were not visible and didn't add anything.   The drink recommended and mixed by the bartender was good; I might go with a cold beer next time; it would just fit better.    Ambiance is fun, kids can eat there - it's pretty loud, so even if they have spunk and volume like my daughter, it probably wouldn't be too off-putting.  Loved that they sold regular memorabilia (t-shirts, hats) but also had glassware, coasters, bottle openers and cookbooks.  Cool place - can't wait to go back!

On previous trips had always shied away because of the line but this time went for it because the line was 'only' about sixteen people long (not even counting their party members wandering the casino), it actually moved along faster than I would have thought, our party of three was seated in under twenty minutes.  The beer menu had extensive offerings, I was so happy they had a couple selections of Stone Brewing available and would actually enjoy coming here just to have drinks.  We started with the onion rings and truffle parmesan fries, both of which transitioned into excellent sides for the burgers.  The burgers themselves were absolutely awesome, we tried the Hell's Kitchen Burger, which I did not perceive as being spicy in the least, only very, very delicious!  Also had the Blue Cheeseburger, which I was skeptical about because while I like blue cheese I am not a fan of figs nor jam and I assumed "figgy jam" would be something unpleasant to me, but I was surprised how the flavors all worked so perfectly together to make a burger I felt embarrassed about doubting!  I highly, highly recommend not being scared away by lines at this place, I could have been enjoying these burgers so much sooner if I hadn't.

Cons: long line. Don't take reservations.   Pros: accepts credit cards. Easy to find location. kettle chip nachos. Had this great sauce that the kiddos loved. My husband and I shared Some sort of Pork burger w/bacon and pulled pork. Well balanced flavors. Savory and sweet.

Pretty good burger. They were able to make any burger on the menu into vegetarian (by using Portobello mushroom).   Hells burger was delicious. (Jalapeños are spicy so I had them on the side). Parmesan truffle fries were BOMB and came with truffle mayo (which was okay..).   I appreciated that they split the bill between 6 of us when they brought it in. Made it very easy to pay with a large party.

Best Onion Rings I have ever had in my life! A perfect mixture if breaded ingredients. While visiting Vegas, we were looking for a good burger joint near Planet Hollywood. This place definitely fit the bill. My burger was great as expected. The wait was a bit long and a lunch for two cost us around 60 bucks with a tip. Another thing worth mentioning, they offer a military discount. I think it was 10 percent off.

Burgers burger burgers      With burgers being one of may favorite foods.      Gordon Ramsey burger located inside planet Hollywood was my favorite burger that I had while visiting Vegas. The burgers were cooked to perfection and the service was great. We sat at the bar because if you want a great experience at any restaurant sitting at the bar has always been great for us. They had a few bartenders which was great to see because everyone was taken care of even with the huge dinner crowd that came in while we were there.       At 18 dollars a burger it better be good right? Well it was and we weren't disappointed with our choices. I of course picked the spicy jalapeño burger and dh ordered the breakfast style burger. Can't remember the actual names of the burgers but they were delicious. So many fancy names on the menu I though using a description of what was on it would work. We had the chips with pulled pork and those were amazing for an appetizer not to big just the right amount before our burgers came out. No fries with burger but the guy next to us ordered the Parmesan truffle fries and offered us a few because they give you a lot and he was by himself and told us we could have some of his. Those were by far the best French fries I have ever had.       The bar area has about 12 seats across the bar and tables out side of that which has a view of the casino.     I will definitely return to this location on the next Vegas trip.

Never fails. It's my second time here in Gordon Ramsay Burger and every order always tastes good. The first time I was here, we ordered the ahi sliders and the foie burger. The best we've ever tasted! I'm not a burger eater but I ate the whole burger. The second time we ordered Hell's kitchen burger and the lobster and shrimp burger and they both taste so good! A must when in Vegas.

Juicy, flavorful burgers. Delicious appetizers (hummus recommended). Great atmosphere, nice people. Decent service. Lots of menu options. This place is overall great and I totally suggest coming here.

Waited for two hours to get my chicken curry burger. Had my salad. A guy comes in a half hour after me and gets all his food. I ask the server where my chicken sandwich is and they say sorry. Ten minutes more I wait for my chicken burger. They only comp the chicken burger. Not my whole meal. I was here over two hours. WTF!!!!!
Didn't know a burger could be so good. It was a great experience
If you're a diamond member for total rewards you can skip the long lines. The onion rings were incredible and the burgers were cooked perfectly!

Excellent burgers! I had the portobello mushroom burger, and my husband got the Hell's Kitchen burger in median rare meat. We both loved it. The portobello mushroom burger amazed me again and again, the burger was with lots of layers that I've never thought of a burger can be. The truffle fried was also a great choice, it came with two sauce, one is truffle mustard (maybe, not sure), the other red sauce is made of fresh tomato and some other ingredients that we couldn't figure out. But both sauces and fries itself were delicious!

Was walking around Vegas looking for somewhere to eat and when we saw this the burgers called our name, I had gone here before and it was good!!!.  We were quickly serviced and seated. Then we ordered, and to our surprise the burgers came out 3 maybe 5 min after ordering.  At first, since we were starving, we were happy to just have food in front of us, however that feeling was short lived.  We quickly realized the burgers got there so fast that they must have been sitting there already cooked for god knows how long.  But again since we were starving, we continued to eat.  And let me tell you what a mistake that was, I've been having stomach pain since and wasted a lot of time last night and this morning in the room rather than enjoying my trip.  Very disappointed.  Will not be returning.

Grab an Uber and go to In n Out... Go anywhere but here. Most disappointing were the fries. The sweet potato fries were soggy and barely edible, so we ordered the regular ones (for $9) hoping for nice, thick cut fries and classic ketchup. Gordon - WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO THE KETCHUP?! Heinz 57 is beautiful and perfect the way it is... Yours is a disaster. This meal wouldn't even be passable if I were wasted.

You will never find a better burger. Simply magnificent. But be aware that the wait line can be long even in the middle of the afternoon. If you are alone and the line is long, inquire as to whether they can seat you at the bar.

OK so let me start by saying I stayed at planet Hollywood Hotel and I decided to eat here with my mom. Especially by the amount of people that were waiting in line to get in.  So I assumed it would be amazing. We each got a burger and we told the hostess to put it to go  because There was a long wait for a table . But what I didn't know is that our food literally took  like 40 minutes or more. Once we got it we saw that it didn't come with fries or chips or anything. Just a big box for a plain tiny burger. That doesn't have a taste to it and the worst part is that it was raw in the centerof the meat. I was so disappointed especially for the price that you pay for it. I guess i was just paying for his name.

The food was great but the service was phenomenal.  Guy was a great "front man" recommending delicious drinks and burger choices. Kurtis and Rick brought the performance with their renditions on Happy Birthday to my friend Katy. Guy was clearly envious of the manager's jaw line and lush beard but he was able to work through that for the sake of good service. We will be back for sure.

Dining at Gordon Ramsay burger is a great experience if you are a fan of Gordon Ramsay. If you are all about the burger experience, you may want to approach with caution.   I didn't have a bad dining experience at GRB. The service was exceptional and the food was good. The problem for me was the prices. At the end of the day, it is burger and fries, yet I felt like I paid such a high price for what I was getting. Two burgers, one order of fries and three beers was over $90 after tip, which seems extreme to me. I get that you pay a premium on the strip, but this seemed out of hand. There are other places on the strip that have better burgers and for a lesser price.   Again, if you a Gordon fan, then definitely hit this place up. If you are just looking for a burger, you may want to pass.

The burger was good, but nothing to write home about. Gourmet burger places are pretty popular now and I don't think this one offered anything outstanding compared to others. Parmesan truffle fries were very good, but we waited 40 minutes (after the fries arrived) for our burgers. They told us shift change was happening - at 7pm on Friday!? Not a good idea. Also, best to come here if you have a group of 4 or less.

This was my first time eating at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant!   Food: This place should be five stars! I had the Crown Burger, truffle fries and Baby Black Kale Apple Caesar Salad. The burger was cooked to a medium. The flavor was all there and everything inside the burger was A+. Truffle fries were bomb! The ketchup was amazing, I don't know how to describe it but I couldn't get enough. My brother who doesn't like ketchup actually wanted to finish the sauce. The Dijon mustard was suburb! Lastly the salad was light and filling. It was a great way to start the meal.   Service: Our waiter was hilarious! He informed us of all the specials and joked around with how we reacted to the food. He could see that we thought the food was delicious. I don't think there was a point where he did not check up on us. Keep up the great work staff!   Ambiance: I love the British theme. All the posters and color design are pleasing. The dragon with the fire up front was great to look at. The tables and seats were comfortable. I like how you can look into the kitchen and see the chefs cooking.   Overall a wonderful experience!

Good burgers. Black Forest burger with arugula, duck ham, tremor cheese was delicious. Mushroom poutine was very porcini, I really liked it. We enjoyed our meal. Very popular place that's why we stayed in line for 40min to get seated. It doesn't worth going there again.

Great experience at GR Burger- we ordered a lobster and shrimp burger and the hell's kitchen burger - so tasty! Bun was light,  roasted jalapenos and the meat with the asadero cheese and avocado= perfection Oh and the sweet potato fries with the buttery jelly like sauce- yummy!

Talk about a phenomenal burger! Everything this place has is worth trying out. Milkshakes are amazing and the jalapeño poppers are a must try if you like jalapeño poppers at any other restaurant. One of the best restaurants in Vegas.

My second experience for GR burger actually ended up being a subpar experience.  As where I am paying 4 times higher price per burger, I expected an equivalent service. However, our service was nothing but a disappointment. The server forgot our drinks. Once she brought them she spilled them all over the table and me. Broke a glass on us. Our food was served super late. No one came to really apologize us about the whole awful experience.  The food was alright. The beef was not even juicy to think that i got a steak in between my buns.   Would I come back? Not really unless a friend visiting wants to try it

The burger was awesome. I got the classic burger, American cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onions. We ordered french fries and onion rings. The onion rings were out of this world and it came with two different sauces, both delicious. French fries, I woudn't go crazy about them, a bit mushy. Just that we got seated next to the burning flames which I guess is part of the decor at the end of March, and the waiters were not willing to seat us somewhere else and would want us to go out and wait in the line again if we wanted a different seat. I am not sure what's Gordon's plan for those flames in the summer, it was only March and we were burning already. Maybe that would make people order more beers.

I found it mediocre at best. The burger was cold, bacon not crispy, fries truffle felt not fresh.  I felt dizzy as I left an hour ago, finally got to my room and got so sick I could barely stand to vomit.  I am not a drinker, so though in Vegas, I must be the only sober person around.  Those who rate above a star are comparing to McDonald.  Very very very upset.

From the moment we walked it we knew it would be fantastic! When you have a hostess like Evelyn who greets you in such a warm and friendly manner it sets the tone for an incredible dining experience. IMO Evelyn should be put on the fast track to management training. She certainly has the people skills.  And of course the food and dining service is as always marvelous.

The fries and the oreo cookie creme brulee shake came out somewhat quickly and were delicious. The burger was a tasty and appetizing, but seeing as though we got here and ordered a little after 11 and it just barely got served at 12:20, even thought we were told the burgers take 20-25 minutess, not sure it's worth it...especially when you're really hungry.

Everything was uniquely delicious and put together. I had the Lobster and shrimp burger with a spicy margarita. My hubby had the "Hog Burger" and we shared the Parmesan onion rings which were fried to perfection. I'm picky about shrimp and was so happy that it was not a lot of filling in my lobster and shrimp patty.

There was a huge line when I came across GRB one night in Vegas. I was alone, so went to the hostess and asked if there was bar seating available -- which there was, at the Kitchen Bar! I immensely enjoyed watching the kitchen staff execute at a pace and with a focus you would expect from a GR kitchen. I had the special burger. Of course it was great. I ate half, and had the other half for breakfast the next morning. Dare I say it was better cold from the fridge the next morning? 4 stars because of price... I had a burger, fries, 2 beers, and I spent $50+. Not a surprise given you are in Vegas, but... the value makes it a one-time visit.  Check it out!

Pretty simple to sum this one up: 1.  Easy and efficient check-in 2.  Table was ready when the text came 3.  Super nice server and very attentive. Even during shift change 4.  Burger was outstanding and we knew it would take about 25 min. It did take a little longer but they were crazy busy. 5.  Would have liked a few more options on the burgers but this is his menu. Settled for the UK burger and was a great decision. 6.  Onion rings came out quickly and were outstanding. Very light batter that held up to frying and the two sauces provided. Sauces were nice mix between sweet and spicy. 7.  Despite delay, burger was cooked perfectly. Love the toasted bun with sesame (light and dark). Fries were solid. Not greasy. Nicely salted -- and I like a lot. 8.  Server was very attentive with refills, as we were just doing tea and soft drinks that afternoon. 9.  Everyone cleaned their plates and we got out in a timely manner to head back to casinos/shopping/people watching. 10.  Exactly what you would expect from Ramsey. Perfection expected and delivered.  He might have dropped a few F-bombs on the timeliness but the food was outstanding.
GIven all the hype, it was just okay.

A friend recommended this place and said the burger was awesome. Ok, let's give it a try.  I came here after J Lo's concert at the same hotel. It was around 11pm but the place was crowded!  However, a table for 2 usually doesn't take too long.  We started off with a portion of their fries. Delicious!!! Thick slices just like I love. They came with some dipping sauces and one of them was truffle aioli, which was so good! I ordered the Forest burger. I had never had duck bacon before and loved it! This burger was very very good. The bun was toasted so didn't get soggy throughout the meal.  The other guest had the Blue burger. I tried a piece of it and it was good too. For cheese lovers it is a must! It is VERY cheesy.  We decided we needed more fries so we ordered the sweet potato fries. They are served in very thin slices with some powdered sugar on top. I really liked them, it is a different twist. But their "simple" fries were my favorite!

Based on all the reviews I thought the food was going to be something special. Definitely nothing really good. I ordered the tandoori chicken burger and it was on the dry side. Not much flavor. Not worth $14.   We also ordered the shrimp salad. Shrimp was extremely salty! Order it and try it for yourselves! It has good flavor, but the saltiest thing I've ever in my life tasted. The rest of the salad was a basic green leaf salad. Worth $16? NO.  Parmesan truffle fries. It was OKAY. Nothing special other than sprinkled cheese and garlic on fat soggy fries. Worth $12? NO.  Lastly service was extremely slow and lackluster.  Friendly employees at least.
Trying For The First Time,And We Loved It! Big Big Fans! The Hog Burger Is Honestly Really Delicious. It's The Best Burger I've Eaten,That's For Sure!

We decided to try this place because it was right next door to our hotel and it's got Gordon Ramsey's name on it, so it's gotta be good, right?    Aside from the twenty minute wait in line (no reservations) next to fiery welcome sign (even behind multiple lanes of glass, I could still feel the heat), the food was great!   I ordered the Turducken burger with a side order of truffle Parmesan fries.  FYI, none of the burgers come with sides but the fries are worth the $12.  We started with the Poutine and scarfed that down in minutes - it was absolutely amazing!    Definitely come with your stomachs empty because the food is awesome and the portions are huge!  I thought I'd have room for a Creme Brûlée Shake after but, clearly, my eyes were much bigger than my stomach.

This place has a huge waiting line, any time of the day! :) For a large party of 6 people, there is a 2.5hour wait time, so plan accordingly. Once we got our table the service was quick.  Oreo Creme Brulee milk shake is a not to miss dessert here! Bluecheese burger is a must try. I also liked Hell's kitchen burger and onion rings. Chicken wings were decent. Not a fan of fries here though.

Loved our burgers and experience at this place! Our server was very knowledgeable and accommodating with our orders. I had the Blue. So good! The onion rings are perfectly done with a balanced amount of batter to onion.

If you're in Vegas and on the strip and you're in the mood for a good burger, definitely visit Planet Hollywood! There's always a line but it moves quickly. I think I waited for about 15 minutes.  The Blue Cheeseburger which has blue cheese, fig jam, arugula, cider vinegar reduction and spicy mayo is a must! Pair it with some truffle fries. It's a pretty big order to share!

You cannot make reservations and have to stand in line, but the line moves along pretty well and you can look at the menu too while in line to help you decide what to get.  Service was great!  They were very nice.   1) Tandoori chicken burger - it was a bit dry and the feta is dry too so the tahini sauce could not save it. It was OK.  I would get something else. 2) Lobster-shrimp burger - SOOOO GOOD!  I would definitely get this again.  The pickled vegetables are spicy and tangy and really makes the burger 3) Parmesan fries- they are shaped like chips or wedges rather than thin fries just so you know. Make sure to ask for all their ketchups - chipotle ketchup, curry ketchup and regular as they are all tasty.  The truffle mayo it comes with too is tasty!  Overall great place and our server was really nice. Its a tasty reliable place to eat.

Food was great, even though we had to wait for 2 hours, but they gave us estimated time so we could come back after a little bit of street sightseeing. We ordered The hell's kitchen, Foie Burger, Blue cheese burger, The hog burger, and truffle parmesan fries. Hells kitchen and foie were really good. And I loved truffle parmesan fries!

Great tasting burgers for such a great price! One of the best tasting burgers I've ever had. The restaurant itself was quite busy. The food was decently priced, the drinks seemed over priced for their taste. Our waiter wasn't very attentive and spent most of his time chitchatting with people. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and Crown burger. My husband liked it so much he ordered a second one, but it came out very undercooked. Overall, the food was great and this will definitely be a regular stop anytime I'm in Vegas.
A little over priced because of the name but it is great flavor and hell we are in Vegas! So go there and expect a large bill but all worth it

I heard so much about this place and decided to try it out. I got the "Hell's Kitchen" burger and it's dressed with avocados, cheese, roasted jalapeño, roasted tomatoes, and jalapeño aïoli. Wow. Best burger I've ever had!!!

A 3.5 would probably be a more accurate rating for this place. We were in town for a bachelor party and decided a good burger would hit the spot for lunch.   I am not sure how it worked out but since we had a fairly large party, we didn't have to wait in line. They took down our info and called us when the table was ready. I guess they didn't want is backing up the line too long. This was great as we were able to wander around a little bit and grab some drinks in the casino.   Once seated, our server got our drinks and an appetizer order. She was very pleasant and explained the different burgers in detail for whatever questions we had.   The burger was good, but not great. Cooked to perfection but flavor was lacking a little bit. Let me tell you what you need to order are the truffle fries...AMAZING! I believe it came with a couple of different dipping sauces which was a plus.
Muy rica la comida, aunque cara (es lo que tiene ser famoso en Las Vegas). No se hasta que punto merece la pena ya que hay mejores hamburguesas por la zona

Been here too many times and the Hell's Kitchen burger never disappoint! A must try because I feel like there's a lot going on in the burger as compared to his other burgers. My favorite part about the burger is the tomato, definitely not like any other tomatoes you've had! This place is generally a good 30 mins-1 hr wait average , but might be less if you go during an off hour.
Everyone I come to Vegas, I have to stop here. The burgers are beyond amazing.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  My favorite it Bell's Kitchen Burger with a fried egg.

At first I was hesitant to come here. I've read reviews about how theres always a line.. & i hate lines.. I kept thinking to myself how good can their burgers be? No way they can be better than In-n-out's...  Anyways so one day i was strollin down the strip, it was around dinner time, stomach is getting a bit growly.. figured its time to find a bite to eat.. decided to stop by Planet Hollywood and chilll there for a bit.. enjoying that free AC while searching on Yelp for my next meal.. had this place bookmarked for the longest time so figured.. hey, im here, why the heck not!  i absolutely love the exterior of the restaurant, the highlight of it being the "fire wall".. just a really neat piece and great for photo ops.  The food here was amazing! its not comparable to In-n-out, being that these are gourmet burgers.. but they are definitely worth the price you will be paying for these bad boys.. you really cant go wrong with any of them.. but their most popular one is definitely their Truffle Burger which was DELICIOUS!!!  INSIDER TIP!!! ORDER THAT MILK SHAKE TO WASH IT ALL DOWN!!  No lie, my favorite item i got here was their milkshake, their custard, creme brulee with oreo to be exact. it will cost you around $11 but it was one of the most satisfying shake i have ever put  in my mouth!

Referred to me from one of my colleagues. i have visited twice now. two things to say Wow & wow. The beef. my gosh so fresh and so well seasoned. The brioche bun, the combinations of toppings. I will be back again for sure. A must whenever you're on the Vegas strip
Fantastic burgers and wonderful service. Tammy took great care of us. We should definitely visit again.

Party of 8 in town for Bachlorette party. The wait is long if you go for dinner. They do not take reservations. Ala Carte ordering. I spent about $25 for burger and onion rings I think. Service could have been better, our waiter was getting off and his replacement took forever to start or come to us. Food took awhile, they were short in the kitchen. Still giving a 4 Star because baby that food is GOOOOOD! Would definitely return

This place is OVERRATED.  Been here twice, I told my friends this place is overrated the second time I came but they insisted on coming.  I got the Backyard Burger, and to be honest this is just a burger like any other burgers. I would say a burger from Jack in the box taste as good as any burgers from this place.

There's constantly a line outside of this place and it usually takes 25 minutes after you order to get your meal but it's well worth the wait. Easily the best tasting burger I've ever had. The Hell's Kitchen burger isn't as spicy as I was expect but the food was great. Sweet potato fries are sprinkled with powdered sugar and I can't get enough! Drinks are pretty pricey.

All I can say is YUMMMM!! The service was beyond great, the food was amazzzzzzing! Im not a fan of sweet potatoes, but the sweet potato fries with powdered sugar is really good! This place is a must go when in vegas. It's kid friendly if you're with kids, which is a huge plus. The decor and atmosphere are also great. We'll definitely be back on our next trip to vegas.

We sat at the bar and waited for our burgers to be delivered for over an Hour. Sorry. It don't seat us hear after being 5 couples front the front of the line. 45 minutes later we were told  that it takes 35 minutes.

This place brought me to burger heaven. I would die a million times if it meant I got to visit burger heaven if not just for an hour. I wouldn't recommend this place for a date, cus you'll completely forget about your significant other and fall completely in love with the sweet sweet burg. I'm drooling just thinking about it and my girlfriend is wondering what's wrong with me. Little does she know I'm fantasizing about putting those delicious buns in my mouth.

Yummm yummmm and yummmmmm!!!!! 1 of the best burgers I have ever had!! A super cute little restaurant, right upon entering Planet Hollywood. I am sure there will always be a wait to eat here because of how amazing the burgers are. This was my first time and we waited about 20 minutes to get seated which wasn't too bad. We sat at the bar and the bartender was super attentive and friendly. Greeted us immediately with drinks and gave his recommendations and what the best items on the menu are. We went with what he recommended which was the famous Hell's Kitchen Burger. It took a while for the burger to come out, which he warned us about, so we also ordered the truffle fries to snack on while we waited. The fries were okay, but I may be bias because I am a thin cut fry person and their fries are thick wedge fries. They were good, but would have been AMAZING if they were thin cut. All that matters is the main course, which was out of this world!! It was on the spicy side, but my goodness! The bun was absolutely perfect and the burger literally melts in your mouth. MUST GO TO BURGER JOINT BEFORE LEAVING VEGAS!! YUM!! Pricing wasn't too bad either, well worth it! I wish I had room for dessert!

Absolute genius. He knows how to make a burger. The flavor combination is perfect. My blue burger was salty & sweet. Meat cook was on point. We sat at the bar wait time for a table can be timely especially if you have 3 or more in your party. The atmosphere is very upbeat and inviting. Prices are reasonable.  If you want a burger come here. You won't be disappointed. .
Hmmm .. I recommend that girls shared their burger and order fires or onion ring.. I can't eat the whole burger after eating onion rings and salad.  Burgers are okay.
Easily one of the best burgers I've had anywhere. Go for the Hells Kitchen burger you can't miss. Fries are delish too. Weekend evenings can get busy, go for lunch to avoid a wait.

300th review!  UPDATE: I love how they "renovated" so they could start over on Yelp. {/end sarcasm mode}  TL;DR: Go to Bobby's Burger Palace if you feel you must eat a celebrichef burger while in Vegas. Half the price, better burgers, better service, little to no wait, no tipped employees.  Don't believe everything you see on TV! I'm so disillusioned. Gordon, you were my favorite celebri-chef. I forsook Anthony Bourdain for you! I have been following Gordon religiously and watching every show of his I could get my hands on ever since I discovered F Word and the original Kitchen Nightmares on BBC America 12 years ago. My husband and I have been quoting him for over a decade. I have even made Amy's Baking Co references in a Yelp review. But the food here was NOT "simple, fresh, and vibrant," as Gordon could often be heard barking at hapless failing restaurateurs.  The fries were hard and over-seasoned. The burgers, which we ordered blue rare, came out well done. Sending it back did not fix it (and I fear the saliva added by our disgruntled waiter did not improve the flavor either). They also tasted burnt and oversalted, and both burger and bun were dry and crumbly - the former because it was overcooked, the latter because it was old (tasted even older than the bread we used to throw away for being too stale at the bakery I worked at while putting myself through college). The shakes were too sweet to choke down more than a mouthful or two and had way too much crap going on. Not just the shakes, EVERYTHING down to the sauces was needlessly complicated: some additional flourish for the "coolness factor" or something, not actually contributing anything to the flavor, and often going one step beyond to actually detracting. The food was as gimmicky and smug about its cleverness as the name BURG(ordon)R(amsay). No hint of simplicity, freshness, or vibrance. Just over-complication, massive overcooking, and smugness.  We left 3/4 of our food untouched, which is like a 9th circle-level sin for us. The servers just cleared our plates without caring to ask if there was a reason we didn't eat very much of it.  So not worth the hype, the price, or the long wait.  If I were Gordon I would want to make sure that every restaurant that bore my name and likeness had service and food I was proud to put my name on, but I guess he would rather watch his bank account grow than work to protect the reputation he sweated blood for years to attain.  The only reason why I can't say this was the worst overpriced meal I've ever had is because BEAST exists.

The hype is real!  I know that Chef Ramsay was not behind the grill the night we came, but it seems there is a real attention to detail here that has earned the name.    This was our Thanksgiving dinner this year.  My older son and I came here because the younger son was acting up.  This was my son's choice.  I was game.  There was a bit of a wait for two, but not too bad considering it's Vegas, at early dinner time, on Thanksgiving Day.  When we were seated the server came over pretty quickly.  They have a pretty simple menu of burgers and sides, but all of the offerings looked very interesting.    They have a good selection of draught beers on tap.  I started with a Boddington's - delish.    For an appetizer, we ordered their take on nachos - kettle cooked potato chips topped with corned beef and smothered in a cheese sauce.  OMG!  Wow!  This was sooo good.  My son ordered the basic burger and I ordered the Hog Sandwich for our entrees.  My son really liked his burger.  He plowed through it like nothing.  My sando was pretty amazing.  It had a ground pork patty topped with pulled pork, bacon, and onion strings.  Whoa!  Porky heaven.  The only hiccough of the meal was that they ran out of two beers that I tried to order.  I ordered the first off the menu.  The server came back and told me that they were out, but he also brought two tasters.  I really liked one, so I ordered it.  He came back a few minutes later and told me they were out of that one too, but he gave me a free glass of his other recommendation.  I did not expect that at a big name Vegas restaurant, so all worked out fine.  Definitely a great place for a casual meal in Vegas.  Based on this experience, I want to try some other GR restaurants.

Recently tried this delicious burger place while out in Vegas. An absolute must stop if you are a fan of Gordon Ramsay and his delicious food. The line can be quite a wait but if you have a party of 4 or more can go by a bit quicker with preference for larger parties  Onto the food. I had one of the best burgers I've ever tasted in my life. Great quality meat and condiments. The ambience is amazing along with the friendly staff. Will def be checking this place out while in Vegas in the near future

We were pretty impressed with our first visit so we decided to visit again this trip. The wait wasn't too long at 7-8pm on a Thursday night - about a half hour for a party of 2.   Since we weren't too hungry we decided to share the blue burger, chips with curry sauce, and a brown butter caramel pecan shake. Our server came by pretty quickly to ask us if we wanted to order any drinks (they're all listed on an ipad) but we declined seeing as how we already packed in quite a few drinks by that time. From there the service went a bit downhill, our server wasn't very friendly and also got our order wrong (order wasn't written down, just remembered). We ended up with the correct burger and drink but truffle parmesan fries instead - we decided not to send this back since it looked pretty good and the price difference is pretty small anyway. One thing to note, the food took a very long time to come out; we finished pretty much the entire shake before the fries came out.   As for taste, the blue burger is a solid if you like blue cheese, relatively simple but done well. I will say that I enjoyed my forest burger from our last visit a bit more. We loved the fries though, especially the truffle sauce which was extremely decadent. The shake was superb and I like how there were caramel pecans right on top - would definitely recommend trying out their shakes!!   We essentially didn't see our server for the rest of our meal and had to wait quite a while to get the check.   With everything said, I still like Burger- the food is great & well priced, plus the poor service seemed to be a relatively isolated incident. The tables in other sections near us seemed to have pretty attentive servers & our server from our last visit was also extremely friendly and attentive. Overall I'd still recommend stopping by if you're staying at Planet Hollywood or just craving a burger!

It seems this place is always busy. We came here at 8 pm one night and were told that it would be a two hour wait. So, we decided to come back another night. When we arrived, we came here in a group of four at 9 pm and waited about an hour and a half for a table. By the time we were at the front of the line, we were super hungry - but we were told that a party of four would take 45 minutes longer, so we ended up splitting our party into pairs.   We ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and Kettle Chip Nachos. The burger was really good! The beef patty was tender, juicy and cooked perfectly. However, I was extremely disappointed with the nachos as the chips were basically drenched in oil. The chips were soggy from all the oil in this dish. One of my relatives felt sick to her stomach after eating this dish, and she was sick for the next few days of our trip.   Overall, I would not line up again and wait to eat those nachos. If I come back to Vegas, I'll be heading over to Ramsay's Fish and Chips instead!

Meh. Ordered burgers and fries and shakes. Waited forever. Food was fine but nothing special. Even for the strip it seemed incredibly overpriced. After the long delay, they got two of the orders wrong, even though nobody ordered anything special. By the time they brought the re-do orders, everyone else had cold food. One of the re-do orders was still wrong. All of this took more than two hours and nothing was above average. Except perhaps the shakes. Those were tasty. The waiter never apologized which seemed tacky and just kept saying it was too loud to hear anything.

First the burger WAS GREAT! Can't argue that. But after all it is a $15 burger, it had better be, lol. The reason for the 3 star rating was the way they pile up extra charges without letting you know.  After my kids ordered their plain ole hamburgers the witness asked if they wanted mushroom or bacon. They, being kids said, "ok".......They don't tell you that that added $16 to the bill by doing that. Actually they way she mentioned it I too assumed it was part of the meal, she never said that it was extra, but then again I live in Vegas and know how they underhandedly gouge visitors. Shameful. Gordon, you don't need the money that bad.

The place feels a little more elevated and fancy. The fire by the doors gives it a true Gordon Ramsay feel. I waited in line and it moved rather quickly as long as you are in a party of two. They have to move tables to sit more than two people which is understandable. I got the crown burger which just melted in my mouth. My friend got the Hell burger. The server was great and took the initiative to have both burgers cut in half for us to share. Both were amazing in their own way. If you love burgers, check this place out. It's unbelievable. Highly recommend and plan to return.

The restaurant is clean and the service is great. The food though, isn't super surprising.  My husband and I ordered the onion rings, truffle fries, burger and ale dog.  The truffle fries were the best. The ale dog was SO salty I ended up having a bit and asking them to just take it off our bill.  Overall though, lots of food for the cost!

Had dinner here tonight and it was such a good burger! The fries came with two types of specialty ketchup (Chipotle ketchup and Curry ketchup). Both had some kick to them and were great. I had the St. Archer IPA which was also fantastic. Do yourself a favour and go there for dinner if your in Las Vegas.

Amazing burgers! Sub-par service.   +Crown Burger: My boyfriend ordered this and it was delicious, something about the dried tomatoes complimented the burger very well. +Blue Cheeseburger: I got this because I love blue cheese. I asked for the spicy mayo on the side because I didn't want it to be too saucy or spicy. This burger was not as good as the crown burger because it tasted so buttery and heavy. It was cooked perfectly and once I removed some of the cheese, the buttery-ness subsided, which was good.  +Onion Rings: Best onion rings ever! So glad we got these instead of the truffle fries. The breading was perfectly seasoned and crispy and the ranch and chipotle ketchup were amazing.   -The server disappeared after we got our food and we weren't able to flag her down to get the check for around 20-30 minutes. She tended to the tables around us but never came back for us. The bussers were extremely helpful though.  I would definitely come back but not if I'm in a rush to be anywhere.
Long line, long wait for the food, bad service, not tasty burgers. Overpriced. Didn't like it! Don't recommend!

In Las Vegas ist der Appetit bekanntlich sehr groß. Ich als großer Freund von Rindfleisch zwischen zwei Brötchenhälften musste dieses Lokal einfach aufsuchen. Bitte esst hier ! Alle Burger sind großartig und mit viel Liebe zubereitet. Preis - Leistung ist ABSOLUT gerechtfertigt. Ich habe hier den besten Burger meines Lebens gegessen.

I came across this restaurant as I was exploring Planet Hollywood, and of course me being a big burger snob, so I decided to check this place out. I found the exterior super exciting and cool looking. The wait was max 10 minutes.   Once we walked in and were seated, I was quite impress on how fast that was, however when I saw how big the restaurant was, my expectations of the quality of the food decreased. Thank goodness the ending was not a disappointment.  Being a huge burger snob of course I asked the extremely kind gentleman that assisted us for his recommendations. He gladly recommended a seasonal burger that was off menu. He provided the details of the ingredients and I was convinced so I ordered it ( forgot the name but it was beef with short rib, it was amazing!!!). I also ordered the fries that came along with a curry & chipotle ketchup. Me not being a fan of curry, chipotle nor ketchup, the thought didn't fancy my interest so in addition to what was already in front of me I still went ahead requested for regular ketchup. I ended up wanting to get the full experience of their touch to the fries so I went ahead and tasted both the curry and chipotle ketchup resulted in making my taste buds tingle and I ended up not being able to stop dipping my fries in the curry... wowsers..  Let's cut this long story to a conclusion...  The burger exceeded my expectations.. Yes, it did!! Would I try this place again.. Yes, I would definitely come again next time I'm in Vegas!!  Excellent Service and even though we were warned that we would wait a little while for our food, the wait was not as bad as we thought.   From a Beer Snobs point of view, the only downfall was that they don't have quite a large variety in Craft Beer and they don't support any of their local breweries... boo!!!! But the 1 DIPA available that I tried was a comfort to my beer & burger snob ways...
Best burger and service I've had. The meat combination was perfect and so were the burger choices. Really hit the spot.
40 minutes wait and then 2 hours to finish eating. Service is very slow. Food is decent. Overhyped in my opinion.

If this is the standard for Gordon Ramsey, then I wouldn't try a higher end place. For as much as he talks about seasoning, there certainly wasn't any on my burgers or fries except for cumin in the ketchup which was less than appealing. I just went with the plain Backyard burger hoping for good flavor but apparently you need to slather it with 3 different cheese and sauces and bacon to make it taste good.  I would skip this place and go straight to Shake Shack.
Great service and food: fabulous atmosphere with British Invasion sound track. Love the fired signage. Sat at the bar where I was addressed by name. All about the details!

I was extremely impressed with the "Forest" burger it was cooked to perfection. The exceptionally juicy burger was topped with tremor cheese, arugula, grilled mushrooms and duck bacon. The combination of the arugula, cheese and duck bacon was a flavor explosion. Again, the duck bacon was such a unique twist on the traditional "bacon" burger. Everything was on point including the service. A must go! Reasonable priced as well. Dessert was .

The food was awesome. The Backyard Burger was so good. The taste of the butter in the lettuce. Would definitely recommend eating here. The staff was good as well. I would fly to Vegas just to eat here. One of the best burgers I've ever had.

The line looked long to get in but for two people we were seated pretty quick at the bar. Service was whatever not friendly but not rude either. Ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger ($17) and my boyfriend got the blue cheeseburger and we shared some Parmesan fries ($12). The food wasn't as great as i thought, I've had better burgers. I ended up getting food poisoning and spent one of my vacation days in Vegas in bed recovering my boyfriend also felt sick after his meal. Save yourself the money and the stomach ache do not eat here.

You have no idea how much it PAINS me to give a restaurant named after the man himself anything less than a perfect score. Anyone who knows me knows that I have a strange yet justified obsession with all things Gordon Ramsey. That being said, my visit here was just not great. My friend and I sat at the bar because they said it would be a long wait and we just wanted to split a burger and truffle fries. The bartender told us the burger would take roughly 30 mins and I wasn't terribly upset about it because come on... perfection takes time lol in actuality the burger didn't come for an hour. And that was annoying because it was getting late and an hour to make a burger is kinda ridiculous lol   The burger itself was cold, very salty and kind of fell apart as you tried to eat it. The bartender was not attentive to us at all. After she took our order we didn't see her again. She spent most of the time talking to a friend.  In fact, when we finished a separate waiter saw us sitting there waiting and took our plates.  The only saving grace were the truffle fries but they are pricy.   Overall I wouldn't return if I visit Vegas again. Prices were too high for the product and the service during this visit wasn't great.    Still love Gordon though
I ordered the short ribs and a glass of wine. The short ribs were very dry. I had to drink a swig of wine for the meat to go down.  Over cooked food with a name.
First time to try the Gordon Ramsey burger! I was delicious! Definitely would come back again!

One of my "have to go" places before my first trip to Vegas. Waited a while in line and got seated by very pleasant hostesses. Wait staff also was amazing and very friendly.
