The food was what I had an issue with. It took FOREVER to get our food!!! Almost 40 mins for burgers to come out. The fries were cold when they came out. I was sorely disappointed!!

1 word: YUMMY!  My husband and I went to Burger Saturday afternoon for lunch around 1pm.  We waited about 30 minutes for a table.  Once we were seated, we were almost immediately greeted by our server.  I can't remember his name, but he was GREAT!  He made an excellent suggestion about a secret burger (the F Word burger), that my husband ended up ordering.  It was a little pricey, but well worth it.  I had the Farmhouse burger, and then we shared the truffle fries.  So so good!!!  I must also add that this was not our 1st visit here, but probably the best food and service that we have ever received.  On that note, I am already looking forward to dining at Gordon Ramsay Burger again!

Really overrated. Waited about an hour for a seat then another 30 minutes to get our food. This was at 2pm on a Sunday. I was looking around at the tables and seemed like everyone was just waiting for their food with empty tables. The hog burger was $18. the pork was overpowering. It comes in a super thick pork patty, wrapped in bacon, topped with shredded pork. They should've given more Cole slaw. I couldn't finish the pork patty because it was so thick and so I left it on the plate and the smell of it was making me noxious. Very strong pork smell. Everything was just mediocre. Can't say it's worth the money. Total was about  $170 for five people.

THE. BEST. BURGER. EVER.  Literally words can't describe how flavorful, tender, and juicy this burger was. I love a good classic burger that uses fresh ingredients that compliment each other, instead of relying on gimmicky crap. I got the crown burger and it was outstanding. The bun was perfection, the tomatoes and fresh herb aioli was perfect together. The arugula was a great addition to the burger. We also had the curried shrimp salad which was very tasty and full of good flavors as well. Drinks are good too. I will be back for those delicious burgers. Definitely lives up to the hype.

Good once. Maybe their shake will bring me back for a second try.  $50 for a burger, fries, and shake...and quite a long wait.  I stood in line for about 1/2 an hour just before 3pm on a Saturday, which was understandable. After being seated at the bar, the server took my order within a few minutes.  I ordered the Hog Burger, Truffle Parmesan Fries, and a Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake.  The shake came out within 5 or 10 minutes, followed shortly by the fries.  However, it was somewhere between 35 to 40 minutes before my burger came out. The server had warned of a 25-30 minute wait, and I had accepted that. However, by then, the fries were lukewarm, and my shake had been devoured as it was absolutely delicious.  The overwhelming memory of the Hog Burger was its dryness. The generous serving of patty was cooked to a perfect medium as suggested by the server, but I found myself requiring a lot of water to offset the dryness of the entire burger.  On one hand, this was a nice change to the usual grease-drenched burgers at other establishments, but perhaps a light spread would make the burger more enjoyable.   The Truffle Parmesan fries were just ok. There was a light sprinkle of parmesan over the top of the fries, which lead to a rather uneven distribution of the cheese once you got to the fries hiding at the bottom, especially since they were served in a cone.  There were two interesting sauces; one was red and mildly spicy(chipotle ketchup) and the other was a yellow creamy blend(truffle aioli).  One of the barbacks/assistants made my service experience excellent. He filled in for my server and refilled water regularly and noticed that I was scrutinizing my prestained fork and offered to replace it without my having to ask.   Overall, not a satisfying first experience with their burger and fries, but I've only sampled a small portion of their menu.

Burgers are good. I ordered a hog burger and liked it. My friend ordered the hell's burger and it was good too (if you like spicy). Fries and crepe brûlée drink were alright. Like the fire display out front too.

This place was definitely over hyped for us.   I came here with my boyfriend around 11pm but called before to see what time their kitchen closes. The waitress said their kitchen is open until 11:55pm, which is nice since they actually close at 12am and they are willing to still serve you.   Upon arriving, we see the famous Gordan Ramsay sign lit up with fire behind it. We were super excited about trying this place out, especially after reading the reviews.   I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger medium rare along with the truffle fries. Nothing stood out about it. I've honestly had better burgers for a better price. I usually prefer avocado in my burger to be more guac style but here they cut it into slices for you. Also, there is tomato in it and it was cold and stood out (in a bad way) from the burger.   For the name, I expected better food. The price was decent since everything on the Strip is usually around there though.   Would I recommend or come back? No.

Burger ottimo, patatine un po' pesanti. Meglio puntare al burger. L'attesa è valsa la pena. Blue cheeseburger + backyard. +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

With a location bearing the famous Gordon Ramsay's name, I expected much more.   SERVICE: The service was the most upsetting as the waitresses were extremely frustrating. I came with a party of 9 with them originally saying 45 minutes. After an hour, I asked of the status and a lady stated that "it'll be 10 more minutes since they are now cashing out." Half an hour later, we, again, asked of the status. Their response: "oh, we gave it to another group. Sorry. It'll be 15 more minutes." Each time we asked of the status, they would change the story of which table was "finishing up" and that it would be "another 15 minutes."  Guess what? 40 minutes later, they still have not gotten us a table and we are the longest waiting group. Total wait time was 2.5 hours when they originally promised 45 minutes.   The service is poor and frustrating for such a famous location. If this location were to improve, improve the waitresses as they are just willing to improvise false stories and wait times.   FOOD: We decided to stay for the food since they made us wait 2.5 hours for a table they kept promising. The food was mediocre at best. The poutine was extremely salty and would bring even the healthiest person into hypertensive crisis. The meat was overcooked despite ordering a medium-- just overpriced for the hype. I am disappointed to give this a poor review especially since I am a big fan of Chef Ramsay.   ADVICE: Avoid this place. Just check out the Bobby Flay burgers near by. They treat you with respect there and the food is superior.

Came here 20 minutes before closing and sat at the bar. The host greeted us and was friendly. The bar server was cool and attentive.  The hell's kitchen burger which is there best seller was soooo good. I added an egg which cost 3 bucks extra.  Their shakes are awesome. Their caramel with pecan sounds super sweet but wasn't too sweet at all.  Their oreo tiramisu shake is the bomb! definitely a must get if you're not on a calorie count lol

Over priced, over hyped, mediocre burgers.  The wait to sit is long. The wait to get your food is even longer. Burgers are around $15 and up. Fries are not included and they will run you $8, $11 if you want truffle fries.   The burger patties are DRY. I wanted to try a specialty burger so I went with the Hog Burger ($18) and BF went with the Hell's Kitchen Burger ($15). Both of the patties were dry. We also got the truffle fries ($11) and they were steak fries which I am not a fan of. Also, they came out lukewarm. Now, I have no problem with the price if the burgers are good. I understand this is Vegas, on the strip, so I understand the high prices. But if I'm paying for those prices, I expect it to be good. I've had super premium dry age beef burgers upwards to $26 to greasy spoon burgers, and I love them all as long as they are good. I rather eat In-N-Out, Shake Shack, even Five Guys that I don't like that much over Gordon Ramsay Burger. Even if they are the same price.   The service is a whole 'nother thing. We waited close to an hour for the burgers to come out. The server explain that it takes them 45 minutes to an hour to cook the burgers. At least they could have given us the fries beforehand? And how come some people got their stuff quicker than us? We were highly suspicious they dropped our order or something went wrong in the back. Around 30 minute mark, we asked about our order and they said our burgers were next. Another 15 minute and no burgers. 50 minutes ish, the burgers come out and a bit later the manager comes over to apologize and explain, but there isn't much of an explanation. He says he'll get us a free beer or a shake but I know I'm gonna be way too full for that. I'd rather he comped the mediocre fries or something but oh well.  In the end, the bill was over $60 for two burgers, fries, and a beer. And a highly regrettable choice of meal for our short time in Vegas.

I went here on Friday night about 11 PM (party of two) and they asked if we wanted kitchen bar seating which we were fine with. Our waiter was quick and provided very good service throughout the experience. I got the Cheeseburger and it is AMAZING it has 3 different cheeses! :) for the price I wish that it came with fries but the burger was enough for a late night meal. I have gotten this burger before about a year and a half ago and I never have forgotten about it and it is just as good as last time!

I didn't really wanna eat here, honestly. It looked frou-frou and overpriced from outside. I was glad we did, though. I was wrong. Burger was very enjoyable.  The food is not ridiculously overpriced. Pretty amazing food, too, actually. I can honestly say the Hell's Kitchen Burger was one of the best burgers I've had. I'd pass on the Tandoori Chicken Burger, though -- it's good, but nothing special.  The truffle fries with dipping sauces were delicious and big enough for two to share.  Service was pretty good, too. Friendly staff, drinks always refilled quickly. Food took 25 minutes to come out, but our server warned us about it ahead of time. It's worth the wait.

My pregnant wife and I just got sat after waiting in line for over an hour, which I wouldn't have minded so much except that they were taking everyone it would be a 30 minute wait. Then, when we finally got seated and didn't see a waiter in the first 8 minutes, we were told as we ordered that it would be another 40 minutes before we got our food. If I would have know it would be almost exactly 2 hours from getting in line to receiving my food, I seriously would have gone to Panda Express. No overpriced burger is worth this. Las Vegas strip location.

I am a sucker for a good burger and the first time I came here, I was beyond satisfied. The service was great, I never had to hound a server down like I do at some other restaurants. I sat at the bar and I love the fact that all of the workers were genuinely smiling, having a great time and getting along, stress-free. It created an exciting and very joyful experience and I will be going back.  Burger suggestion: The Hog Burger

Terrible Experience! No reservations accepted...so after waiting an hour at lunchtime, we're seated at a table that is basically in the hotel entrance way. Then we waited an additional forty minutes for our food. We mentioned all of this to our waiter, who apologized, agreed, but claimed no ability to affect the situation. I  complained to the Manager, trying to be much more gracious than Gordon Ramsay. He as well claimed no accountability. I'm writing this YELP review, trying to be much more gracious than Gordon Ramsay. Either Gordon Ramsay has no idea what is going on at this restaurant or he is a SHAM.

Amazingly good burgers for a very decent price! The burgers are perfect, the paddies great. And the combinations are great! Have tasted the hells kitchen and blue cheese burgers. Both were really tasty. Also good service.

finally tried this over memorial day weekend. called ahead to see if there was a wait and they said about 25-30 min wait for lunch. walked in through the door and saw a long line but apparently that was for parties of 2? we gave our number to the hostess and they would text us when our table was ready. shopped around planet hollywood for about 15-20 mins and our table was ready. i rely heavily on yelp pictures so even though the menu sounded good i had to check yelp. i ended up getting the farmhouse burger medium rare, my friends got the hog burger (its pork so they can only serve it medium at the most), and the hells kitchen burger. we also got the onion rings (delish!), fries (amazing), and the sweet potato fries(ordinary). the fries are huge btw. can def share with your group. they also had a lot of different sauces you can dip them in. we also asked for the aioli which i looove with my burgers. everything was so juicy and delicious! definitely come here it is worth a try! gordon ramsay lives up to his name!

I really want to give this place high marks, because the food was fantastic. The foie gras burger was definitely the best burger I've ever eaten, but there were two things that bugged me about my visit. The glass that my beer was served in was not very clean, and had visible food residue from the previous customer on it. I'm pretty sure I got sick from it, and looking back I should have asked for a new glass, but it was pretty hard to get a hold of our waiter. Speaking of which, it took nearly 20 minutes for our waiter to come collect our bill. It was a busy day, but I feel like a restaurant with a high-profile name like Gordon Ramsay on the front should be able to handle a full load of customers with little to no difficulty.   Overall I was satisfied with the food, but the service and cleanliness could definitely be improved upon.
Stood in line for 45 minutes just to taste this burger. The wait was worth it.

I love Gordon Ramsay, however, it is not worth the price and the wait :/ I mean it's in Las Vegas so yes, you have to wait for almost everything but I really don't see myself from going back there even if I were to visit NV again.   The sangria is actually really delicious, but again, kind of pricey.  I wouldn't highly recommend but it wouldn't be the worst thing in the world to try it here once in your life.

Delicious! Delicious! Delicious! My husband surprised me with a trip to Las Vegas, and I was most excited about going to Gordon Ramsay burger! It did not disappoint! I got the farmhouse burger, my husband got the crown burger and we got delicious kettle chip nachos as an appetizer! Even though the burgers were delicious, the nachos were hands down one of the best things I've ever eaten. I was literally making questionable noises while eating them because they were that good. We also got truffle fries, which were probably the weakest thing we got, but still good. We got really in to truffle last year when we went to Italy, and when you order truffle anything in the US, they give you a little measly bit of truffle. Not GRB, they loaded it up. It was almost too much truffle. Other than that, I can't wait to go back!! My favorite part of Vegas!
Everything was good except the seafood burger. It was really weird and did have a good taste.

Came here for dinner during our first night stay and I am in love with the Hog Burger. For someone who does not eat beef, this was the perfect burger anyone could ask for. It had a huge patty (see my pictures) and was filled with flavor. There was about an hour wait but luckily I was able to get seated within 5 minutes since I am a PLATNIUM member. GET PLATINUM PEOPLE, YOU SKIP LINES! The food took awhile to come since it was super busy. The Truffle Fries came first which were pretty tasty. I will definitely be coming back here again.
AMAZING burgers!!! Definitely will come back here when I come to Vegas next ;) Great service even tho they were super busy!! Sweet potato fries were to die for!

It's good but is it worth the wait? I'd give this place 3.5 stars. The restaurant is eye catching, it has flames to draw you in. Oh and don't forget the star power name attached to the place. But once you get inside, it kinda feels like an upscale diner.   It has a mix of counter, low and high table seating which seems plenty but the place has built quite the reputation and can certainly draw a crowd. If you don't mind the wait the food is pretty good. They take your favorite burgers and fries and kick it up a notch. I had the anniversary burger and truffle fries. The burger is made in limited amounts so ask ahead to see if they have any. The gourmet beef patties are cooked over an open flame using prime cuts of meat. And of course the fries are generously coated with a taste of rich truffles.  If the line is short I'll probably pop in again.

Tried onion rings for the table, which were great. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger, absolutely delicious. Save room for dessert too! I tried the Creme Brûlée shake and loved it! Great stop if your visiting Planet Hollywood & Miracle Mile Shops.

** Good but I'm not sure it's worth $25 and the line!**  Happened across this new burger place located in planet Hollywood. There was a line and someone told us the the wait was 2 hours or 2 people.   We decided to order take out at the front corner and wander around the Casino while we waited  1 hour...  for a burger (yikes)  They have a lobster burger which was intriguing but we ordered the steak cut Truffle fries ($11 amazing) and 2 burgers: Hell's Kitchen (most popular) with jalapeños  and the Patriot (Turkey burger with shoestring frites and cherry compote)   Total cost was around $48 or $25 each ( we shared fries). Serving size is reasonable. all in all a good burger but Vegas is  overpriced, he's a world renown chef, and I'm sure I won't return - there's too many options
It was awesome 3 years ago but this time the burger patty was really dry. They dont have the coffee shake anymore either.

This is one of my favorite places to go in Las Vegas!!! The burgers are absolutely phenomenal!!! My favorite is the Hell's Kitchen burger and the backyard burger!!! I always order onion rings as well they are so delicious !!! I highly recommend trying this place out if you haven't yet. There's usually always a line but in my opinion the food is worth the wait. If you have never had poutine you should defiantly try that while your here to. The burgers are huge so my boyfriend and I usually share one so go hungry. We usually make it a point to at least go once or twice a year. In my opinion it's the best burgers I have ever had!

Probably the B E S T burger I have ever had that I didn't produce myself. They only serve 100 burgers of this style...when gone, they are gone. Aged NY blended with rib meat, and a true medium rare was spot on!

Looked forward in trying Gordon's burger restaurant. Was it the best burger I have ever had? Nope. It was perfectly cooked (medium well) and very juicy. Cheese was fresh and a nice bun. Homemade ketchup was a nice touch. Onion rings were excellent. We left still feeling a little hungry as the burger size was on the smaller side. Service was outstanding!!!  Two burgers, onion rings and an ice tea came to $60 including tip. If you do want the best burger The Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay is the best anywhere and at half the price.

You're better off eating at Red Robin (it's cheaper and around the same quality). Poutine is absolute rubbish (it's basically just fries slathered in spicy pepper sauce). I've had better poutine from a Canadian Costco. Burger was majorly over cooked (ordered medium rare, got well done). Cheese looks and tastes like Kraft singles. For a man who has a show called "Hells Kitchen", the food here certainly came directly from hell. And I love Gordon! But the quality of food here is just atrocious. And there was cheese on the bill folder and brown crust on a "fresh" served plate. and it's basically a sports bar atmosphere. Step it up Ramsay!

Just a Burger? I think Not Whats going on here? Whats going on here is that there is a flow of flavores that are dancing delightedly on my tongue. A melding of a symphony of flavors that were developed by a genius. I had the Forest burger and I would have it again and again.

I was worried that this restaurant being owned by Chef Ramsay would not live up to his standards that I've seen on his shows.  My best friend and I were on a girls trip and I wanted to check it out.  We waited in line for 30min not too bad considering.  We both ordered a burger, with a side order of fries and onion rings.  WOW!  Burger was juicy, had a lot of flavor and cooked the way I asked.  Just observing while I was eating noticed waiters were on it.  Cleaning tables and chairs as soon as people were done eating.  A+.  If you're looking for a great burger this place will not disappoint.

Annual run to my favorite burger spot! ($15 burger) Since I've tried 5 years ago, I've been going back here annually to enjoy the burger. The name has changed from "BurGR" to "Gordon Ramsay Burger" located at Paris Casino. All the names on Menu has been updated into new names but seems like the ingredients haven't changed.  I had to go back home right away so we decided to choose TOGO, and it was great experience. The girls at the front helped me with new menu and it was fairly fast. (Explained it's almost the same as other older menu) The food took about 30-40min to come out but looking at the Line, I would rather gamble some $ while waiting for food to come out.  Food came out pretty warm and it was awesome burger!!  We will be back again next year~!

This place is a hype, the burgers are not with the amount of money you'd be paying for. But the chicken wings are the best I've had. I ordered a set of wings, the crab shrimp burger, lamb burger, and the firehouse burger; all of them were good but just didn't have a punch. They came with sweet potato fries and normal fries; the sweet potato fries were also just okay because they added some white powder to it and it was way too salty and the normal fries were too dry and soft, as I felt like I'm eat mashed potato sticks that were fried. I also ordered their crum Berle Oreo shake and pecan caramel shake, the Oreo shake was phenomenal. But the burgers are whack, so 2 out of 5 because I went there for a burger, the burgers were trash for the hype this place was. The fries were trash and any beginner can do better, the burger was a hype and some franchise restaurants are much better and cheaper(BJ's brewhouse), but the chicken wings are too die for and the Oreo shake was unreal.

His steak place at the Paris Hotel is to die for.  This place, not so much.  Expected a lot more for the price.  Burgers are expensive, which I expected, but they should have been excellent.  Don't go if you expect to be wowed.

I'm (pretty much) obsessed with Gordon Ramsay so I was ecstatic to be in Vegas with a chance to dine at one of his restaurants. Steak was out of price range (poverty college student) so burgers it was.   Ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger ($15) and truffle fries ($11) to share. The burger was delicious, with a nice kick of heat. Perfectly cooked. The truffle fries were okay - the parmesan was a little overpowering and seemed to absorb much of the truffle oil.   The place is located in Planet Hollywood. It's got a very modern posh look. We came at 11:30am on a Tuesday and had no wait for food...unfortunately after ordering, our food took at least 30 minutes to come out! Luckily I was in good company so there was plenty to talk about but it really was a long time for burgers and fries. Service was just okay, as the server only came by once early on in our wait. The server was knowledgeable about the menu but really didn't display much interest in us after we ordered. The place also doesn't take reservations, so  it can get crowded at peak hours.  Bottom line: It's as tasty as you'd expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. A little pricey but it's Vegas and it does have the Ramsay name. Prepare for a length wait for the food, sadly.  Anecdote: The table of four next to us also had a long wait for their food, so much so that the manager came out to talk to them. They waited for over 25 minutes, which apparently is the policy there. We definitely waited just as long, but no manager came to talk to us - probably because we are potatoes. Sad.

One word: over-hyped. We were excited to try this place after passing by it year after year, so we came in for dinner. We got there around 5 and there was a bit of a line, but we were seated within 30 minutes. We ordered the nachos, Hell's Kitchen burgers, and truffle fries.   Within ten minutes we were greeted by a special little guest--a baby cockroach came out to play right by our feet! We were pretty surprised that, what with Gordon Ramsay's habit of battering restaurant owners for their unwelcome pests, he had some in his own restaurant. At least it was only a baby and not that grotesque, but it was still pretty freaky to see at a place where you're about to eat. We told a passing waiter and were moved a couple tables down by the manager, although I'm not sure they ultimately did anything about the cockroach.  On to the food--it was all unimpressive. Everything seemed to be made of good quality ingredients, but lacked flavor overall. The burger seemed to have a good bun, and the meat appeared juicy, but again, no flavor. The nachos were fairly good. The truffle fries were a let-down.   It was just a very "meh" meal. There are many, many better places to get a burger on the Strip.
If the food wasn't good enough, Paul and Brandon just completed our dining experience

Really awesome place!! Had the mushroom burger since I'm vegan and the onion rings!! It was flavourful and did not disappoint. Definitely on the pricey side for burgers but worth every penny!! I definitely recommend this place
If you want to spend 3 to 4 hours just to heating to Bruegger. Then you can go  tease please. The food is good but the service is horrible

This place was defiantly great, amazing hamburger, beautiful decor. I only had one complaint that makes this a 4 star was the waitress I had. The waitress was Dorota and all she did was talk to her coworkers when they themselves were working and sitting in a corner laughing with the other workers. She never swung by our table unless we asked another waiter to get us something. Polite but she never came by to check up on us. Overall very great experience aside from the waitress!
This place was simply amazing. Everything tasted fresh and amazing. Get the farmhouse burger, you will not be disappointed.

They have really great burgers!! And great customer service.  They slightly messed up my husband's order,  and they were very proactive in correcting it. The manager even came out to apologize, and it was such a small mix up!

This restaurant was located in the hotel/casino we stayed at so it was an easy pick to go here for lunch. I passed by the restaurant several times during my last visit to vegas and there always seemed to be a line. Thank goodness we had reservations and was seated within 15 minutes of checking in.   Since I don't eat meat I decided to go for the Portobello mushroom burger which was over $20. I shared onion rings, sweet potato fries, and truffle fries with others. The burger itself wasn't that memorable and the fries were not the best. I think the onion rings were good though.   All in all, service was meh maybe because they were busy. I probably will not return though just because it's vegas and there are so many other restaurants that taste better. =/

Refused seating at 12pm claiming that they were only seating for the Super Bowl, which didn't start until 3pm. We would've eaten, paid and been back at our room long before the pregame show. They also failed to post this restriction on their website, meaning we walked a mile in the Nevada heat for nothing. As a Total Rewards Diamond member, I am not impressed and it would seem that my business is more welcomed over at MGM properties.

3.5 stars. On the last day of our trip, my husband and I decided to give the line a shot. 30 mins before opening, we began to line up. We were the first to be seated and first to have our burgers served. Although we were the first, it still took 30 mins for the burgers to be mad after we placed our order! Def pack your patience and don't come too hungry!   Lobster and shrimp burger - saw it on "Worth It" Buzzfeed channel aka basically  what we came for. In sum, it reminded me of eating a bunch of shui mai  (dim sum dumplings) sandwiched into a burger. Not exactly how I imagined it.. tasted fine but a little plain to be honest. With pickled  carrots as the only topping, it became boring almost immediately.   Hells Kitchen's burger - traditional burger with jalapeños chili and avocado slices - tasty but compared to Holstein's the night before, it was pretty forgettable. Safe choice for those trying out Gordon Ramsey's burger for the first time though - original flavor with a slight twist.   Sweet potato fries - game changer! - going to start dusting all my fries in powdered sugar.   Overall - good burger but definitely not worth the ridiculous line/wait line.

Long wait, mediocre at best food. Overpriced for what you get and restaurant employees indifferent to you. I don't think they're concerned if you're satisfied or not, there's a line at the door waiting for your table.

I must say great experience from their service to their food AMAZING everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and their  juices we were made fresh absolutely recommend trying this restaurant out u won't be disappointed

I have had a lot of burgers in many places, but this was hands down the best burger I've had to date.  I ordered the Crown Burger, and asked for the chef's recommendation on cook level, which the waiter informed me was medium rare...soooo glad I asked!  The burger was so flavorful and juicy.  I have never used this term on a burger before, and didn't think it was possible, but the meat seemed to melt in my mouth!  Everything on the burger worked well together, the seasoning on the bun ('everything' seasoning maybe?) had a little saltiness and a bit of crunch to the soft bread, the herb aioli was delicious, the arugula was a perfect leafy green to the burg, the ONLY thing I might have changed is to have a slightly heartier slice of the mimolette cheese on the meat.  Also had the truffle fries which were amazing good -- they came out nice and hot and the truffle was not overpowering.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it...
Most delicious burger I have had till date. They make a simple burger to perfection. Food is just so fresh and cooked to perfection. If you are looking for quality not quantity do visit Ramsey burger
burger was okay, a bit dry. but sides were amazing. unique flavors and dishes.
The onion rings are AWESOME here! Creme brûlée oreo milkshake was also killer. Burgers on the salty side.

Been to Steak and Pub a few times-this was the first trip to Burger. Had the Hells Kitchen Burger, a regular Cheese Burger, regular fries, and Onion Rings.  So the highlight of the meal is definitely the onion rings!  Amazing. I would go back just for them. Fries were mediocre at best (way better at Pub). The ketchups are interesting... I would have preferred regular- but they don't have it (eye roll). The burgers were cooked well, nothing special. The HK burger had really good/hot green chile - and I'm from New Mexico and know my green chile. The peppers on it (poblano?). I could have definitely done without. Shakes were amazing as well!  Filling!!

Ok so we did it.  We fell for the tourist trap celebrity chef burger joint.  The difference is we knew we were falling for the tourist trap that is celebrity chef burger joints.  The lady friend and I came here to get our traditional vacation burger fix.  No matter the trip, we always end up at a local burger establishment.  We decided on this one because of the namesake celebrity chef.  The restaurant has a very chain like feel and it's extremely busy.  The wait staff is flying around in circles trying to hurry up and turn those tables!  They want you to scarf down those 20.00 burgers so they can get the next sucker in here to buy a 20.00 burger.    I had the farmhouse burger which comes with a fancy cheese, fancy bacon and a fried egg.  They cook the burgers to order and the fried egg oozes out upon 1st bite.  The burger is actually pretty damn good but it's 17.00 and comes with nothing else.  The fries are fresh cut and have to be ordered separately for 8.00.  Now the fries will feed 2.  We each ordered 2 beers to wash it down.  4 beers, 2 burgers and 1 fry and I spent damn near the same money as a 5 star restaurant back home in Nola.  The food was solid but you are paying for the neon light bill of the casino it's in.  Be warned

Same location as the previous "BURGR" in Planet Hollywood but changed a little bit and is now "Gordon Ramsay Burger". The menu added/removed some items and the restaurant has a more UK theme now. I tried the Crown Burger which was not on the previous BURGR menu, and it came with aged mimolette cheese, arugula, fine herb aioli, and sun dried tomatoes. The meat was cooked perfectly medium, and it was juicy and seasoned well. The mimolette cheese resembled almost a sharp cheddar to me and added a nice savoriness to the burger, but it wasn't overly salty due to the bitterness of the arugula and sweetness of the sun dried tomatoes. The aioli wasn't overpowering and complimented the other flavors of the burger, I'd order it again! Truffle fries are a must when I come here, and the truffle dipping sauce is soo good. It did take a little while for the food to come out but it's worth the wait. Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas and it's affordable/not outrageously priced.

This restaurant is terrible value in my book.  The service is terribly slow.  We (party of two) waited ten minutes to be seated (not a big deal), then after we ordered our drinks (water) it took another ten minutes to get them and be able to put our order in (not a big deal).  Then, it took us almost an hour for us to get our food (very big deal).  The menu is essentially just burgers and fries (we ordered two burgers and one order of fries) which are two of the simplest and fast cooking meals one could order at a sit-down restaurant (an entire industry known for "fast food" is built around burgers and fries).  It should never take that long to serve these items.  Again, service was inattentive.  We tried the sauce that came with the fries and didn't like it so we waited at least five minutes for our server to walk by so we could ask for Ketchup.  She said sure and returned with a third cup/dish of the same sauce.  We both tried it and looked at each other in amazement.  We waited at least five more minutes to be able to ask if there was any real Ketchup.  We were advised that there was not.  This put us over the edge.  My girlfriend like simple burgers with Ketchup and I, having already started eating mine (we were starving when we sat down), felt like the burger was mediocre (not a difficult item to make tasty).  Additionally, the fries (more like potato wedges) were bland and mostly hard - a condition that would have been easily mitigated with some Ketchup.  We finished our burgers in extreme disappointment.  Upon finishing, it took another 5-10 minutes for our plates to be cleared and then another five or so for our check to come back.  After providing my credit card, it took 5-10 minutes for it to be picked up and several more to be brought back to sign.  Once I had the check signed, we waited for our server to return to ask for a box for the nearly untouched order of fries so we could take them home and eat after getting our hands on some Ketchup.  We waited at least five minutes.  She came back shortly with the box and we promptly left the table.  On my way out, I spoke with the/a manager and advised him that the operations of the restaurant are poor and need work.  I also strongly suggested that the restaurant, a "traditional American" burger joint offer real Ketchup to which he responded "that will never happen."  That doesn't bother me because I will never eat there again, but I think it highlights a major issue with the restaurant.  The restaurant is not focused on providing a premier dining experience for customers but is solely geared toward attracting people with the brand name.  As is evidenced by the restaurant name, and Gordon Ramsay's face all around the restaurant as if he is superhuman, this restaurant, and Gordon Ramsay, is the poster-child for arrogance.  This is an expensive burger-joint.  $15 for just a burger, with no slaw or fries included.  Burgers are an easy dish - creating your own doesn't make you special.  Fries are simple as well.  Homemade fries are great, and always a little unique.  But let's not pretend as through they are a specialty item.  And Ketchup.  Well, Ketchup has been around a long time and is an All-American condiment.  To suggest that Gordon Ramsay could create a house sauce that is so good that nobody would ever prefer real, traditional Ketchup...is insane.  To call the house sauce "Ketchup" is misleading.  Not to mention that the sauce is actually terrible.  It tastes nothing like Ketchup and, to us, resembled a smoky shrimp cocktail sauce.  All said, I could never recommend this place. Food is sub-par, service is poor, and customer satisfaction is not a priority.  Arrogance permeates the atmosphere as the restaurant relies on the brand name to lure customers to pay high prices for cheap food.  Note:  The couple sitting next to us left in disgust shortly after receiving their meals.  We were only able to infer that something was terribly wrong with the food.  Either a grossly undercooked burger, a hair or other item in the food, or...no Ketchup (I had seen her spreading a giant glob of sauce on her bun/burger shortly before the server was beckoned to her.  The woman asked that her plate be taken away and declined an offer for any substitute dish.  The man stopped eating and asked for the check.  The manager who I ultimately spoke with, brought the couple the check and made an apology.  Note, he still brought the check which the man paid (over $60).  This does not seem like a genuine apology nor does it indicate any acceptance of responsibility on behalf of the restaurant.
I ordered the Forest burger and it was so good! The burgers don't come with fries, you have to order them separately. The parmesan fries were also good! Definitely recommend this place.

Gordon Ramsay's Burger never fails to disappoint. The burgers are always spot on. We got the Truffle Parmesan Fries, the Hog Burger and the Turkey burger (I think it was Turdunken Burger? ). The truffle parmesan fries were amazing (as always); I loved the Truffle aioli that comes with it. The pork pattyy in the Hog Burger was juicy and, and the pork bbq was just perfect. We so got a couple of cocktails.. The rum punch, bad donkey and another fruity cocktail. The cocktails were a bit disappointing though (definitely needs improvement).   All in all, it was a good experience and would definitely be back for the burgers and fries. Be prepared for the wait though. We had to wait almost an hour for a table for two.

Gordon Ramsay babe I love you so much. You just know how to make my day. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that I have nothing negative to say. I've had some good burgers which is the ones I make, but this burger was like a golden burger from heaven, I had to pinch myself to make sure I wasn't dreaming. Gordon marry me please!

You may be turned off from this place since you have to wait in line for about 30 minutes but let me tell you, it's worth the wait.   We were first skeptical of this place since most gourmet burgers are typically good but how much better can you get by going to this place? TONS!  This place is definitely a must visit... It's a Gordon Ramsey for God's sake.  For starters, the onion rings have a great crisp and flavor.  It is served with home made ketchup and their home made ranch.  They also have a french fry with a curry dip... Delicious!   If you are hesitant on  burger choices, I recommend the Hog burger . Patty made out of beef Chuck, brisket and bacon which is then wrapped in bacon and topped with bacon, BBQ pulled pork, coleslaw, pickles and fried onions!  AMAZING!!!  They also have great shakes and an amazing chocolate dessert as Gordon Ramsey would do.   You definitely have to make it out....SO GOOD!

Unfortunately Gordon Ramsey Burger served me both the most expensive and the worst burger I had during my trip here. Not that the burger was terrible or anything, but all the fancy ingredients left me with a pretty average experience. The anniversary burger was pretty flavorless, despite the aged steak used to make the burger. The hog burger was a little better, being juicier and better seasoned.   The Irish nachos we had as an appetizer were absolutely amazing!! The corned beef was savory and sweet, and the cheese sauce that drenched the nachos was divine. Unfortunately even that hardly redeemed the overall experience here.
Ordered the truffle fries and Blue burger. All delicious. Ask to sample their sauces (especially the white cheddar and smoky chipotle) to really experience good flavor.

Tip: parties of 5 or more don't have to wait in line, walk up to the hostess stand and they'll text you when your tables about to be ready. We got so lucky with our party of 5 and were able to walk around and shop then go back upstairs to our room at Planet Hollywood to relax. The wait was about 1.5 hours, we sat at 7:30PM.   Price: super reasonable prices especially for the Gordon Ramsey name and it being located on The Strip!   Appetizers came out super quick, took about 2 minutes, it came before our server even gave us our water lol Kettle Chip Nachos: instead of traditional tortilla chips they use kettle cooked potato chips, I feel like this is up to personal preference. I wasn't too crazy about it cause the toppings made the chips soggy but everyone else in my party loved it. They weren't skimp on the meats either.  Beer Battered Onion Rings: super crispy and a good portion to share. Good but nothing too special. Parmesan Truffle Fries: the truffle dipping sauce was really good! Again, good size to share with 2-3 people. This didn't come out until the burgers which I thought was thoughtful of them haha. Cheddar Ale Soup: I wouldn't recommend, it was kind of plain and super super salty.  Took about 15-20 minutes after appetizers for the burgers to come out Our party ended up getting very similar burgers but all the burgers were excellent and cooked perfectly to medium rare, they were also hot temperature wise which I loved, I hate lukewarm food! :)  Hell's Kitchen Burger: LOVED IT! Two of us got this and both reviews were a thumbs up. Super juicy and moist, buns are important to me in a burger and I loved how the bread never got soggy. They weren't skimp with the avocado and there was a spicy kick but nothing too overwhelming. TIP: try adding some of the truffle sauce from the fries on this, heavenly!  Farmhouse Burger: who could go wrong with a fried egg? The mangalitsa bacon really pulled this burger together! I couldn't help but steal a couple bites!   Backyard Burger: a classic burger but nevertheless a good burger!  Can't wait to be back and try some of the more exotic options like the Blue Cheese or Foie Burger, I love foie gras.  Recommend going early cause lines get long, don't go during prime time like lunch or dinner. We walked past at 10:45AM, 15 minutes before opening and there was already a line! The line at dinner was super long but as I've observed, 2 and 3 top tables get turned over pretty quickly.

Definitely worth a detour if you love burgers. Their burr here are always juicy and well built. Recently had the backyard burger, a simple burger with cheese lettuce and tomato. This let's you taste and enjoy the meat without too many other flavors...well worth it. Also had the wheat berry quinoa salad with chicken skewers. Only complaint about that was the chicken. Taste was great but had a lot of fat and cartilage on it. If you like lean white meat it won't suit your tastes. Or maybe that was just our order.   Truffle park fries complemented the burger well. Also they have an impressive beer list which was great. They also carry la fin du monde on draft which was a nice surprise.

This place must not pay their help well. Some quit tonight. Waiting forever for a table of three.  If it wasn't for the others I would have abandoned this shit a long time ago.  Tables of two go in regularly and just seated a table of 5 that have not been here as long.  I wish I could scream like Gordon does.

The burgers are very good and well seasoned. The onion rings were great. Just a little bit too greasy but worth a try. We went at 10 pm and there was about a 30 min. wait to get in. Service was good and the food came out in about 20 minutes. I feel it is a must try when in Vegas.

Lots of pretentious (yes, I said it) menu items and the burgers are really rich.  I had the blue cheese burger and the flavor blend was awesome - blue cheese, manchego, arugula, figgy jam, cider vinegar reduction and spicy mayo.  If I was hungrier I would have tried the giant cone of onion rings or the kettle chip nachos with corned beef, short rib and English cheddar sauce.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is the somewhat distracted service - don't rush me to order and then ignore me.

Love the burgers, the fries and the onion rings. But I was sad that they took my favorite hot dog off the menu. It was crazy delicious. The only other hot dog they have had a cheese sauce and I would NEVER eat a hot dog with cheese sauce but then, I don't eat movie theater nachos either. My burger was juicy but a tad over cooked. She said medium would have some pink but it did not. It was still quite good. Service was extremely slow however so be prepared to wait . We were near the pass and food did sit quite a while before runners showed up. I found that surprising. The manager was also running food which I like so they must have had some people call in sick! The line to get in was only about 15 minutes so that was good. Please put my spicy hot dog back on the menu!

Such a great experience! The line  had about 35 people and we waited about 20 minutes to get seated!  Hostess was extremely friendly and the service superb!  We got the Hell's Kitchen burger, sweet potato fries and the fire wings!  All was good but the wings were amazing.  Best I ever had! Josh S the server was very laid back.  He came to us and told us that he was going on break and let us know who was going to take care of us and the latest server was as smooth! I will be back!!!

As many others have posted, the wait just to get a seat is long.  Once seated, service is ok, they're quick to take your order, but the wait for the food is long.  I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger.  The meat itself was cooked perfectly medium rare, but the toppings left something to be desired.  For something called the "Hell's Kitchen", I expected there to be some heat, but what I tasted was very mild, almost without any heat.  I think they need to boost up the heat factor. Fries are good, boosted by the excellent spicy ketchups they provide. Overall, everything tasted fine, but nothing special.   There are too many other burger options on the strip for me to give this a high recommendation.
The kettle chip nachos were simply amazing. Hog burger was solid and I recommend the Oreo shake!!!

At my last day of Las vegas, I'd been GR burger. I really expected about it. I ordered 2 burgers Hell's Kitchen burger and hog burger. Hog burger is in special menu. By the way i like Hell's Kitchen burger then Hog burger. Cuz i like juicy and avocado flavor. Ps i am a big fan of GR
Hells kitchen burger was really flavorful and delicious the spicy wings were also really good and the truffle French fries were great! Definitely worth the wait .

Service is slow.    The hellfire wings were disappointing. It was a premium price for those wings and what we got was something not far better from Safeway instacart wings with carrot shavings and bits of blue cheese thrown on top.    For the burger, I ordered the special which had a teeny tiny bit of rib meat thrown on top of the patty. Patty was a nice thickness, but the diameter was terribly disappointing.  Cabbage slaw in the burger was typical and nothing special.   This will be the last time I eat on the strip

I've been to this amazing restaurant the last time when I visited Vegas and I was looking forward to the visit this time again! My burger was juicy and tasty, however, the server we had had an attitude. Her service made our experience this time pretty awful. I wouldn't consider to come back the next time when I'm in Vegas again!!! My friend and I didn't have a pleasant visit!

i'm not that much of a burger junkie, but i really enjoyed my farm burger here! the patty was a blend of chuck, brisket and short rib, topped with strips of fatty duck bacon. the fried egg sat on top of a melted slice of sharp cheddar cheese, which somehow helped cut the greasiness of everything that was going on in this burger.  however, it took a freakin' long time for the food to come out. this place will teach you what being hangry is.

The wait for a table was over an hour for dinner but it was worth the wait. I shared the farmhouse burger, an alcoholic beverage with blueberries (sorry can't remember the name of the drink), truffle fries, sweet potato fries, and hot dog. All I have to say is the service and food were awesome. The servers were very attentive and fast. The quality of the ingredients used to make the burger was unbelievable. I love how balance the flavors were and how it was not over seasoned. The burger meat had a nice crest on the outside and cooked all the way through but the patty was still very juicy. The fries were great. There was nothing special about the hot dog but I had to try it since we're already there. I would definitely come back to try other items on the menu. I almost forgot, the drink I had was awesome. It was very light and refreshing. I would order it again.

While in Vegas I popped into Gordon Ramsey Burger for a quick lunch. I was greeted with a smile and seated at the chef bar so I could watch the show. My waiter greeted me and was so comfortable to talk with. When asked what I was interested in I gave him the ahi tuna sliders the UK burger or chicken saltimbocca sliders. I then asked what he thought was the best burger.  TURDUCKEN BURGER it was.  Watching the kitchen prepare delicious plates was amazing. Everything coming out of that kitchen was picture perfect. Amazing Show. The sous chef ran the pass and was in complete control of everything that was presented.  Now to the burger.  With the first cut the perfectly runny yolk ran down the burger.  The mix of flavors with the turkey chopped burger with duck confit was amazing.  The bun was grilled to perfection. Service was wonderful and I normally do not finish an entire burger.... this one was finished. Gotta love Vegas. Gordon Ramsey did not disappoint.
First place we stopped while visiting Las Vegas, it was a great choice! We had the kettle chip nachos and a Hell's Kitchen burger. Everything from the service to the food was excellent.

Soooo tasty, juicy, and full of flavor! I got the Farmhouse Burger - that comes with the fried egg & I have no regrets ! Like everyone else said, the Truffle fries & Onion rings were fire.   Pro tip: If you have a platinum card present it up front, our wait went from 1hr to 10 minutes!

My husband and I decided to try his burger since it's Gordon Ramsay. We decided to split on the Hell's Kitchen Burger and regular fries. The burger is smaller than the average American burgers, but the fries were just perfect to split with another. When we bit into our burger, the bun and the meat was just perfect! The crunchiness and buttery bun was delicious from every bite. The flavor of the burger meat was cooked perfectly!! We'll definitely go back to try other burgers!    Total: $35 for 1 burger, 1 regular fries, and 1 beer

Been trying to come here my last few Vegas trips and the wait is always pretty long. 1hr plus! I like the casino Planet Hollywood so the wait wasn't bad.   The burger is actually really good and fairly priced at about $15-$20 (Vegas prices of course). The quality and flavor of the patty was good and cooked just how I asked Medium Rare.

I know I have written a review of this place before because we eat there each trip.  I think it used to be Gordon Ramsay "burgR", with no "E"????  (This is driving me nuts, I know it used to have no E!).  We look forward to this and make this place a stop each time in Vegas. The burgers really are that good.  The wait this time was ridiculous, over 2 hours at some times!  Luckily on Friday at about 6pm the line was only 30 minutes so we again got our burger groove on.  Our server (can't remember his name) but he was spot on, super friendly and helpful and very attentive.  It's hard to have this type of attitude when a place is as busy as this place is so kudos to great service.   The only downside to this visit is that some of the past menu items are gone.  :-(   No more Euro burger, it was a favorite and the new lineup of shakes is missing some of the old and best ones!  We actually declined on getting a shake this time due to there only being 2 offered that just did not sound so great.  We never get the fries as they are really expensive and quite frankly better at any Habit Burger.  Nothing special with them at all.  Sorry Gordon, the chips just ain't happening.  I wish the server would have told me that the "house wine" was $14 per glass when I ordered it, I might have changed my mind as it was really nothing special.  I guess I should learn to ask first.  Burgers = A+

Sat at the bar, look at their giant beer list, ask if they had a pilsener and got a bit of a sneer from one of the bartenders. Ok Mr. Double-IPA, guess we haven't left 2014 yet?  In any case. Staff was a bit too casual if you ask me. One staff member loudly saying to the bartender how he lost his virginity to that song (kinda funny) but then proceeding to talk about how the other guy is going to get fired, etc.  Now to the actual burger. Got the Hell's Kitchen burger. Good combo with the jalapeno, guac, avo, but overall unimpressive. Slightly overcooked patty, but more troubling was that it wasn't exactly a great patty.   More troubling is the fact that the extra Truffle Fries I ordered (yes, Fries cost extra)... were actually Chips (the English kind, not the Lays/Pringles kind) instead of fries. Now since most Americans restaurants serve fries for their "Fish & Chips" instead of Chips, I'll give him a pass on this one, but seriously he should know better.  Then again he's probably re-using them on his Fish & Chips joint few blocks down the road.  Overall, not sure what I was thinking having a Brit make me a burger :)

Service was very slow. Order everything at one time to spare the headache. Fries came out after the burger. Bloody Mary mix was finest call, not house made, GAG. I got the lobster shrimp burger. Not good at all. I swear there was a low key Italian sausage taste in it. Hubby got the foie gras. Very good. Tasted like duck of course. I wouldn't come back here until they fix their service. Idc how good the food is, if the service is bad, I'm out

I've always wanted to try one of Ramsey's restaurants and I finally had the chance coming to Vegas this week! I was originally going to get a typical beef burger BUT then I saw that there was a shrimp and lobster burger and I had to try it! It was much lighter than a burger and had such a great combination of flavors with the seafood mixed with picked carrots and cauliflowers. It was a bit pricey at $26 but I'd definitely recommend it! The truffle fries were also very delicious. Only complaint would be the service is a bit slow, it took about 30 minutes to get our food after ordering.

The food is great. I've been here before and loved the jalapeño burger. If you like spice, this is a must try. However, their service is disgraceful. I really wanted my boyfriend to try this place and was disappointed when I saw a long line to get in. I was assured by the hostesses it would only be about a 30 minute wait, which not-so-quickly turned into a 45-minute wait. By this time we were only a bit more than half-way. I went to talk to them about why it was moving slower than we were told and why other parties were walking in (when there were no reservations available). I was told these were diamond players and they took priority. This would've been good info to have before we wasted 45-mins in line. We ended up leaving and going somewhere else. Terrible service Gordon!

I love this place. Great location inside Planet Hollywood in Vegas. The ambience and decor is nice. Service is on point. I had the ahi tuna slider ($14 USD) and lobster & shrimp burger ($25 USD). It is expensive I know but I promise you, it's worth it.
The service is beyond amazing !! Not only is thye  service superb but the hamburgers and food quality is up too par!! I highly recommend  this place.
The burger was everything what i imagined and more... I wish i lived in vegas to hace this on the regular and prices were surprisingly very reasonable

The food was prepared well and presented well, but for some reason everything tasted sweet to me. I'm a low sugar consumption person, so I'm very sensitive to anything sweet: even the the truffle fries tasted sweet. I prefer Umami burger.
The Oreo shake was the best I've ever had. Get that. Burger was pretty good, but I'm not sure it's worth the big price tag. Chicken wings were also amazing.

As someone who's tried Shake Shack, In N Out, other family/private owned burger joints and restaurants, hands down I can say Ramsay burger is definitely worth trying more so than Shake Shack.  My breakdown for the 5 star and the suggestion to get it over Shake Shack is as follows:  Service (4.5) Its a dine in with server style so of course you dont have to self serve like you would at Shake Shack. The server I had was pretty friendly and attentive during the whole time.   Drinks (4.5) While Shake Shack does serve beer, Ramsay Burger has a lot more options and varieties including cock tails and wines. I tried their Irish Mule which was apparently the most popular drink on the cock tails selection. It was as how the server described it, not too sweet but not too overwhelmingly strong. I believe she told me it was composed of jameson, some beer, probably syrup and lime.   Burger (4.5) I tried the Hell's Kitchen which seemed to be composed of provolone, patty, avocado, jalapeno and tomato. Yes the burger was on the pricey side of $15 without fries but shake Shacks burgers all average around $9-11 as well. For the quality of the beef patty and the structure of the burger, I d say this was worth it.   Fries (4.5) Ordered the parmesan truffle fries which came with two sauce. One reminded me of honey mustard flavor and the other close to marinara sauce like taste. But it was surprisingly very good as the parmesan grits and the fries texture blended very well together. It was around $9-10 which once again like the burger, is on the pricey side but its big enough to share between two people. So its not a bad deal at the end of it.   Overall, my friend and I were both pleased with Ramsays burger and did not regret not going to Shake Shack.

You would think that a 5 Star chef such as Gordon Ramsay would give people organic quality food in this day and age, but it appears he is just another sold out PharmaWhore! I guess if you don't sell out then you will never become as famous!  The waiting line is about an hour to be seated and if you are a vegetarian, there is a choice of a portobello sandwich on the menu, but you are gonna pay for it at ($17)!  I have heard rumors that Gordon despises vegetarians, so this just confirms it for me!  He permits you to come to his restaurant but you will pay 2 more dollars for that non-meat sandwich!   It took about 30 minutes for our food to be served.  My partner got the the burger. It was too salty and the tomato had not been cut properly because it had the brown end still on one of the pieces. What Gordon, you allow that?  The plain french fries ($8) were fresh cut and fine, but a bit stale/cold when we got them to our table. They do not come with the burgers, so you would need to order them separately. The positive thing is they are a large portion that can be shared between 2 people.  Overall, it was not a great meal and we will not be back. We were expecting much more from you Gordon.   As Donald would say, "You're fired!!!" Otherwise Gordon, best get your butt back into that kitchen to check!  Update: When I got home I got horribly ill and was up all night. I am allergic to canola oil and cannot stomach GMOS, so I suspect that they are using canola oil and/other GMOs in this restaurant!

My wife and I were ecstatic to find this little gem in Vegas (located inside the mall- in casino- within Planet Hollywood). It can be quite the walk if you don't know where you're going.   However, although is says the environment is good for children, there is smoking galore, and the restaurant is open to it.   We had about a fifteen minute wait, and the hostess told us it would be another five minutes or so, if we could just wait back within the roped-in line we had just come from. Sure, no problem.   There were already people who gathered in that line, and because we had begun there, we simply stepped three feet to the side, so we weren't on top of anyone.   Because we weren't specifically in the square foot she was referring to, she took a customer who was behind us in line first.  She called us again to the counter in five minutes and said, "the line is over there," again pointing to the line directly next to us.   We politely explained to her: "We began there, and waited, and the line filled up, so we just stepped off to the side to wait."  She stared at me with a dumbfounded glare, and shook her head.   "Um the line is there," shaking her head at us.  Well, it's not necessarily my favorite thing to be made to feel stupid from something so minute, when I'm first trying out such a popular restaurant.   The server who took us to our table was amazing, respectful, and kind. Although I was excited to experience the Gordon Ramsey atmosphere, the noise level was so high, we had to get our food to go.   We ate quietly in our car, and the food was amazing, unique, and delicious.
The name Gordon Ramsay doesn't add up to the burger. The bread and the meat were not better than Shake Shack. Dissapointed and overrated

Really good food but the front service wasn't as expected. We were a group of 4 and made us wait until our group was complete to be seated but they gave a table to a group of 6 that was after us and was incomplete too.

Always loved this place, great food and atmosphere although noisier than many places. The food here is affordable and exotic while being normal all at the same time.  Higher recommend the farm house burger, the truffle fries and there shakes although if have a shake you may not be able to finish your burger.  Must eat place if coming to Vegas

Cool atmosphere, but disappointed my burger was overlooked twice! A little on the pricey side, but maybe cheap for Vegas? I got the Gordon Ramsay burger, even over cooked it was still delicious. The sweet potato fries were the same as anywhere else, there's plenty to share in one order! I didn't care for the sauce that comes with it but the ketchup was good.

Came here for an early lunch because anytime is a good time for a burger. It was a our last day in Vegas after a long weekend we decided to give this place a go. With so many good reviews and being the burger lover that I am this place was on our list for Vegas Dinning. Being as we got here early we didnt wait too long to be seated. maybe 20 mins for a party of two. We sat ordered and our burger came about 30 minutes later. Sure this is a long time to wait for a burger but it was worth it. We both ordered the Hells kitchen  burger and my partner added a fried egg which he really enjoyed. Over all good experience only wish they offered regular ketchup as im not a huge fan of homemade ketchup concoctions. Try it, but dont come when your already starving.  Burger average 15.00 Fries 11.00

Food was amazing! However,  the service was terrible! Waited forever for refills, messed the order up and waitors and waitresses were more interested in chatting amongst each other at the POS machine while on cell phones. After we were done eating, waited 10 minutes for check. Very disappointing... Oh, and red headed waitress was talking very loudly at POS machine dropping F Bombs about EDC event. My 11 year old son found it amusing. Very unprofessional! Not what I expected from a restaurant with Ramsey on it...

I'll start by saying the food is good. The problem with Burger is that the service is sooooo bad and everything is so expensive. I understand Vegas isn't cheap but for what Burger is, it's a little expensive for how terrible the service is. After eating here twice, idk that we'll come back.  Explanation of bad service - The waitress we had was not a native English speaker and was very very difficult to understand. She also could not answer questions about the menu and told us she needed someone else to help. It slowed the whole meal down significantly. Once we had ordered she brought the food out, and it was not as it was explained on the menu, or by her, or by the server who helped explain it. Idk if it was a language barrier/miscommunication issue but I would like to be able to expect that I get what I ordered and not something else.
One of the best burgers I've ever had. Was in Vegas a few weeks ago and while I was there, could not resist returning over and over again.

Saw all the reviews and was really excited to try this place. (Also fans of the show Hell's Kitchen). Found a hair in my food and the only reason I'm giving a 2 is because the manager comped the food. Ordered the onion rings, fries, the farmhouse burger, and the hell burger. The hair either came from the fries or the hell kitchen burger. Immediately lost my appetite and didn't want a new one. The Mrs lost her appetite too and we left Vegas disappointed as this was our last meal in town. #Disappointed

The line wasn't terrible and seemed to be moving so we hopped in to get  a taste of the Ramsay Burger.  The line DID move fast indeed, however once seated we were ready to order as we spent enough time in line reading the menu and so we ordered right away.  The basic burger for the wife and the crab and lobster for me, with parmesan truffle fries to share.  We waited, oh, AN HOUR to get hour food.  Seriously.  And we were not the exception - everywhere you looked in the restaurant everyone was getting antsy and asking around for their food, and the waitstaff were tactful in avoiding us.  I could just hear Gordon in my head screaming at the staff had he been there.  We were borderline walking out when it finally arrived.  The food was pretty amazing I will admit.  I didn't care for curry ketchup, regular would have done fine, but the burgers and fries the flavor was amazing.  Just wish I didn't have to scarf it down to make it to my next scheduled item.

Good food and service, not too long a wait considering the location.  I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, awesome patty, full of flavor and not dry. The problem came in the form of a 1/4 of an avocado that was not sliced and just plopped atop the burger. My wife had the back yard burger with slices of tomato over 3/4" thick. Service and food otherwise were great.

We recently stayed at the Planet Hollywood, and ended up eating at Gordon Ramsay Burger twice. We all enjoyed our meals, and service was excellent (although it did take a bit longer to get our food on our second visit). The burgers were cooked just right, and the onion rings are so delicious! We will definitely eat here again next time we're in Vegas. A bit pricey, but everything on the Strip is expensive.

My first stop every time my fiance and I go to Vegas. The burgers are outstanding and the truffle fries are delicious. However, I was very upset to find out that they got rid of the jalepeno poppers. I understand menus change and it has been the same for many years but those were some of the best poppers I ever had. We literally crave them all the time and get so excited to come to Vegas to order them as our app! Please bring these back!!!
Pricy but different kind of pub fare. The burger is a bit small.  The shake wasn't bad, but the only thing worth ordering is those duck fat fries. Sooooo good.

We have when past this location a few times and there was always a line. Especially with the name of Gordon Ramsay and being impressed with his Pub location in Casaers, we decided to check this place out.   At 3pm, there was a decent line outside the location. I thought it was kinda odd since we eat early to avoid the lines but maybe that is a good sign. Finally, we made our way to the front and the location was not filled to capacity. Why we waited, I have no idea but will learn why later as dinner progressed.   Our server was very friendly so that is a huge positive. She took the time to explain a few things and was very bubbly. There was probably the only biggest positive there.   My girlfriend ordered a cocktail and I ordered a creme brulee milkshake. They both were amazing. And we ordered the duck poutine. The fries took about 20 minutes and they were fairly good. It came with duck bacon, the sauce had good flavor and depth. But the fries had a little grittiness to it. I dont think they washed the potatoes because it was almost like a small grains of sand. Very disappointed in that. As someone who once worked in fine dining... how could you miss an important step like that?  After an hour upon sitting down, our burgers did not arrive. We were finished with the fries (which I hoped would be enjoyed with the burger but as I slowly ate it... it was finished a long time ago) and we sat there talking and waiting. You look around and everyone has the same sad face of "Where is my food?????"  Finally, after over one hour..the food finally arrived. By now, my food has expanded so I am not that hungry anymore. My girlfriend ordered the Hog burger which came like 1 foot tall. I remember a clip of this shows of "How do I even eat this burger? Its so damn bloody big". Well, he probably didnt say that word from word but close enough. We wondered the same thing. You couldnt smash it down but you couldnt eat it like a normal burger. The Hog burger was mangalitsa pork, mangalitsa bacon, bbq pork, white cheddar, pickles, crispy onion, and slaw.  I ordered the "Foie" Burger which had pate foie gras (spread), chèvre, port wine aïoli, frisee. It had a decent foie spread but at the same time, it was a little tangy from the aoili. It was slighty more on the tangy side so it could put down some people who dont like that flavor contrast. Luckily, my burger was manageable and it really did come out medium rare like I requested. At least they did something right.   Overall, the server was great, the food was decent and the wait was horrible. I do not think I would return to this location when I am back in Vegas. Instead, I may check out his Steakhouse or go back to the Pub location.

One of my favorite meals while in Vegas. True to Gordon Ramsay everything was cooked fresh.  We had a Farmhouse Burger and an Ahi Tuna burger along with the truffle fries.  Delicious, delicious and delicious. Could not imagine anything more delicious until dessert arrived.  Do not visit this restaurant without trying the Brown Butter Pecan Caramel shake. It's Ramsay's signature dessert and yes, it is life changing.  I'll be back!!

Over a half an hour long line while you stand and look at half empty tables. Once the order was placed it was almost an hour to get the $17 burger that o asked for medium rare only to get a well done dried out burger. Never again. Even Gordon Ramsay should know you don't cook a burger to death. Maybe he should focus some of his yelling at these cooks.

This one was a bit disappointing. Everything was hot and fresh, I think it was just the selection I made. I had the Pork Chop and Applesauce burger. I know what your thinking, but no it didn't have actual apple sauce on it. It was cabbage-apple slaw. The patty just didn't have a lot of flavor to me. Fries were really good and not, but I just wasn't impressed with the burger. Others in my group had some phenomenal looking burgers which is why I still give 4 stars. Don't believe in knocking a decent restaurant just because my taste buds didn't like what my brain wanted to try.

I had the soup and a burger.  They were both good and seasoned perfectly. This is an above average burger( I have had one better in Vegas) and I would recommend this place to anyone who is a burger fan.

Amazing food! I'm a huge Gordon Ramsay fan and I can see his influence in the flavors and different variations of food here!  We had the Hell's Kitchen burger, nachos and sweet potato fries.  The burger was loaded with avocado and the burger was juicy!  The sweet potato fries are dusted with powder sugar which was interesting but the taste exploded in my mouth!!!  The different sweet and savory sauces were on point.  The manager talked story with us and the staff was friendly. We did have to wait awhile for our food but it was so tasty!

so this restaurant was on my to-do list since it opened. i finally had the honor to eat here (huge gordon ramsay fan) so let me detail was wonderful experience here...  we got in line at around 8. there is two lines for big parties and smaller parties. i believe if you are more than 4 then you go into a separate line. the bigger line seemed to go faster just because there were so many small parties of 2 and 4 that they had to wait for other tables to finish first. we waited about 30 min which is not bad at all.  once we got in it was so classy so you def pay for what you get! we got a booth table and wow the set up was beautiful and they even give you menus with his face on it and you get to keep it as a souvenir!! which i def did!!  even as you sit and wait for your food they come over and snap some pictures for you to possibly purchase.  the wait was a little long but they let us know just because they do make the burgers from scratch. they did bring our fries out earlier - i just wish the burgers were a little faster so i could eat it with the fries.   so to the most important thing: THE FOOD!!!  -just fries ($8) - literally just fries; not amazing but they were thick cut and the sauces weren't anything special. -truffle parmesan fries ($11) - just get the regular fries. again, fries were nothing special. -farmhouse burger ($15) - THE REASON FOR THE 5 STARS. THE BURGER WAS AMAZING. highly recommend and all my friends were happy with their other burger choices.  OVERALL: i would come again but JUST order a burger and no fries. id love to come back and tries the other sides. trust, the burger is worth the wait.

Situated at Planet Hollywood the place is always packed! Got seated 5 mins before closinG since i had to line up for 30 mins.   Good beer selection from crafts to classics. I opted for a hoppie beer 9.% but it didnt seem that strong so i wonder if got the right one. The hops were nothing out of the ordinary for IPAs   Had the farmers burger and hells kitchen burger both were really good. The hells kitchen burger has jalapeno aioli and roasted jalapeno, fresh avocado which complimented the burger alot, and some good cheese. That burger was a killer. The farmers burger was good too, with an over easy egg and duck bacon, which tasted like regular bacon to me.   Service was weak, since i guess its closing time.

Came here Thursday evening at 8pm and the wait to get a table was about an hour. We got a table around 9. The line moved depressingly slow -- mostly due to the fact that they gave priority for reward card holders.   We ordered onion rings ($9), Hell's Kitchen burger ($15) and the UK burger ($15), and a beer ($8). The onion rings came out pretty good, and fast, though $9 is overpriced for onion slices and batter. Both the UK and the Hell's Kitchen burger were decadent and pretty tasty but I was a bit disappointed, I guess I expected more, like more complex flavors. Also, a few bites into the Hell's Kitchen burger, I realized that the avocado was missing. We were sitting at the counter top, so I called the nearest waitress over and told her about the missing ingredient. Without saying anything she went over to the set up table and handed me a small ramekin with a small avocado sliced, said maybe a curt sorry, and hurried away. Even our waitress took a good 10-15 minutes to get us our check after we finished. They all seem so busy that, other than the water boy that came over frequently to refill out glasses, I don't feel like we've been given enough attention.

Gordon Ramsay needs to go into this kitchen,  his own, and start screaming and cursing out the chefs.   My 3 cheese burger was ordered rare, and came out medium to well.   Overcooked, dry, flavorless.   Cooking hamburger meat is easy, so there's no excuse for this!   Mr B got the Hell's Kitchen burger with jalapeño,  avocado,  dried tomato.   It had a good amount of heat and was pretty tasty.   Way better than that sad excuse for a burger I had.   There's a line to get into the restaurant, but it moved quickly.   The wait for the food was approximately half an hour!   Gordon ramsay should be screaming and cursing about that too!

As a Vegas local, I usually try to avoid restaurants, especially chains, located on the strip since they're always so overpriced and are catered more towards tourists. But I had family visiting & we were already in the area, so we gave this place a try.... I was BLOWN AWAY. We got the onion rings and gooey fries as appetizers. I am not a fan of onions in any way, shape or form, but these onion rings were BOMB. The truffle Parmesan fries, tho it sounds about pricy at $12, came in a huge serving size and were also terrific. And finally.. I got the tandoori chicken burger. This was probably one of the best chicken burgers I've had in my life (and I've had a lot b/c I'm not a big red meat fan).  Other than the fantastic food, the customer service was on point even on a busy weekend night. We actually had a 1hr wait to get seated, but we didn't mind it since there were lots to do around & we were notified when it was our turn. I would absolutely come back here again.

Was really curious as to what Gordon Ramsay's restaurant can deliver when I happened to be in Las Vegas. I think it is really great that larger parties are able to put their name down and get a text message to come back when a table is available.
