Although the servers are very nice, the service was so slow. My water was never refilled and the food took over 30 minutes to come out. It was not even that busy but it seems that multitasking is something that the workers were lacking in. The food was good, a tad dry, but still tasted very good. 4 star for food. 3 for service.
Absolutely the best hamburger I've ever had so thick so juicy so tasty as you can tell by the photos it was delicious!!!!

Celebrity Chef's restaurant, did not disappoint.  It was packed when we got to put our name down.  There was a line just for putting your name down.  The menu was simple and being a fan of Gordon Ramsey's food shows, I was expected to be wowed. We had 7 people and a hungry appetite.  We ordered almost every appetizers and each of them was delicious.  My favorite was the truffle Parmesan fries (still thinking about them).  The burger was well made and very juicy.  Would have been a good idea if I had shared mine cause I wasn't able to finish (especially with all the appetizers we ordered)  Service was good. We were able to enjoy the meal before heading home.  Would recommend! Get in line folks! I think it's worth it.

Writing this review remembering that I'm reviewing a restaurant located in a very touristy Planet Hollywood Hotel in Vegas.   Pros: High-quality burgers, fries were amazing Cons: ridiculous wait time, pretty expensive  The wait is crazy. If you are not a Total Rewards member, it may not be worth it because depending on the day, you might have to wait up to two hours to get a table. When seated, the service does move pretty quickly. Our waiter was very nice even though he was handling like dozens of people.   At our table, we had the Hell's Kitchen burger, Portabella burger, and Backyard burger, and the Truffle Parmesan fries. All of the food was awesome. It's pretty pricey, and may not be worth it for some which is completely understandable. I don't think Burger is one of those "must go to" places in LV, but the food is still really good. Overall, I don't know if the food quality justifies the wait and the price but that's just personal preference!
This may have been the best burger I've ever experienced. Definitely top 5. Had the Forrest burger and truffle fries and ever bite was a treat. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

S-L-O-W. Took 15 minutes (maybe more) for a server to even say "hi" to us after being seated. No drink menu - server gives you an iPad and then stares you down to make a decision quickly. Servers all advise 45 minutes for a burger - they advised it was because burgers are "made to order" (hmm, I cook burgers for 10 minutes at home.) Ordered 1 burger, truffle fries, hummus and 2 drinks = $70 + tip Food was good but experience was disappointing.

If you're in line waiting to get in or debating whether to get in line, don't!!!!!  You will end up walking out wondering why you did that.  One of the worst burger and fries I've ever had.  Simple order, a cheeseburger no bun with a side of avocado and a fried egg, that's it!   I got a piece of meat that tasted like it came from Safeway, a soft boiled egg not even on the burger, and I kid you not a sliver of avocado.  Server agreed it was ridiculous and did the right thing.  Go Elsewhere, hek even the salad at the hotel cafe had 2 pieces of avocado!
Amazing place but Limited options for vegetarians, coupled with $25 burgers and long waits. Good for one-time try.
My second time coming here and noticed that they changed it up a bit. Food is great. I would come here again next time i'm in Vegas.

Great burgers, meh on everything else. For real.   No reservations, so come early and expect to wait a while. I went at 10:30pm and we waited in line for about 30 minutes. I saw lines forming in the morning to eat there at 11am.   I had the Hells Kitchen Burger, and it was damn tasty! Burger was cooked to a perfect medium as I asked, I loved the kick to the burger and the sesame seed bun was nice.   I also tried the truffle fries. They were good, but if you've had truffle fries before, this isn't any different.  The disappointment of the place was the drum menu and cocktail program. All of the cocktails sounded too sweet or too nasty. So many cheap beers too. Even our server commented that the cocktails were "shitty" and I didn't disagree with him based on the two I tried.   I actually recommend this as a place to snack. Get the burger, skip everything else, and eat a meal a couple hours later.

We ordered onion rings to start the meal, which came out cold. I could see them staging the fries and onion rings in the window under a heat lamp. The dipping sauces were good and the presentation was nice! The burgers were fantastic - Hell's Burger and the Blue Cheese Burger. Server was a little over the top with his personality. He thought he was much better than what he was.
Well the wait is long....no different than anything good in Las Vegas...  Excellent food and service.

This place used to be awesome. They changed the menu. Sticky toffee pudding pops are gone...that's a super bummer for us. The stars are because our food (we shared a burger and poutine) took 30-40 mins to come lukewarm to us. We ate most of it because we were hungry and didn't want to ask for a refire, only to wait again. It's not worth waiting 45mins-1hr for a table to get cold food. Go somewhere else.
Serious the Foie burger is worthy of killing someone for... it's sooooo good I love it. The Oreo shake with creme brûlée is also good

One of the best burgers I've ever had. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger per the servers recommendation and it was bomb.com! I added an egg which was over cooked, I asked for over medium and for the egg to be runny. That was a #fail but the burger was so good that I didn't even care! LOL Also give the burger a solid 25 minutes to cook, I never knew a burger could/would take that long LOL The truffle fries I didn't care for because they were too thick and heavy for my tasted but we got them because they were also highly recommended. My sister loved them. They were just too thick and rich for my taste buds. His ranch and ketchup were so good! If you like a spicy burger full of flavor this is it! I did eat the WHOLE THING in ONE SITTING LOL

Very Good Burger!!! We had a bit of a wait, that was expected but the line moves really fast.  We ordered the Kettle Chip Nachos for an appetizer, very good. The Nachos come with shredded corned beef and short rib meat which is the star of the dish.   We ordered a the special of the day, The F Burger. This ranks up there with one of the best burgers I've ever eaten and the burger patty is the best I've tasted.  It was like eating a perfectly tender piece of steak.   The only reason for the four stars is the cost ratio.  Overall, this is a great place to eat, in a great environment.
Just pay for a crappy service.. it's took forever for the food to come in and ruined my friend s birthday ..

I'm not huge on burgers, but the Hell's Burger was pretty darn good! It had a nice spicy kick from the jalapenos. We also ordered onion rings and truffle fries to share, and each appetizer came with 2 sides of sauce. Within my table, everyone ordered a different burger. I had the Hell's Burger, and the others had U.K Burger, Backyard Burger, and Forest burger.   My brother was very disappointed with this place because he ordered a medium rare, Forest burger, and his meat came out almost well done. Everyone else ordered their patties to be medium and ours came out almost well done too, but I was okay with it. I would probably give this place a 3.5 stars if possible, but I still enjoyed this place.

This place was AMAZING! Totally worth the wait! (Though the wait wasn't even that long). My husband and I sat at the counter in front of the kitchen (where most people seemed to not want to sit) but I really enjoyed it! It was interesting to see how it all worked back there. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, it was sooooo tasty! So much flavor, cooked just perfect! Definitely one of the BEST burgers I've ever had. I also ordered their speciality cocktail which was a cinnamon pear sangria, I wish I could order this drink everywhere! It tasted amazing. All in all a great experience here! Definitely planning to come back! Tip: unfortunately, you cannot make reservations here so make sure you give yourself plenty of time to wait for a table.

For me this is a hype place. Maybe I'm boring, but I don't care if my burger has all the fancy weird toppings that I don't recognize. Because I hadn't brushed up on my 50 types of cheese I ended up ordering one that had what tasted like a goat cheese on it. Really disappointing since I am not into it at all. I would have asked our waitress what some of the items were but to be honest she seemed less than thrilled to be there and did not make me feel comfortable enough to ask her to explain the items. Not to mention we had to keep asking for our drinks to be refilled, and flag her down to get our bill after we sat there not eating for a good 10-15 minutes. Drink refilling is admittedly one of my nerves because that is serving/waiting 101. I know there are other better waitresses there as one next to us seemed really helpful and eager to assist her table.   We came without a reservation and waited maybe 5 minutes, not bad at all.   This is a wonderful place for someone who is more cultured in their cheeses, odd vegetables, and duck bacon... my boyfriend liked it, me not so much.   Got points for 1. Convenience to the strip 2. Fairly priced for a gourmet burger 3. Awesome truffle fries.

We come to Vegas once a year. Every time we do we have to go to Gordon Ramsey Burger. It's our third time here and it's been remodeled since our last time it was Gordon Ramsay  BurGR. The burgers are still great which keeps us coming back every year. I had ordered the  farmhouse burger medium which comes with an egg, bacon and cheese. It was cooked to perfection. We also had the onion rings they are beer battered thick cut and come with two dipping sauces one chedder ranch the other chipotle ketchup it's enough to share.  Our previous visits we have had the truffle fries and they are great also. One other great thing is they accept total rewards comps. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

Ate here during our latest venture to Vegas.  Had the Bleu Cheeseburger which was really good.  The beef was delicious and the flavors of the bleu cheese, arugula, and spicy mayo complimented it overall.  Only complaint was that it was a tad salty.  Truffle fries were legit.  Service was top notch, our glasses were never empty, but man our food took so long to arrive, it wasn't our table either.  If it wasn't for that, I'd give it four-stars.  If you're looking for a good burger on the Strip, check this spot out.  #GordonDontPlay

This is the second time I've been here. Got the onion rings again because they are that good. Not to heavy of an onion taste but crispy and goes well with the homemade ketchup. Tried the Fish and shrimp burger. Pretty good. I say that because there was a sweetness to it that I'm not fond of. But great taste of fish and shrimp. The shrimp and fish were ground into a patty which worked well. Overall the atmosphere was buzzing and the staff was friendly. I enjoyed my meal once again and would recommend this place to anyone that would like a good burger

Gordon Ramsay is my idol and his creations are perfection. I love the truffle fries and I got the house burger. Both items were perfect, the first bite got my mouth dancing! The environment was really cool too!

Always wanting to try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurant and having to be in Vegas me and my husband tried this one.   It was a little less than what we expected!!   We ordered hellfire chicken wings, hell's kitchen burger (most popular one as per our server) and truffle fries. Wings were amazing with lot of flavor, great balance of sweet and spicy and juicy. The burger was ok, juicy meat but lacking flavors and the bun/bread was ok too. I have had better burgers than this. The fries were ok.   Also there was waiting of approx 20min which was not too bad and servers were nice.   Overall I liked it and would wanna go to have wings again and may be try other things on menu when in Vegas but not for hells kitchen burger ;)

I love Gordon Ramsay, so I just had to eat at one of his restaurants while I was in town! There was a line of people waiting to be seated. NOTE: only parties of 2 or less wait in the line. Parties of 3 or more need to put their name on a list and they will contact you via text when your table is ready.   The wait was estimated to be an hour long. When we were notified that our table was ready, we were about a 7 min walk away (waiting for our drinks lol). We called them to let them know and they held our table for us! I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and onion rings. Everything was pretty good -- a bit on the pricey side, but that was already expected. I had some of friends' truffle parmesan fries and they were okay. I don't think they were worth $11, and I preferred the onion rings over the fries.   Service was okay. Our waitress was hard to locate at times when we needed something, but it wasn't anything to get upset about. Would I come back? Yeah, but I would consider other options first. Next time, I'm coming for your steakhouse, Gordon Ramsay! ;)

Huge disappointment. You are just paying for the name. I'd rather have Red Robin. It's one step above McDonald's.   Waited 2hrs.   Backyard burger ordered it medium, got it over cooked to med-well. Asked to remake. Got another one back over cooked at well done ++  Gave up. They gave us credit for it.   Hell's Kitchen. Wife ordered med-well (I know, I know), got it over cooked at well done ++   Maybe ask for it rare to get it medium?  The beef size is like 1/4 or 1/3 lb. very small amount of meat compared to say John Howie or any other high end burger/steak place.   Fries were reheated what seemed like 4 times.   Ketchup was trying too hard.   Won't be back. Ever.

The burgers were fine for the money, but not LV special. Price wasn't too bad, but the sales pitches from the staff were annoying. That would all be forgivable except for watching food dying in the window from our seats. Seriously. Fries, rings, and apps sitting in the window for 10 minutes waiting on burgers to sell while a sous chef portioned sauces. Everything went out too. I felt bad for the people eating dead food.

Nice setting, good service, good presentation. Went for the burger but loved the fries. I definitely recommend the sweet potato fries and the truffle parmesan fries; they are perfection, especially when dipped in their coordinated sauces. That being said, the burger was kind of a flop. I had the Forest Burger which had two of my favorite burger toppings, mushroom and bacon (although in the odd forms of forest mushrooms and duck bacon), but the tremor cheese overwhelmed the taste of everything else on the burger. The burger tasted like a meaty block of tremor cheese, with not even a hint of bacon or mushroom to it. Kind of my mistake though, I ordered the burger despite it being topped with an unfamiliar cheese, and paid the price.
Currently having the best burger of my life here. Blue cheese burger. Highly recommend.

Get Hog Burger (I think this is what its called). This review is based upon several month ago. I've been here with my girlfriend. Thank god! there were no waiting in line. We were seated promptly and servers were really attentive and nice. Ordered Hog burger with Goat Cheese burger (I don't know what it is called) and onion rings. Onion rings came out first to start, and it was like heaven in my mouth with their specialty sauce on the side. Burgers were great that time. Price is reasonable too, so I would not say anything bad about this place.  But the only downside is that it usually has such a freaking long line that de-appetite you by just looking at that long line, so be aware of that. If you can handle this long line, great place to go.

Next time I'll try Bobby Flay's burger joint.  The service was a bunch of "uninterested" slogs dressed up in pretty outfits.  Unfortunately, my $20+ lamb burger was COLD and almost raw. The fries (all 14 of them) were the best part of the meal.  I wanted to say I ate at Gordon's restaurant, and I did. But the price tag was NOT worth it. I could have gone to In N Out for a REAL burger.  Very disappointing.

This place recently underwent a change of ownership, which we did not know until we were seated.  NONE of the delicious burgers that were on the menu are there anymore. The burgers we did order were NOT delicious - they were AWFUL.  4 of us in the party and no one finished theirs.  We ate what we were served as it took FOREVER to get our food and we were starving.  Plus, we had to send 2 of them back to be remade as they were overcooked (we asked for medium rare, not chared) .Fortunately we are Diamond players so we did not have to wait in the 45 min to 1hour plus line, but I PITY whoever waits for this crappy food.  The cafe would have been better.  I eat burgers once a week and was looking forward to Burgrs, what a let down.  Maybe change the name to BUGGERS.    GORDON, YOU OUGHT TO BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELF FOR ALLOWING YOUR NAME ON THIS PLACE, BUT I GUESS THE LICENSING FEES YOU RECEIVE MORE THEN MAKE UP FOR THE LACK OF FLAVOR, SERVICE ETC...  I can only hope that your star is now fading in Vegas and soon ALL of the place with YOUR NAME attached go under.  I cannot wait to see what takes the place of this joint (I cant even bring myself to call it a restaurant) - HOPEFULLY by the end of the year....or sooner.  * SHAME ON PLANET HOLLYWOOD or the F & B manager or whoever for allowing this place to remain open.  Apparently, I am in the minority as there are rave reviews here. Those who gave 4 or 5 star reviews most likely NEVER had the opportunity to eat at the original BURGR, or they would probably change their ratings.

I was expecting something really good....however it was just OK.  2 of us had the Hog Burger.  It was very dry. We both drank over 3 glasses of water with it.  I'd recommend trying something different...or a different place.  The Parmesan fries were really good, the sweet potato fries were not...just give those a miss.  Service was pretty quick once we got a table.

Debated on giving this 3 or 4 stars because it is Vegas so some expectations have to be lowered because it is a busy place where higher prices are the norm. My boyfriend loves Gordon Ramsay and we always watch his shows so we knew we had to check out this place! We went around dinner so obviously we knew it'd be a long wait. It was a 90 minute wait and I was totally willing to stand in line but the hostess took our number and told us we could walk around the hotel/casino and they'd text us when a table was ready. I looove that! We ended up going to a cool bar while we waited and then getting a text to come back, so convenient! We were seated immediately and ordered our burgers. They let us know they take a longer time because they hand make them so we were expecting a longer wait than normal but it was sooo long! Maybe it was because we were hungry but it felt about 3x as long as you'd normally wait at a steakhouse. When we got the food it was absolutely delicious!! I got the UK Burger and could only finish half of it because it was so filling and tasty! Still craving it!  I didn't care for the cocktail much but that could have just been my own tastes. It took forever to get our server's attention to ask for the bill, and then for them to finally come back with the bill. When we finally got them to take our card it took a while for them to bring it back again! This was frustrating because the entire process of waiting for food etc had already taken so long, I thought the checkout process would at least have been swifter. When they finally brought the receipts to sign I was excited-- i thought "write a tip, sign, then finally LEAVVVE!! YES!" But nooo... turns out the server charged BOTH bills (we had two groups) on my ONE credit card even though we had given them two cards and explained. Had to wait yet again for them to correct this and I'm still not sure if it was corrected since it was so busy and couldn't hear what was going on much. So the service was definitely not what I expected but the food was good. I think if you go when it's not so busy you would have a 5 star experience but not at prime time.

First of all, the line doesn't make any sense, so I advice you go to the hostess, check in, and they will text you when the table is ready. This place is definitely worth visiting. The best burger ever, and the price is decent. It doesn't come with fries, but the side order of fries is shareable. I recommend medium burger, it's juicy and soft.  The only reason I didn't give 5 starts - when we watched Master shef, Gordon Ramsay yelled at one of the contestants for making french fries that were not exactly all same shape. He said it was absolutely unprofessional. Well, you should know that in his own burger place all french fries are DIFFERENT, the most different shapes we have ever seen. I wouldn't care, but he was the one to insist on it.  Definitely check this place, enjoy your burger.
Solid and creative hamburgers with good service. It is always busy here. I would recommend getting any hamburger and going for lunch!

How to properly write a review for a Ramsay restaurant without using the F word? ;)  I'm up to the challenge.  Of course there was a wait, and that's to be expected.  I don't necessarily think the hostesses handled this in the most efficient or friendly manner, especially for there being 4 of them.  4 employees to do one job and to do it poorly, kinda weird.      The great thing is that you forget about this pretty quickly after you sit down.  Excellent menu with thoughtful creations and options for everyone.  What I loved is that from the fries, to the onion rings, to the dipping sauces, to the burger and every component on the burger....all thoughtful.  All tasty.  This is not a place that serves Heinz with his hand battered onion rings or raw onions with their pork burger.  All components are thoughtful and delicious and that's what makes this a stand out, gotta return, Ramsay name worthy establishment.   Go!  You'll enjoy your meal here.  Trust.

I was very excited to try this place even though i heard mixed reviews.  I came on a friday night at 8 and the wait wasnt too long 25 minutes which was a surprise.  Waiter was very friendly and came multiple times to ask if we needed anything service overall was great :) im giving it three stars because i felt like the onion rings and the truffle Parmesan fries were way too salty.  The burger was ok nothing amazing overall the meal wasnt worth the price and i wouldnt come back again.

I am a big fan of chef Ramsay and wanted to go here when I was in Vegas. This is a great place to have a burger but there was a long wait. The time it took in line to sit at the bar was about 25 minutes. When I sat down the bartender informed me the burgers take about 20-30 minutes to come out. He was accurate but the wait was worth it.  The burger was cooked to perfection and tasted great!  I was so full from the burger I couldn't even finish the fries.  The bartenders were also very friendly and personable.

what's not to love here. the food is simply amazing the atmosphere is great and the staff is super friendly. i order the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was super delicious as well as the truffle fries.  the wait time for our food was just a little too long but i don't usually care for that.  great job and will be coming back to this place whenever i'm around Vegas!!

Popped in for dinner for two..the wait was  about 30min...not too bad. Got seated had ro wait a little for the waiter, but from that point forward he was on.  The Burgers  My wife had the Farmhouse I think it was called. That isht was great. Cooked to perfection was the burger & over easy egg.  I had the Forest and did not like it. It had a weird taste...maybe the duck bacon? I eat duck so I assumed it would be ALL good, but not so much for me. That is not to say it wasn't cooked perfectly because it was. Just didn't like it.  I told my waiter he apologized like he was wrong and offered me another burger in it's place. Well by this time wifey is done & we have to go see the fountain show. So I decline the replacement beccause we are leaving. The waiter assured me it would be quick so of course I got the Farmhouse cause it was effin great. He did not exaggerate the burger was packed to go before my visa came back.

My husband had been wanting to visit this place for a long time but we never got a chance to until this trip. He was so excited since he is a huge fan of Chef Ramsey. This place does not take reservations so it's first come first serve by waiting in line. Ppl were right and you do need to get in early. For parties of 3 or more, depending if there is a wait the hostess will take your name and number to text you when your table is ready. I thought this was nice instead of waiting so we were able to go play some games, plus we were still waiting for the rest of our party to join us.   The service was great, our waitress was real attentive and she kept our drinks refilled at all times. Plus she was good about letting us know how long the food would take to set our expectations which I appreciated. We ordered the kettle chip nachos to munch on while we waited for our burgers. They were pretty good and flavorful and crunchy. For the burgers we got the Hell's Kitchen which I  thought was cooked well and I loved the peppers and aioli. We also got the Parmesan truffle fries on the side. It was enough to feed the 4 of us. All the sauce accompaniments (we also asked for ranch) seemed freshly house made and were delicious!   Overall the meal and experience was great. I would definitely recommend coming back and would probably go again if we come through Vegas again.

This place looks cool with the fire from outside the restaurant, but the hostesses could care less if they work and the food was disappointing. I was starving and had just landed in town so I thought just about anything would be good - but it wasn't! I had the Hell's Kitchen burger but it was so bland and had no flavor. The only flavor was from the one big jalapeño you bit into and that was just burning your mouth. I usually love spicy and hot foods. The onion rings were decent because I liked the spicy ketchup, but the Cheddar Ale soup was yuck! Way too much chive.  The wine menu was awful and was all cheap bottom shelf stuff you get from Costco. I like trying new wines and champagne when I'm out - especially Vegas, so that also was disappointing. Definitely don't stand in line for this place. It's just hyped up because of the name behind it.

Atmosphere here is top notch, and you can expect a long wait if you miss the opening time. Walking in, the restaurant reminds you on multiple level that it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant (maybe to hypnotize your taste buds).   As most, this place was on our bucket list but we were half prepared that it was mostly hype. And, we were right.  Granted the meat, condiments and buns (wish it was warm but more on the cold side) were fresh. Although the burger we wanted was suppose to be medium rare, it could've use another minute on the grill.  Be forewarn that their foie gras burger is actually a "SPREAD", not a foie gras patty. Knowing this we still gave it a shot. Knowing it's a spread we still couldn't taste the foie gras, perhaps because the bleu cheese was too over powering. If there was a must try burger, go for the Anniversary Burger (it's not on their menu) and their Seafood burger.   As for the appetizers, the onion rings are the best of all the bunch. The wings with bleu cheese didn't work for me. The Nacho's was made with fresh chips, but for some reason the meat, sour cream and everything else didn't mesh together. The white truffle french fries was unique and worth a try if you must have french fries.  Their shakes were on the overly sweet side to the point where the kids didn't even finish half.

The patty is made up of riblets or something. The burger was way too salty. They have like a whole wall that is on fire so it was physically hot too. Although their shakes are good. They are made with like a parfait and taste great

Other than the long wait this place was great. We went back 3 times at three different times of the day and the line was still lonngggg. Decided to come back after seeing our last show and waited 30 min to reach the front of the line. This was about 1045pm. Plan ahead if you want to eat here.
Best burger I have ever tasted. I had the hog burger. Not a burger fan by the way, however i got dragged into this place by the best in who just had to have a burger

Jessica the hostess should be fired.  She asked me for $20 tip to move my party to the front of the line.  Then when my party waited over 45 mins she handed me my $20 back and said good luck waiting an hour and a half.  Jonathan the manager was quick to take care of us with good service so thank you sir for the great customer service!
Best burger place I've been too in awhile.  Second time here and it's still as amazing as the first!
I love this place. It is amazing. My mouth is in heaven. I had a boner when I left and there was nothing I could do. Most people just nodded and acknowledged that they also enjoyed the burgers!

I ate at this restaurant on Wednesday night about 10:30pm. Every table was full and there were lots of staff around - which I will address later in my review. We started with the Beer Battered onion rings. MISTAKE. They had obviously been fried earlier and the re-dipped in the fryer. They had this weird powder on them which was not Parmesano Reggiano as advertised  it was strangely reminiscent of the green can Parmesan.    Come on Gordon, that would have caused a famous f-bomb and an equally famous spit-out. Now, I know you don't oversee the day to day, but your name's on it so ya gotta own it. These things reminded me of onion rings you would get in a take out that's delivered to your house hours after they are cooked.   My husband had the Specialty fish and crisps burger... or should I say the indistinguishable protein burger drowned in a STRING dill mayo. F-bomb... spit-out.  A specialty ... wow NO.   I, on the other hand, had a perfectly cooked Hell's Kitchen Burger. It was a perfect medium cook, great bun, and just the right amount of sauce to be moist, but not like the fish thing over-sauced.   Now, the restaurant itself and the service. First we waited in line for ten minutes or so and there was this bizarre fire sculpture behind the glass. It was generating enough heat to actually cook the food there. Really!!! It was 95 degrees outside in Vegas so fake fire would have been welcomed.   The service was less than stellar as well, actually it was terrible. We had 4 or maybe 5 different people waiting on us. The guy who took the order and the check and who didn't get a great tip stood on the side and joked around with his friends the whole time. He never checked on our drinks or anything. I chalk that up to management. A well-trained  floor manager would never have let that happen.   My advice... there are lots of great restaurants in Vegas. Find one other than Gordon Ramsey  Burger.

Came here with my wife for lunch on a Thursday afternoon. There was no line so we were seated right away. I have wanted to try this place for a while. My honest opinion is that yes, the burgers are good. I could taste the quality of the beef used and it was well seasoned. I had the jalapeño burger which was not really spicy, it just had a small kick. The bun is soft and the ingredients are good quality. I did not really enjoy the sweet potato fries as I found it strange that it had powdered sugar spinkled on it. The negative really has to do with the service. The servers are not that welcoming and act like it's a fast food restaurant as opposed to a sit down. No smiles, no welcoming, no "enjoy your meal." The food runner dropped off the food with a slam of the plate and didn't say a word. Also, this is a rather expensive meal for just a burger. If you are coming here, it's because of the name attached, not necessarily because of the quality of the experience or any value.

We must have gone at a good time, we were sat immediately. Service was good and the food was really tasty and fresh. I was really impressed that the ketchup and ranch were made fresh as well. Really good!
Great burgers, friendly atmosphere, hardly no wait to get in. Would definitely go again! It was a very casual experience but also delicious.
Awesome burgers and great service. I highly recommend the jalapeno poppers, they leave the seeds in 1 and don't tell ya which.

I'm a vegetarian (and healthy eater foodie) and this place rocks!! Plenty of vegetarian friendly dishes! And the drinks are amazing! The fries are with the toxins in your body- they come with cool flavour ketchups. And great vibe and atmosphere.  Get on list for table and they'll text you when ready.  The line gets pretty long!

Fantastic food and our server was awesome.  I There isn't much to say!  Gordon Ramsay is known for keeping it simple and this restaurant delivers on a simple premise executed well with high quality ingredients.  It wasn't the best burger I've ever had, but it was definitely a five-star!

Phenomenal menu knowledge by server Nadine. She recommended the Forest Burger after I explained what I liked. Needless to say it was beyond my expectations. The onion rings were breaded to perfection and the sauces were like something I've never had in my life!

OMG! The Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad is the best salad I have ever eaten in my life! Perfect amount of dressing. All flavors complimented each other. Tons of greens, but they were balanced by all of the other vegetables and the delicoius grains in the salad. So I guess I"m saying, it's a very large salad. And it was sooooo good!!! We also had the Hummus and Pitas. Yum!   My husband was in the mood for a salad and so was I. When I suggested we go to Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant, my husband was like, "For a salad?!" But he humored me.   After we finished eating, he said that his salad (we both had the same salad) was superb. He really thought a salad at a restaurant that specializes in burgers would be lacking. But he was happliy surprised to find that his salad was really good.  The only downside to this restaurant - and it's a big downside - is that they don't take reservations. So you either have to go very early and wait by the fire sign (not ideal with the Vegas heat), or eat at a time that most people won't be lined up, or just wait as long as it takes. The line was fairly short when we arrived at about 5:30pm on a Saturday night. But it still would have taken about 35 minutes to just be seated and we had a show to catch.   I asked if they could do a takeout order for us instead and they did. That saved us! It was super delicious and I'd eat here again for sure!   The staff were friendly and very helpful. Thanks for an awesome dinner!

The hype is reaaaaal.  The burgers aren't bad, they are tasty, but definitely not worth the pricetag. The servers are super slow, and that's the reason they always have a long line outside. There are plenty of tables inside, they just dont turn them over efficiently. Maybe it's their plan.. trying to make it seem more busy than it is.  It is such a popular place in Vegas, because its probably the only moderately priced Gordon Ramsay restaurant in all of Vegas. Try it once, but it's really nothing too special.
We had Mother's Day lunch here and it was fantastic! Food and service were both outstanding.

It was a pleasant experience dining here. We got seated right away on a Sunday afternoon, 4:30pm, as there was no line (yet). The food service is a little on the slow side (took 15 min to bring out our appetizer and another 15-20 min to bring out our burgers) but it's due to the fact that the kitchen cooks everything to order and they take their time to ensure high quality. Plus I asked my patties to be cooked well-done which they did perfectly!  Blue burger: 5 stars! Loved the complex flavors! Hells Kitchen burger: also 5 stars, but I prefer the Blue burger more if I had to choose between the two.  Chips and curry dip: 5 stars... super fresh potato wedges, big portion, and delicious yellow curry dipping sauce.  Worth the hype but I probably won't wait in line for this. Come during the downtime!

This is a great burger joint but with Gordon's name attached, I was expecting something a bit more.   We were able to get a table without reservations after a moderate wait, only 30 minutes. Which is to be expected with a place this popular.   The drink menu was creative and delivered the flavors promised  There was nothing tricky about it but in hindsight, I should have just gone with a beer.   We ordered poutine and onion rings to get things started. The onion rings were amazing. Usually onion rings go limp and soggy almost immediately but these held up.   The poutine, however, was just a mess of flavor. Poutine is simple. Fries, brown gravy, cheese curds and optional meat. This was needlessly a complicated dish that tried too hard and was a disappointment.   The burgers served up were delicious but the entire table I was with ordered them cooked the same way, medium rare, based on our servers suggestion. When they arrived, however, we had burgers that ranged from rare and almost blue to almost medium. I had one of the rarer burgers and while tasty, it just became a wet mushy mess a few bites in.   The service was great. The ambience was cool and what you would expect. It is a bit noisy and crowded but this is Vegas after all.

The first time I went with my group of friends there was no wait, the service was amazing, our server went above and beyond. Literally would have recommended this place to anyone because the food is just delicious! Second time around, today to be more specific, I left completely disappointed. Not disappointed with the food because it was just as delicious as the first time. Disappointed because for some reason the staff kept giving my friends and I unwarranted stares, talking about our group to other staff and looking right at us. Mind you my friends and I are far from being rowdy and obnoxious so I do not see a reason as to why the staff would act this way. We may not dress like the richest people in the world but that does mean it's okay to assume we do not have money. It made the whole second experience very uncomfortable and honestly as much as I love the food I would really think about it long and hard before stepping foot in this establishment again. Food deserves 5 stars.

We took an Uber to specifically eat here because we were craving a good burger. we arrived at 11:30 and they close at midnight. They turned us away because "the kitchen is having issues" however people were still not served their food so what kind of issues would this be? I spoke to the manager who said they can't keep up with business and have long ticket times so they had to close early. What kind of restaurant of this name in Vegas understaffs their cooks and closes early?

The burgers and shakes here are always dope. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger. The meat was cooked how I requested it (med-rare). The fries sauces were great. Some of my fries came out a little soggy but it's alright since it was only a couple of them, nothing I would cry about. I also ordered the Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake. I always order one to-go so I can sip on it while wandering the Strip since the drink is pretty chilled and the weather is hot. Every time I go to Vegas, I always make it a point to eat here, I never miss out on the great burger.  I am not a professional food critic or chef but I do enjoy good burgers. This is always on the top of my list as #1 burger. I highly recommend you also reserve a table in advance since it's always crowded in here. If you are coming solo, lunch time you can probably find a bar spot without reserving (up to around 2pm) but afternoon, evening, and night times require a reservation to get in quickly.

Disclaimer: I was not a happy camper (with my spouse) once I walked into this place and looked at the menu prices. I gave her the look.  OK. To start off, my family and another family were on a Spring Break trip in Vegas (don't judge). And my wife was in charge of most of the itinerary and she chose this place I knew nothing about. I guess she seen it on TV or friends or what. Well, once I walked in and glanced at the menu, I was like this place is NOT price friendly for kids and we have 3 kids with us. Ex. The hotdog was $17 (I think). Anyways I just frowned up until the point of the food arrival.  I ended up ordering a Cheeseburger as this is what they are known for. Again, wasn't happy with the price but I went along with it as planned. This place was very elegant and well thought layout. Live fires burning all around. You could see the kitchen in a distance as food was prepared. The wait staff was exceptionally polite and friendly. We actually held a 2-3 minute conversation that was pleasant as well. We ended up changing an order after placing it and the waiter was not upset at all for changing and also offered if we don't like something to let her know and she will exchange it. So I was impressed and feeling a little more at ease about the price issue (above).   The food arrived: I left out the part that my spouse suggested we order 1 french fries for my entire family of 3. Once the waiter placed our fries on the table, I was like wow. I should have listened to her. Ending result, we left several fries uneaten and I hate to waste good french fries.   Now to the burger. The burger size was a decent size. The meat looked hot and juicy. Quality of the remaining of the burger looked great. I was impressed. Once I bit into the burger, all i could say is Hmmmmm. This is pretty good. And it was as juicy and tender as it looked. Those damn fries (sweet potato) were on fire (not literally). They were VERY delicious. I wanted to make sure I ate all of those before helping with the regular fries ordered.   Hotdog: Yes, that $17 hotdog. That thing was huge. I was thinking no way my son will be able to eat half of it. The weenie was wrapped in bacon. With that notion, I really wanted to taste it. And once I did, it was delicious. I could have ordered it for myself and been happy. My son was able to finish half of it and he enjoyed it. We were all stuffed.  I recommend this place for the food mostly, and the amazing ambience they offer. And the cleanliness and wait staff.  All of it was amazing.

I was thrilled with the food here! Absolutely delicious! I had the truffle fries, poutine fries, the Crown Burger, and a creme brûlée milkshake as well as a Chamborita cocktail (I shared with others. Lol) The poutine fries we're by far the best poutine I've ever had! They were devoured in almost no time. The burger was wonderful and did the namesake of the restaurant proud! It was a good size, juicy, and the flavors mixed really well with each other. The drink was delicious and strong and the truffle fries were awesome! All in all, I really enjoyed myself! The price is rather off putting, though. The burger alone was $16. That didn't include any sides. The poutine fries were $14, the truffle fries $12 (you can get regular fries for $9), and the drink was $13. The portion sizes are good, though, so you definitely won't leave hungry! Definitely recommend for a nice night out!

I am writing this review as I have been waiting since one hour for my truffle fries. Also the people right next to my table with exact truffle fries order got it after ordering 15 mins after us. No waiter has checked on is since 20 mins or so.  Eventually we got served super cold fries and we weren't able to finish neither the fries nor any of our burgers as they were cold.  Felt really bad as I hear good things.

I had high hopes for a good burger,  I have been to all the great burger joints in Las Vegas. I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger, I ordered it medium rare and it seemed raw to me and under cooked. Maybe next time I should say medium. The patty should be bigger also, it got lost in the toppings. Where is the beef?  The truffle fries were over cooked  and all I got was little pieces not full fries.  I can't believe they serve Pepsi, everybody knows burgers are only good with a ice cold Coca Cola?  As Gordon would say that burger and fries was @ "DONKEY" Sorry Gordon not a happy burger consumer at your joint.
Great service and great food! I was so full and the fries are also amazing. The place is a little more on the casual side and overall this was a great place to have a delicious burger.

I love you Gordon Ramsay! You can cuss at me all you want!  I was super excited to come here when he announced after the season finale of Hell's Kitchen.  The winner, Christina Wilson, is the executive chef here!  I was mind blown on how juicy the burgers were.  I always order the Farmhouse burger and the addition to the fried egg is exquisite.  I love Truffle fries, but I was disappointed the way it was made here. They were cut in wedges so you don't get the crisp crunch and there wasn't enough truffle!  Still a fan of fries though. Fries before guys? For appetizers, we ordered the Pork Belly buns and I was amazed at how soft the buns were. Usually, some places overcook the buns so it ends up dried out.  I'm not sure if they're still serving that, but it's definitely a must have there.  If you're in Vegas, this is your one stop!

Best.. meal.. of my entire.. LIFE! And I can't wait to try other G.R. Gems! I have spoiled my palate so much with this place that ordinary restaurants just cannot cut it for me. I brag all the time about this place! I don't remember what I had as far as my burger but it was very tasty especially their variety of mushrooms they add to them. The Poutine fries were amazing! What I loved is that usually you taste nothing but a mushroom after-taste with poutine but this flavor was much different! More of a freshly cracked black paper taste. Burnt ends were by far the best part. And cocktails? Definitely worth it! I can't forget the Oreo creme brûlée milkshake! I have never had anything like that in my life! By far, best tasting food.
Best burger I've ever had hands down.  Great service even though super busy.  The food was amazing and I would come back again for sure

This was my second visit to this restaurant and let me tell you this place never disappoints. I just love this place and the food here.  Food- Finger licking good Staff- Friendly  Service- Great Prices- Reasonable

Luckily we arrived early enough on a Sunday afternoon to by pass the long line to get in to this place.  Staff was inviting, knowledgeable and friendly.  Refills came quick and upon ordering we were quickly informed we may be interested in a starter because all burgers take about 30 mins to be prepared and delivered to table. We decided on chicken wings and beer battered onion rings.  Was super excited. Expecting to be blown away, and I was thoroughly unimpressed.  The rings were made with shoe string thin onions, a lot of oil and light batter.  I literally felt like I had a cup of grease in my mouth   The wings were very meaty, but just seemed dry to me...but honestly I'm not a great wing eater, so according to husband, these were "pretty good."  Burgers--Hell's Kitchen burger, the chiles add a dimension of smokiness and full round flavor.   The Hog Burger, super huge and filling.  Very delish! Forest Burger, my burger:  bacon fried in duck fat, patty, sautéed mushrooms, arugula and I added an egg.  Thank goodness gracious I added that egg--it added some creaminess and moisture to the burger (even though I ordered med-rare, not very juicy) that it needed desperately.  I don't know if someone over seasoned the sautéed mushrooms and put too much salt, or if the thick cut duck fat bacon lent a salty taste to the burger, but darn it, my blood pressure went up!  I had to pull out the bacon  And I absolutely love--LOVE arugula on a burger, but the heaviness, and maybe the creaminess of the egg in combo with the arugula just didn't work.  The arugula lent a bitter, earthly zing to the burger, and not in a good way  gosh, I'm so bummed.  First time at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and not super impressed...

Let me start by saying, I was trying to find something wrong with this restaurant. My guilty pleasure is watching Gordon's shows and I was hoping that I could catch a screw up or something but everything went without a hitch.   I recommend getting there early as we waited for about 20-25 min for a table. After being seated we were greeted by a friendly waiter whom introduced us to the concept and recommended a few items. We ultimately chose the following: - hell's kitchen burger - bleu cheese burger (pictured)  - sweet potato fries  Oh man... I am dreaming of those fries, they are amazing! Please please do yourselves a favor and go to this burger joint, you won't be disappointed.   We came in hangry and left overwhelmingly delighted. Damn you, Gordon!! Can you do anything wrong?

I have to say the flavors are great. The burgers were exciting yet overpriced, but for the name, I wanted to try it. The fries we got one order to and I was disappointed with the texture and got some with pieces of potatoes that had black in them. The texture of the fries was off and seemed to be tougher as if they're had been reheated. I loved the ketchup flavors that the brought with the fries though. As far as I am concerned the place is more touristy.

Came in at noon on a Thursday and there was no line. The menu has no pictures and for me that's important lol. The drink menu is on a tablet that the server brings to you. Table setting is simple.  I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger and my husband had the Forest Burger along w the Truffle Parmesan Fries.   You must try the Chamborita!   Husband and I gave our burgers an 8 each. Fries are a 9/10.

We had the best waiter here his name is Alex. Ask for him if you can. My husband got the blue cheeseburger and I got the onion rings! I am a very picky eater so I always stick to something safe but OMG the cheeseburger was amazing and the onion rings are to die for.

Best burger I've ever had... awesome fries, and the curry ketchup is fantastic! The atmosphere is nice, but it did feel a little "busy" as the restaurant is very open and near the entrance of the Planet Hollywood casino. Would recommend!
It's Gordon Ramsey so I figured it would be good, it exceeded my expectations. Truffle fries are a must, you won't regret it! Burger had great flavor, juicy and filling.

Definitely worth the wait; don't be intimidated by the long line. Lobster and shrimp burger was fantastic. I ordered the foie burger, I was disappointed. The burger was fine but I got only one bite of real foie gras taste. Was not worth the extra six dollars price above the regular burger. The truffle Parmesan fries were great tasting from the fries on the top of the dish. After that, they were just plain fries. Worth trying at least once.

My family and I went here on a whim since the reviews were so great, and my late-night binge watchings of Gordon Ramsay. So my expectations were super high. Unfortunately, our experience was terrible. Went here at 12 in the afternoon, and we had to wait 15 minutes just to be seated. We ordered the truffle fries, some Thai/curry shrimp salad, and a blue cheese burger. It took roughly an hour and 30 minutes just to receive the order. Our fries were room temperature and stale, though the truffle sauce was good. The burger wasn't charred, it was burnt. You couldn't taste the cheese or the meat whatsoever, all you could taste was the bitterness of the burnt parts. Now here's the worst part: the salad. The shrimp was the SALTIEST thing I have ever eaten. I've had plenty of curries in my life, and nothing has ever compared to the burnt, sodium-ridden shrimp that we were served here. Left with less than half the burger gone, only a few fries gone, and a plate full of salad and shrimp. Maybe we just got a bad batch of everything, who knows? Skip this place and go eat somewhere more worth your money.
I can say Ive "been there and done that" but that's  all. $85 for 2 burgers, 1 order of fries and 2 cocktails were not worth it. Ive had better burgers from "Back Yard Burgers" in Florida

A little pricey and I think the sides are even better than the burgers.  If you're looking for a great burger there are less expensive options.  But sometimes you need a fun Gordon Ramsay experience.    Everybody who has tried the farm burger loves it.  Get the onion rings. Amazing.

Went here years ago and loved it. Everything was perfect and delicious so I made a point to go when I went back to town. Something changed. The truffle fries tasted stale. The burgers were acceptable, but nothing like the perfection of before. With a casual atmosphere and barely satisfactory food quality the $40/person price was not worth it. Sad and disappointing situation overall.
I just had the lobster burger and foodgasm.  Kettle chipped nachos. Holy heavens batman.  This place blew my mind.
The hamburguer is not that good... everything was salty and the waiting time to get the food is to long for a burger  I don't think that the price worth the experience

Me and my bf were visiting lv and decided to eat a lunch here. We ordered a truffle parmesan fries and hell's kitchen burger and a hog burger. Both burgers were very delicious however the hog burger was exceedingly bomb ass good!!! We will definitely comeback for hog burger when we are back in town. One star is taken away because the service we got was terrible. For 20 min we didn't know who our server was because no one came to us and we couldn't flag anyone down even though it wasn't that busy. After we finally got to order the server never came to check on us and it was hard to flag anyone down for drink refills. the food was great but I was disappointed with the service

I'm in love with this place! The burgers are juicy, I recommend getting the truffle fries and don't forget the salads! Everything on the menu is to die for.   If you're a Vegas tourist, expect a lot of walking just to find this place - deep inside the Planet Hollywood (PH) casino. I'm not a fan of PH at all. I think it's a dump - one of the dirtiest places on the Vegas strip. (No wonder it's the center for drug dealers and strip scammers.) That's the biggest disadvantage I think this wonderful burger restaurant has.   Otherwise, just make sure you arrive before 4p.m. on weekends to avoid long lines. In spite of its location, it's worth trying out at least once!

I had such high expectations for this place, and they were met. Gordon Ramsay Burger served me the best burger and fries I've ever had. The wait was atrocious. We probably waited a little over an hour in line and it was by the line of fire, so it got a little warm. Other than that, everything was a dream.  We got seated and our server was very attentive. He kept making sure we didn't have any questions and was very quick. We ordered the Farmhouse burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger. Both were DELICIOUS. The farmhouse burger had a fried egg and savory thick bacon, and the Hell's kitchen had a slices of jalapeño and jalapeño aoli.  I highly recommend the truffle parmesan fries. They were extremely flavorful and comes with ketchup and garlic (?) dipping sauce. I dreamed about it the next day. Come try this place at least once in your life! You won't regret it.

I came here after a long and fun night in Las Vegas.  I wanted a burger and the line wasn't bad at all at 1am.  I had the Hog Burger and it was so full of flavor. The ingredients were fresh and it's a must when coming here.  I also had the truffle fries and they were really good as well.  I'd love to come here again.
Great burger! A bit expensive, but worth every penny. The truffled fries are also awesome!

I live here in Vegas behind the flamingo so I decided to park there for free and take a walk I ended up here. I've been to his pub at caesars and I just wanted a good burger. I sat at the bar the staff was spot on, friendly and took my order quickly, another staff member seemed like a manager was on top of everything, working the room and keeping people happy, the burger with the asiago was delicious i think it was called the hells kitchen burger I ordered med rare and got just that. I was pleased because some are to scared to keep it a little pink. They also didn't over price their burgers I had a burger an iced tea and with tip was only 23 dollars. I will be going back for sure!

Have reservation at steakhouse so just stooped by here get a small bite ...   Ordered a fries for togo about 30min ago and recieved it about 40min after we ordered. Also didnt give us utencils and nepkips.. :(
This was an amazing experience. The wings are incredible and I don't really eat wings often. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger. And the Jalopena Rita!

Was in Las Vegas for a week for business so I didn't have much time to enjoy the local restaurants, but there was one restaurant my GF and I could not be more anxious to try out. We both are huge chef Gordon Ramsey fans, we wanted to see if his meals were as good as they looked on TV! We showed up at about 3pm on Friday. It was a 30 minute wait in line just to see the hostess! Bring comfy shoes because there is nowhere to sit down unless you want to lose your place. I did see a couple come up in front of the line and retrieve a reservation they had made, so if that is a thing they allow I highly recommend doing it. There is a large fireplace with custom ironwork. It can be very warm standing in line so make sure you have layers that you can shed. But it was worth the wait. After getting through the line, we were seated immediately. I ordered a Backyard Burger with bacon and Dubliner cheese, I'm sure it tastes authentic with American Cheese but I wanted something a little more adventurous. I ordered an IPA cause you can't have a burger without a good beer. Their beer selection had a decent variety but not overwhelming. The food came fast but not rushed, I'm sure they take their time preparing. Burger was as good as I hoped it would be. I was surprised how high the burger was stacked, I generally like burgers I can fit in my mouth and not have to cut with a fork. And the spicy ketchup that came with the fries was interesting and good! Overall great experience. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Food was top notch.
Probably the best burger I've ever eaten! F-word burger and truffle fries were incredible! Can't wait to go back. Delicious Irish Mules as well!

Great burger. Cooked exactly like I asked. Parmesan fries with truffle oil were fantastic, 1 order is plenty for 2 people. Sat at the "Chef's table" which is basically a counter that faces the kitchen. Pretty cool watching them pump out burgers at blazing speed.
The food was awesome. Went with the recommended Forest Burger. The server was spot on describing it. We also ordered the onion rings & truffle fries to share.

The restaurant itself is cool. Lots of things to look at and TVs if there are any sporting events.  The service, especially the waitress was extremely friendly and helpful. We always had full drinks and everything we asked for very promptly.  I unfortunately was not impressed with the burger; which is strange considering this is place is famous for their burgers. My wife however really liked her burger so perhaps it was just bad luck on my part.  Overall; I would recommend this place for a quick and reasonably priced meal.  Reply to Nicole: My burger was just overcooked, twice. I requested medium and it was well done both times.

Had to try this place when I was in Vegas. Have to say I was a little disappointed. The burger wasn't seasoned at all. The Parmesan fries were really good though. Very near flame decor on the outside.

I was sat at the bar immediately at lunch time on a Wednesday.   I've watched Gordon Ramsey's burger tutorial online a million times, so I had high expectations. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger medium-rare as recommended. It was perfectly cooked meat, juicy, tender, well seasoned. It's hard to keep that slippery jalapeños pepper in there when you bite into it! Definitely provided a balanced kick without overpowering it, but definitely makes for messy eating and constant burger management. My bun was under-toasted for my taste, very minimal color when I opened it up. My friend's was perfectly toasted. So a bit of bun inconsistency. For a $18.40 + tip burger, I really think just a few fries could be included. Even in Vegas. Or maybe offer a half portion fry volume. It's a large burger so no way I could have finished fries and definitely not at half the price of another burger ($8-12). But I would have liked to try them. I'd still like to try the Farmhouse next time.   The spot at the bar had a/c blowing directly at me. Ok... I put my fleece jacket on. Still fricken freezing. 2 if the 3 men working behind the bar looked really unhappy to be working here. They weren't inhospitable, just appearing uninviting.

The logic behind my three stars is as follows: 5 star for the burger 1 star for the service. I realize it's a busy restaurant but I'm not sure how it could take 40 minutes to make our burgers. It was also discouraging when our neighboring table sat down after us and they got their food before us and left before we got our burger...  Maybe because we ordered some beer is why they took so long but we wanted cold beer with a good burger. By the time our burger came out beer has warmed a bit... I'm not sure if our order just got lost or entered wrong but for a high class restaurant it sure sucked.   Onto the food: (once it arrived) the truffle fries are out of the world! They come with their house ketchup and maybe truffle mayo? It wasn't too crisp but it wasn't soggy either! We ordered one order and it was plenty for the three of us mainly because the burger was big! I recommend the first burger I think it was hell burger? It's the one with roasted jalapeños. Hands down that has to be one of the best burgers I've ever had. The meat was cooked perfectly medium and the roasted jalapeños with the avocado was such a good texture! Add fries and ketchup and it was an excellent meal.  However I value service as well and while I would like to come back.. I doubt it.

What can I say.. there are mortal burgers and there is hog !!!  The chef takes us by hand into a mangalitsic triple delight. To start with, a moist succulent pork patty wrapped in bacon topped with slow smoked/ braised pork brisket with melted white cheddar sandwiched between toasted seeded buns. Cabbage tarragon mayo slaw coupled with crispy onions flavored with garlic, paprika, and cayenne as delectable toppings. Bread and butter pickles cutting through the saltiness of the bacon and sweetness of the brisket, completes the scrumptious package. Hog burger is definitely an ambrosial experience to relish in spite the long line to get in.   Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood is an urban casual spot for a gourmet burger with ambiance mirroring the peppy energy of Vegas.   Recommended, Cheers!!!!

Don't come here if you have a party less than three or else you will have to wait in line for at least forty minutes. I am not sure why Ramsay cannot afford a system in which they send you a text when your table is ready. Not only do you have to wait, you have to stand next to the fire wall, which can get very hot.   We waited in line for about 40 minutes like suckers. After we were seated, we had to wait another 15 minutes for our waitress and then an additional 30 minutes for food, so DO NOT come hungry. The burgers were good but nothing unique for $15+ each. Eureka! burgers (a chain) deliver the same quality tasting burger for a lower price and shorter wait.  Since they were busy, our waitress barely checked up on us. What was even more annoying was that when we got our check, she made big circles around multiple things on it like "tip is not included" and the total amount, etc. as if we couldn't read.   tl;dr: ok-tasting burgers, not worth time and price

I'm sorry but this was mediocre. If you're expecting 'perfection' you will not find it here. My burger wasn't how I ordered it (medium rare). Also we were seated near the entrance so we got the heat from that fire display. Seriously, you'd get better food at the Subway in the food court.
Amazing! We took the crown burger and blue cheese burger, great taste, worth every penny.  The Gordon recommendation for bear was great (can't remember the name but it's includes vanilla taste)

Oh.....My.......Gordon Ramsay! We're loving the burger bar trend, and this place sets the bar very high! The decor is super cool British themed, cool use of color and a walk of fire. The food was absolutely decadent. My husband and I shared the ultimate cheeseburger and onion rings. The burger was so fresh, the cheeses were tangy and smooth, and the sesame bun was toasted to perfection. We were happy we decided to add bacon to the burger, it was perfectly crisped and had great smoke flavor. The onion rings were breaded perfectly and served with a chipotle ketchup that is out of this world! The ranch sauce with the rings was good too, but the ketchup was a nice spicy treat for the ol tastebuds.

Love this place!  My favorite burger place!   The burgers are well balanced with a good bun to burger ratio.   And they don't drool drippings all down your hand.   They are on the Strip, so prices are high and the place can take a while to get in.   But as I said, my favorite burger and the fries are very good.

Definitely paying for the name here.  Extremely expensive and food was very disappointing.  It wasn't bad, but you have high expectations for Ramsay and the burger and fries were nothing out of the ordinary & not worth the price.  My husband and I both ordered fries because we wanted two different types.  The waitress asked if we wanted two servings, but didn't tell us that she was asking because each serving can probably feed 4 people.  Had we known that, we would have ordered only 1, especially after getting the bill and finding out the the fries were $8 & $11 each.  We had the truffle parmesan fries and regular fries, and there was not much taste difference.  They also come with different sauces, which we really didn't like.  I had the backyard burger.  Good, but not great.  My husband had the farmhouse burger, which was a mess.  It comes with a "fried egg" but it was just oozing egg yolk as he tried to eat it.  The restaurant is actually very small, and is placed at the entrance to a mall area, with two sides of the restaurant open to the shops, making it feel like a fancy food court.  I was really looking forward to this and was let down.

To sum it up - my second visit here with the wife was false hope for quality - with the visit being saved by the shake.   Second visit for me to Vegas and Gordon Ramsay burger joint and the atmosphere is great, starting with the flame wall at the entrance.   My last memory from 2 years ago was amazing. I was expecting the same quality. Having been at Gordon's steakhouse the night before, our expectations were high. We both ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, truffle Parmesan fries and the sweet potato fries. The wife has a cocktail (signs of alcoholism for sure ;) - and I ordered the brown butter caramel shake.   The fries came out first, we were very hungry and the fries were excellent. The truffle Parmesan fries were square cut and crunchy with a hint of shaved Parmesan on top. The dipping sauce was amazing - some kind of mayo rendition with some type of peppers. The sweet potatoe fries were thinner cut and crunch - absolutely to die for. They had a touch of powder sugar on top, as well as some on the side if you wish to add more. The dipping sauce was a jalapeño custard mayo type of sauce and is the perfect companion to the sweet potato fries.   A few minutes later, the burgers showed up. This is where the disappointment happened. Gordon and staff - if you ever read this - I suspect you take quality very seriously and I'm not sure if this was a one off or what but the burger was atrocious - almost not edible. It was overly salty, the bun was stale and overall over cooked (we both ordered medium). Wife and I both cook, and we would not want to serve anyone that type of quality.   Having ordered the shake, they must have forgotten it. The server apologizes and is in awe why it was not brought out already. She proceeds to bring it in a to go cup. Man, I am glad she did. It was perhaps the tastiest sweet item we've had in Vegas all week ( the desert at Gordon's steakhouse is top notch). The brown butter and pecan were rich and creamy - it does not let you put it down no matter how full we were. We were upset we didn't go back later that evening for a second round.  In summary - the fries and shake were a solid A The burger, which is supposed to be a signature dish, was a complete failure. Shame on Gordon Ramsay and his staff for putting out such a terrible product. We may be back for the shake but doubt it for the food.

This is my favorite fastfood place..... I've tried White Castle, Shake Shack, In-N-Out but keep going back to Burger when I need a quick burger and fries (about 100 times so far) (yes really). My absolute favorites:  - Farm burger/bacon/egg - Euro burger/truffle/cheese/cheese/cheese - Hog burger - amazing piece of pork + delicious apple butter/sauce - caesar salad; I'm not a salad fan but I love this one - Toffee/ice cream pops (mandatory purchase)  TIP:  If you sit at the bar or request "to go" style, then your time wasted standing line is zero.

I always wanted to visit this restaurant so last night I finally did the waiter whose name is Paul was amazing very friendly the Oreo creme brulee milkshake was also amazing the highlight of the entire meal as far as fries and burgers it was ok I had higher expectations I guess if I do return definitely will try different burger the one I tried was hells kitchen burger since I'm big fan of the show it has something I don't know if it was jalapeño or aioli but some bitter taste my daughter had farm burger she liked it no complaints overall the dessert and the waiter will get 4 stars

Food  was AMAZING. But service was horrible. The manager greeted us which I thought was very cool. But the front desk ladies, chatted amongst their selves while I stood there, and later after waiting over a half hour for my food... I saw a chef stand in front of me on his phone for like 15 minutes. What the hell? What kind of people  do you employ.?? Disgraceful. Great food doesn't excuse poor environment and staff. Wouldn't return, my time is exponentially more valuable.

We are huge Gordon Ramsay fans and the food here was absolutely amazing. We waited in line for about 20 minutes and it was absolutely worth it. The onions rings and cheddar ranch were to die for! The meat that the burgers were made of was the best I've ever had to be honest. 10/10 would recommend even if the line is long to get a table!

Hella good! This restaurant is located at the entrance of Planet Hollywood facing the strip. Came here on Saturday around 3:30 and it did not disappoint. Being a Saturday, there was a line and we ended up waiting about 45 minutes or so. Some bar seats became available and 2 groups in front of us didn't want them, so we happily jumped the line a bit.   Food: Amaaazzing! I wasn't feeling to good, so I nibbled at everything, but everything I tasted was so yummy. We ordered a burger (forgot which one), ahi tuna sliders, hellfire chicken wings and a side of fries. Everything was delicious. The burger and wings especially! The ahi tuna wasn't anything special, but wasn't bad either.I was sad I wasn't feeling well, otherwise I would've enjoyed the experience much more and ordered more food to try.  The restaurant itself is nice, clean and the service was great. We were very pleased with our experience here and look forward to coming back next time we are in Vegas.

Not worth the hype. Waited over 1/2 hour for 2 burgers and fries. Burger was luke warm and fries were soggy.  Some people who arrived after us were served much sooner. Such a big disappointment, not Gordon worthy.  Won't be back for what what we paid.

Loved it! It was my first time here, we tried to come here last year while we were in Vegas but the line was super long. I would recommend coming here for lunch & arriving a couple minutes before it opens!  Let me just start by saying the ambiance is beautiful in this restaurant. The fire at the entrance lights up the whole room. The staff was friendly & gave service with a smile which is always a plus. Everything from the moment we walked in was amazing.  The food was the best part! We started with appetizers - onion rings & the mushroom poutine. Delicious! The onion rings were light & the flavor was so good. The cheddar ranch dip was the best pairing to dip the onion rings in. The mushroom poutine was savory & delicious one of my favorites. If you love mushrooms you'll love this dish! I ordered the ultimate cheeseburger, the different cheeses gave it such a kick! My husband ordered the hog burger & loved it! We also ordered the lobster & shrimp burger & that one was my favorite! Portions were a good size. Timing didn't take long since we ordered appetizers first.  They don't have a kids menu, but if you ask they offer to make a grilled cheese or a normal hot dog. We ordered our 1 year old daughter a grilled cheese & I can guarantee you I'll never be able to top that.   We will definitely be back!

As a big fan of both Gordon Ramsy and juicy burgers, I felt obligated to try this place out while in Vegas. After wandering around trying to find this place (we didn't realize it was inside of a casino), we were finally ready to sit down around 10pm. Fair warning, since this is inside a casino, you have to walk through the clouds of cigarette smoke and crowds to get to the bathroom if you need to wash up before or after your meal.  As for the menu, there are tons of really enticing options. I went for the Hells Kitchen Burger, because I love spicy foods. I must say, the burger was cooked perfectly, had incredible flavor, and did not have insane amounts of heat. There was also a seafood burger on the menu, which sounded too good to pass up! A burger patty made up of lobster and shrimp? Count me in. But because it's a $26 burger, we decided to order it and split it amongst the table so we could all taste it. The burger ended up being incredibly disappointing. I suppose we had high standards due to the fact that it was so expensive, but it did not at all resemble lobster meat and just tasted like we were biting into a burger made up of shrimp. Not great.  All in all, I feel mixed about GRB. Food was good overall, but the prices are a bit high, the location isn't ideal, and our food took quite a while to come out, which was surprising at such a late hour when it was not too busy. You can definitely get a great burger here, just know what to expect!

I don't know how people could say this place doesn't live up to its hype, because I LOVED my experience here! I had the lobster and shrimp burger  ($25) but it was $25 well spent! It's one of their specialties! The lobster and shrimp patty was so fresh and freaking delicious. The truffle fries were good but the sweet potato fries were even better. It had a nice crispy texture with powered sugar! Also, if you get the lobster and shrimp burger be aware that the pickled veggies are kind of spicy because there are jalapeños in it! Besides that, its definitely worth trying and the service was great!

For the long wait and slow service, you'd expect something truly magnificent. However I was a bit disappointed to find that this place didn't even crack my list of top burger places in America. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was good, don't get me wrong, but it was just lacking the pizazz or special ingredient that it needed to take it to the next level. It didn't have as much of a kick as I had hoped for and I thought the bun that they used was definitely lacking and could've been upgraded. Then there are the truffle fries. These are the biggest waste of money ever! They are more expensive than the burger and have very little truffle taste if any. They are also cut so thick they are essentially wedges. I prefer my truffle fries thin shoe strings. If anything, I'd recommend saving your money and just going with the burger when you come here unless you have a big group and would like to share the fries otherwise it just isn't worth it.
Delicious!!!! Love the atmosphere I had the patriot burger and it was very filling!! Will definitely visit again when I come to vegas

The food was great, truffle fries are surprisingly worth it. Often when a restaurant says truffle fries the taste difference is negligible but in this case, it was well worth it. I had the hell's kitchen burger. To preface, I do have a fairly high spice tolerance so the burger to me was just heated, nothing to freak out about, even though the server warned me I might want to have the ghost pepper cheese on the side. That being said, the burger was delicious, tasty, juicy, and held up to the last bite. We also tried the salmon toast, pesto mac and cheese and the hummus. All tasty.   The service was great. Our server, Heather, was extremely friendly, kind and helpful. She did the most to accommodate our family and made us feel very welcome, from menu recommendations to accommodations for our picky eater.   Would recommend. Great atmosphere and decorations.

This is the best piece of food I ever put in my mouth . I've never ate a stake that taste this good . I had the farm burger . We also got garlic parm fries and sweet potato fries . Both were excellent but even with four people I recommend just getting the burgers . With the fries it was to much food. This is a can't miss if your in Vegas . I wanted to go back before we left but ran out of time .

I came here for lunch, sat at the bar. The servers are very friendly and nice offering of burgers and sides. I had the forest burger and truffle parmesan fries. Everything was tasty and u can they used high quality beef. Ambiance was casual, comfortable yet trendy.

The burger patty was very tender and my favorite part. We ordered the poutine fries which were just okay- ive had been poutine. For burger we got the Hell's Kitchen burger which was very good. Patty was cooked how we like, good flavor. Takes 30 minutes for a burger to come out. The line was pretty lengthy too, but we got seated at the bar. Would recommend!

I'm so disappointed. I love Gordon Ramsey and my intent was to eat at all of his restaurants while in Vegas, but I always seemed to be too full from other meals and this was my only stop. We stood in line to get in mid afternoon and, while the line was long (to the end of the window), it went really fast. I read reviews that parties of two stand in line and larger parties go put their names in. I had a really tasty strawberry drink and we ordered the hellfire chicken wings, expecting them to be spicy, but they weren't at all.
