My bf, a huge wing fan, didn't like them, but I liked them, especially dipped in the sauce they brought on the side. We both liked this sauce and, when they tried to take it away, we asked them to leave it for our burgers - we were glad we did. My bf got the Hells Kitchen burger and I got an off menu burger that I was never told the name of, but it was topped with brisket, arugula, an aioli and picked shallots. My bf said his burger was just ok - underwhelming. I've never gotten tired of a burger halfway through...maybe it was because there was just so much meat on the patty, but I didn't get any other flavors coming through to give it a kick and it was just too much of the same flavor that I was sick of it. I ended up using some avocado and tomato from my bf's burger AND the sauce from the wings and even then it was just ok. I still didn't finish it. I wish I'd had a better experience - maybe I should have tried the lobster and shrimp burger?

It wasnt the best burger for that price but a nice experience.  We got there @ exact 12pm on Thursday got seated immediately. But by the time we finished, there was a short line.  We ordered 1 helllkitchen burger and 1 lobster&shrimp burger, 1 truffle parmesan fries and 1 hellfire chicken wings with blue cheese. Ah an 1 cocktail (cant recall the name) The burgers are huge!! Luckily we were really hungry that we can finish all.  Chicken wings was what I was craving for. Im not a big fan of blue cheese but it was a good combination with the wings.  I would say the lobster burger was slightly better. The beef burger was well cook to what I ordered(medium well)  Truffle fries were a bit too hard (i think they were coated with corn starch). Service was Ok as it was not too busy.
Delicious burgers and there fries are very good they get served on a metal cone very fancy but you can still walk in there in jeans very cool place and very good.
Food is amazing, and has great taste for the value, HUGE DOWNSIDE is the wait when you can clearly see thru the window all the open tables!! What up with that?? It's not like they take reservations.

Over the years I've watched Gordon Ramsay on his show, "Hell's Kitchen" on Fox. I started to get less and less interested in watching reality TV but that never stopped me from trying one of his Vegas restaurants. I know Hells Kitchen just opened at Caesar's Palace but I was dying to try Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood. I was on a budget so I strictly ordered the classic Gordon Ramsay Burger with fries and just a glass of water.   Whenever I passed by the restaurant, the line was almost out the door. Thank, God I only had to wait 10 minutes and with the bar having open seating. I quickly stay down right away when there was an open spot. I didn't bother ordering anything else but the Gordon Ramsay Burger. Honesty, it wasn't excellent or below expectations. Maybe because I'm use to having gourmet burgers so it's hard to tell the difference. Let's just say the burger was cooked just right, juicy and tender. I'd comeback here to try other items on the menu. Now I can finally cross off the Gordon Ramsay Burger off my Vegas list.
Hands down, this place has THE BEST burgers ever! Delicious, fine burgers that are hard to compete with.  Love this place

Me and my husband were in Vegas for couple of days. And every time we're in Vegas we always indulge in bomb A$$ top of the line juicy burger. And we like to try different burger joint every time we're there. So this time around we decided to try " GORDON RAMSAY BURGER " located in planet Hollywood.   We got there, got seated right away. Atmosphere was just an ordinary topical restaurant nothing fancy or anything. Only eye appealing was the fire place, which made it more formal.  We ordered ~  Truffle fries - thick cut, not much flavor, came out kinda cold. Not a fan :/  My husband got the Hells Kitchen Burger W/ Bacon - he rather have 5 guys burger all day long  I got me the ultimate Burger-  lack flavor and meat was dry even when I ordered it Med   Over all I was expecting more from this burger joint sense it is Gordon Ramsay. But there was no party or firework in our mouth. Wasn't satisfied and not worth $70. Like my husband said 5 guys are better and it's half the price.  Sorry Gordon Ramsay but you're burger and fires need re-vamping.

I would come back just for the kettle nachos and truffle fries. **get the nachos and fries!!!!!  The burgers are large. I liked that the buns were grilled but I didn't care for the patties. I had the hog burger. Too much pork for me and it was in the dry side.  I really wish they would serve fish and chips.   I liked that our waitress said we could order grilled cheese for our toddler. I probably would have ordered it for myself too if I hadn't gotten the burger.

THE best burger I have EVER had!   It was totally worth waiting 30 minutes in line!   Ultimate Cheeseburger was delicious! Everything anyone can want in a cheeseburger! Hell's Kitchen Burger...anything with avocado automatically tastes great.   Both burgers were amazing! You can taste the quality in the patty itself.   The Creme Brûlée Shake was delicious! Suggestion: make sure to finish the creme brûlée first. I was not a fan of mixing the creme brûlée with the rest of the shake.   All in all, I didn't expect less from Gordon Ramsay!  I literally went back the next day to have another burger, but looking at that line which we were most likely going to be standing for, for 2 hours or more is what stopped me.

Came for lunch on Friday 25 May, and was seated at the bar. We were served by this chap who said he was filling in from another restaurant. When I asked him what's good in the menu, he said he's never eaten the food so he has no clue what to suggest. Service was slow and food came out maybe 30 minutes later. Paying the check also took a long time. Apart from the really bad service - the burger tasted good. But take note that the burger costs around $15-20 and didn't come with any sides, that's an additional $9-12. The truffle fries was pretty ordinary l, but the onion rings were much tastier.

First impression wasn't great. While waiting in a line sucks, watching others constantly skip the line is frustrating. You can skip the line too we were told - if you let the casino open a credit card in your name.  This means that while you're told 20 minute wait you're really standing in like for nearly an hour, in front of a roasting gas flame too (to give the Hell's Kitchen aesthetics, but is terrible placement for a line). I have to point this out the lines wait because while we were waiting at end of the line the hostesses continued to tell people 20 minutes and I'd keep interjecting "we've been waiting nearly an hour" so those people's expectations could be more accurate. It felt they were being disingenuous to people who may have plans/shows to go to. In the end they also stopped offering people tables (except to those skipping the line) and could only offer chefs bar seating.  Once we sat down for the meal it was prepared quickly however my party agreed the burgers were really nothing special. My own Hell's Kitchen burger was kinda ruined by the half-an-avocado which just kind of slides out as you try to eat, pulling the toppings out.  The one great aspect of the food was the truffle fries and onion rings. Those truly were great, and we agreed we're worth waiting in line.  Unfortunately at the end of the night the computers all went down and no one had any orders or bills so waitresses had to go around asking for orders again to calculate bills - then said people needed to pay with cash or else they'd need to go find those carbon-copy mechanical-slide credit card machines. Wasnt a great final impression.

We've waited in line here more than once but always gave up because the wait was too long. However, we were determined to try the burgers on our last trip to Vegas when the line was just a half hour. The burgers were good but not oh wow great. The fries were those big thick slab type, but I like fresh cut thin fries best. The house made ketchup was decent. We had the onion rings as a starter and enjoyed the rings but not the dipping sauces.  We ordered our burgers medium well. Mine was a mushy medium, but husband's was cooked as ordered. We both think a Coke is a must for the optimum burger experience, but no Cokes here so we got nice, cold beers. The service was slow. The ambience was nothing special. I wouldn't stand in a long line to eat here again. I might eat here again if I were hungry, and there wasn't a line, but otherwise it's a pass. There are better places if you want to indulge in a burger.

We order the Farmhouse burger and the Ale Dawg. The burger had great flavor and was perfectly cooked, not dry and not dripping all over. Ale Dawg was not greasy at all which is tough to do with a beef hotdog wrapped in bacon. The only thing better than the food was our server Hilary.

The sweet potato fries are amazing! Served with a jalapeno honey sauce that's rad. The ketchup is also fresh and delicious. However the trying to be trendy metal cone in which they are served causes most of the fries to become soggy before you get a chance to eat them.  The burgers are pretty lovely. Have had The pilgrim every time. Heard great things from my Indian lover about the indian themed burger.  A creme brulee milkshake shouldn't be served with whipped cream, covering the brulee top. Be sure to order without whipped cream! The milkshakes are too sweet, the creme brulee pudding is good but sweeter than a creme brulee- more like American vanilla pudding.  I wasn't the biggest fan of the chips n gravy.  I actually like getting the shake and fries take out because I can take them home and pop the fries in the oven and shake in the freezer, so the shake is thicker and the fries are crispier. It would be grand if they were thicker and crispier, respectively, in house. Fries gotta be crispy!   I also wish this location offered alcoholic milkshakes, I love a chocolate milkshake with Guiness or malt liquor.

I love the hamburgers and the decor. Nice selection of juicy burgers. I would have given 5 stars but I didn't care for the fries. They didn't have much flavor but the sweet potatoes fries are really good.
Awesome service thank you Michelle , awesome food, make sure to get the Oreo creme brulee Shake.

Absolutely love Las Vegas and Gordon Ramsay is one of those characters that you love to hate with the shows like hell kitchen and top chef Going to going to this place was definitely on today's agenda and also it was a tourist attraction and the fact that it was located in my hotel which was playing at Hollywood was another added bonus The greeters to the waiters to the cashiers everyone was pleasant and eager-to-please the menu itself wasn't that long burgers nothing shocking there I opted for the turkey burger option but my husband went in for one of the signature burgers that included everything but the kitchen sink which he got with fries we both have fries and drinks and for two people the bill alone was over 35 almost $40 but the experience was nice and the food was pretty good so no complaints you just have to know that you're going to spend a decent amount of money here for the name alone

First , I waited in line for 20 minutes  to get in. Second, the waiters take forever to take the order. Third, they run out of sparkling water. How this is possible in a place like this. Maybe the chef Ramsey is bs on his tv shows cause this is not acceptable in a place like this. I did not go to MacDonald so I expected better. Fourth,  after I ordered the food I realized I wanted to order coffee (freshly brew coffee) but I could not find my waiter, so I tried to reach other waiters, but they did not care. I was amazed. The other waiters were looking for my waiter. It took me 10 minutes to order the coffee. Amazing. Very poor customer service. Plus the coffee was horrible. I don't know how they can call freshly brew coffee. Burguer tasted good. Not complaint on the burguer. It's pricey but here is Vegas so this acceptable. Finally, I expected better experience because of Chef Ramsey , but now I don't know what to think. Maybe that chef is full of Bs in his TV shows cause definetly bad experience overall here.  Again burguer tasted good...

I was really surprised how "meh" the food was here. I love burgers and was really looking forward to Burger and after a long wait in line, I found the burger to be nothing special at all. In fact, I would rate several fast food burgers better including Five Guys and Smash Burger...and Gordon Ramsay doesn't even come close to Bachi Burger in town.   The truffle fries were dry and bland. After reading great reviews, I was looking forward to those as well but another let down.  I did have the browned butter caramel shake along with my Innis and Gunn beer. The shake was delicious.   I had the ahi sliders as an appetizer. That was ok but nothing great.  All in all, not impressive. The line is really long and it's a bit pricey which was expected. If you want a great burger in Vegas, Bachi is the best.

Yum, yum, yum!   I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger, which includes asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes, and jalapeno pesto aioli. It was awesome! The combination of all the ingredients meshed well together, and the avocado was perfect in the burger.   But the WINGS THO. These were Deeeeeelicious! That buffalo sauce was perfect and not too sour with the perfect acidity, and the blue cheese sprinkles on top of the wings just completed the dish so well. The first time I came here, I ordered just the wings and had a bite of my friend's burger. He had some of the wings as well, but I just wanted to try everything since I love food.  However, the SECOND time I came here, I ordered the shrimp salad (which sucked so don't order salad) and since I wasn't satisfied, I ordered the wings. Since it was a bit much I asked for a box as well as the check since I was in a rush. I put half the wings (4 pieces) in the box, and devoured the other 4. But mannnn, I couldn't help myself and slowly but surely, I ate the wings one at a time from the box I was supposed to take home to my friend. I ate one from the to-go box and I was like, just one more. Then there were two left, and who leaves just two pathetic wings for leftovers? That's just rude giving somebody two wings, so I HAD to eat the rest... xD  Anyway, if you come here, get the wings and the burgers aren't bad too! I believe if you are a diamond or seven star reward card, you get to skip the line.  FYI both times I came here the food does take awhile to come out, so it's not the best place to go if you are in a rush.   Cheers!

To be honest, I don't get why Gordon Ramsay BurGR felt the need to relaunch themselves.  A four star average spread over 5,400+ reviews seems like a damn good reason to leave well enough alone!  Not that it feels like much has changed.  In fact, we wouldn't have even known if our server hadn't mentioned it.  At the same time though, as modest as their remake was, the English/grammar nerd in me was pretty happy to see them put the "e" back into "burger" (yes, I get that the "BR" were for his initials...).  In all seriousness, the look and feel of the now-named Gordon Ramsay Burger is the same as before.  The only real changes I could see were with the menu; prices are $1-$2 higher (they don't have a discount for Total Rewards members anymore) and their burger offerings have been tweaked a bit (some have been altered, others seem to have been added/removed).  Thank goodness my friend was down to split a couple of burgers though; getting to try two burgers at the price of one = more bang for your buck!  -- TRUFFLE PARMESAN FRIES...$12 (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-burger-las-vegas-3?select=okbyfgMxoiyZiSlZd_iztQ) In terms of taste, this was exactly as good as I remember - a decent amount of parmesan, the perfect amount of truffle oil, and all around delicious.  The fries were also just as crispy and flavorful as before, though the fries weren't cut as large this time around, which was fine.  -- HOG BURGER with Mangalitsa Pork, Mangalitsa Bacon, BBQ Pork, White Cheddar, Pickles, Crispy Onions, and Slaw...$18 (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-burger-las-vegas-3?select=_SbSCPmhzVn-y2K7aI4Osg) With pork on pork on pork, this burger sounded awesome to a pork fan like me!  Sadly though, this didn't amaze (good, but not amazing).  The pork patty was super juicy and flavorful, and I loved the onion strings and melted cheddar, but I didn't sense much of the bacon or BBQ pork.  Not sure though if it's because they were lacking or if everything else just overshadowed them.  -- FARMHOUSE BURGER with Dublinar Cheese, Mangalitsa Bacon, and Fried Egg...$16 (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-burger-las-vegas-3?select=lJrPb63uD2PTF9Xmti1I6Q) Though the Hog Burger didn't amaze like how I had hoped, this was terrific!  Which wasn't surprising, given the classic combination of toppings - soft, lightly toasted buns, a well cooked patty, a runny egg, thick and flavorful bacon (in this case), and gooey cheese.  Definitely recommend this!  Name change aside, it was great how our experience wasn't far off from the first time around - terrific!  The menu options, the food, the service...all just as good, even despite prices being a shade higher (to be expected after four years!).  While I still want to check out Burger Bar next door at Paris, and even though I'd still give Holstein's a slight edge by comparison, GR Burger is as solid of a choice as ever.
The decorations and burgers were amazing, truffle fries were great too, the staff was really nice she introduced us the featured on the menu.

I would describe this as a Gordon Ramsay themed restaurant. Everywhere you look, his face stares back at you. I'm not sure if they have a restroom inside but if they did, his name would be on the toilet seats and a photo of the man himself, hands folded, would be taped to the back door of the stall, judging you. His name and photo are literally all over this place. I get it, it's Vegas, but I feel like if this was on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon would have a few wise cracks for the "donkeys" that chose the decor. THE FOOD: a tasty burger that won't blow your mind, but it's good. The flavors are there and they did not disappoint. Go if there's no line, it's convenient for you (staying in Planet Hollywood), you LOVE looking at photos of Gordon Ramsay, or are simply very very hungry for a decent burger.
Great Burgers Yummy Sweet Potato Fries may eat hear everyday this week! Great Service & Speedy Service
Get the Poutine Fries - you will not regret it.   Food was great, sadly didn't get yelled at, or see anyone else get yelled at.

Unreal! Wow! If you are craving a perfect burger unlike any other in texture and flavor, this is the spot. This experience was excellent from beginning to end. Friendly greeting at hostess stand as we awaited our table. Our server was prompt, informative and attentive. Top notch service with much consideration.   Due to the volume of this establishment it takes 25-30 minutes to receive your burger of choice. Server recommended a starter since it is delivered quicker. The corned beef nachos served over hand cut potato chips were incredibly rich and delicious.   Kale/Romaine Caesar salad was amazing! The dressing was the star of this beautiful salad. Let's just say I never felt like one could be addicted to a salad but this one will get ya!!   The burger: OMGoodness! Unlike any other. It looks modest when it arrives but one bite and you know everything about it is special. We ordered the UK Burger, it is topped with Dubliner cheese, chutney and arugula on an absolutely perfect bun. The bun is topped with black and white sesame seeds and is pillowy yet hearty. The meat was so buttery and seasoned to perfection. You savor each and every bite and don't want it to end. It leaves you eager to try every burger on the menu.   There is a wide variety of burger choices and many appetizers to choose from. Fries are a la carte.   Even though the line can get long it is definitely worth the wait. If you are a burger lover or connoisseur  then it's worth the trip.

My friend and I stopped here on a Monday morning right before our flight out of Vegas because we were staying at Planet Hollywood. We were hungry at 10:30am after we checked out and decided to gamble and have a drink at the Extra Lounge adjacent to the bar.   Before we knew it, we turned around and saw that a line was already forming for the restaurant. We were seated quickly and our server was super friendly. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger which was just a little spicy and cooked to a perfect medium. My friend got the farmhouse burger which she enjoyed but she ended up requesting a side of avocado to add because she wanted to add a bit of freshness to her burger bc the beef patty, egg, and bacon was just a lot of fat. She was told there was a $3 charge for it but when we got the checks it was $4. We were in a hurry and didn't mention it. The avocado they add to the burgers (whether it comes with it already or on the side is just one big piece of 1/4-1/3 of an avocado which I wish they'd just slice thinly and fan on top of the burger. I ended up doing this myself.  We also split an order of fries which was plenty between the two of us. They are steak fries and not especially crisp on the outside but tasted fine. It came with what I think was curry ketchup and a house made one so if you're just into Heinz, you might have to bring your own.   Overall a great burger, nice staff, and would stop at again if I were staying or doing something closeby.

I've never had such a rich burger. I ordered the hog burger and it was absolutely phenomenal. This burger definitely set the gold standard for burgers. While it may seem pricey for just a burger, you'll leave full and happy wondering how any burger could ever compare.   If you have any room for desert the chocolate tart was amazing! It had the smoothness of chocolate, with a slight texture of caramel. The way it melted in your mouth makes it worth it. While I'm going to have to run for days to burn off the calories from this meal, I would absolutely do it again.

Dang, how have I not written a review for this amazing joint? I don't remember what I ate since the last time I was here was years ago, but the experience was so good that I still keep telling people it's the joint to go for a delicious burger that won't break the bank! Anyway, just happy to drop a 4-star review to this tasty joint!

I'm still thinking about that burger! I had the Tandoori Chicken burger which was tiny bits of chopped chicken in a delicious tahini vinaigrette with crumbled feta cheese. I will be going back to Planet Hollywood for another one. I loved it!
A premium price for regular taste burger. Expect a long waiting time about 45 min and the service is slow about another 20 min. First and last time.

Everything about this place is excellent. The food, the service and the atmosphere are all top notch. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger which was great. I would only recommend if you like hot/spicy things. There is a great drink selection as well. This is probably one of the least expensive meals on the strip with this level of value.

I'll start off by saying that I'm not a Gordon Ramsey fan. Never watched Hell's Kitchen, or anything. But the memes I find on the internet about him are hilarious!  Hubby had been wanting to check this place out for the past year, so during our last trip to Vegas over LDW, I thought what the heck, let's try it out.  We waited in line for about about 20 minutes, when one of the hostess asked us if we wanted to sit at the chefs table. I didn't really want to stand in line anymore since I was starving, so we took it. I'll admit, they made it sound like a cooler experience when they were telling us about the chefs table, so I was a little disappointed when it was just a bar counter. Fine, I'll let this pass, my expectations were a little too high.  This is where things went pretty sour. First, it took about 15 minutes for a server to say anything to us, another 15 minutes to get our drinks, and about 45 minutes to get our food. Considering that i was starving, I was in a pretty hangry mood. I couldn't believe how slow this place was. I'll give it to the cooks, they were moving pretty fast at times, but other times, they were just standing around waiting for the food to cook. I noticed that the burgers would all come at one time, about 5 or so, and then the cooks would just be standing waiting for more food to cook. It's like they would cook the food in shifts, rather than being constant. Why not just consistently be cooking, rather than putting everything together, then waiting for the food to be ready together?   Now about the food: I had the Tendori Chicken, lettuce wrapped. All I asked for was the chicken, and cheese wrapped in lettuce. Not too complicated right? Well, the chicken has some kind of sauce that took away the goodness of it. But since I was starving, I just let it go and ate it. But I wasn't a fan of this sauce. When I asked the server what this sauce was, she didn't know, and had to ask a chef, who looked liked he didn't know either, and then just settled it with being "marinade". Umm no, this was not cooked with the chicken. This was tossed on top of the chicken. There is a difference.  Hubby had the Backyard burger, no complaints from him. He thought it was ok. High quality ingredients, but not really worth the price tag.  We decided to share an order of sweet potato fries, which are huge btw! We both weren't a fan of the powdered sugar they added. I don't get powdered sugar on fries. Whats the point of it?   Overall, I don't think I will come back. There are better burger places around Vegas. At least I got hubby off my back with trying this place out!

Gordo!!   I had this on my must-visit list when coming to Vegas and Gordo did not disappoint! Went right before the dinner rush, which I recommend. No wait for my party of two - walked right in.   The menu was fancy and short - so Gordon, am I right?   I opted for the most expensive burger on the menu, "the foie" . It was the second best burger I've ever had. Meat cooked medium rare as requested. Bun... the bun . Never really considered a bun to be a really essential part of the burger but this bun is special .   Skip the $12 garlic fries. Good but Not worth it .

Well this was a great experience. We waited 20 mins in line. Server was attentive.  We rocked the nachos which were fantatsic. Corned beef wasnt too salty. Very good. Got the hells kitchen burger.  That bread was so soft. The meat was a perfect medium rare. Tons of flavor. The garlic truffle fries was a generous portion of tasty from start to finish. Great amount of alioli. Id highly recomend coming here. There is an emphasis on quality here we havnt found at other places. Thanks!

Front of the line access for Diamond Members. Very friendly staff.  This was one of many restaurants I wanted to try when in Vegas.   I was lucky to be there during the week.  Ordered the Ahi Sliders, Truffle Fries and Cheeseburger. We were informed the burger would take about 30 minutes, but it was so worth the wait. Fries came out fast and so did the Ahi Sliders. Food was so delish.....

WOW . . . I mean. . . WOW  Not many places make me say WOW in a review with all caps, but Gordon Ramsay achieved that twice in Las Vegas! This was one of the two amazing meals thanks to Chef Ramsay!  Came by around 6:00pm on a Tuesday, not too busy and did not wait at all. We sat right by the flaming wall which really gave us a Gordon Ramsay Hell's Kitchen experience!   I will start off with the biggest and quite frankly the only downside to the night...our waiter. All the other waitstaff and hostesses seemed so nice, friendly, easy going . . . but ours was an absolute ass. We sit down and don't even open our menu and asks what we want to eat. Really? The rest of the night he kept coming by trying to force us out. We didn't care, we ate and relaxed, left him no tip.  ANYWAYS now for the absolute best part - THE FOOD!  We ordered a few things, I will list them from least favorite to most favorite!  Pork Belly Hot Pockets - little hot pocket like pastries filled with pork belly, bacon marmalade, and topped with tomato jam and herb aioli. The flavors were honestly great. Tender, juicy pork belly, savory sauces, but it was just so little. For $12, the price to portion ratio just gave a lack of true enjoyment! But still good none the less    Farro-Quinoa & Chicken Salad - this was surprisingly great! A HUGE salad that my mom couldn't finish, even splitting with my dad and I, it was so much food! the chicken was juicy and cooked perfectly, the vegetables were all cooked to a delicious soft texture, the lemon vinaigrette was light and fresh, and the cheese added a nice creamy sweetness!   Jalapeño Poppers - These were the. best. jalapeño poppers. I. have. ever. had. WOW!  they bring out a long tray of six poppers, each in their own sauce cup. The poppers are HUGE! no cheapness there. The batter is thin, amazingly crispy, deliciously flavored, and inside ...WOW! jalapeños were soft, fresh, and filled with creamy thick bacon cheddar sauce! Then the sauce each popper was dipped in . . . the cheddar ranch sauce . . .OMG . . . thick, savory, salty, rich, cheesy, ranchy, absolutely amazing combination !   Last but not least, the star of the night and the whole vacation - the Truffle Burger!  Let's start with the bun . .the soft, delicious, toasted, poppy-sesame seed bun . . . excellent! Then the thick, amazingly wood grilled patty, so juicy and tasty, perfectly paired with the following condiments . . . truffle tremor cheese, oh so cheesy, warm, creamy, slightly nutty, coating your mouth in cheesy goodness. Topped with foie gras creme fraiche, continually coating your mouth while mixing with the cheese for a  savory, salty, slightly gamey flavor and creamy texture. All of this topped with truffle aioli . . oh man, this was the softest, juiciest burger I have ever eaten! Adding some fresh crunch with the frisee lettuce, this is seriously one of my top three favorite hamburgers I have ever. ever. EVER. eaten.   Chef Gordon Ramsay has brought Vegas an affordable, delicious, amazing dining experience with some of the best food you will ever have the pleasure to enjoy!

4.5 stars for this place. Not the best burger I've had but pretty close. The truffle fries were really good.  Had the forest burger which I liked a lot. My friend had the crown burger and liked it a lot. Would come back again.
Omg so yummy! That's all I have to say. Food was amazing. Took a little while but definitely worth it.

We visited here 6/28, and we had high expectations. The restaurant was clean and nice, our server started off nice, but once we ordered drinks and our food she was nowhere to be found. We requested that our Truffle Fries come out before our burgers because we were hungry, after waiting 30 minutes, all of our food came out together! The burgers were overcooked (we both asked for medium) very disappointing! She also let my husbands Diet Coke go empty twice. This place is just an overpriced Red Robin. Sorry Gordon Ramsay, your food and servers at this place suck.  The only good thing was my cocktail.

As a long time fan of Gordon Ramsay finally visiting a restaurant of his, I was so excited. I ordered Parmesan fries and the Forest Burger and I am not lying when I say this was the absolute best meal I've ever had. The ingredients on the burger were ones I hadn't tried before so didn't prefer, but the patty just melted in your mouth. This gave me clarity on how all the burgers I'd eaten that were leaking grease were just that, but this was actually juicy and completely flavorful along with the perfect combination of the tremor cheese and mushrooms. That order of burger and fries has put everything else I've had to shame, most definitely a meal that will never be lived up to. Go to this restaurant so you can change your life and regret eating any other food forever

The line was long but surprisingly it moved quickly! Excellent service, great food (very tasty) & absolutely LOVED the chocolate pudding shake w/Kahlua, it was definitely a heavenly dessert in a cup! We ordered the Hell's Kitchen & the special F -word burger!

Top notch experience!  We came by around 8:45 on a Sunday night and ended up waiting around 10 minutes for a table for 2.   I opted for the Hells Kitchen burger and my husband had the Hog burger. When the food came, we got our Parmesan truffle fries (delicious!) and my HK burger, but they brought a Backyard Burger instead of the Hog. We have no idea if they sent it to the wrong table... but expecting no less from a Ramsay restaurant, they had to fire a new one, which finally came when I was almost done with my burger and we had already finished the fries. Our waiter apologized and let us know that they were taking the burger off the bill. The manager then came over to also express his apologies and explained the situation. He also offered us a free drink since our waiter had not offered one during the wait, so we opted for the caramel pecan milkshake (highly recommend). Management handled the situation extremely well and we would definitely come back.  My only improvements would be a greeting once you get to the front of the line..and our server could've been friendlier... but that's it!  *a photographer comes around taking your picture and will try to sell it in a cardboard frame for $10 FYI

I honestly do not know how this place has a four star rating. From the moment we walked in. The hostess were uninviting, the waitress was extremely awkward, and it took 45 minuets after we ordered to get our food. I ordered the portobello mushroom burger, which was good. I will give them that. However, it was $17 without a side. It was good, but not $17 good. By the time we finished three burgers, and one fry cost us $75!!! There are several other places in Vegas you can go to get a good burger for half the price. You're just paying for the name here.

Had the wheat berry quinoa salad and it was very bitter. Not to my taste. The mushroom poutine was divine. And the lobster and shrimp burger was not worth $26. Overall for a Gordon restaurant, it didn't live to my standard.
First time here and I have to recommend the Hell's Kitchen burger. The beef was juicy and tender with some great flavors. If you like spicy this burger is a great option!
I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and was excited to discover the restaurant, I got the farm house burger. It was pretty good, maybe my expectations were a little high.  I would give it an 8.8

I came here on a Thursday afternoon for a late lunch. Gordon Ramsay Burger is located inside of the Planet Hollywood hotel. There always seemed to be a line in the evening (7pm-8pm). There were four of us and we were able to snag a table immediately at 5pm. The staff here are great, very attentive and constantly refilling our drinks without us even having to ask :)  I had high expectations since this is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and I was not disappointed. I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger which comes with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno aioli. This was one of the best burgers I have ever had, I loved the spiciness of the roasted jalapenos and jalapeno aioli and the bun was perfectly toasted. The burger itself was cooked medium well per my request, the meat was juicy, not overcooked and dry. There is a huge variety of burgers on the menu so if you are not a fan of spice, there are many other options. I also ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries to share as a table. The fries were perfectly cooked and I loved the flavors. The burger is very filling so sharing the fries as a table was ideal.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and I plan on coming back on my next trip to Vegas. The prices are super reasonable for a high end burger created by Gordon Ramsay :)

Looks cool from the outside but extremely hyped up... They made us wait 25 min for a table... Once inside the waiter was off his rocker nutso and acted like he was drunk. The food took 30 min to come and we ordered 8 burgers and 2 fries ... We paid like 100$US for 2 burgers and 1 fries .. Waste of money!!!

This is what a $30 burger and onion rings, no drink looks like :/ I'm speechless ..... Is it worth the experience? Would the price affect your taste buds and sensory organs? ......... for you to find out!

It's pretty expensive, but the burger is worth it. My friend and I both split the farmhouse burger and the forest (?) burger with medium rare meat. The farm house burger was great. The egg was nice and runny, and the flavors melted together so nicely. The forest burger had great mushroom flavor and tangy cheese. The meat is so tender! They burgers are on the pricier side and fries are extra, so look to spend $20+ on a burger and fries. The burger is def worth it. They have unique dipping sauces for their fries.

It's a burger place. It's good. But It's a burger. Nothing amazing, nothing special. Would I come again? Maybe if someone insisted. Was this the best burger I ever had? Definitely not.  Food was ok but that's about it.

We were there on weekend. It's a very popular place so you should except a long waiting. If you have award membership like diamond/platinum, you can skip the line. So go straight to the front.   We sat and drinks order was taken immediately and we got them right away, however it took 45min for foods to arrive so you know how long the waiting is like.   Over all foods are good except my meat medium was kind of medium rare, so my husband ate mine. Oreo Milk Shake was really really good except they topped with very sweet cream brûlée and It wasn't really necessary. But I guess it's up-to the person who drinks and some people may like it. But not me. Next time I may ask to omit it.
The burger was good. The service was also very good and friendly. The reason for "just" three stars is the very long waiting time. We had to wait approximately 50 minutes to get a table.

The burgers were fantastically delish. Almost as good as in-n-out! Sure, I'd rather have an in-n-out burger at a fraction of the price but we were celebrating bff birthday. Fun, loud place. Long wait but why be in a rush when you're in Vegas.

My bf is a huge fan of Gordon, but I personally think the foie gras burger is just great. It's not surprisingly good, but it tastes alright/great. The truffle fries are a lil disappointed tho. But overall it was a great experience  One more thing is that their beer is so expensive
I have had better $20 dollar burgers. I'm not a hater but I felt like every burger looked the same, with different toppings. Same bun, same everything.
Best burger on the strip! Every time I come here, I never get disappointing. Considering it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, the pricing of their food is super affordable!
Service rapide dans un cadre très sympa. Les frites a la truffes sont à tomber par terre. Pour ce qui est des burgers ils étaient bons mais pas les meilleurs mangés

What a delightful experience. The food was great. The service was great; we thoroughly enjoyed the manager who brought us our delish bottle of wine. The ambiance was amazing. They mentioned they had their music up louder than normal for a trial run on how customers liked it, and we loved it! Great music! The employees seemed to enjoy it, as I was watching one employee who stood there and just sang her heart out while waiting for her tables food to come up.   Loved it! Will come back!

BOMB. Best burger place I've ever eaten at. Honestly left feeling sad knowing I won't have this place at home.  They don't take reservations, but our party was fairly large and we needed a handicap-friendly table so they made an exception. We were there on a Sunday around noon and the line was about a 30 minute wait. We stayed at Planet Hollywood (where the restaurant is located) and the line was always long when we saw it.  I had the Tandoori Chicken Burger- every bite was so flavorful. And that goes for literally everything our party of 10 had. Our favorites were the Kettle Chip Nachos and Truffle Parmesan Fries. Seriously sooo delicious! I swear every bite my whole family would look at each other and say how good it is lol.  Service was 10/10 too. Crazy busy, but they still brought our food quickly and checked up on us often. Overall, an amazing dining experience! :)

Great quality meat! Burgers are simple as far as not having many toppings. My husbands bacon was floppy. Awesome truffle Parmesan fries! Decent pricing for what I expected. My burger wasn't quite well done but that's ok!

It is hard to walk into a restaurant without any expectation when you see one of the most famous names in restaurant business. Walking into Gordon Ramsay Burger, my expectations were very very high. Once you are seated you are greeted with a table setting that reminds you of the British Flag with and a simple menu on top with very minimalistic fonts with the name of the restaurant. The physical Menu it self even felt like there was a lot of thought, design elements and interaction put into it compared to a regular menu at majority of the restaurants. The drinks and dessert are on a separate tablet menu the server brings that seems a bit out of place and don't see the use for but I feel like its because of the limited space on their actual menu.    On to the food. I had the Anniversary Burger which also seems like the F-Word burger that wasn't on the menu. The patty is a blend of 27-day, dry-aged New York strip, Bone in ribeye and barbecue short rib. It's topped with frisee, pickled shallots and lemon vinaigrette. It seems like the design isn't very sophisticated and I like how simple yet flavorful it is. People might ask whats the point of all the best meat in a patty, you won't taste it.. but the truth is it made a whole lot of difference. you can actually taste the dry aged and the quality of meat in each bite. Parmesan Truffle fries are cooked to perfection with subtle yet enough seasoning and flavor of both Truffle and Parmesan in every bite of the Fries. It is hands down one of the best gourmet burgers I've had.    Service is a bit slow due to the place being so damn busy but it's understandable since the place was jam packed. The only gripe about this place is the waiting system. We had 5 people in our party and they were kind enough to take down our number and text us when our table was ready but for party of 2 or less, They said you have to physically wait in line. Though we didn't have to wait in line, this just didn't make any sense to me. If you already have a system of where you can take peoples name and phone number down, why can't you do that for everyone so they can go enjoy a little bit of Vegas instead of waiting in line next to a window full of flames?    Price is a bit high for a burger at $22 but I understand as it's hard to find anything to eat with less than $20 at a sit down restaurant in the stip of Las Vegas.    Regardless of the wait, and what other people may say, I personally enjoyed every bite of my burger and it was a extraordinary burger. it is definitely worth the try. c'mon it says Gordon Ramsay and how often do you have the opportunity to walk into a restaurant with his name in front.

What A Great Tasty Burger !!! Las Vegas has so many good places to eat  But did a search for the best burger in town and Gordon Ramsay Burger was one of the top choices. With the flame burner wall surrounding the restaurant give a modern bbq torch feel.  There was a wait to be seated but not super long for a Saturday night .  We opted for the bar seating to speed up the process because we were starving. *Good Beer Selection *interesting twist on Burger Combinations  Ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger was juicy excellent taste yummmmm!!!! Had onion rings that were amazing  And French fries came with different types of dipping sauces.  *Customer Service started of weak with the first bartender not having a good knowledge of the menu. Then a seasoned bartender took over and had that playful attitude made a fun experience.  Will be back for sure

It was just foinee. I and my friend went to Gordon Ramsay Burger couple weeks ago. it was around late lunch time and still busy. Food is just ok cuz way toooo salty. I got sandwitch and my friend got a blue cheese burgar. I also ordered sprite and server pour WATER on my sprite glass. Ok I could understand, it could be happened. The worst thing was that our server was not really friendly but only paytime(when they gave us the bill) I could see his smile. Lots of people..good music.. It is fancy casual restaurant you could try for once.

OMG... delicious! Went there last night with family and ordered the hells kitchen burger, crown burger, and ale dog with truffle fries. Best burger I ever had. Requested the burger be cooked to medium and the temperature was perfect! Can not recommend enough if you are hungry for a good burger in Vegas!
Skip the burgers, they are so-so. The appetizers and Oreo milkshake is what I find so good about this place!! If you have a sweet tooth, I strongly recommend the Oreo milk!!! It is heaven.
Didn't cook it medium on both visits this weekend . Very disappointing ! Management doesn't seem to care
I highly recommend this place. The burgers are pricey but once you indulge in the flavor, you know it's money well spent.

I'll start by saying that I'm always skeptical when going to a restaurant that has a lot of "hype" around it because of a celebrity chef. Will the restaurant live up to expectations? Is it hyped up because of the name behind it? Are you paying a considerable amount more for something that isn't anything special? I mean this is only a burger joint!  Well, Gordon Ramsey Burger was everything I hoped it to be!   I went in with my husband and a couple of friends on a Saturday around 11:45-noon. There are no reservations, it's first come first serve.  The line moves pretty quickly, it was about a 15-20 minute wait... and we were about the 5th party in line. Not bad!   I love that the menu is fairly simple. There are enough options, but it's not overwhelming! Extensive menus are a bit of a nightmare for any indecisive person like me! Haha!   We ordered beer battered onion rings to share as an appetizer. They came with two dipping sauces; chipotle ketchup and a cheddar ranch. The onion rings were cooked to perfection, flavored well and the cheddar ranch sauce was the perfect compliment to them! It was a great start to the meal!   For my burger, I wnt with one of the more popular options; the Hell's Kitchen Burger. O-M-G! That thing was amazing! It was topped with asadero cheese, avocado, roasted jalapenos, and roasted tomatoes. The patty was so flavorful... it would taste good plain, that's how good it was! Seriously, there was a party in my mouth when I devoured this burger!!! It was tasty, memorable, and something I would crave!   My husband got the hog burger and that thing was MASSIVE! It consisted of a patty made of pork and brisket, wrapped in bacon, topped with pulled pork, crispy onions, white cheddar, pickles, and slaw! What?! He LOVED it!  Our friends had the Crown burger and I think the backyard burger. They enjoyed theirs. We wanted to share a variety of fries, so we ordered the parmesan truffle fries, sweet potato fries, and the chips with curry sauce. The fries' portions are large and can be shared. Having 3 orders between the 4 of us was way toooo much. I would stick with the parmesan truffle or the sweet potato.   We also wanted to indulge in a dessert and shake. I ordered the chocolate caramel tart which was chocolate cream served with hazelnut ice cream, hazelnut crunch, and milk chocolate! Sooooooooo delish!!! I would recommend it. Our friends shared the Oreo crème brulèe shake, they loved it.   Ambiance is lively. Service is excellent! And the food is tasty/memorable! If you're a burger fan, check it out...quality meat in the burgers and very tasty!

If we are in the mood for burger, Ramsey's burger is the place we go. From unique to gourmet burger selections, it will be your ultimate burger experience. I normally like the: Hell's Kitchen burger, farmhouse and the chutney burger. You have to order the sweet potato fries, the powdered sugar and the dipping sauce is so good. The truffle Parmesan fries is also delish
LOVED IT! I had the lobster shrimp burger and it didn't disappoint, with a blend of tasty and unique flavors. The service was incredible. Much faster than expected and our waiter was very attentive.

Do you think they have good burgers in the casino at Planet Hollywood?  Do your think you can have good burgers at a place that serves almost 2,000 people on a busy night?  Think YES people!!!  There are places more glamorous, with much better settlings, but if you want to get in and out quickly, have a shockingly good burger, and pay a reasonable amount then this is your place!  We all had different burgers, and we all loved them.  Ok, the chicken burger was undercooked, but the issue was rectified immediately, the item was removed from our bill without asking and the manager was great.  Good food, fast service and awesome fries!

Because I am an avid cheeseburger fanatic and have heard many a good thing about his restaurant, this place was on my list of "burger joints to conquer". Pricey? Yes. But totally worth it for the aficionados.  What I had: the Uber Cheese Burger. Why? Because I love cheese and apparently have no concern over clogged arteries. It was melty, and tangy and loaded with delicious cheesy goodness. The patty was juicy and cooked to perfection. It really needed nothing else and hit the spot. The perfect accompaniment was an order of their crispy Truffle Fries with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. Because no burger is complete without exquisite fries, am I right? The only caveat is the wait time which is standard here apparently.  Delicious decadence in a fun environment with a great wait staff....can't ask for more than that!

The burgers were amazing and the truffle fries are definitely worth sharing, a must! My boyfriend and I shared the Hell's Kitchen burger and the Crown burger and I am sorry I did for the burgers back home will never be the same! I am not a fan of hot, spicy food but the Hell's Kitchen burger was great n not too spicy. The truffle fries were absolutely amazing! Sorry but In n Out should not be compared to these, even the best gourmet burger back home can't top these! The 45 min wait wasn't exciting but to me it was worth it to have had tried one of the best burgers! Love Ramsey n as always he does not disappoint.

It's effing RAW!!! I ordered medium. Friends ordered med rare. Their's were well done and mine was rare. Also I ordered no bun, my burger was brought with a nun and was told the chef doesn't allow modifications...dbags.

Key Points: Best burger I've ever had. A must-try on the Las Vegas Strip.  Two of my friends and I came here for lunch in the midday during an educational conference located at the Cosmo. We were pleasantly surprised to find this place conveniently located across the street at Planet Hollywood with only a 15 minute wait for 3 people, despite the long line out the door!  We all ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger, which the server stated was the most popular. That makes perfect sense, as why not name your signature burger after one of your signature TV shows?  The burger was cooked medium, as requested. The meat was juicy, savory, flavorful, with the perfect texture (not too soft, tough, or crumbly). The sesame buns that had just the right amount of firmness, without any stale taste at all. The asadero cheese added a nice touch, and almost looked like a fried egg. Hands down the best burger I've ever tasted, and I've tasted quite a few in the world. I guess you can't go wrong with something created by a master chef like Gordon Ramsay.   The three of us also shared an order of the truffle fries. Those were crispy, and delicious as well.. It was abundant enough for all three of us, with some left over. My appetite just wasn't at its baseline, otherwise I definitely would have finished the remainder of our fries.  Also, the place was splendidly decorated. Make sure to take a look at the blazing fire wall while you're in line and while dining in.

I thought this place was good but not great. Might have gotten four stars if not for the fact that they don't take reservations and always have a pretty big line. While I really enjoyed my burger, I don't think I would stand in line for 30+ minutes in order to get it again. There are lots of amazing burgers to be had in Vegas that don't require the long wait.

I'll start by saying that I really enjoy this place, and their burgers are delicious!! Their service is great, and it's definitely a casual place, but you can dress up and not feel out of place. The burgers are great! Oh, and the parmesan truffle fries are my favorite! The reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is because I have kids, and there is not much on the menu for simple taste buds. I know, "What are kids doing in Vegas???", but as much as I don't like taking them to Vegas, they like going for the lights and nice rooms. So, we take the kids for dinner, because they need to eat too.  For parents: if you find yourself at Gordon Ramsey Burger, and you're with the kids, I would recommend the Chicken Sliders, just ask to get them plain. Also, wait times can be long. We waited 40 minutes for a table (5 people). Our last visit was Thanksgiving week, 2017.

Over an hour wait but so worth it.  We were so happy to see they had just added the Impossible Burger Patty to any burger for $6. The fries were good. Our waiter highly suggested the onion rings but they were blah. The Pecan Shake we ordered was so delish.

This place is truly a high quality burger establishment. Now was there a line... oh heck yes. However they will take your number and text you when a table is ready which is really nice. I had the parmesan fries which was amazing and my group had milkshakes with their burgers. I loved the version of milkshakes with the pudding in it. I like the different take on a milkshake. I have been here a couple of times. Worth the wait.

As someone mentioned, the wait is long! No only waiting to be seated but waiting to get the order. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was absolutely amazing. The food was definitely worth the wait, though! I'm already dying to have some truffle fries again
I really wanna give this 5 stars because the food was perfect! So was the waiter! But the hosts seemed like they didn't know what they were doing as if they were completely lost.
Every year, we travel here (atleast twice/three times a year) for the Gooey Fries  I'm sad and probably not coming back because of the discontinuation of the Gooey Fries.

Great burgers and ambiance! I have to be honesty, I came initially for the novelty initially since watching "Hell's Kitchen" is a guilty pleasure. They have a variety of options (including a HK burger) to satisfy all types of eaters.   Blue cheese burger for $15 did not disappoint our taste buds. But the real stars of the show were the truffle fries ($12) and the off-the-menu special anniversary burger for $22. A lot has been said about the fries already, but let me tell you about this special burger. Yes, $22 is a lot in general. No, it's not a lot in Vegas. It was perfectly cooked to the requested temperature, the added brisket and frisee plus whatever else was on there was a great accompaniment to the meat - without outshining the star of the show.   Only negative, the service was slooowww. The tables seating after us received their food at a variety of different paces, so it wasn't like us waiting over 45 minutes for burgers and fries was atypical for that date. Perhaps the expeditor lost our ticket? Dunno.

Line was out the door so the food must be good...And it was!  Waited 1 hour for table and food was slow coming out but the food quality and our server Alex made it well worth our time. Salads were unique and flavorful. O-rings were Top notch and the Burgers BIG and Tasty! We will be back!
Good burgers with reasonable price. I ordered Hell's Kitchen Burger and it is quite good. Cost me $15 bucks.

My friends and I have decided to try out Gordon Ramsey Burger this weekend while we were in Vegas.  Host: 1 star  For anyone who is a first timer, parties of 3 or more do not need to wait in their line. You'll need to go to the host and tell them your name/number of people. They will ask for your number and send a text. Once when you get a text, you have 10 minutes to return back to the restaurant to get your table.   Initially, we had a group of 7 present, which we need to wait about 35-40 minutes. We then had an additional 3 more people added to our group, a total of 10. I went up to the host, Kelly (asked our server specifically what was her name just in case if she gave me a fake name), to change the number of parties. She again asked for my number but  I never received an updated text. I reconfirm with another female host and she also said they will resend a text. Guess what? My request was never on the books. We ended up with 7 people in one table and the other 3 had their own table on the other side of the restaurant. This service is not acceptable.    Food: 5 stars  Highly recommend: TRUFFLE FRENCH FRIES  Burgers do not come with fries. We've ordered truffle French fries, ahi tuna sliders, hellfire chicken wings as appetizers. I've ordered a crown burger, super delicious!   Server: 5 stars  We had great service from our server. She was very organized and friendly. Food came out quick.   Would I return to this restaurant? Yes  I understand that the awaiting guests may be overwhelming to the hosts but this type of service is unacceptable. People come to the restaurant because of Gordon Ramsey. The service may just be ruining it.
The line is a real pain, looks tacky for a high end burger place. Feels like a suped up TGIFriday's to me. Burger was mushy, too much bum for the burger. It wasn't bad it just wasn't awesome.

I had the best burger ever here!!! I had the anniversary burger I definitely recommend getting it! I know the waiter had said it was only a limited burger because they were celebrating something but if they have it when you go get that one!
1. Amazing truffle fries 2. Sea food burger-shrimp/lobster was amazing - but pricey - 4.5* 3. Hells kitchen burger- pretty good 4.5 * 4.Hogs burger - good

This review is for the hostesses and service only.  This is my favorite restaurant and the food is 5 stars, but the rude hostesses make me not want to return.  There were two groups ahead of me in line at 5:45 pm on a Friday night.  Half of the restaurant was empty, yet they were holding the line. I asked how long the wait was.  Without looking to see how long the line was, the hostess did 45 minutes. She must be psychic.  Food is great. Service is shit.  I can't imagine there would not be enough servers working at dinner time on a Friday night.
Very very good burger! Ordered the ultimate cheeseburger with veggie fixings and fries. Everything yummy!! Long wait but worth it!
You should try onion rings! Was so yummy. Burger was perfectly done and delicious. Prices are reasonable and worthy.

Keep walking if you're hungry! The food is great, the service is average, the wait times are terrible. 1 hour to be seated, then another 40 minutes for the food to arrive. It was good food, but if I had known the wait time inside was so long I would have skipped eating here.

We we're so excited to try Burger. Finally getting the chance, we stopped in Saturday night right before 6. Surprisingly the line was short and we were seated within 5 minutes.   Our server was great, super informative. We ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger, Blue Cheese Burger and Truffle Fries to share. Our waiter told us it'd be about 20-25 minutes for food. I did think that was a little awkward to tell us that, but I appreciated the honesty. We weren't in any rush.   By about 30-35, our food came out. Looked amazing. Cut my burger in half a saw it was definitely well done (we had both ordered ours medium). Not a big deal but when Red Robin can get a burger done-ness right and not Gordon Ramsay, that's a bit of an issue.   The burger was great except the patty. All of the flavors were there. Loved the kick of spice and my boyfriend loved everything about his Blue Cheese burger. Except the party. Not sure why we waited that long to have over cooked burgers.   The truffle fries had the same issue. The flavors were amazing. But the fries tasted like they sat under the heat lamp waaay too long. And no surprise, if you looked over to the kitchen you saw rows of fries sitting under the lamp.   The kitchen was clearly behind which surprised me at 6 on a Saturday, not what I would think would be the dinner rush. There were plenty of empty tables around us.   Seemed like they were waiting for the kitchen to catch up because they stopped seating people for about 15 minutes. By then, the burgers seemed to come out a lot quicker.    I really wanted to like this place, and had our burgers been not been cooked to death and our fries sat out, it would have been 5 stars.   Service 5 stars. Flavors 5 stars but it's the kitchen that brought it down. Work on efficiency and this place would be so great.

My family ate here, and the service and food were a huge disappointment. My daughter ordered a hotdog, and when we asked for ketchup it wasn't what she was expecting. It was some sort of house ketchup, and they didn't carry plain. Our food was cold, and not to mention we waited over an hour just to get 2 burgers and a hot dog. Just to get our drinks took 20 minutes. The only thing good was that we were seated fairly quickly, only took about 10 minutes. The staff seemed careless and rude when we were asking about the different items on the menu. We came here thinking it would be a great atmosphere with amazing food, instead we got horrible service with mediocre food.

Delicious! Truffle fries were so tasty with homemade ketchup. Burger was seasoned perfectly, the pickles on it were the best I've ever had! Atmosphere was cool and clean, and I loved that you could sit at the bar and watch all the action in the kitchen. I gave four stars because our server was curt, and not nearly as attentive as she should have been. There is nothing worse than feeling like you are begging for a refill on your water. I would definitely recommend this place for the best burger I have had in Vegas!

We had two burgers, the blue cheese one and the hell's kitchen one. I'd say neither was bad, but I'd also say neither was particularly outstanding, and given a moderately high pricetag (16-17) at lunch and a long line, that qualifies this place as overrated. The parmesan fries are solid. But honestly, if this place didn't have a celebrity chef's name attached to it, it would be nowhere near as popular.

Really enjoyed our burgers here and the concept. My negative is that they don't take reservations and even off times there is a long line. So while I did enjoy it I would prefer to just go somewhere else than to stand on a long line because it is good but not worth it to me.

Ooh my goodness...the best burger I've ever had! The bun was soft, fresh and spongy! Th meat was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection! The Parmesan fries are excellent!! We also ordered the Oreo custard shake (yummy) which is perfect for sharing! Highly recommend if looking for a delicious burger restaurant!!

The burgers are definitely worth the wait. We were a large party and they text our phones when our table was ready. That allowed us to grab some pre dinner drinks at the little bar around the corner. Server was super sweet and accommodating to the first timers!

This place is definitely worth trying if you're ever in Vegas! It's a tad overpriced but if you think about where you're at, it makes sense. The service here is exceptional! Our waiter made sure to check on us occasionally to refill our water and crack a few jokes.  The Truffle Parmesan Fries ($12) are pretty good. My favorite part is the dipping sauce - I'm pretty sure they make it from scratch (Fresh tomatoes and truffle oil, etc)  Hellfire Chicken Wings ($14) are amazing. Huge pieces, juicy, and an explosion of flavor! I definitely would choose this over their fries.  The Crown Burger ($15) is probably my personal favorite. It's extremely flavorful and the meat is spectacularly cooked - make sure you order no more than medium (I suggest getting medium-rare though).  The Hell's Kitchen Burger ($16) is alright. If you like spicy, this may be a good choice - but I personally don't think it tops the Crown burger in terms of flavor. Again, make sure you don't over medium for the meat!  The Lobster and Shrimp Burger ($26) is delicious. It's something worth trying once if you're a seafood lover. The proteins are cooked nicely. The only thing that makes this a turn-down is well.. The price.

They don't take reservations, but they do text you when your table is ready. So put your name on the list, then walk around Planet Hollywood to gamble, people watch on the strip, shop in Miracle Mile, or get a drink at their bar while you wait for your table.   It's kid friendly, casual, and not insanely priced. You still get a taste of "Gordon Ramsay" without breaking the bank. Everything is a-la-carte, so fries are extra. But one order of fries is enough for two people to share, and you can choose from several different types of fries, so it makes sense.   All of our food (and drinks) came out quick and hot. The hostess, server, food runners, and bussers worked well together making sure that all tables were taken care of in a timely manner. Out of the 4 of us, we all left full and happy!
Surprisingly good!  We ordered the Blood Orange Cosmo's, Hog Burger, Ultimate Cheeseburger, Truffle Fries and got a small creamsicle desert.  A little pricey but totally worth it!

YES YES YES!!!!!  We had one of the best restaurant experiences that we have ever had in Vegas! We loved it so much, we ate here for majority of our vacation.   Just about everything you need to know:  Gordon Ramsay Burger is located in the Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino Resort. He has several restaurants in multiple hotels so don't get confused! When you arrive to Burger, you have to wait in a line to get in. We got lucky with the times that we went and didn't have to wait in line very long but it does get packed so be prepared to wait! The hostesses were so nice and friendly and made us feel so welcome. It was really cool that one of the hostesses remembered us and welcomed us back.   The restaurant is a nice size and the atmosphere is really cool. They do not tolerate drunk and obnoxious guests which was really refreshing!  Service: On both occasions that we went, we had TERRIFIC service! Both of our servers were very knowledgeable of the menu and checked up on us multiple times during our dinner. One employee who really stood out to us was the busser Caleb. Caleb was absolutely a joy to see on both of our trips to Burger. He was one of the kindest employees at a restaurant that we have ever encountered. He deserves a promotion, raise, or something. Just watching him take pride in his job and smile at every table was so refreshing.   Food: YUM!!! Over the course of 2 visits, I had the "Hell's Kitchen Burger", the "Backyard Burger", "Beer Battered Onion Rings", "Kettle Chip Nachos", and "Truffle Parmesan Fries". Everything was PHENOMENAL, except the Fries. They were not as great as I think they could have been but everything else made up for it. Make sure you request your burger to be cooked the way you like it. They normally make it "Medium" which is a bit too pink for me.   Prices: I think the prices are spot on. The price is definitely worth the food.  Overall, This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I highly recommend it and we will definitely be making it a tradition to come here at least once when we come to Vegas.  I hope this review helps you decide on where to get a delicious "Burger" when you come to Vegas!!!! :)

Service here was on point! Adam our server was super attentive and that made it worth every penny! I got the blue burger and my husband got The Hog burger, and we also got the onion rings as a starter. The onion rings were awesome, crunchy and delish! The Hog was super flavorful but MESSY and a little on the greasy side.....but delish! The Blue burger was good, I wished it had more arugula and the figgy jam on it, the blue cheese was super overpowering. I gave it 4 stars mostly for the service if it was just for the food I would have done 3.
Been here a couple times and it doesn't disappoint.  The burgers are cooked perfectly.  Love the truffle fries!

My husband and I loved this place... about a 30-40 minute wait but completely worth It... service was fast enough to calm the "hangriness," but not fast enough to make you worry about the actual freshness of the meal. I had the portobello mushroom burger and my husband had ( can't remember the exact name) a burger with bacon, cheese, and egg and we shared the Parmesan truffle fries... everything was tasty, fresh, and inventive.

The burgers are over priced and nothing special they lack flavor and small for $16.00 without fries. The shakes are good but wouldn't get a burger from there again. Gordon Biersch has much better burger.

Wow...  burgers are so good.. It is pricy but very tasty...  I ordered Hell's  burger and Farmers burger with Putine  fries and Truffle fries...  The door opens at 11 am but already long line was formed...  I would say at least 30 people waiting in line..  Luckily I was 3rd person in line.  In the beginning dining area was empty but in minutes, whole place was filled up.  Hell's burger was very spicy... So if you can't handle hot spicy food, I don't recommend.  However, Farmers burger is good for every age.  Uncooked york of the egg makes burger more juicer and nicely blends with the patty.  Putine fries are nothing like the ones I ate in Canada..  It was totally different but visual, and taste is something you must try...

Ate here a few times and have found the food and the service to be excellent.  The burgers are always fresh and delicious and cooked as I like them, rare.  The burgers can run $15 to $22 but  the mixed drinks and desserts are priced below normal for the Strip.  But price doesn't matter if the food is excellent!  In the world of burgers, this place is a real stand-out. The only downside is you will most likely wait on line for about 20-30 minutes and also wait that long for your food.

The food was amazing! I'm rating only four stars because of the wait, we waited almost an hour for our food and the appetizers came out with our meals. There was also a pushy photographer who took our picture and tried to sell us the pixilated prints. I felt like that cheapened the experience.   However, the food was excellent. No complaints there!

This food tastes like a smoker made it. Salty. The staff is friendly but the meal below a standard burger place. The pricing separates even the burger from the fries. I'd pass on this place. The celebrity chef element brought nothing to the proverbial table.

Really over the top for a burger place, fine fast food if you will, everything from decor down to the burger bun was perfected, the quality beef, the perfectly melted cheese, the spicy pesto, the fries, the curry ketchup that came with the fries, really unique. We get so used to burgers being this widely available junk food, this place gave the burger its glory back, will definitely be back.

I love coming here, keep in mind they do not take reservations, they will take your name & number once you get there. We waited about 30 min on a Saturday night, not bad. The burgers are excellent along with truffle fries. Yum !

$14 min for your Burger, hot dog or otherwise. It's good, but I've had just as good a burger if not better at places that give you fries with your menu item. We ordered the tuna sliders, parm fries and the bangers and mash. Fries were ok, but a little dry, not made to order. Dipping sauces were the star there. The garlic aioli was fantastic.  The tuna sliders were good, lacked the burst of flavor I think we were hoping and expecting it would have. Bangers and mash was pretty decent, the little potato balls were awesome, the roll the sausages were on were fresh and delicious. I can't complain overall, however - devils always in the details.  That being said the curry dipping sauce I requested on the side had been sitting in the fridge and I had to stir it up a little to be able to dip anything in it.  When you're paying $25-30 for a burger and fries..... I expect little things like that to be right.  It just sort of misses the mark for me.  I've been here before and said the same thing.... I only came back because my sister had never tried the place and wanted to go.  I can't really say that I'll be back.  The novelty is in the name, certainly not the dishes.

Good burger. Mine was very salty which is why I deduct half a star. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger. However the bun was delicious, the party cooked perfectly to order. I would return to try the other burgers.  The other half star deduction comes from the service. The host staff is chatting on their phones while a long line is waiting to be seated. Every once in a while she looked up to engage the customer who would be instantly seated at one of the many available tables.  Once finally seated it was hard to flag down your server. Burger took over a half hour to prepare after order and it took almost as long to wait to pay the bill.

We are sad that we visited Gordon Ramsay Burger on our last day in Vegas!  Wished we would have the first day so that we could go back on our last day.    Husband ordered the Yardhouse and I the Hell's Kitchen burger (replaced beef patty with turkey patty).  OMG- the burgers were very moist and juicy!    You know it's a good burger when you see the patties glistening and juicy, however, no grease at all on your plate or fingers after you are done Inhaling it.   I don't care much for onion rings or fries and boy were the onion rings Delicious!  We also Inhaled the onion rings with its two dipping sauces within minutes!  We will be back!

With all things in consideration, you get a gourmet burger for a good price. I was even more inclined to go because I'm a huge Gordan Ramsay fan.  You are welcomed with a wall of flame on the side of the restaurant. It feels a little bit like you're eating inside of Hell's Kitchen. Flashbacks to all the seasons I've watched... Anyway, I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger and it was cooked very well. Each bite gave me goosebumps. We also ordered a side of truffle fries which was seasoned perfectly.   The customer service was top notch. Our waitress did a great job keeping our party of 10 happy. With Ramsay as their boss, who can dare to mess up? This place gets a thumbs up in my book!

Service was terrible! We were seated at the empty chefs' counter, put in our order, and subsequently the seats next to us were filled by two other pairs. Both of the other parties got their drinks and fries before us and eventually I ask if we can have our fries. We can see that dozens of fries have been prepared and gone out..... the waitress says yes, but the fries don't show up. Had to ask again. Burger comes out and it's ok. Not as good as previous times. Pretty disappointed.

Don't miss out on these burgers. That will be the best you have ever had. The service is exceptional. The Mediterranean burger is made with lamb. It is my favorite. My wife likes the blue cheese burger.

Loved it! Felt like I was treated so well. Each flavor was perfect. I couldn't believe how yummy the food was.  We also had shakes that couldn't have been better. This place is great for a birthday or special occasion because it will surely be a great memory and very filling!
I was pleasantly surprised that the burgers were tasty, fresh and original. Service was excellent and the decor was interesting. Great price for a nice Vegas burger!

THE BEST BURGER WE'VE EVER HAD!!!! If you are ever in the Vegas area, you must go there. My son ordered a burger, The "F-word" burger that had short rib, brisket and another steak all ground into one SUPER juicy, FLAVORFUL  burger!!! (Note: it's NOT on the menu! Seasonal??) The onion rings were very DELICIOUS!!! This will be my family's go to place every time we are in Vegas!!

Our server was personable, and he took very good care of our table.  We mentioned in conversation that it was my daughter's birthday.  The place was packed, and we weren't expecting anything, but he made her feel like a princess.  Can't wait to come back!
AWESOME burgers!  A little pricey but that's what you get with a celebrity restaurant on the Vegas strip. Yummy!

Great environment, good food, poor service.  If you're in a party of 4 or more, you can skip the line and go straight to the front to give them your name and number. They'll text you once your table's ready. When my party of 5 came on a Sunday, we checked in at 1:30pm and our table was ready at 2:15pm. By the time we sat down, our waitress - who seemed very unenthusiastic for having to work that day I might add - said the burgers would take half an hour to make. HALF AN HOUR! Our appetizers came out within 15min but our burgers actually didn't come out for another 45min. Imagine how hangry we were.  The Onion Rings and Truffle Fries are great to share with a group of people. The dips that each come with add a lot more flavor. They were both good but not great, I've definitely had better for less.  Forest Burger (mushrooms, arugula, duck bacon) - I loved the combination and it sure was tasty. I was intrigued when I saw the duck bacon but wasn't a fan when I actually tried it. There was no duck flavor and it tasted essentially like salty dried meat. Normal bacon would've made it better. However, the beef patty was delicious - probably the best I've had.  Farmhouse Burger (bacon, fried egg) - I personally liked the Forest Burger better but the 3 others I came with preferred this burger. They used normal bacon here which was a plus.   Bottomline: The food is good, but for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, I expected more... and better service.

Had the U.K. Burger for lunch and it was quite delicious. The bun was grilled and had a crispy bottom which is typical of Gordon.   Also had the sweet potato fries which came out before the burger. Came with powered sugar and an aioli sauce and they were incredible. Paired with a beer will set you back about $35. Sat at the bar - overall a great experience.

I'll keep this short and simple. I've had better burgers at Wendy's. Burger was tasteless and portion size was on the super small size. The best food were the sweet pickles that came on the burger. The only thing worse than the crappy food was the terrible service. Had to wait 15 minutes to see a waiter and then saw him only twice more during the hour we were there. The place wasn't super busy and the staff seemed more interested in flirting with each other than doing their job.

Was not that impressed, there was 7 of us, waiter forgot my ice tea and chicken wings, he did make it up to me by giving me free chicken wings.
