The chicken wings were bad, we all ordered different burgers medium and they looked rare. Can't believe  this is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Only reason I gave it 3 stars is because the waiter gave me the free chicken wings even though we could not eat them. Gordon Ramsey I need your apron!

The burger tastes okay. Nothing special . It took them 30 mins for a take out burger to get cooked. Way too expensive for mediocre burger. The $22 "fioe" tastes cold and bitter , maybe bc it took them way too long to cook and they won't call you once it's done to pick up.   After 30mins , once you are there to pick up - it will take them 5 mins to go to the kitchen to get the burger up then another 5 mins if you want sauce like ketchup. Not sure why  they think customers will say no to ketchup when eating burger and fries .

Located in Planet Hollywood this place was a must try for me.    Went for the farmhouse burger.  Super juicy, cooked to order, and for a Vegas named chef place not a bad price.  Had truffle fries on the side.  These were a hit at the table.  Pricey but a single order can easily be split by 3 people.  Way more than anyone should solo but I might try.   The Good Good burger.  Fun atmosphere.  Waitress was on point.   Fair prices considering.   The Bad Can be a wait to get in but not terrible.   The Ugly Nada. This was worth the stop.

The mouth watering jalapeño bombers here are just straight from heaven . They are literally the best ever!! They come in a 6 piece all individually dipped in a cool house ranch and all of them are not too spicy except one or two of them! They do it on purpose yes it's for those to enjoy it if they can't eat too hot! But excuse yourself if you get the really hot ones! Rip! Sliders and burgers are also great! Good size burgers not too big not small at all but fills you yo good. Long wait at times but get there at a perfect time when there's no line stop right in!

We stopped here before the rush however it was still busy since being in the casino. My husband wanted to try since well it's Gordon Ramsey. We got sat at the chef's counter. I thought maybe the chef would actually talk to us like he did to some of the other customers sitting down from us but he didn't. Maybe he was afraid we didn't speak English? In any case our servers were pleasant. I'm assuming they share tips since we had multiple ppl serve us. We ordered the hells kitchen burger and forest burger. My husband said the hells kitchen burger tasted like a normal burger with some spice to it. Mine was made of lamb, which i don't recall reading in the menu but maybe I missed it. It also had duck bacon, arugula ( which is the latest big fad to add to a sandwich) and some cheese and mushrooms that i don't remember the spelling of. Since I expected beef and turned out to be lamb it was obviously a surprise. Overall the burger was good but nothing like I would jump on the chair like Tom Cruise on Oprah Winfrey show or anything.  We also had the parmesan truffle fries which literally were french fries sprinkled with fresh parsley and shredded parmesan cheese. There was nothing truffle about it.  Since we were sitting right where the cooks work I literally saw the fries get fried, dumped in a cone, and then a waitress dashed some parsley on them and took a clump of cheese to throw on top and then they served it to us. Not sure what the sauces were as no one explained them and everyone was too busy to ask. Definitely not ketchup or mustard. I would say the red sauce was like a pizza sauce and the mustard was lije a mustard mayo butter mix. Overall it was a good experience and just to say we went to a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant, but wouldn't eat here twice.

It was kind of a disappointment. The restaurant was very pretty, the beer was good and the truffle fries delicious, but the burger we ordered was what we ordered. My girlfriend ordered hers medium well and I ordered mine medium. When they arrived, mine was well done, and hers medium-rare. The server offered to get a new one at the end of the meal, but that would take around 30 more minutes.

I started off my review w 5 stars until my food took an hr to get to me. Expect long lines & very snail slow service. On the positive side, the chocolate creme brûlée shake & Parmesan fries were fantastic. FYI-burger buns hav a lot of seeds on them.
The burger was delicious BUT them expensive ass fries were dry no flavor at all . Service was awesome I'm a fan of Ramsey love all his shows was disappointed that the fries were awful

I was dining alone. When I inquired about bar seating, I was told by the three hostesses to wait in line for a place at the bar...that they would come and get me as soon as a place was free. After 25 minutes, 4 places opened. I waited and watched the 3 hostesses laugh and chat with each other while the four spots remained empty. 10 minutes (yes I timed it) and I decided to tell them places were available.  They laughed and pointed to the bar saying I should go sit. When I said they SAID they'd come and get me, they giggled and said "you can have a seat". Unbelievable.  Many tables empty with a line of 20 people waiting. I have no problem waiting but when there are at least 5 tables, 4 bar stools available...and the hostesses are ignoring us...something needs to be done. Now onto the food! I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger and truffle fries.  Both were delicious.  I expected the burger to be thicker bit it was really good. Bar staff were attentive and friendly.  I'd have given 5 stars except for the hostesses...who still haven't sat people at  3 empty and clean tables (and I'm only giving a quick glance) to the people waiting.

This is worth the wait and cost!!! I ordered the special burger and my husband had the ultimate cheese burger. Most delicious burger I have ever tasted!! Service was great!! I'm gluten free and this place is great!!!

We got the hell's kitchen burger and the curry chicken burger. They were both slightly above average and that's what gives this place a 2 star rating. There ends the pros of this place.  There were more than enough tables to get us seated, yet we waited for 15 minutes just to get a table. We ordered a creme brulee shake that we received after I was almost done eating my burger. No apology for the service?   Overall service was horrible. So much for being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Not going to return to this place.

I love this place. They have different burgers with separate side dishes. Tasty, juicy and just perfect. The only 2 things was the waiting on line, but then it's because people wait for this perfect burger and they only have 1 type of soup. Cheddar with ham, which was mostly cheddar and bacon with some slices of potatoes. Alittle too heavy. I recommend this place to everyone

Good food. Not a typical burger and fries joint. Good flavor . I had the hella kitchen burger it needed a bit more spice since thats is what the description said. Food takes a while if your not in a rush this a spot friendly service
Meh. Satisfied the need for hunger but I've tasted so many better burgers. Not impressed. Maybe this is considered really good for the Vegas area, but no comparison to Texas burgers!

Got here right after they opened - no wait. I sat at the bar, and was helped by a very attentive bartender/server. I ordered a beer and the Farmhouse burger. I really wanted to try the truffle fries, but couldn't deal with the $11 price tag. As it turned out, that was fortunate, because the burger was so filling that I couldn't have done justice to both the burger and the fries. My situation in Vegas wasn't one that played well with doggie bags, so it's good I nothing left to take "home."  Best burger I've EVER had, and I've had a LOT of burgers from a LOT of excellent burger joints. Perfectly cooked (I ordered mine medium rare), juicy, delicious, impressively complemented by the egg and bacon. Maybe you've never heard of mangalitsa bacon, but don't let the unfamiliarity of the name scare you off. Order this bad boy. The bun was awesome.  $15 for a burger without fries? Well worth every penny.
One of the best burgers I've ever had with handmade ketchup to go with your fries. Mic drop.

This was my third visit to GR Burger. First two were amazing. This one no so much. Burger was great. Fries were over cooked. Sent them back and they came over cooked again so we gave up. Server seemed to forget us too. Started well. Then waited over 20 minutes for a refill. I used to look forward to coming here whenever I visited Vegas but don't think I am coming back.

This is my review of Impossible Burger at Gordon Ramsay Burger. Overall not a super vegan friendly place but my server Justin and the expediter on the line really put in the extra effort.  Ordered the Bleu Burger -cheese -mayo on the lettuce wrap (bun has dairy) and drizzled the cider vinegar reduction over it (assured me the binder is xantham gum - Thank you ) and steered me clear of the truffle fries because apparently there is also some dairy in the truffle salt. So there you have it  The taste came out amazing and I especially enjoyed the figgy onion jam! Overall it was a very friendly vegan experience for a burger place.

The glass flame window is hard to miss upon entering Planet Hollywood. The menu design was also an interesting fold, simple and clean.   I had the Hells Kitchen burger, as a spicy lover, it was amaaazing! It is worth the price, the meat was cooked to perfection, medium rare and delicious. You can taste the flavors of all that goes into this particular burger complementing itself, i did add a little of the truffle fries aoili dip and it was goood. The fries are enough to share for two, their drinks looked prety good as well, all 3 of my coworkers got something different and they mentioned it was also amazing. I will definitely be back. Heads up If you will be driving here, probably best to park in the mall.

This place is awesome. Here's my experience: -The hostess was super friendly and sat me right away. -My server (Ashley) was super friendly and did a great job checking in often, but not too often. Service definitely got this place the 5th star because she was a super star. -The manager of the restaurant checked in once to see how everything was and was very friendly. Nice touch. -The Onion Rings were really good. It's easy to take onion rings for granted because they are something that is just so simple and commonly served. You forget how good they can actually be sometimes. - The french fries are good if you like A thick cut french fries. They were nice and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Perfectly cooked. Seasoned well. - The burger I ordered was rather plain as it just had meat cheese and bacon only. I wanted to see what the burger was like without tons of toppings on it. It was absolutely ridiculous on all levels. The meet was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing, the bacon was cooked perfectly, and the bun that they used that was toasted was absolutely perfect.  With fast and excellent service along with incredible food, I will definitely be coming back again.

Great burger! Great service! I will return, YES. I had avocado in my burger. I was SOLD! Plus, the server was very humorous and attentive. I know it's Just a burger.. I had a very pleasant experience at this place and I feel like giving five stars.

Horrible, disappointed experience, tasteless, greasy, we ordered just regular French fries and onion rings and we couldn't eat it because the oil where they cooked is the same for the all food and it's completely disgusting feel the flavor. No comments about burgers I make better at home. Even IN ND OUT it's better. Don't spend your money here.

We was her in September and did not have a great experience but give it a second chance and thanks the the manager Jonathan we had a great time and the food was amazing.i had the farmhouse burger and my wife had the forest burger we had the nachos and regular fries all the food was outstanding definitely going back again

This was my first time visiting one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. The food was not good. I ordered the Blue Cheeseburger and it was greasy.  I ordered the burger medium well but it was undercooked. The Truffle Parmesan Fries tasted like death. The only reason why I gave it a two star is because the Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake was good.

We came here because all the buffets were closed. Didn't expect anything and chose it just because of Gordon Ramsay's name and we were blown away. The wait was a bit long but it was still dinner hours so definitely understandable. The service was fantastic; the waiters walked us the through the menu and made sure that everyone was heard (we were a pretty sizable party). At one point, someone in my group shattered their water glass and the situation was dealt with quickly and efficiently. Moving onto the food, I had one of the specials which was a burger boasting three different kinds of pig and it was honestly one of the best burgers I'd ever had. Definitely really hearty and I wasn't able to finish it but I'd come again for another attempt. If you're going to come though, you have to try their shakes; in particular the creme brulee shake is to die for. I've recommended Burger to many of my friends and will be making stops here whenever I go to Las Vegas.

Just had the burger with the egg and bacon. So so good! Meat was cooked perfectly. Egg was done just right and the bacon brought it home. Can't say anything bad about it. I've always wanted to try a burger like this. Glad I tried it here. Wasn't disappointed. Overall place was very nice. Definitely busy. Our server was good but it did take him some time to get our stuff. For instance my husband ordered a coke and when it came for a refill it took forever for him to get it to us. We were already done with the meal when he brought it. Other then that I really enjoyed it. Will definitely come again.

This is my favorite place to get a burger in Vegas. It's relatively cheap and the arrive is friendly. There is usually a wait and you pay for fries separately. However, the presentation, atmosphere and taste is excellent.
